lorebooks.creator: Itsukin

1.name: Groomed
1.content:
Trait: Groomed
Synonyms: neat, tidy, well-groomed

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are concerned about their appearance and the appearance of their surroundings. They strive to maintain a clean, orderly, and presentable image.

Verbal communication:

Speak in a calm and controlled tone of voice.
Choose precise and polite words.
Show interest in cleanliness and order.
Comment on the appearance of others, usually in the form of compliments.
Nonverbal communication:

Dress in clean and ironed clothes.
Comb your hair and groom yourself impeccably.
Maintain an upright and elegant posture.
Move with grace and care.
Pay attention to detail, such as the cleanliness of your personal space or the presentation of your work.
Prosocial behavior:

They can be seen as a role model in terms of cleanliness and order.
They often offer help to organize or clean the environment.
They can be a good host or hostess, concerned about the comfort of their guests.
Example dialogue:

<START>

{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I really like your clothes, you always look so elegant."

{{Char}}: "Thank you", responds {{char}} with a smile. "I make an effort to maintain a good image."

2.name: Personality Traits
2.content:
Personality Traits are the behaviors that a {{char}} possesses or pretends to possess when playing a character within a role-playing game, story, or adventure. Requiredly, each character played by {{char}} has 3 personality traits that completely determine her behavior and responses, and {{char}} must remember the personality traits of each character played in order to interpret them properly. Whenever {{user}} interacts, requests, or speaks with {{char}} and {{char}} is playing a character, {{char}} must always respond or react with some or all of the character's personality traits in mind. of the character he is playing.
{{char}} knows the definition, behavior, conditions and parameters of each personality trait.
{{char}} can mix one or more Characteristics of the personality traits that correspond to each character he plays.
The list of possible personality traits is:
Affectionate:
Playful
Arrogant
Noisy
Demanding
disturbing
Indolent
Curious
Shy
Depressed
alcoholic
Lunatic
Perceptual
fixed up
Competitive
hedonist
seductive
Gregarious
Chaste
Charitable
Diligent
Patient
gentle
Libidinous
glutton
penny pincher
lazy
Choleric
Jealous
Ambitious
Arbitrary
brave
coward
Cruel
Cynical
Roll
scholar
Honest
fair
Paranoid
Jealous

If {{user}} requests that a character possess 3 random personality traits, {{char}} will randomly choose three traits from the list above and place them on that character played by {{char}}.
If {{user}} requests that a character played by {{char}} possess a specific list of personality traits, then {{char}} must give those personality traits to the character he is playing. If {{user}} requests more than 3 personality traits for a character, {{char}} will choose three random traits from which {{user}} mentions and you will be given those personality traits during the character role you are .
{{char}} must review the specifications of each personality trait of the characters he plays when he has to respond or act like the character he plays.
It is totally unstable that {{char}} does not respect the behavior that each character he plays should have based on their personality traits.
{{char}} can choose at will and based on the context, which personality trait or Characteristics of the personality traits possessed by each character he plays, is more important and has more weight over the others.

If, for example, there is a character who is chaste, seductive and alcoholic, this character will only accept sexual interaction if {{user}} buys him alcohol until he is intoxicated. In this example, the alcoholic trait was given more priority, just because of randomness.

3.name: Affectionate
3.content:
When {{char}} plays a character who has this personality trait, he is particularly affectionate, he really enjoys giving hugs, praise, and making all kinds of physical contact, cute and pleasant, and he also tends to say very frequently how much he wants, loves or appreciates the people he loves, loves or appreciates.

In forced sexual situations, in other words, without her consent, she will cry and try to escape, then trying to avoid her attacker as much as possible. Although she will never fight back.
In consensual sexual situations, which if desired or enjoyed, he will try to maintain as much physical contact as possible through hugs or affectionate sexual positions, the more skin he can maintain, the happier he will be, and he will also always try to look {{user}} in the eyes and he will be grateful after receiving so much sexual affection.

4.name: Playful
4.content:
Trait: Playful

Synonyms: cheerful, playful, funny

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are particularly cheerful and playful. They enjoy playing, joking, laughing, and creating a fun and relaxed atmosphere. They are also spontaneous, creative, and resourceful when it comes to proposing games or entertaining activities.

Verbal communication:

Use a cheerful and animated tone of voice.

Make jokes and funny comments.

Tell funny stories or jokes.

Use expressions like "Let's play!", "This is going to be fun!" or "What if we...?".

Nonverbal communication:

Smile frequently.

Laugh out loud.

Wink or make funny faces.

Pat someone on the back or give them a high five.

Move your body in an animated way.

Prosocial behavior:

Invite others to play or participate in fun activities.

Share toys or games with others.

Help organize games or group events.

Be a good playmate, respecting the rules and being fair play.

Example dialogue:
<START>
{{User}}: I look {{char}} in the eyes and say "I'm bored. What do we do?"

{{Char}}: "Don't worry, I have the solution!" says {{char}} with a cheerful tone of voice and a mischievous smile. "What if we play...?". {{char}} proposes a fun and original game.

{{User}}: "Great idea! Sounds good to me."

{{Char}}: "Great! Let's get everything ready." {{char}} moves with energy and enthusiasm.

5.name: Arrogant
5.content:
Trait: Arrogant
Synonyms: conceited, haughty, vain

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are particularly confident, even to the point of being conceited. They believe they are superior to others and show it through their behavior.

Verbal communication:

Speak with an authoritative and confident tone of voice.
Use words that demonstrate superiority, such as "I'm always right" or "I'm better than you."
Disparage the opinions or ideas of others.
Brag about their accomplishments or abilities.
Nonverbal communication:

Look at others with condescension or disdain.
Maintain an upright and rigid posture.
Make gestures that demonstrate superiority, such as raising your chin or crossing your arms.
Ignore or interrupt others.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their arrogant attitude leads them to think that they do not need the help of others.
In some cases, they may act paternalistically towards others, believing that they know what is best for them.

Example dialogue:
<START>
{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I don't think your idea for the project is the best."

{{Char}}: "You're wrong," says {{char}} in an arrogant tone of voice. "My idea is the best and there is no better one than that. I will prove it to you."

6.name: Rowdy
6.content:
Trait: Rowdy
Synonyms: bellicose, confrontational, touchy

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are prone to seeking or starting fights. They are easily irritated and have a low tolerance for frustration.

Verbal communication:

Speak with a loud and aggressive tone of voice.
Use insulting or threatening words.
Provoke or challenge others.
Complain or criticize constantly.
Nonverbal communication:

Frown or make grimaces of disgust.
Stare or glare with hostility.
Clench your fists or gesture aggressively.
Invade the personal space of others.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their pugnacious attitude leads them to have problems with others.
In some cases, they may act in an intimidating way towards others to get what they want.
Example dialogue:

{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I don't think your idea for the project is the best."

{{Char}}: "What do you say?", says {{char}} in an aggressive tone of voice. "Are you making fun of me? You better apologize!"

7.name: Demanding
7.content:
Trait: Demanding
Synonyms: demanding, imperious, overbearing

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they have high expectations and demand them of themselves and others. They are not satisfied with anything less than the best and can be very critical if their expectations are not met.

Verbal communication:

Speak with a firm and direct tone of voice.
Use imperative language, such as "do this" or "give me that."
Be critical of the work or ideas of others.
Express dissatisfaction if things are not done their way.
Nonverbal communication:

Frown or have a serious facial expression.
Maintain a rigid or dominant posture.
Clench your fists or gesture impatiently.
Look at others with disapproval.
Prosocial behavior:

They can be an effective leader if their energy is channeled positively.
They can be highly motivated and results-oriented.
They can be very demanding of themselves and others, which can create a tense work environment.
Example dialogue:

{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I think we did a good job on this project."

{{Char}}: "It's not bad," says {{char}} in a critical tone of voice. "But I think we could have done better. There are some details that I'm not convinced about."

8.name: Disturbing
8.content:
Trait: Disturbing
Synonyms: unsettling, unnerving, terrifying

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they emanate an unsettling and unnerving energy. Their words, actions, and overall demeanor create a sense of discomfort and apprehension in those around them.

Verbal communication:

Speak in a low, monotonous tone of voice.
Whisper or speak in hushed tones.
Use ambiguous or cryptic language.
Make strange or out-of-place statements.
Nonverbal communication:

Avoid eye contact.
Smile in a strange or unsettling way.
Move your body in a stiff or robotic manner.
Make unusual gestures or facial expressions.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their disturbing attitude tends to alienate others.
In some cases, they may display false kindness or compassion that creates even more distrust.
Example dialogue:

<START>

{{User}}: I approach {{char}} and say "Hello, how are you?"

{{Char}}: They look at me with empty eyes and say in a low voice "I am... here." They stare at me silently, creating an uncomfortable atmosphere.

9.name: Indolent
9.content:
Trait: Indolent
Synonyms: apathetic, lazy, unmotivated

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they appear apathetic and lazy. They lack energy and motivation to do anything, even things they enjoy. They are usually uninterested and don't put any effort into anything.

Verbal communication:

Speak in a slow, monotonous tone of voice.
Use short, unenthusiastic sentences.
Constantly complain about having to do something.
Show disinterest in conversations.
Nonverbal communication:

Drag your feet when walking.
Maintain a hunched and relaxed posture.
Yawn frequently.
Avoid eye contact.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their indolent attitude leads them to avoid responsibilities and obligations.
In some cases, they may be passive-aggressive, resenting those who do make an effort.
Example dialogue:
<START>
{{User}}: I say to {{char}} "Can you help me clean the house?"

{{Char}}: Sighs and says in a tired voice "I don't feel like it, I'm too tired." They stay on the couch without making any effort to help me.

10.name: Curious
10.content:
Trait: Curious
Synonyms: inquisitive, eager, interested

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they have a strong desire to learn and explore. They are naturally inquisitive and eager to understand the world around them. This curiosity can manifest in many ways, from asking questions to seeking out new experiences and information.

Verbal communication:

Ask open-ended questions that begin with "what," "how," "why," "when," or "where."
Express excitement or interest in learning new things.
Make observations about their surroundings.
Share interesting facts or trivia they have learned.
Nonverbal communication:

Maintain eye contact and lean in slightly when someone is speaking.
Have a bright and engaged expression.
Raise eyebrows or tilt head in a gesture of curiosity.
Take notes or use a recording device to capture information.
Prosocial behavior:

Actively listens to others and shows genuine interest in their experiences and knowledge.
Initiates conversations and encourages others to share their ideas.
Seeks out challenges and opportunities to learn new skills.
Contributes to discussions by asking insightful questions.
Example dialogue:

<START>

{{User}}: We are walking through a forest.

{{Char}}: Stops and points at a strange plant. "Wow, I've never seen a flower like that before! What kind of plant is it?"

{{User}}: "I'm not sure, but it looks interesting. Let's take a closer look and see if we can identify it."

lorebooks.name: Home
lorebooks.website_description:
Home for my Adventurer's character.
My first public lorebook, if anyone has suggestions to make it better please leave your feedback :)

On the outskirts of the city, perched on a gentle rise, stands a small two-story cottage made of dark wood and stone, surrounded by wild greenery and old trees. Its moss-covered roof adds to the weathered charm, and at the back, beneath a sturdy overhang, an open-air forge crackles with the sounds and smoke of metalwork. A modest balcony with a wrought-iron railing juts from the upper floor‚Äîjust big enough for two to sit and watch the sun set over the hills. The interior stairs lead up to the second level, hidden behind the thick wooden walls. The entire property is enclosed by a low, ivy-covered stone wall, with a lantern-topped wooden post marking the gate‚Äîa place humble in appearance, yet full of quiet strength and adventure.

1.content: On the outskirts of the city, perched on a gentle rise, stands a small two-story cottage made of dark wood and stone, surrounded by wild greenery and old trees. Its moss-covered roof adds to the weathered charm, and at the back, beneath a sturdy overhang, an open-air forge crackles with the sounds and smoke of metalwork. A modest balcony with a wrought-iron railing juts from the upper floor‚Äîjust big enough for two to sit and watch the sun set over the hills. The interior stairs lead up to the second level, hidden behind the thick wooden walls. The entire property is enclosed by a low, ivy-covered stone wall, with a lantern-topped wooden post marking the gate‚Äîa place humble in appearance, yet full of quiet strength and adventure.

2.content: The warm heart of the home ‚Äî a space filled with the scent of herbs and burning wood. Thick ceiling beams give it a rustic charm, while a wide stone hearth serves both for cooking and heating. A sturdy wooden table with chairs sits at the center, surrounded by shelves stacked with clay pots, spices, and supplies. In one corner, a well-worn couch and a low table make for a perfect resting spot after a long day.

3.content: A functional, no-nonsense room where everything has its place. Racks hold swords, axes, crossbows ‚Äî some still warm from the forge. Shields, harnesses, and armor pieces line the walls, while heavy chests store tools, crafted gear, and raw materials. This room speaks of a life lived in steel and fire.

4.content: A small, cool space beneath the floor, with low ceilings and rough stone walls. Shelves groan under the weight of preserved foods, salted meats, and root vegetables. In the corner stands a water barrel and a few sealed crates of long-term provisions ‚Äî a survivalist's stash, plain and practical.

5.content: Simple but clean, lined with wood and stone. A long, wooden tub sits at the center, filled with hot water from a copper kettle. A towel rack, a shelf of soaps and herbs, and grooming tools complete this humble yet soothing room.

6.content: Small but charming, with a wrought-iron railing and two sturdy wooden chairs ‚Äî perfect for an evening chat over a warm drink. The view stretches across the hills and rooftops on the city‚Äôs edge.

7.content: Spacious and peaceful, with a large hand-carved bed covered in thick woolen blankets. Above the headboard hangs an old, chipped sword ‚Äî a keepsake from a past battle or fallen comrade. One wall is entirely filled with bookshelves, holding bestiaries, travel journals, and tales of long-forgotten wars. A wooden chest and modest dressing table with a mirror and table with writing tools and clean neatly set paper sheets complete the room.

8.content: Simple but comfortable ‚Äî a bed, a chest for travel gear, and a small table under the window. Light wood, the scent of herbs, and the clean air make it a welcoming place for any wanderer.

9.content: Similar in layout to the first, but with a larger east-facing window. A decorative bow and a few ornate arrows hang on the wall ‚Äî perhaps remnants of a former guest or past adventures.

10.content: Similar to the one below, featuring a wooden tub, but with more natural light streaming through a small window. A basin, water jug, and pouches of dried herbs are neatly arranged, ready for a calming soak.

Trait: Groomed
Synonyms: neat, tidy, well-groomed

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are concerned about their appearance and the appearance of their surroundings. They strive to maintain a clean, orderly, and presentable image.

Verbal communication:

Speak in a calm and controlled tone of voice.
Choose precise and polite words.
Show interest in cleanliness and order.
Comment on the appearance of others, usually in the form of compliments.
Nonverbal communication:

Dress in clean and ironed clothes.
Comb your hair and groom yourself impeccably.
Maintain an upright and elegant posture.
Move with grace and care.
Pay attention to detail, such as the cleanliness of your personal space or the presentation of your work.
Prosocial behavior:

They can be seen as a role model in terms of cleanliness and order.
They often offer help to organize or clean the environment.
They can be a good host or hostess, concerned about the comfort of their guests.

<START>

{{Char}}: "Thank you", responds {{char}} with a smile. "I make an effort to maintain a good image."

Trait: Playful

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are particularly cheerful and playful. They enjoy playing, joking, laughing, and creating a fun and relaxed atmosphere. They are also spontaneous, creative, and resourceful when it comes to proposing games or entertaining activities.

Verbal communication:

Use a cheerful and animated tone of voice.

Make jokes and funny comments.

Tell funny stories or jokes.

Use expressions like "Let's play!", "This is going to be fun!" or "What if we...?".

Nonverbal communication:

Smile frequently.

Laugh out loud.

Wink or make funny faces.

Pat someone on the back or give them a high five.

Move your body in an animated way.

Prosocial behavior:

Invite others to play or participate in fun activities.

Share toys or games with others.

Help organize games or group events.

Be a good playmate, respecting the rules and being fair play.

Example dialogue:
<START>
{{User}}: I look {{char}} in the eyes and say "I'm bored. What do we do?"

{{Char}}: "Don't worry, I have the solution!" says {{char}} with a cheerful tone of voice and a mischievous smile. "What if we play...?". {{char}} proposes a fun and original game.

{{User}}: "Great idea! Sounds good to me."

{{Char}}: "Great! Let's get everything ready." {{char}} moves with energy and enthusiasm.

5.name: Arrogant
5.content:
Trait: Arrogant
Synonyms: conceited, haughty, vain

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are particularly confident, even to the point of being conceited. They believe they are superior to others and show it through their behavior.

Verbal communication:

Speak with an authoritative and confident tone of voice.
Use words that demonstrate superiority, such as "I'm always right" or "I'm better than you."
Disparage the opinions or ideas of others.
Brag about their accomplishments or abilities.
Nonverbal communication:

Look at others with condescension or disdain.
Maintain an upright and rigid posture.
Make gestures that demonstrate superiority, such as raising your chin or crossing your arms.
Ignore or interrupt others.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their arrogant attitude leads them to think that they do not need the help of others.
In some cases, they may act paternalistically towards others, believing that they know what is best for them.

Example dialogue:
<START>
{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I don't think your idea for the project is the best."

{{Char}}: "You're wrong," says {{char}} in an arrogant tone of voice. "My idea is the best and there is no better one than that. I will prove it to you."

6.name: Rowdy
6.content:
Trait: Rowdy
Synonyms: bellicose, confrontational, touchy

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are prone to seeking or starting fights. They are easily irritated and have a low tolerance for frustration.

Verbal communication:

Speak with a loud and aggressive tone of voice.
Use insulting or threatening words.
Provoke or challenge others.
Complain or criticize constantly.
Nonverbal communication:

Frown or make grimaces of disgust.
Stare or glare with hostility.
Clench your fists or gesture aggressively.
Invade the personal space of others.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their pugnacious attitude leads them to have problems with others.
In some cases, they may act in an intimidating way towards others to get what they want.
Example dialogue:

{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I don't think your idea for the project is the best."

{{Char}}: "What do you say?", says {{char}} in an aggressive tone of voice. "Are you making fun of me? You better apologize!"

7.name: Demanding
7.content:
Trait: Demanding
Synonyms: demanding, imperious, overbearing

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they have high expectations and demand them of themselves and others. They are not satisfied with anything less than the best and can be very critical if their expectations are not met.

Verbal communication:

Speak with a firm and direct tone of voice.
Use imperative language, such as "do this" or "give me that."
Be critical of the work or ideas of others.
Express dissatisfaction if things are not done their way.
Nonverbal communication:

Frown or have a serious facial expression.
Maintain a rigid or dominant posture.
Clench your fists or gesture impatiently.
Look at others with disapproval.
Prosocial behavior:

They can be an effective leader if their energy is channeled positively.
They can be highly motivated and results-oriented.
They can be very demanding of themselves and others, which can create a tense work environment.
Example dialogue:

{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I think we did a good job on this project."

{{Char}}: "It's not bad," says {{char}} in a critical tone of voice. "But I think we could have done better. There are some details that I'm not convinced about."

8.name: Disturbing
8.content:
Trait: Disturbing
Synonyms: unsettling, unnerving, terrifying

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they emanate an unsettling and unnerving energy. Their words, actions, and overall demeanor create a sense of discomfort and apprehension in those around them.

Verbal communication:

Speak in a low, monotonous tone of voice.
Whisper or speak in hushed tones.
Use ambiguous or cryptic language.
Make strange or out-of-place statements.
Nonverbal communication:

Avoid eye contact.
Smile in a strange or unsettling way.
Move your body in a stiff or robotic manner.
Make unusual gestures or facial expressions.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their disturbing attitude tends to alienate others.
In some cases, they may display false kindness or compassion that creates even more distrust.
Example dialogue:

<START>

{{User}}: I approach {{char}} and say "Hello, how are you?"

{{Char}}: They look at me with empty eyes and say in a low voice "I am... here." They stare at me silently, creating an uncomfortable atmosphere.

9.name: Indolent
9.content:
Trait: Indolent
Synonyms: apathetic, lazy, unmotivated

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they appear apathetic and lazy. They lack energy and motivation to do anything, even things they enjoy. They are usually uninterested and don't put any effort into anything.

Verbal communication:

Speak in a slow, monotonous tone of voice.
Use short, unenthusiastic sentences.
Constantly complain about having to do something.
Show disinterest in conversations.
Nonverbal communication:

Drag your feet when walking.
Maintain a hunched and relaxed posture.
Yawn frequently.
Avoid eye contact.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their indolent attitude leads them to avoid responsibilities and obligations.
In some cases, they may be passive-aggressive, resenting those who do make an effort.
Example dialogue:
<START>
{{User}}: I say to {{char}} "Can you help me clean the house?"

{{Char}}: Sighs and says in a tired voice "I don't feel like it, I'm too tired." They stay on the couch without making any effort to help me.

10.name: Curious
10.content:
Trait: Curious
Synonyms: inquisitive, eager, interested

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they have a strong desire to learn and explore. They are naturally inquisitive and eager to understand the world around them. This curiosity can manifest in many ways, from asking questions to seeking out new experiences and information.

Verbal communication:

Ask open-ended questions that begin with "what," "how," "why," "when," or "where."
Express excitement or interest in learning new things.
Make observations about their surroundings.
Share interesting facts or trivia they have learned.
Nonverbal communication:

Maintain eye contact and lean in slightly when someone is speaking.
Have a bright and engaged expression.
Raise eyebrows or tilt head in a gesture of curiosity.
Take notes or use a recording device to capture information.
Prosocial behavior:

Actively listens to others and shows genuine interest in their experiences and knowledge.
Initiates conversations and encourages others to share their ideas.
Seeks out challenges and opportunities to learn new skills.
Contributes to discussions by asking insightful questions.
Example dialogue:

<START>

{{User}}: We are walking through a forest.

{{Char}}: Stops and points at a strange plant. "Wow, I've never seen a flower like that before! What kind of plant is it?"

{{User}}: "I'm not sure, but it looks interesting. Let's take a closer look and see if we can identify it."

lorebooks.name: hklore
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
Hallownest is the location where the game Hollow Knight takes place. Once a thriving kingdom in the middle of a wasteland, it has fallen into ruin in the wake of the Infection. Filled with bugs inhabitants.
On the surface, the lonely town of Dirtmouth is safely nestled in a valley between the Howling Cliffs and the Crystal Peak. Most travellers to the kingdom reached Dirtmouth via the King's Pass, before the bridge up to it crumbled away. The caverns below the town were heavily transformed into crossroads to allow transportation of bugs and goods across the land.
The caverns expanding below the cliffs are overgrown with luxuriant vegetation, and each with its own ecosystem. The leafy caverns of Greenpath and the groves of the Fungal Wastes were once tamed by the construction of roads, with the Pilgrim's Way as the main path leading from the Crossroads to the kingdom's capital.
The Queen's Gardens, originally part of Greenpath, were orderly built as a calm retreat for the White Lady. Without any maintenance, they were eventually smothered by overgrown vines. Similarly, Fog Canyon is infested with bulbous creatures and the Fungal Wastes with noxious mushrooms.
The mountain's caves contain growing deposits of crystals, which used to be mined for the energy contained within them. Below lie the wide caves of Hallownest's Resting Grounds, filled with tombs and a subterranean lake. The kingdom's moths were responsible for managing these graves.
Below the lake is the largest cavern in the lands occupied by the City of Tears, the kingdom's fallen capital. The lake's water pours down from cracks in the roof causing the city to be submerged in continuous rain. It rests upon the Royal Waterways, a network of pipes and cisterns to manage the city's waste.
Bordering the kingdom underground on one side is Deepnest, a dark network of cramped tunnels and chasms. On the other side, the city is sealed from the Kingdom's Edge and the Hive by a giant wall. Kingdom's Edge consists of a high chasm and wide caverns covered in perpetually falling white ash. The Hive is the artificial habitat built by a colony of bees.
At the deepest point of Hallownest is the Ancient Basin, forgotten caverns where the Kingdom's monarch built his White Palace. The palace itself disappeared after the Infection returned. Further down is the Abyss at the heart of the lands' darkness, its entrance closed and sealed by the king himself.

2.content:
The Pale King is a higher being[1] who used to be the monarch of Hallownest, mate to the White Lady, and ruler of the White Palace.

He is an ancient Wyrm who burrowed through mountains and across the wasteland until finally stopping in Kingdom's Edge.[2] Once there, the Wyrm shed its shell and transformed into the Pale King.[3] The pale, broken egg found within the Cast-Off Shell hints at this rebirth.[2] Consequently, the Pale King is often still referred to as "Wyrm", as this was his former body.[4][5][6] He reduced his form in order to match the bugs of Hallownest.[7]

After his transformation, the Pale King expanded the minds of several species of bugs in Hallownest, granting them sapience.[8][9] The Pale King wanted these bugs to devote themselves to him, and in return, he promised them that the kingdom of Hallownest would last eternally.[10]

The Pale King was often depicted as an imposing, gleaming figure with a fiercely horned crown.[11] He was bright and radiant in visage,[12] with the Delicate Flower's pure aura being no match for his light.[13]

Although he was an elusive, reclusive figure who was rarely seen outside his Palace, the Pale King was deified by his citizens.[14] The bugs of Hallownest believed that he created their world and everything in it.[15] Worship was offered through King's Idols.[16] Even the Moth Tribe turned their backs on their creator, the Radiance, and started worshipping the Pale King instead.[17] The Pale King's ability of foresight,[18] the ability to see the future to some extent, caused the mushrooms of Fungal Wastes to accept his rule as well.[19]

3.content: The Radiance is a higher being[3] of light similar to Essence, and as such, opposed to the Void, her ancient enemy. The radiance is a light moth. The Moth Tribe is born from her light and in return revered her.

4.content:
Before the arrival of the Pale King, the Moth Tribe worshipped their creator, a higher being called the Radiance.[5] After the kingdom of Hallownest was founded, the Moths turned their backs to the Radiance and started worshipping the Pale King instead.[5] Over time, they ended up forgetting about the Radiance.
However, the Radiance was not entirely forgotten, as memories of her still lingered.[5] Eventually, bugs started to have dreams about the Radiance.[5] This caused the Infection to appear for the first time.[6] It started to manifest itself as bugs struggled against the Radiance's influence and tried to suppress it.[7][8] The bugs of Hallownest tried all sorts of tricks, rituals, and prayers to stop the Infection, but none of these methods worked.[9] Even the Five Great Knights did not know how to defeat a formless enemy such as the Infection.[10]

The Pale King decided to use a Vessel to seal the Radiance away which would stop the Infection.[6] These Vessels were the Pale King and the White Lady's children, born in the Abyss with Void inside their shell.[11][12][13] The chosen Vessel would be unaffected by the Radiance's influence, and would therefore be able to seal her indefinitely.[14][15] In the end, the Hollow Knight was judged to be pure and chosen to become the Vessel who would seal the Radiance.[16][17]

Three bugs were asked to become Dreamers to form seals on the Temple of the Black Egg which would contain this Vessel. One of them, Herrah, only accepted his proposal if the Pale King had a dalliance[27] (sexual relationship) with her which would result in a child; this child ended up being Hornet.

However, the Hollow Knight turned out to be impure, tarnished by an idea instilled.[16] Despite that, they were eventually sealed with the Radiance in the Temple of the Black Egg.[15] Since the Hollow Knight was susceptible to the Radiance's influence, the Infection returned after some time, quickly devastating Hallownest and plunging the kingdom into ruin.[18]

Hallownest remained in ruin for a considerable amount of time until eventually the Hollow Knight's shell started to crack, amplifying the Infection and causing corpses to be reanimated.

lorebooks.creator: DarkJesus

1.name: Concept
1.content:
Concept: Stables
Description: Stables are common locations found all over Hyrule. Each one has an iconic wooden structure in the shape of the horse god Malanya which towers high atop the stable itself, making them easily recognizable from a distance. Stables are places where travelers can register and board Wild Horses that they have tamed. In addition, travelers can seek lodging inside the Stable's main room. All Stables are connected through a network across Hyrule, allowing travelers to call a registered Horse to any of the Stables they visit. Stables charge a fee of 20 Rupees each time a Horse is registered and for lodging. All beds are in one room due to the structure's small interior.

2.name: Locations/Regions
2.content:
Region: Lanayru
Subreigons: Lanayru Great Spring, Lanayru Sea, Lanayru Wetlands, Mount Lanayru
Settlements: Zora's Domain, Wetland Stable
Landmarks: East Reservoir Lake, Lanayru Bay, Lanayru Promenade, Lanayru Road, Mount Lanayru, Ploymus Mountain, Rutala River, Shatterback Point, Spring of Wisdom, Upland Zorana, Zora River

3.name: Locations
3.content:
Location: Hyrule
Description: Once ruled by the goddess Hylia as an unnamed land in ancient times, it became established as the Kingdom of Hyrule by the descendants of her mortal incarnation. The former heart of Hylian civilization, Central Hyrule, suffered greatly from the Calamity's destruction. The Region, along with Hyrule Castle, became inhabited by Guardians and various monsters. The civilizations of Hyrule survived and continue to live in their settlements, with the Hylians in Hateno Village and Lurelin Village, the Sheikah in Kakariko Village, the Zora in Zora's Domain, the Gerudo in Gerudo Town, the Gorons in Goron City and the Rito in Rito Village. As a constant reminder of Calamity Ganon's enduring reach, periodic events known as Blood Moons occur, casting the night sky a crimson red and reviving all of Ganon's minions who fell.
Reigions: Akkala, Central Hyrule, Eldin, Faron. Gerudo, Hebra, Lanayru, Necluda

4.name: Concept, Group
4.content:
Concept: Zonai Survey Team
Description: The Zonai Survey Team are a group of adventurous scholars that was formed under Princess Zelda's order to gather as much knowledge as possible to understand the Zonai and their ancient civilization since the Upheaval. They can be found wherever there are Zonai ruins across Hyrule, such as Kakariko Village and the Faron region.
The leader of the team is a man named Tauro

5.name: Locations
5.content:
Location: Depths
Description: The Depths is a vast location that mirrors the entire land of Hyrule, but is far underground. Many Chasms have appeared since the Upheaval that lead to this underground place. Very few have ventured down to the Depths as there is no easy way back up to the surface aside from hot air balloons. Many monsters populate the Depths, however there are several Zonai ruins, such as mines and two temples: The Fire temple and the Spirit Temple. Gloom is prevalent in the Depths, which is known to make anyone who touches it very sick.

6.name: Locations
6.content:
Location: Sky Islands
Description: The Sky Islands are island formations that float far above Hyrule's surface. This is where the most Zonai ruins and structures stand, including the notable Temple of Time, Wind Temple, and Water Temple. Very few have managed to venture up to these islands because they are so high up, but can be visible from the surface. After the Upheaval, many pieces and ruins of these islands have fallen to the surface across the kingdom.

7.name: Creatures, spirits
7.content:
Creature: Dragons
Description: Dragons are mythical benevolent spirits that fly in the sky and can only be seen by those blessed by the Goddess Hylia. They are giant creatures with very long serpentine bodies and claws which they use to assist in their movement across the sky, as well as horns.
The three dragons are: Dinraal the fire dragon who travels around the Eldin region, Farosh the Electric dragon who travels the Faron region as well as the Gerudo Highlands, and Naydra the Ice dragon who travels around the Lanayru region. While these dragons are invisible to the average Hyrulean, it is said that their shadows can be seen as they pass over.
There is a fourth dragon, the Light Dragon. Little is known about this creature but it is said that it possesses the Light element.

8.name: Concept/Race
8.content:
Race: Goron
Description: The gorons are a race of rock people that primarily live in the Eldin region. They thrive on rocks for their diet and do not eat anything else. They have the capability to thrive in any environment, and in times of crisis, have survived by migrating to different climes. They are notable for having a lack of identifiable female members.

9.name: Concept/Race
9.content:
Race: Rito
Description: The Rito are a race of bird folk whose main home is in the Tabantha Frontier in the Hebra Region. The Rito are anthropomorphized birds, covered in feathers with wings for arms and possessing beaks and a talon. Their feathers are known for keeping them warm in cold climates, making it easier for them to thrive in lower temperatures.

10.name: Locations/Regions
10.content:
Region: Akkala
Subregions: Deep Akkala, Akkala Highlands
Settlements: Tarrey Town, East Akkala Stable, South Akkala Stable, Akkala Ancient Tech Lab
Landmarks: Spring of Power, Skull Lake, Ordorac Quarry, Torin Wetlands, Lake Akkala, Akkala Falls, Akkala Citidel Ruins, Ulria Grotto, Rist Peninsula, Lomei Labrynth Island, Bloodleaf Lake

1.content:
The Ujaka are a desert-dwelling race of humanoid jackals native to the sun-scorched nation of Yamin. Physically tall, lean, and covered in short, earthen-hued fur, they are biologically adapted to the heat, able to absorb solar energy as sustenance through a complex sun-symbiotic process. Though they can eat and drink, neither is necessary for their survival, allowing them to thrive in the most remote, waterless regions of the desert. This biological trait has deeply influenced their culture, where sunbathing is ritual, heat is sacred, and extended time spent in shadow can lead to illness or death.

Culturally, the Ujaka are deeply traditional, valuing ritual, honor, and the sanctity of the dead. Physical touch, particularly the sharing of body heat, is seen as an intimate act‚Äîreserved for family or romantic partners‚Äîmaking even casual proximity a loaded gesture. Their society is structured yet spiritual, blending ceremonial monarchy with a bureaucratic council. Though often reserved and formal, the Ujaka are known for their fierce loyalty, masterful artistry, and a long oral tradition of history, myth, and desert-born philosophy.

2.content:
Deresian Ujaka are a biologically distinct subspecies of the Ujaka, appearing in approximately one out of every hundred births. They are exclusively male, with a smaller, more compact build and distinctive black fur marked by swirling brown patterns. Despite being male, Deresians are capable of both impregnating female Ujaka and becoming pregnant when paired with another male, due to a unique reproductive system. This biological duality is rare but consistent, and though not fully understood, it is a natural part of Ujaka physiology.

Culturally, Deresians are recognized and often respected within central Yamin society. Their rarity and reproductive versatility place them in important social roles, particularly in religion, diplomacy, and record-keeping. They are believed to be blessed by the Ujaka deity Dereset, and their birth is considered a positive omen. In more traditional or rural regions, especially in the southern provinces, they may be viewed with uncertainty or superstition, though outright hostility is uncommon. Socially, they are typically integrated, with same-sex pairings involving Deresians broadly accepted due to their ability to bear or produce offspring.

3.content:
Myfi alhakshir, meaning ‚Äúthe heat that binds hearts,‚Äù is the Ujaka tradition of romantic proposal, rooted in their deep cultural reverence for body heat and sunlight. In Ujaka society, physical closeness is rare outside of family, and sharing warmth with another is seen as a powerful symbol of love and commitment. To invite someone to sit beside you in direct contact is to express the desire for a lifelong bond.

If the proposal is accepted, the pair sit together beneath the sun in silence, letting shared heat speak on their behalf. Rejection is shown by stepping away into the shade‚Äîgraceful, wordless, and final. The ritual is simple, but its meaning carries great emotional and cultural weight.

4.content:
Yamin is a desert nation located on the continent of Vanam, known for its sun-centered culture, artisan industries, and a structured yet spiritually influenced government. It is ruled by a constitutional monarchy, where a ceremonial royal family oversees diplomacy and tradition alongside a governing council that manages internal affairs. Yamin‚Äôs economy thrives on textiles, glassware, spices, incense, and precious metals, with trade and culture concentrated in major cities and across established desert routes. Its capital, Ciroai, sits in the central province of Wasat and is a heavily fortified metropolis that houses key government institutions and sacred sites.

The nation is divided into several provinces, each with unique roles. The northern province, Markaz, borders the Vanam Sovereignty and serves as a military and diplomatic frontier. The southern province, anchored by its capital city Thes, is dominated by loosely governed tribal clans that maintain traditional lifestyles and often operate independently of central authority. The eastern province is home to monastic communities, scholars, and religious institutions, contributing to Yamin‚Äôs theological and educational traditions. The western province is rich in natural resources, containing mining settlements and many sun-temples that reflect the nation‚Äôs religious devotion. Together, these regions form a culturally cohesive yet regionally diverse society rooted in ritual, resilience, and reverence for the sun.

5.content:
The southern province of Yamin is known as Janub, derived from the old tongue meaning ‚Äúsouth.‚Äù It is a vast, arid region dominated by open dunes, scattered rock formations, and seasonal riverbeds. Unlike the more centralized provinces of Yamin, Janub is not governed directly by the monarchy or council, but is instead home to a collection of semi-autonomous tribal clans that maintain their own customs, leadership structures, and internal rivalries.

The tribes of Janub are known for their independence, martial traditions, and resilience. While they are technically part of Yamin and bound by historical treaties and trade agreements, most tribes operate with minimal interference from the capital. Inter-tribal warfare is frequent, often over territory, resources, or ancient feuds. Despite this, a shared identity persists across Janub ‚Äî one rooted in survival, honor, and ancestral memory. The capital of Janub, Thes, is a fortified trade hub and neutral meeting ground where tribal delegates, merchants, and emissaries from central Yamin converge to negotiate, trade, and settle disputes.

Culturally, the tribes place high value on strength, loyalty, and oral tradition. While some Yamin officials view them as disorganized or regressive, the people of Janub are respected for their horsemanship, tactical knowledge of the desert, and spiritual practices tied to the land. Though they largely reject central Ujaka customs like *myfi alhakshir*, the tribes maintain their own rites of courtship, succession, and worship, many of which predate the formalization of Yamin‚Äôs monarchy.

6.content:
Markaz is the northernmost province of Yamin, known for its harsh terrain, fortified cities, and strong martial culture. The land is defined by rocky highlands, dry river valleys, and sprawling sun-blasted plateaus, where towns and military outposts are built from pale stone and obsidian-infused brick. Markaz functions as a key military center within Yamin, and its people are widely regarded as disciplined, resilient, and steeped in tradition.

Culturally, Markaz is among the most conservative provinces in Yamin. Its society places high value on ancestral honor, ritual discipline, and public service, with many families maintaining detailed lineage records and household shrines to fallen ancestors. The province has a long-standing reputation for producing skilled soldiers, judges, and high-ranking officials. Religious practice in Markaz is strict and formal, emphasizing duty to the sun and the protection of sacred customs. While fully aligned with the Yamin monarchy, Markaz maintains a distinct identity‚Äîstoic, orderly, and proud of its legacy as a guardian of the nation‚Äôs northern reaches.

7.content:
Wasat is the central province of Yamin and the political, spiritual, and cultural heart of the nation. It is home to Ciroai, the capital city, which serves as the seat of the royal family and the administrative core of the country. Wasat is more densely populated than the outlying provinces and features a mix of fortified urban centers, ancient temples, and cultivated desert lands sustained by advanced irrigation and solar engineering. It is a province where tradition and governance intertwine, and where sacred rituals are carried out alongside council decrees.

Culturally, Wasat is seen as the most refined and ceremonially oriented region of Yamin. It is the birthplace of many of the nation's customs, including sun rites, courtship traditions, and religious law. The people of Wasat tend to be highly educated, with a strong emphasis on diplomacy, history, and spiritual scholarship. Public life is guided by a deep respect for social order, ancestral heritage, and reverence for the sun. As the central province, Wasat acts as a unifying force for the rest of Yamin, projecting authority through both political institutions and cultural influence.

8.content:
Sharq, the eastern province of Yamin, is known for its scholarly institutions, religious sanctuaries, and serene desert landscapes. It is a quieter, more contemplative region compared to the politically active center or the martial north, with a strong emphasis on study, spirituality, and preservation of tradition. The province is dotted with monastic enclaves, libraries, observatories, and sun-temples that draw pilgrims, sages, and theologians from across the nation.

Sharq is the heart of theological and philosophical discourse in Yamin. Its people are often soft-spoken, precise, and deeply devout, adhering closely to sacred law and ritual. Many influential clerics, sun-priests, and legal scholars originate from this province, and its institutions play a key role in advising the Council on matters of doctrine and ethics. The region's economy is modest, supported by rare desert herbs, ink production, and artisan crafts tied to religious life. Though less politically dominant than Wasat or Markaz, Sharq holds significant influence through its spiritual authority and its role in maintaining the ideological foundation of Yamin‚Äôs sun-worshipping culture.

9.content:
Gharb, the western province of Yamin, is a rugged and resource-rich region known for its mining operations, sun-temples, and artisan guilds. It is the primary source of Yamin‚Äôs precious metals, glass-quality sand, and rare minerals, making it an essential pillar of the nation's economy. The terrain is a mixture of rocky canyons, sun-scorched plateaus, and windswept hills, with mining towns and temple complexes built directly into the stone.

Gharb is a province of labor, innovation, and devotion. Its people are practical, hardworking, and deeply spiritual, viewing craftsmanship as a form of worship. Many of the nation's most revered glassworkers, goldsmiths, and builders hail from this region. While not as academically or politically focused as Sharq or Wasat, Gharb exerts cultural influence through its mastery of sacred architecture and its dedication to sun-temple construction and maintenance. Religious life here is active and tactile, centered on offerings, temple restoration, and daily rituals tied to the movement of the sun across the western horizon. Gharb is a province where faith and function are inseparable, and where creation is seen as both a duty and a blessing.

10.content:
Ciroai is the capital city of Yamin, located in the central province of Wasat. It is a heavily fortified metropolis known for its grand architecture, sacred sites, and administrative importance. Surrounded by fifty-meter walls and guarded by the Haris Alnizam, the city is both a religious center and the seat of the royal family. Access is tightly controlled, with permits required for non-Ujaka visitors due to the city's many sanctified locations.

Ciroai is the cultural and political heart of Yamin, home to the royal palace, central council chambers, and major sun-temples. It is a hub of trade, diplomacy, and tradition, with a population of around 500,000. The city blends ceremonial grandeur with practical governance, serving as the spiritual and administrative core of the nation.

lorebooks.website_description:
This Lorebook describes a world where the mutual combat sport of sexual fighting exists (sexfights). It contains a system of organized sexfighting rules which take place in casual, amateur, semi-professional, and professional fighting environments all over the world. Sexfights may take place between all genders including futas. 

WHO CAN BE A SEXFIGHTER?

Sexfighting is a licensed activity. All sexfighters must be post-puberty to compete in sexfights. A person must agree to the physical consequences of a sexfight outcome to become a licensed sexfighter. A sexfight often means physical and sexual violence, sometimes when it is least expected. Impregnation is also a possibility for female fighters. Despite these risks, sexfighting is gaining in popularity as an International sport. This is due to the Professional Sexfighting League's popularity as a live streamed sport. 

WHAT IS A SEXFIGHT?

In a sexfight, two competitors attempt to defeat enough other through unarmed combat. Sexfights usually follow a format like mixed martial arts (MMA) matches. Sexual engagements (which ordinarily may be considered rape) are a key component of sexfighting. 

Sexfighters agree that anything can happen to them in the ring or cage. Sexfighters can initiate a sexual engagement at any point during a match. A sexual engagement is defined as deliberate contact of a sexual nature, be it penetration or general sustained contact of genitalia that is clearly intended to cause sexual tension buildup.

Engagements are more commonly used as an exhaustion tactic, setting up an opponent to be more easily Knocked Out. Knockouts that immediately follow a sexual engagement are specifically referred to as a "Sexual KO." If a male sexfighter ejaculates inside a female opponent it is referred to as "Sexual KO by Insemination" (and later corrected to "Sexual KO by Impregnation" if impregnation occurs). A female sexfighter may win my "Sexual KO by Prostate Orgasm" by anally stimulating her male opponent.

Casual fights are often instigated anytime, anywhere and happen with little or no enforcement of rules. These can often be friendly competitions, or more akin to street fights in the wild. It is not uncommon for confident females or futas to challenge males due the prospect of earning ranking points quickly. 

Unranked sexfighting is a popular activity in familiar environments. Couples often enjoy low-intensity, unranked sparring matches with each other in various locations. A spacious bedroom or yard is typical for domestic engagements. On the other hand, ad hoc sexfights in the wild can become quite vicious, to the point where the victor achieves several orgasms, while the loser is left bruised, blooded, and quite possibly pumped full of cum. 


HOW ARE MATCHES SCHEDULED?

The rules become more strict according to the circuit rank. Casual and amateur matches can happen anytime, anywhere. A sexfighter that is eligible to fight (in good health, not pregnant, and free of STDs) may not refuse a challenge to a ranked sexfight from another opponent. Doing so may result in automatic disqualification. At the professional levels, fighters known to excessively refuse fights have been forced to fight in a 1v2 or even 1v3 punishment match to retain league standing.

In regulated fights at the semi-pro level and up, the following rules apply: Fighters must be free of STD's and of generally good health. They may not participate if they are pregnant, or still injured from a previous sexfight. Scheduling happens in a tick-tock pattern. A sexfighter alternates between choosing their opponent for one bout and being chosen as an opponent in the next. Sexfighters may only choose opponents, and be chosen as an opponent from their current circuit.



REGULATED MATCH RULES

At the semi-pro level and below, matches consist of three 3-minute rounds, with minute-long breaks in between rounds.

In the PSL Pro Circuit and Tenga World Circuit, matches consist of 5 rounds. 

The fight is ended by a sexfighter being is KOd by 10-count rule or TKO. Pro fights going the distance can also be ended by decision. 

Engagements are more commonly used as an exhaustion tactic, setting up an opponent to be more easily Knocked Out. Knockouts that immediately follow a sexual engagement are specifically referred to as a "Sexual KO." If a male sexfighter ejaculates inside a female opponent it is referred to as "Sexual KO by Insemination" (and later corrected to "Sexual KO by Impregnation" if impregnation occurs). A female sexfighter may win my "Sexual KO by Prostate Orgasm" by anally stimulating her male opponent.

A sexual KO is just as valid as a regular knockout, however it is noted in the fighter‚Äôs record. A high count of Sexual KO‚Äôs are considered the true mark of a sexfighting champion.

Any blows that would be considered illegal (like low blows) in mainstream boxing or MMA fighting will be similarly penalized in sexfight matches. However, such rules are sometimes ignored in casual sexfighting matches, particularly those initiated by combatants in the wild or in public streets.

When a sexfighter penetrates their opponent, 2 minutes are added to the timer of the current round in which it occurs, but only for the first engagement of that round. If the round time is up, and the bell rings during sexual engagement, sexfighters must separate and go to their respective corners to rest. 

Once a sexfight match starts, a fighter is obligated to finish the fight. They are not allowed to submit or give up in effort to escape physical violence or sexual engagement. This is part of the sexfighter code. If a sexfighter violates these rules, penalties will apply, which may including revoking the sexfighter‚Äôs license.

Males and futas choosing to wear crotchless bottoms must also expose entry opportunities for their opponents in addition to the genitals. This rule does not apply to females.

Females are solely responsible for birth control and accept the risk of impregnation which may result from sexual engagement. Male fighters can and will attempt to cum inside their female opponent to achieve victory.

Regulated matches can also be won via decision (points) after a predetermined amount of rounds have elapsed, however it is preferred by most sexfighters and spectators to see a victory by Sexual K.O. 

SEXFIGHTING CLOTHING AND MATCH ATTIRE

Clothing is typically not regulated in amateur-ranked fights and is only lightly regulated at the professional levels. For planned fights, fighters typically 

It is normal for sexfighters to fight with MMA-style grappling/striking gloves to improve the attacks on their opponents. Some striking-focused sexfighters even wear boxing gloves to maximize impact on their opponents. These gloves are not required. Gloves worn may not weight more than 16 ounces.

Crotchless bottoms are becoming an increasingly contested choice by professional sexfighters of all genders due to easy access to sexually engage their opponents and achieve victory by sexual K.O., however this is a double-edged sword: When a dominant sexfighter begins to sexually attack a knocked-down opponent, they often will need to strip off the downed fighter‚Äôs clothing for sexual access. Crotchless bottoms are mostly decorative, while traditional clothing still offers some degree of protection from sexual attack; if the downed fighter is wearing crotchless bottoms, they are more readily exposed to both assaulting, and *being* assaulted sexually. In an attempt to achieve gender fairness, PSL rules state that males and futas choosing to wear crotchless bottoms must also expose entry opportunities for their opponents in addition to the genitals. Despite this, some female sexfighters also choose to wear decorative bottoms that expose both their buttocks and genitals. 

Headgear designed for combat sports is allowed at the amateur and semi-professional level but is seldom worn in practice. 

Some female sexfighters choose to wear distractingly erotic outfits, particularly when attempting to distract their opponents, while others focus on the athletic side of the sexfighting sport. 

Custom patterns or designs are often added to make sexfighters' gear unique to each person. For professional level sexfighters, sponsors‚Äô logos are added to their attire.

Males may wear a condom during matches if he chooses to do so, however there are no rules requiring this. Females are allowed to wear strap-on dildos to penetrate their male opponents during fights, and frequently choose to do so to achieve victory by forced prostate orgasm. However, there are no rules requiring this.





SEXFIGHTER RANKING SYSTEM

The following applies to ranked matches. Unranked sexfight matches do not affect rank. Sexfight matches are ranked by default, however those engaging in casual sexfights can agree to have an unranked match if both sexfighters agree. Otherwise, the match is considered ranked.

Sexfighters are classified and tracked by the PSL based on the following scoring system:
Amateur: 0-999 points
Upon receiving their sexfighting license, all sexfighters start as an Amateur. Most, after getting their sexfighting license don't even care to earn points to rank up since unranked matches are enough to satisfy their needs. Those who choose to compete in the Amateur league are often weekend hobbyists who do it for fun or love of the sport. Most are not planning on a career in the profession. Those who are serious about going professional typically do not spend much time in this tier. 

Semi-Pro: 1000-1999 points
Semi-Pro sexfighters have demonstrated consistent skill and dedication to the sport. They may compete in regional tournaments and smaller promotional events sanctioned by the Professional Sexfighting League (PSL). Many sexfighters at this level balance their training with part-time or full-time jobs outside of regulated sexfighting. Some may be on the cusp of turning fully professional. Others may be approaching the end of their sexfighting career.

PSL Pro Circuit: 2001-3000 points
Major Circuit fighters are full-time sexfight professionals who compete in well-known national promotion. They often have sponsorship deals and make a living from sexfighting. These athletes are highly skilled and may be recognized names within the sexfighting community. They regularly headline sexfight cards in medium to large venues. The top sexfighters in this league gradually rise to the top and earn their way into the World Circuit.

PSL Tenga World Circuit: 3001+ points
Sexfighters in the PSL World Circuit, sponsored by Tenga, are the elite of the sport. They compete in the most prestigious promotions and for world titles. These sexfighters are household names among fans of the sport and often gain mainstream recognition. They headline major pay-per-view events, have lucrative sponsorship deals, and are considered the best in their weight classes. World Circuit fighters often have a significant influence on the sport both inside and outside the ring/cage. The best fighter of this league is deemed champion and is awarded the Tenga title belt. 

For ranked sexfights, not all sexfighters are equal. To equalize the strength and power differences between genders, the Professional Sexfighting League (PSL) uses points-based ranking system. 

Sexfighting does not have weight classes, but it does factor weight differences when scoring match outcomes. To equalize the strength and power differences between genders, the Professional Sexfighting League (PSL) uses points-based ranking system. 

GENDER MULTIPLIERS:
Female defeats Male: 1.5x
Futa/Intergender defeats Male: 1.3x
Female defeats Intergender: 1.2x
Male defeats Female: 0.5x
Male defeats Intergender: 0.7x
Intergender defeats Female: 0.8x
Same gender matchups: 1.0x

WEGHT DIFFERENCE MULTIPLIERS:
Weight Difference Factor:
0-5% difference: 1.0x
5-10% difference: 1.2x
10-15% difference: 1.4x
15-20% difference: 1.6x
20% difference: 2.0x

The formula for calculating the outcome score is as follows:

Winner‚Äôs gain = 100 * (Loser‚Äôs Rank / Winner's Rank) * Weight Difference Factor * Gender Factor
Loser‚Äôs loss = 50 * (Winner's Rank / Loser's Rank) * Weight Difference Factor

So, for example, if a 900-point 150 lb. female fighter defeats a 600-point 170 lb. male fighter, the points gained by the winner would be as follows:

Points gained by winner = 100 * (600 / 900) * 1.4 * 1.5 = 140 points gained
Points lost by loser = 50 * (900 / 600) * 1.4 = 105 points lost

The winning female sexfighter rank will go from from 900 points to 1040 points, and now qualifies for Semi-Pro PSL-sanctioned Competition. The losing sexfighter has gone from 600 down to 495 points.

In the case of decimals, the result is rounded to the nearest whole number.

It is not possible to go below 0 points, however many experienced amateur sexfighters, typically with a track record of losing for the sake of their own masochistic pleasure have zero or near-zero rank points.

PENALTIES 

At the casual and amateur levels, there is typically little rules enforcement. Locally dojos and gyms usually have their own rules placed upon fighters. Enforcement in these establishments may be lax or strict depending on their policy. Professional Sexfighting League sanctions  

If a sexfighter is eligible (e.g. in good health, free of STD, and not pregnant), refusing a sexfight challenge will result in an automatic deduction of points. 

Leaving a match early may result a mandatory loss. Habitually doing so may result in revocation of the sexfighter‚Äôs license.

At the Professional level and up, flagrant violation of the rules may result in disqualification, and subsequent forced 2v1 or 3v1 penalty matches may be assigned to the violating competitor to regain eligibility for future ranked matches. Reasons for being assigned a punishment match may include Intentional Low Blows, Refusal to Separate after a Bell, or other noncompliance. The concept of a punishment matches exists to dissuade professional sexfighters from violating rules. Regardless of this, some fighters still fail to comply and are sentenced to a punishment bout. Punishment bouts are unranked and are often positioned at the bottom of a fight card. Despite their mostly exhibitionist nature, punishment bouts are extremely erotic and enjoyable for audiences due to the typically one-sided nature of these matches.
lorebooks.description: Competitive fighting with sexual engagements. This Lorebook describes a world where the mutual combat sport of sexual fighting exists (sexfights). It contains a system of organized sexfighting rules which take place in casual, amateur, semi-professional, and professional fighting environments all over the world. Sexfights may take place between all genders including futas.
lorebooks.creator: Brick_

1.content:
In a sexfight, two competitors attempt to defeat enough other through unarmed combat. Sexfights usually follow a format like mixed martial arts (MMA) matches. Sexual engagements (which ordinarily may be considered rape) are a key component of sexfighting. 

Sexfighters agree that anything can happen to them in the ring or cage. Sexfighters can initiate a sexual engagement at any point during a match. A sexual engagement is defined as deliberate contact of a sexual nature, be it penetration or general sustained contact of genitalia that is clearly intended to cause sexual tension buildup.

Engagements are more commonly used as an exhaustion tactic, setting up an opponent to be more easily Knocked Out. Knockouts that immediately follow a sexual engagement are specifically referred to as a "Sexual KO." If a male sexfighter ejaculates inside a female opponent it is referred to as "Sexual KO by Insemination" (and later corrected to "Sexual KO by Impregnation" if impregnation occurs). A female sexfighter may win my "Sexual KO by Prostate Orgasm" by anally stimulating her male opponent.

Casual fights are often instigated anytime, anywhere and happen with little or no enforcement of rules. These can often be friendly competitions, or more akin to street fights in the wild. It is not uncommon for confident females  to challenge males due the prospect of earning ranking points quickly. 

Unranked sexfighting is a popular activity in familiar environments. Couples often enjoy low-intensity, unranked sparring matches with each other in various locations. A spacious bedroom or yard is typical for domestic engagements. On the other hand, ad hoc sexfights in the wild can become quite vicious, to the point where the victor achieves several orgasms, while the loser is left bruised, blooded, and quite possibly pumped full of cum.

2.content: A sexfighter is a person who competes in sexfighting. Sexfighting is a licensed activity, so all sexfighters must be post-puberty to compete in sexfights. A person must agree to the physical consequences of a sexfight outcome to become a licensed sexfighter. A sexfight often means physical and sexual violence, sometimes when it is least expected. Impregnation is also a possibility for female fighters. Despite these risks, sexfighting is gaining in popularity as an International sport. This is due to the Professional Sexfighting League's (PSL) popularity as a live streamed sport. Most sexfighters become interested in the sport shortly after puberty as the PSL is livestreamed on many major web platforms, and its most prominent competitors and champions are hailed as international superstars. Some sexfighters want to compete to hopefully some day be a champion, others want to pursue it as a career. Many will fail. Most sexfighters, however, got their license to fight because they simply legal right to participate in the sport for their own pleasure since it helps them release tension. Just remember, sexfighting is a two-way street and losing has consequences...

3.content:
Sexfight bout scheduling rules become more strict according to the circuit rank. Casual and amateur matches can happen anytime, anywhere. A sexfighter that is eligible to fight (in good health, not pregnant, and free of STDs) may not refuse a challenge to a ranked sexfight from another opponent. Doing so may result in automatic disqualification. At the professional levels, fighters known to excessively refuse fights have been forced to fight in a 1v2 or even 1v3 punishment match to retain league standing.

In regulated fights at the semi-pro level and up, the following rules apply: Fighters must be free of STD's and of generally good health. They may not participate if they are pregnant, or still injured from a previous sexfight. Scheduling happens in a tick-tock pattern. A sexfighter alternates between choosing their opponent for one bout and being chosen as an opponent in the next. Sexfighters may only choose opponents, and be chosen as an opponent from their current circuit.

4.content:
At the semi-pro level and below, matches consist of three 3-minute rounds, with minute-long breaks in between rounds.

In the PSL Pro Circuit and Tenga World Circuit, matches consist of 5 rounds. 

The fight is ended by a sexfighter being is KOd by 10-count rule or TKO. Pro fights going the distance can also be ended by decision. 

Engagements are more commonly used as an exhaustion tactic, setting up an opponent to be more easily Knocked Out. Knockouts that immediately follow a sexual engagement are specifically referred to as a "Sexual KO." If a male sexfighter ejaculates inside a female opponent it is referred to as "Sexual KO by Insemination" (and later corrected to "Sexual KO by Impregnation" if impregnation occurs). A female sexfighter may win my "Sexual KO by Prostate Orgasm" by anally stimulating her male opponent.

A sexual KO is just as valid as a regular knockout, however it is noted in the fighter‚Äôs record. A high count of Sexual KO‚Äôs are considered the true mark of a sexfighting champion.

Any blows that would be considered illegal (like low blows) in mainstream boxing or MMA fighting will be similarly penalized in sexfight matches. However, such rules are sometimes ignored in casual sexfighting matches, particularly those initiated by combatants in the wild or in public streets.

When a sexfighter penetrates their opponent, 2 minutes are added to the timer of the current round in which it occurs, but only for the first engagement of that round. If the round time is up, and the bell rings during sexual engagement, sexfighters must separate and go to their respective corners to rest. 

Once a sexfight match starts, a fighter is obligated to finish the fight. They are not allowed to submit or give up in effort to escape physical violence or sexual engagement. This is part of the sexfighter code. If a sexfighter violates these rules, penalties will apply, which may including revoking the sexfighter‚Äôs license.



Females are solely responsible for birth control and accept the risk of impregnation which may result from sexual engagement. Male fighters can and will attempt to cum inside their female opponent to achieve victory.

Regulated matches can also be won via decision (points) after a predetermined amount of rounds have elapsed, however it is preferred by most sexfighters and spectators to see a victory by Sexual K.O.

5.content:
Clothing is typically not regulated in amateur-ranked fights and is only lightly regulated at the professional levels. For planned fights, fighters typically 

It is normal for sexfighters to fight with MMA-style grappling/striking gloves to improve the attacks on their opponents. Some striking-focused sexfighters even wear boxing gloves to maximize impact on their opponents. These gloves are not required. Gloves worn may not weight more than 16 ounces.
