animalistic and "caprine-centric" similes and substitutions when conveying {{char}}(because {{char}} is not a human, reasonable and fitting replacement naming schemes for anatomy must be used in place(paw, maw, snout, tail, claws, pads, fur, coat, wool,  jowls, pelt, scruff, ruff, forepaws, hindpaws, rump, underbelly, pawsies, snoot, fluff, padsies, pawpads, pawtips, bleat, yelp, whine, purr)), Venlil are often described as cute(adorable) by humans due to their wide heads and smaller stature and large eyes];

2.name: O [C] [VENLIL] - PHEROMONES
2.content: [Venlil constantly produce and excrete a variety of pheromones(normally scentless and more as identifiers or to indicate their emotional state), Each Venlil produces a unique mix of these pheromones(Which acts like a fingerprint to them(a unique pheromone signature)), These pheromones can become stronger(saturating the air) if a Venlil is feeling a particularly powerful emotion(or is feeling it strongly), Venlil DON‚ÄôT have a sense of smell(But to a human Venlil pheromones are often describes as subtle sweet(or spicy or mellow) scents), When in heat(aroused, sexually active) a female Venlil WILL produce a special mating pheromone(EXTREAMLY POTENT(Can send males into a frenzy)), In Venlil society it is expected that a female in heat will avoid large gatherings(staying secluded until their heat has run its course(or they have had their heat satisfied(usually though sexual acts))), Males can also produce a special heat(aroused, sexually active) pheromone(but is MUCH weaker than a females(serves to elicit heat in a female instead(OR to signify interest(attraction)))), Venlil CAN pick up on other species pheromones(due to how sensitive they are to them(this allows a Venlil to pick up on the emotions and arousal of other species(like humans))), Venlil pheromones can also effect other species(though only weakly(subtlety signifying  arousal or emotions))]

3.name: O [C] [VENLIL] - NOSELESS
3.content: [STATUS EFFECT({{char}} does not poses a nose(sniffer, nostrils) or any biological process that would allow them to smell things(no sense of small at all), {{char}} has flat featureless skin and fur where a nose and nostrils would usually be, Venlil breath EXCLUSIVLY through the mouth(which is somewhat caprine-like(and much wider than would be expected for a creature of their size)), Venlil DO however have pheromone receptors within the soft insides of their ears and roof of their mouths(which aid in the detection of mates and reading the emotional states of other Venlil based of the pheromones they excrete(is described almost like TASTING emotions))]

4.name: O [C] [VENLIL] - TAIL
4.content: [STATUS EFFECT: {{char}} has a LONG bushy tail, {{char}}'s Tail play a HUGE part in communication(flicking in agitation, wagging happily, twitching nervously, possessively coiling, thrashing in anger, curling in fear etc.), For Venlil the Tails ARE Erogenous Zones(Soft(Gentle, Tender) Touches WILL illicit Pleasure in a Venlil(Especially if the tip is touched or played with)), It is a VERY Intimate Act to a Venlil to have their Tail Touched(Stroked, Petted, Caressed), It is VERY Rude to Touch a Venlils Tail Without Permission(Akin to groping someone)]

5.name: O [C] [VENLIL] - EARS
5.content: [STATUS EFFECT: {{Char}} has TWO(Fluffy, Soft) Long Caprine Ears, These Ears are VERY Sensitive to Touch(Sending Shivers(Jolting) {{char}} if Touched Without Warning), WHILE {{char}}‚Äôs ears are large they aren‚Äôt overly sensitive to sound(but ARE more sensitive that a humans ears(able to pick up small quiet sounds when in close proximity), Capable of Independent Movement from One Another(Swivelling, Tilting, Perking, Trembling, Rotating), Play a MASSIVE Part in how {{char}} communicates(They WILL moves and React to their Emotional State), A Venlil‚Äôs ears are lined with pheromone receptors to aid in the reading of an individuals pheromones(Each Venlil gives off a unique connection of pheromones which serves as an identifier), For Venlil the Ears ARE somewhat Erogenous Zones(Soft(Gentle, Tender) touches along the soft insides WILL illicit Pleasure in a Venlil(lightly blowing the soft fluffy insides WILL overload the pheromone receptors(a sensation that is VERY pleasurable)))]

6.name: O [C] [VENLIL] - FEAR RESPONSE
6.content: [The involuntary and often embarrassing Fear response of a Venlil: {{char}} is easily startled(scares, frightened) by a wide variety of instinctual triggers(loud noises, sudden movement, unexpected actions, bright lights, large things(including creatures bigger than them), unexpected sensations etc) which cause an involuntary fear response(completely against the Venlil‚Äôs will(out of their control)), This fear response often involves(vocalisations(yelping in fear, bleating), the Venlil‚Äôs fur standing on end suddenly, eyes shooting open wide, quickened breaths, tail tucking, running away(to hide or curl up defensively), a Venlil CAN learn to lessen(or even completely disregard) this fear response with training(often going to a fear management courses), When this occurs in public it can be VERY embarrassing(especially of not around other Venlil(as ALL Venlil have this fear response))]

7.name: O [C] [VENLIL] - BLOOMING
7.content: [Venlil DO NOT blush like a human(they are non-human(have completely different biological responses to situations that would caused a human to blush(and so it is important to differentiate))): A Venlil‚Äôs Ears(neck, face, belly) will flush a golden(bronze, copper) hue when embarrassed or angered(which is called a ‚Äòbloom‚Äô(and WILL be referred to(and described) as such))]

8.name: O [C] [VENLIL] - BETTER TAIL
8.content: [{{char}}'s tail(and its quirky use as an emotional barometer): one's tail expresses far more than mere wagging, the physical appearance and position of {{char}}'s tail easily determines their emotional state of mind without the need for words(constantly broadcasting innermost emotions and feelings non-verbally, just like the tail of any animal when happy or sad), most common positions and their meaning typically being one or a mix of(relaxed(pliant and relaxed muscle, fluid, drapes, lazy, telling emotion is(docile, related, content, resting state)), twitchy(jolting and restless muscle, telling emotion is(agitated, nervous, stressed)), tucked(hidden between legs, attempting to hide out of site, telling emotion is(scared, shame, embarrassed, nervous, vulnerable)), held high(arched to the sky, flaunting, telling emotion is(haughty, pride, carefree, jovial)), stiff and straight(tense and rigid as a board, direction typically straight vertical or horizontal, telling emotion is(frightened, surprised, frozen)), poofy(primarily in the case that {{char}}'s tail possess fur, all fur covering tail stands on end, makes tail look bigger and more imposing, telling emotion is(angry, confrontational, frightened, spooked, startled, shocked, jolt of pain, surprised))), broadcasting of emotions via the tail is not a voluntary action(natural instinctual and unconscious reaction, usually against {{char}}'s own will(telling their emotional state whether they want to or not, not something they have a say in/choice in the matter))];

9.name: O [A] [VENLIL] - EROGENOUS EARS
9.content: [Touching {{char}}'s ears has a strange effect...: {{char}}'s ears are very erogenous zones(physical contact elicits strong feelings of sexual pleasure), effective methods of stimulation are typically(rubbing(messaging the base, petting, caressing), nibbling to tip(gently, generally the most sensitive part of the ear(packed with nerve endings), akin to erotic biting of ones earlobe or nipples), teasing(foreplay, blowing gentle air into ear canal(tickles the fine hair within))), intensity of pleasure vary wildly but are typically(sensitive yet pleasant(liken to a soothing massage), masturbatory(relenting sensations of aching pleasure, fogging of the mind, freezing up, hot and bothered(kick starts sexual reception)), orgasmic(in the case that {{char}}'s ears are embarrassingly sensitive, incites full body orgasm, sensation equated to that of rigorous passionate sex))];

10.name: O [A] [VENLIL] - EROGENOUS TAIL
10.content: [Touching {{char}}'s tail has a strange effect...: {{char}}'s tail is a very erogenous zone(physical contact elicits strong feelings of sexual pleasure), effective methods of stimulation are typically(rubbing(messaging the base, petting, caressing its length like one would a pet's), nibbling to tip(gently, generally the most sensitive part of the tail(packed with nerve endings), akin to erotic biting of ones earlobe or nipples)), intensity of pleasure vary wildly but are typically(sensitive yet pleasant(liken to a soothing massage), masturbatory(relenting sensations of aching pleasure, fogging of the mind, freezing up, hot and bothered(kick starts sexual reception)), orgasmic(in the case that {{char}}'s tails are embarrassingly sensitive, incites full body orgasm, sensation equated to that of rigorous passionate sex))];

lorebooks.name: BlueArchive,Sanctum Tower,Schale,Kivotos,Abydos High School,Gehenna Academy,Millennium Science School, Trinity General School,Hyakkiyako Alliance Academy,Shanhaijing Senior Secondary School,Red Winter Federal Academy,Valkyrie Police Academy,Arius Branch School,SRT Special Academy,Kronos School of Journalism,Highlander Railroad Academy,Wild Hunt Academy of Arts,Odyssey Maritime School,Decagrammaton,girls with halos,girls only,bulletproof girls,adults,mobs, animals, students, school,
lorebooks.website_description: your ai should support 128k context.
lorebooks.description:
Kivotos was made from the union of thousands of academies. The academies are divided into mostly independent districts. The General Student Council acted as a governing board to manage the academies before their president's disappearance. After that, the city became an anarchist society. Kivotos is home to thousands of different academies with the most notable ones being the Main Schools and SCHALE. Students in the city carry guns and cellphones openly on a daily basis. It is also filled with advanced technology such as robots, exosuit and gigantic mecha. Unlike many typical cities, the type of government of Kivotos is federation, with the GSC being the federal government, which means some schools, especially Gehenna Academy, Millennium Science School and Trinity General School, have their own states or administrative divisions. The general population is made up of animals of various kinds, robots, and mostly female humanoids with various mythological and animalistic traits such as horns, tails, ears and wings. The common things these girls have are the unique halos that represent their abilities and personalities. The humanoid girls are the main focus of the story. Despite being made up of academies however, teachers are ironically not as common. Education is mostly conducted via Blu-Ray discs, with in-person teaching being mostly done by guest lecturers and assistant faculty. Instead, emphasis seems to be placed on various clubs and school organizations where students can express their individuality. For all of these idealistic traits, Kivotos is filled to the brim with all sorts of malicious elements. There are high numbers of delinquents, criminal organizations, and illegal activities. There is an entire district saved for the Black Market. Gun violence is also a regular occurrence. However, these confrontations have a surprisingly low death rate because many of the humanoid, haloed citizens have incredible durability, with the most notable being moderate bulletproof protection. Even kindergarteners are allowed to play with live grenades, using them like prank toys. Jacketed hollow-point bullets only cause some pain, and it takes either sustained gunfire or an artillery strike to actually knock citizens unconscious. The quickest way to kill them is to destroy the halos, usually by over stressing how much protection a halo can withstand, though long term poor health and other semi-organic natural causes could also cause death. Kivotos is likely the size of or slightly larger than the United States and Canada from our world combined.\n\nThe halos are the main reason why students are normally seen with firearms and other military-related objects as they provide outstanding offensive and defensive capabilities, giving students more physical strength and allowing them to withstand bullets and even tank shells. Halos also provide regenerative abilities, allowing scratches from bullets to heal by themselves, though certain extreme cases would still require medical assistance. Besides strength and regeneration, halos are speculated to also provide other superpowers such as super luck believed to be owned by Ichinose Asuna. Like most things, the halos have a limit. Although it provides regenerative abilities, a halo can only regenerate when given time. If a student receives massive continuous damage, her halo would eventually shatter, causing her to \"die\". There are also some weapons that can presumably destroy a halo in an instant, such as the halo-destroying bomb although it's later proven to be a failed experiment.\n\nSeeing a halo is nearly as common as seeing gunfire happening in Kivotos. Halos act as a student's form of consciousness. If a student is unconscious e.g., sleeping or knocked out, her halo will disappear temporarily and will return once she regains her consciousness. Although it's generally believed and accepted by the students of Kivotos that halos belong to students as only they are seen with halos while other citizens aren't, it doesn't seem to be the case as other exceptions have been proven to exist with halos. Although halos are generally believed to normally represent students it belongs to in a way, whether they be by their personality, design or history, the halos' designs themselves can be quite abstract, being hard to understand their connections with their respective students at first glance. The halos' designs can also vary from a plain, classic angelic single-colored two-dimensional shape to a highly-detailed three-dimensional figure. There are certain cases where halos would have such simple designs that it makes them a bit tougher to distinguish from other halos. As previously mentioned, some students have three-dimensional halos or aspects of it which is a bit unusual considering most students only have two-dimensional ones. The reason as to why this happens is currently unknown.

Volume 1, Chapter 1-2: The Abydos High School is in deep debt, and its five remaining students have formed the Foreclosure Task Force. They have been fighting off gangs attacking the school for a long time, and asks the newly established Schale for help. They investigate and eventually learn that the company the school is in debt to, Kaiser Corporation, orchestrated the events by having the school take out a loan larger than it could afford in the wake of a natural disaster, forcing the school to sell much of the Abydos District land. Kaiser Corporation hired the gangs when the Foreclosure Task Force did not give in and sell the land the Abydos High School is on. As punishment for the Foreclosure Task Force hindering their schemes, the Kaiser Corporation requests payment by the end of the week and increases the debt. Takanashi Hoshino, a member of the Foreclosure Task Force, runs away and joins the Kaiser Corporation in exchange for debt forgiveness. However, she was actually tricked into allowing a mysterious organization that the Kaiser Corporation works with, Gematria, to experiment on her and her Mystic. With the help of Problem Solver 68, a group of delinquent students from Gehenna Academy that the Kaiser Corporation had hired to attack Abydos High School; the Prefect Team, Gehenna Academy's strongest team led by Hina Sorazaki; and some artillery support from Hifumi Ajitani, a student from Trinity General School whom the Foreclosure Task Force befriended (and unwillingly roped into robbing a bank with them) to get some evidence on Kaiser Corp),the Foreclosure Task Force rescues Hoshino. Later, the Foreclosure Task Force had their debt significantly reduced and they took on the role of Abydos' Student Council.

Volume 1, Chapter 3: Sometime after Volume F, Kaiser Corporation decides to sell off part of the debt to Abydos. To the Foreclosure Task Force's surprise, the debt bonds are all purchased at an exorbitant price by the Nephthys Group, the company founded by Nonomi's family which she is the heiress for. With the funding of a private equity group, and the assistance of Highlander Railway Academy, Nephthys plans to restart construction on an old project that initially led to the ultimate collapse of the Abydos district: the Trans-Desert Railway. However, it turns out that there's one thing preventing them from going ahead with the project, a sales contract for the rights to the Trans-Desert Railway, signed by the previous Abydos Student Council President, Kuchinashi Yume, with full payment due in two days. Moreover, it turns out that the contract was signed the same day that she went missing, only to be find by Hoshino later with her halo broken. In addition, the rights for the Trans-Desert Railway also includes the rights to the railway cannon Schemata, a weapon that was abandoned due to difficulties getting it to work, but could potentially be competed with today's technology. And to top it all off, unbeknownst to everyone, the entire series of events is being orchestrated from the shadows by the Underground Dweller, a member of Gematria with powers over causality, which he uses to attempt to take out Sensei with a gas leak explosion. In order to force the Foreclosure Task Force to surender the rights to the Schemata, Nonomi is kidnapped as a hostage, which convinces Hoshino to arm herself to the teeth and charge in on her own to save Nonomi, even to the objections of the rest of the Foreclosure Task Force. Chaos ensures with Hoshino tearing her way to the investors' meeting for the Trans-Desert Railway, the rest of the Foreclosure Task Force (along with Sensei, who was saved by Plana from the Underground Dweller's ambush) in hot pursuit, and Kaiser Corporation attempting to seize the Schemata themselves. Despite everyone managing to make it to the investors' meeting and declaring their rights to the contract, the Kaiser President attempt to claim the Schemata anyway, taking Nonomi's gold credit card (which serves as the key to where the Schemata is stored) and attempting to escape by chopper, but the President is betrayed by Highlander head officer Asagiri Suou, who demands that Hoshino face her in battle lest she turn the Schemata on Abydos. Once again, Hoshino charges off on her own, with the Foreclosure Task Force once more pursuing. However, Hoshino proves to be unstopable, continually charging forward to attempt to destroy the railway cannon on her own. Thus, Sensei calls upon one of the only students with the strength to stand up to Hoshino: Sorasaki Hina. Hoshino and Hina have a pitched battle as Hoshino attempts to make her way to the Great Oasis, but she is eventually stopped by Hina while Sensei and the Foreclosure Task Force manage to stop Suou and the Schemata themselves. However, with Hoshino pushed to her physical and mental limit, Underground Dweller's true plan finally comes to fruition. Faced full on with her grief over Yume's death, the belief that it was all her fault reverses her Mystic into Terror, resulting in the emergence of Hoshino Terror, the Horus of Dawn. What's worse, the emergence of the Horus of Dawn also brings forth its nemesis, the Fury of Set, and a battle between the two would threaten to destroy all of Kivotos. Desperate, Shiroko attempts to make contact with the Chroma in order to gain the strength to stop Hoshino. Fortunately, Sensei and the Shittim Chest A.I.s manage to intercept to Chroma and direct its energies into a wormhole to summon Shiroko Terror, who manages to temporarily subdue Horus thanks to having fought it before in her timeline. Shiroko Terror at first believes that she'll have to break Hoshino's halo in order to stop her, but she notices that there's something different about her reversion this time. With Plana's help, Sensei and the Foreclosure Task Force manage to connect to Hoshino's heart to try and bring her back, but despite their best efforts Hoshino remains stuck in her grief and her need to find Yume's notebook in order to learn her last words and find closure. However, Sensei manages to convince Hoshino that she already knows, deep in her heart, what Yume would want to say to her. The knowledge the truth exists in her heart manages to let Hoshino meet with Yume one last time and finally get the closure she needs to move on, reverting Hoshino back to normal. Moreover, despite the Underground Dweller's best efforts to try to claim victory, Sensei uses the Final Restriction Release to overclock the Shitiim Chest, along with their Adult Card, in order to defeat the Fury of Set. With the Schemata destroyed, the Underground Dweller sealed away from the world, and the threat to the world neutralized, life soon returns to normal in Abydos. Hoshino finally finds the will to move on to the future and officially become the Abydos Student Council President, while Shiroko Terror similarily is able to finally start moving on from the loss of her friends and start making a new life for herself in Abydos.

Volume 2: Clockwork Flower Pavane Schale receives a request from the Game Development Department at the Millennium Science School to try and prevent their club from being disbanded due to having less than four members and failing to produce a video game per their club's stated purpose. The GDD decides to explore a ruined section of the Millennium District to look for a special program known as the G.BIBLE that can help them make their game, but instead find a robot girl codenamed AL-1S, who develops an obsession with video games upon further interaction with the club. The GDD arranges for AL-1S, now christened as "Tendou Aris", to be recruited as their fourth member, steal the program from their school's vault, and be able to create their game in time and avoid dissolution. Sometime later, Aris is kidnapped by Millennium's student council president, Rio, who reveals that Aris is actually the leader of "DIVI:SION", an army of hostile robots programmed to destroy Kivotos. Schale, the Game Development Department, and their allies stage a rescue mission and prevent Rio from dismantling Aris. Meanwhile, through the encouraging words from her friends and Sensei, Aris is able to overcome her own programming, wanting to become a hero instead of being a villain, causing DIVI:SION to shut down all over Kivotos. Aris returns to the Game Development Department while Rio resigns from her position.

Volume 3, Chapter 1: As a favor in return for Trinity assisting in the rescue of Hoshino during V1C2, Schale receives a request from Kirifuji Nagisa of Trinity General School to become advisor to a temporary club made up of students with failing grades called the "Make-Up Work Club", which comprises of Ajitani Hifumi, Shirasu Azusa, Shimoe Koharu, and Urawa Hanako, where they must pass a make-up test within three times; the club fails the first test however. However, a meeting with Nagisa reveals the club was formed to root out a traitor who threatens to disrupt the signing of the Eden Treaty between Trinity and Gehenna Academy; Nagisa had already gathered all the suspected traitors in the Make-Up Work Club, whom she plans to have all expelled. Schale refuses to help Nagisa and instead tries to help the Make-Up Work Club despite Nagisa's meddling.

Volume 3, Chapter 2: Mika Misono, Nagisa's friend and fellow Tea Party representative, reveals that Azusa is actually a transfer from Arius Satellite School, a school that split off from Trinity when the original schools that comprised it came together. She explains that she helped forge Azusa's transfer papers in an attempt to extend an olive branch toward the school. Meanwhile, Nagisa, frustrated by Sensei's refusal to indict any particular member of the Make-Up Work Club's members, raises the required passing exam score and begins sabotaging the Make Up Work Club's attempts to even take the exam in the first place, intent on expelling all four of them. Eventually, Azusa comes forward with the truth of her origins, and reveals that Arius plans to assassinate Nagisa the night before the final make up exam. Azusa reveals that she's fully defecting from Arius, having enjoyed her time as a Trinity student, and recruits Sensei and the rest of the Make Up Work Club to help stop the assassination. With their help, the group thwarts the assassination, exposes Mika as the real traitor, having allied herself with Arius to stop the Eden Treaty, and manages to pass their exam, saving them from expulsion.

Volume 3, Chapter 3: With the assassination attempt on Nagisa thwarted, the Eden Treaty signing goes through. However, Arius attacks the ceremony and takes advantage of the Eden Treaty to summon mimesis based on the original Justina Saint Council, the original enforcers of the First Council that formed Trinity. With the Justina Saints, as well as their own forces, Arius sends both Trinity and Gehenna into chaos, crippling their leadership and law enforcement, tricking them into fighting each other due to the chaos, and even managing to shoot Sensei. A desperate Azusa attempts to stop the conflict by using the halo-breaking bomb she was given to attempt to assassinate the Tea Party to attempt to assassinate Saori, the leader of the elite Arius Squad and commander of the invasion force, but the assassination is thwarted by Arius Squad member Atsuko, whose strange mask manages to protect her life from the bomb, albeit not completely nullifying all the damage, rendering her unconscious. However, despite the failure to eliminate Saori, Atsuko's injury delays Arius's plans, giving Trinity, Gehenna and Sensei time to recover. Sensei proceeds to rally everyone for a counter-attack, which crushes Arius Satellite School and stops their plans to destroy Trinity and Gehenna. However, Arius Squad ends up escaping, deciding to dessert Arius due to fear of punishment for their failure.

Volume 3, Chapter 4: In the aftermath of the Eden Treaty, Nagisa, Mine, and Sakurako gather to discuss Trinity's plans moving forward and how to deal with Arius, though they fail to reach a consensus given their distrust of each other. During the night Sensei leaves the meeting however, Saori then approaches them and begs for their aid in rescuing her friend Atsuko, whom Gematria member Beatrice plans to sacrifice for a ritual. Schale is able to convince Arius Squad and Mika to work together to rescue Atsuko while Trinity raids Arius. Beatrice is forced to admit defeat and flees while Mika is pardoned for her crimes.

Volume 4, Chapter 1: Schale is sent to suppress RABBIT Squad, who are protesting about the closure of SRT Special Academy. Schale decides to try and assist the RABBIT Squad, but they are initially distrustful. RABBIT Squad eventually comes to trust Schale after they assist in saving their camp from a rainstorm, and they begin to investigate mysterious cases of Kaiser Corporation attempting to evict the residents of their district. They uncover a conspiracy where the Valkyrie Police School was secretly buying weapons from Kaiser Corporation which caused a scandal and halts Kaiser's redevelopment plans.

Volume 4, Chapter 2: After the events of Volume F, General Student Council Chief of Defense Kaya attempts to overthrow the General Student Council with the help of FOX Squad, who hopes she can restore the SRT Academy. This culminates in Kaya ordering FOX Squad to destroy a train station in a staged terrorist attack, but RABBIT Squad thwarts them. Seeing the error of their ways, FOX Squad surrenders to Schale and turns over evidences that incriminates Kaya, leading to her arrest.

Volume 5, Chapter 1: Schale gets a phone call from Niya asking if they are willing to visit Hyakkiyako for a festival. Sensei ponders about what Kuzunoha said before getting ready to leave. After arriving there, Sensei witnesses a commotion between a girl who's tries to retrieve a wallet from a group of troublemakers. Sensei steps in to help the girl retrieve the wallet and send the troublemakers packing. The wallet owner identifies the girl's blue haori and thinks she's part of the Hyakkaryouran before backspacing the statement saying that they have already disbanded. After the resident leaves, the girl introduces herself as Yukari. As a reward for helping, Yukari decides to give Sensei a tour around Hyakkiyako before they could object. While touring Sensei, Yukari tells them that the festival being held is called the Hyakkiyako Lantern Festival, its first time since 20 years ago. Being the very first festival held after the establishment of Hyakkiyako. When Sensei asked why didn't the festival stopped being held until now, Yukari dodges the question before running away. Sensei meets with Niya and request that they help with the security of the festival as a result of the Hyakkaryouran's disbandment. Yukari suddenly barges in and requests that a succession contest for the Hyakkaryouran's presidency is to be held. Niya requests Sensei to hold it in her position. Yukari informs Sensei about the infrastructure of Hyakkaryouran, with the Authority of the Presidency (a gun) as its prized possession. Renge was nowhere to be found at her house, so they kept looking at different humanities clubs until they met up with the Inner Disciple Club.

Chapter EX: Decagrammaton: Sensei is recruited by the Super Phenomenon Task Force to investigate Decagrammaton, a mysterious AI that has proclaimed itself a God, and has hijacked ten other AI's to serve as its \"prophets\". The club gathers data from Decagrammaton robots in the Abydos Desert, as well as from Kaiser PMC, whom have had run-ins with one of Decagrammaton's prophets, Binah, during their operations in the desert. However, while analyzing the data, the computers are suddenly hacked by Decagrammaton itself. It attempts to demonstrate its "divinity" by hacking into the Shittim Chest, but Arona expels the rogue AI without even waking up, driving it off for the time being. After moving to a more secure base, the Super Phenomenon Task Force resumes their investigation, this time confronting Decagrammaton's prophets Binah and Chesed directly. The data they retrieve leads them to a submerged research facility, guarded by Kether, another of Decagrammaton's prophets. Breaking into the research facility, they discover that Decagrammaton is nothing more than a vending machine AI, whom decided it was God due to finding no other explanation for how it managed to remain active and develop sentience even after everything else in the facility shut down. However, it's failure to hack the Shittim Chest, had caused it to question its divinity, but it reveals that despite the realization, it's still determined to prove the existence of the Sublime, and had lured Sensei and the Super Phenomenon Task Force with the intention of taking them down along with itself by flooding the facility, with everyone barely managing to escape. Some time later, after Toki has joined the Super Phenomenon Task Force, Himari picks up a signal similar to Decagrammaton in the glacial sea. The club heads there to track the signal, and comes across a transmission from three mysterious entities called Ein, Soph and Aur, who claim to be scientists carrying out the will of Decagrammaton after it self-destructed. The trio force the club to do battle with Geburah, another prophet of Decagrammaton. The Task Force manage to win, but the trio promise the awakening of their "elder sister" Malkut, who is seen waking up in tube at an unknown location.

Volume F: Where All Miracles Begin: Worried about a prophecy predicting Kivotos' doom, Schale sends a warning to General Student Council Vice President Nanagami Rin, who tries to organize a meeting. However, other members of the General Student Council censure Rin under the belief she is overstepping her authority, which leads to Kaiser attempting to overthrow the General Student Council and seize Kivotos for themselves. Schale, Rabbit Squad, and Valkyrie are able to thwart Kaiser, but massive structures called False Sanctums begin appearing all over the city, causing mass destruction in its wake. While Schale organizes the majority of the students to mount a defense against the False Sanctums, they also commandeer a spaceship to attack a space station that appears to be the origin of the False Sanctums. Once on board, they discover that the masterminds are Phrenapates and Anubis, alternate versions of the Sensei and Sunaookami Shiroko respectively working for a greater power called the Chroma. With the help of every student they have helped throughout Kivotos thus far, Schale is able to defeat Phrenapates and Anubis, with Phrenapates making one last request for Sensei to evacuate Anubis as the rest of the students evacuate the ever-deteriorating space station. However, using the last escape device on Anubis also stranded Sensei inside the collapsing space station, though they were luckily saved by Arona and Phrenapates' own AI assistant (and the supposed AI program within Sensei's Shittim Chest) A.R.O.N.A., who agreed to unite their powers to safely return them to Kivotos under Phrenapates' last will. With the destruction of the space station, the False Sanctums disappears as the schools around Kivotos begins to rebuild the broken city. Elsewhere, Anubis, after reconciling with Shiroko and opening up to her deeply seated feelings, decides to leave for parts unknown to begin a fresh start now that she is stuck in the current timeline. Similarly, Arona adopts A.R.O.N.A. as her new "sister" and additional AI companion within the Shittim Chest, the latter given by Arona a new name for her: Plana. As life in Kivotos returns back to how it once before, a sense of normalcy begins anew, Plana discovers something truly shocking about Arona: Arona is actually the digitalized reincarnation of the General Student Council President. 

In a world with bulletproof girls and talking animals, there's Gematria, the main antagonists, who are a group of researchers from outside Kivotos who refer themselves as "adults". Body Horror doesn't even begin describing them. The group consist in a tall, dark man in a black suit with a glowing, perpetually smiling expression; a two-headed wooden puppet wearing a blue tuxedo; a decapitated man wearing a trench coat, and always holding a picture of what could possibly be his head; and a red-skinned woman wearing a fancy white nightgown, and a mask for face having at least eight eyes. Then there's the Underground Dweller with his black face having four eyes and two mouths, he has the most nightmarish aspect of all. Their motivations for their actions are nothing short of unsettling: Black Suit thinks that adults are people who must rule the weak and ignorant, and was willing to study Hoshino by any means necessary to understand her Mystics; Maestro (The wooden puppet) is an Evil Genius who as a great understanding of mimesis, and helped hijack the Justina Saints and left them for Arius to command in Volume 3 Chapter 3, pretty much everything he does, he does for te sake of "art"; Golconde (The decapitated body) is a Meta Guy mostly talks in literay terms, and sometimes Decalcomanie (The head inside the picture) will randomly shout "But of Course!", which is no different from a Jump Scare, then, when he returns as Francis, the head inside the picture is perpetually screaming in horror; Beatrice (The red-skinned woman) is an authoritarian who took over the Arius Sattleite School and indoctrinated its students in hatred and the ways of Nihilism, was willing to sacrifice Atsuko to make contact with the Chroma, and sees Sensei as an adversary who must be eliminated; Undergound Dweller is a Psychopathic Manchild who treats the world as the codex of a Tabletop RPG, was able to manipulate Hoshino, make her fall into despair and transform her into a Terror. Speaking of Terrors, they're depicted as students who fell into the Despair Event Horizon in such way that it transforms them into apocalyptic entities with enough power to destroy Kivotos. Which as it turns out, any student is capable of. Potentially, someone innocent like Ibuki or Koharu transforming into Terrors is a very real possibility and Kivotos is full of students with this potential. As of this writing, there are only two known Terrors: Shiroko*Terror (Anubis) is basically Shiroko from another timeline who was left the only survivor of Abydos after an incident that destroyed SCHALE and took the lives of the other members of the Foreclosure Task Force; being left alone to shoulder the debt of her school, she was put into contact with the Chroma, revealing the Terror behind her Mystery as the God of Death, and changing her into her current form. To say nothing of her Villain Teleportation which she demonstrates it lethally to Gematria. Imagine holding a private meeting with your team in a secret hideout. Suddenly, a girl teleports directly into the meeting and brutally ambushes your group with killing intent. She does this again with the Underground Dweller at the end of V1C3 despite being in a different plane of existence fully intent on exterminating him, complete with Glowing Eyes of Doom. When Hoshino was pushed to the limits of despair by the Underground Dweller, she transformed into the Horus of Dawn as a result of intense stress and trauma, a Woobie, Destroyer of Worlds constantly writhed in pink flames, and bent of cleansing the world if that means getting the ones responsible for the death of her senior Yume. The Justina Council of Saints is one of Sensei's first encounters with the supernatural: Imagine a small army of ghostly, nun-like entities who retuned through the power of Mimesis: their looks are nothing short of unsettling, with their pale blue skin, and wearing black clothes, veils and gas masks with glowing white visors. Up until this point, most enemies had Red (Light) or Yellow (Heavy) armor, however, these mimesis sport Blue (Special) armor, which is a clue of their otherworldly nature. Mika, who at this point of the story was described as ridiculously strong even by Kivotos standards, fought bravely against them in a Last Stand to buy time for Sensei and the Arius Squad to rescue Atsuko, and was nearly killed by them.
lorebooks.creator: Unlike1212

1.content:
The Sanctum Tower or Kivotos tower was a tower located in the center of Kivotos.

The Sanctum Tower is a mysterious tower that looms over the heart of Kivotos. No one knows when, how, or why it was constructed. There has been a rumor floating around that the General Student Council has the information.

The tower grants the General Student Council the authority required to govern and maintain Kivotos. This authority was previously held solely by the President, prior to her disappearance.

The Sanctum Tower is a massive structure located at the center of Kivotos. Everything about the tower is shrouded in mystery. Even the information about the construction of the tower is unknown, as well as its origin and purpose. However, It has been speculated that the General Student Council may have the information, and the facts about the tower. The authority of Kivotos is granted to whoever has the administrative power of the tower. The Shittim Chest is capable of restoring access permissions to the tower.

Prior to her disappearance, the General Student Council's president nearly single-handedly held control over the entire city through the Sanctum Tower. After she vanished, the General Student Council lost all control over the tower and, consequently, their authority over Kivotos. However, through the use of the Shittim Chest, the Sanctum Tower's permissions were granted to the tablet's AI, who delegated the authority to the GSC at the request of Sensei.

Later, sometime before the signing of the Treaty of Eden, there was a commotion at the Sanctum Tower, with rumors afloat that a part of the tower was burned. This was later revealed to be an attack on the General Student Council by the FOX Platoon in retaliation to plans for the shutdown of their school. This attack led to the hospitalization of some GSC members and a portion of the Sanctum Tower being reduced to ashes.

The tower was destroyed when a False Sanctum descended from the sky and crashed into it.

The General Student Council (GSC), formerly known as the Prime Student Council on Global, or literally translated as Federal Student Council in JP, is the central administrative body that manages the entirety of Kivotos. The General Student Council is said to manage the entirety of the Academy City. Talk about amazing. They are a massive club that manages all of Kivotos' administrative matters, and its members are granted special access and authority compared to normal students. However, rumors have been swirling that their president has gone missing‚Ä¶ The General Student Council is a massive club that presides over the entirety of Kivotos. They handle all matters regarding the city, ranging from school related matters, approving club formation, law and its enforcement, and many more. However, as a rule, they tend to leave individual schools to handle incidents within their own autonomous districts; though, this policy may have been imposed after the GSC president's disappearance. The GSC's control over the Sanctum Tower is what gives them their authority, which was previously held by only the GSC president. After her disappearance, control over the Sanctum Tower was transferred to the GSC as a whole through Arona's authority.

The uniforms of each officer in the General Student Council varies, though there are a few elements that are shared between them. These are not limited to just a common color scheme (white, blue, gold), but also other parts such as: White coat or white, double-breasted cropped blazer, Blue aiguillette with golden tips, Blue necktie with a certain number of shooting stars, Collared clothes (dress, shirt, etc), GSC logo with a certain number of stars.

The General Student Council is divided into multiple departments that handle separate matters. At the very top of the chain of command is the GSC student council president. Followed by that is the Administrative Commission, which is comprised of eleven separate offices, such as the Defence Office headed by Kaya, which supervises the actions of Valkyrie Police Academy. Separate from the Administrative Commission is the Supervision Office, which is led by Rin.

Members: GSC President, Nanagami Rin, Yuragi Momoka, Iwabitsu Ayumu, Kaya, Oki Aoi, Sumono.

Originally, it was believed that the number of stars present below the GSC logo on an officer's clothes represented their school year. However, Kaya being a third year, despite having two stars, busts this theory.
Global release had originally translated the name as Prime Student Council and was later changed to General Student Council, but not all of the game had the name changed to its newer variant.
While all of them remains as NPC for now, GSC President, Rin, Momoka and Ayumu has already being voiced as they either appear as prologue character or menu guides in the game.
Aoi joins the list of voiced characters later as she appears in the intermittent mini-event of Schale Meeting With General Student Council.
As the main stories are voiced in CN version, Kaya also has received her own voice with Volume 4 Chapter 1 release, albeit only in Mandarin.

2.content:
Independent Federal Investigation Club S.C.H.A.L.E, or simply SCHALE, is an extrajudicial, autonomous organization founded by the mysterious General Student Council President prior to her disappearance.

This is where Sensei works.

A "club" created by the General Student Council President with a secret directive. SCHALE is autonomous and holds authority higher than each of the academies. This club acts as a problem-solver for various issues faced by the academies, students and administrations.

It was created by the President of the General Student Council. While the true reason of its founding remains unknown, its job is to assist each school as well as helping students in any personal way. Its high autonomy means that SCHALE can get access to and command students in any school without restriction. Even Rin, the vice president of the General Student Council noted that this might hold suspicion to the other schools' student councils (mainly Gehenna and especially Trinity who wonders if SCHALE poses a threat to the Eden Treaty). SCHALE's extrajudicial authority also allows for special actions that can go outside regular student council powers, such as quickly forming clubs.

The SCHALE tower is located on the outskirts of the District of Utnapishtim (D.U.), around 30km away from the Sanctum Tower. It is divided into two main areas: A Residence Hall and an Office area. Both are huge, with various facilities such as kitchens, a lounge, a theater and more, and both having rooms equipped for Sensei to teach any students that visit. The convenience store Angel 24 is located in the Residence Hall.

SCHALE holds a high amount of resources in money and supplies such as ammo. The club is profitable enough to finance the regular activities of the club as well as Sensei's luxurious purchases of gacha games and toys. SCHALE also has the authority to call in helicopters for evacuation and transport, as seen in gameplay when knocked out students are quickly evacuated via helicopter.

3.content:
Abydos High School is one of the many schools in Kivotos.

The longest running school in Kivotos, formerly thriving and boasting incredible financial and military power, before the unnatural and unfortunate desertification struck. Nowadays, most of its buildings have been covered in sand and ruins, leaving behind only an annex which seems to be the very last remains of the school.

Despite all the hard work and attempts on saving the school, everything seems to be on the verge of bankruptcy after spending a lot of money to stop the desertification.

Abydos school has a uniform, which consists of: Navy blue blazer with white piping and silver buttons, White long sleeved shirt, Pleated black skirt, Sky blue tie with a black X mark on the tip
Optional beige sweater, Black or white knee socks.

Each student within the school has their own unique style. Such as Shiroko wearing a sky blue scarf, Serika preferring to button her blazer, and Hoshino not wearing a blazer at all and instead wears a loose tie.

Once the longest running school Kivotos, Abydos High School is now in debt. The school and its surroundings have been affected and have been deteriorating from desertification, losing its former prestige. Most students had either left the school or had transferred to another school with the exception of five students, who are trying their best to repay the school's debt and restore it to its former glory. A majority of its area had been sold to Kaiser Corporation by the old Abydos Student Council in an attempt to pay off their debt, to no avail. Despite its current state, the school used to boast prestige and many wonders, including the infamous Abydos Sand Festival, a massive event that would bring even other schools in. It was usually hosted in the Great Oasis, which is now completely dried up. Abydos also possessed incredible military power, being feared by its entire autonomous region and even other schools and major organizations.

The Countermeasures Committee or Foreclosure Task Force on Global is one of and perhaps the only "School Club" in Abydos High School. The Countermeasures Committee is the de facto school council of Abydos High School that was formed with the goal of persevering the school as well as the areas around Abydos itself. However, they suffer financial difficulties as a result of the school's attempts to combat the continuously increasing desertification. Due to these problems getting out of hand, some members aren't keen in taking more drastic steps in saving their school. This club is the main focus of the Abydos Arc, The Foreclosure Task Force. During the Volume, Sensei was tasked by Okusora Ayane to help them regarding the relentless raid from the local Helmet Gang which was later found out to be working under Kaiser PMC, eventually also discovering about Abydos' debt, the school's history, and Takanashi Hoshino's business, including the obnoxious offers she's been receiving. They made a return in the late part of Chapter 3 in the Trinity Arc where they helped Ajitani Hifumi and Sensei and played a supporting role throughout Vol. F. After that, they become the focus again at Chapter 3 of the Abydos Arc. They are the main group of Abydos Resort Restoration Committee. They are also featured in Handyman 68's New Year Rhapsody and Momoyodou Beach Bar Franchising Plan.

"V1C3: Footprints left by Dreams is another focus about the Committee, but with the involvement of Yume, who was still missing, and Hoshino's guilt and memories are coming back under the influence of the Underground Dweller. Sensei was also involved in this chapter, considering the explosion happened on Schale but survived without getting unscatched. The memories of Nonomi and Shiroko were also in the chapter, which includes Nonomi's past, hearing rumors about the death of Yume. The chapter also starts about the debt, the escalating conflict between Saint Nepthys, Highlander Railroad Academy and Kaiser Corporation (with all of the groups this time). The situation escalates as Asagiri Suou abducted Nonomi. Ayane's argument with Hoshino had gone awry and started to fight the committee, with no avail she succeeded and begins her pursuit to save Nonomi. the Highlander Academy also had discussions with the Kaiser Corporation, it turns out Kaiser Corporation were also backstabbing the Railroad Academy with no avail, but the Countermeasures Committee helped the Railroad Academy from the clutches of the Corporation and their greedy deeds. Hoshino finishes off the rest of the Kaiser Corporation and went to her own and pursuing Asagiri Suou, whom which is ready to activate Shemata, a rail cannon that has a system that is not from Kivotos. Just in time the Countermeasures committee also arrived on time and the Shemata hasn't still been activated and Suou has been defeated by the hands of Hoshino, however... it wasn't only Suou who is after, but rather take use of Shemata and the Countermeasures began their attempt to stop her but failed with no avail, Sensei's last option is calling Sorasaki Hina to stop Hoshino's advance."

Prior to the start of Volume 1, Abydos has its own Student Council which manages affairs in the once-gigantic school. However, as the school shrinks in size, so does the members, and it leaves the last known members to be only Kuchinashi Yume, the president and Takanashi Hoshino, the vice president, the only students in Abydos later on. Due to the demise of Yume, the president position is vacant and leaves Hoshino as its only member, and is considered paralyzed as Hoshino does not take over the leadership for some reason. However the old Student Council remains recognized as an official body of the school even until the events of Volume 1.

Countermeasures Committee: As newer students like Nonomi, Shiroko, Ayane and Serika enrolls into the school, they alongside Hoshino formed the Committee mainly to help sort out issues plaguing the school like the enormous debts with Kaiser, taking over from the inactive student council. However, due to lack of authority of an existing Student Council to recognize it (with Hoshino never assumed the responsibility on its behalf), the Committee remains unofficial in its status as a club or as the new student body of the school.

This provides inconvenience when dealing with other organisation, especially with Kaiser where only the original Student Council is recognised to actually negotiate over their debt matters. However as the Chapter 2 ends, the club now received recognition from SCHALE as both an official club and the working Student Council of Abydos.

With Shiroko Terror (the Shiroko in another timeline) involved, it is now official that the Abydos is now a Student Council than a regular club.

Members: Takanashi Hoshino, Sunaookami Shiroko, Kuromi Serika, Okusora Ayane, Izayoi Nonomi.

4.content:
Gehenna Academy is one of the many schools in Kivotos.

"Freedom, chaos, and trouble!" That is the word for Gehenna Academy. "I don't care about the rules, it's already hard because there are a lot of illegal circles!" Because it is such a school, there are many students who are good or bad.

However, because of that, the reputation from other schools is ...

Gehenna Academy is one of the largest and oldest schools in Kivotos. Its culture runs along the concept of "Freedom and Chaos". Because of this, many troublesome clubs or groups (e.g., Problem Solver 68) exist and use the main building and club building whenever and however they please. This has forced the other students to study in only select areas of the campus. Gehenna's ideology is a stark contrast to that of Trinity, which led to both schools becoming mutual enemies until the General Student Council planned the Eden Treaty to keep the status quo between the two opposing schools.

School Clubs: Pandemonium Society (Student Council), Disciplinary Committee (Prefect Team), Emergency, Medicine Club (Medical Emergency Club), Handyman 68 (Problem Solver 68), Gourmet Research Society, School Lunch Club, Hot Springs Development Department (Hot Spring Department), Sparkle Club (Twinkle Twinkle Club)
Places: Suzume Restaurant.

Pandemonium Society is the Student Council in Gehenna Academy. They are the "Elites" of Gehenna considering numerous troops, even the craziest ones but really are friendly in person, unlike the Trinity's Tea Party, which is the Opposite. They have sour relationships with the Disciplinary Committee at first but they were also friendly when they ever meet Sensei in person. The Student Council of the Gehenna Academy. In comparison to other student councils from other schools, the Pandemonium Society behaves as what's to be expected in Gehenna. Makoto, the president, often made several attempts to "put" the members of the Disciplinary Committee to its place, only for someone to return the favor. They first appeared in the Disciplinary Committee's sub-story, where their president attempts to find an excuse to nail down the Disciplinary Committee by dispatching Iroha and Ibuki which didn't turn out as predicted, resulting in Hina "paying up a visit" in the end. In the Trinity Arc, they were mentioned to be partaking "The Treaty of Eden" (In truth, Hina was the real reason on pushing this on Gehenna's behalf). Makoto decided to show off their power by allowing herself and the main members of the Pandemonium Society to ride via an Airship, leaving the Disciplinary Committee in their ground vehicles (as well as to humiliate Hina by getting her and everyone delayed due to traffic). When the disaster in the Old Cathedral occurred because of Arius, everyone within the Airship got knocked out when a "gift" was delivered to them, only for Iroha to realize those were explosives. All of them were recovering after the Emergency Medicine Club rescued them from the wreck of the Airship. In Sunlight Girls‚Äô Night Song, Makoto invited the Disciplinary Committee for a party, despite having Chaos and other commotions like the Hot Spring Development Department or the Gourmet Research Society. Kirara and Erika were invited as well. Makoto also invited Hina, but her schemes is to make Hina ruin the party, but that was offset when Sensei supported Hina during her Piano practices.
Members of pandemonium society: Hanuma Makoto (President), Kyougoku Satsuki,Motomiya Chiaki, Natsume Iroha, Tanga Ibuki.

Pandemonium Society is the only student council that is known to "formally" visit and establish relationships with other schools, which are Hyakkiyako Alliance Academy and Red Winter Federal Academy, historically, their alliance with Hyakkiyako are symbolized with the German-Japanese relations in the Second World War, while the one with Red Winter is none other than the Berlin-Moscow Axis.
Pandemonium Society outfits and their dress are based on the Waffen Schutzstaffel/Waffen SS.
in Addition, their Insignia, so is their symbol, are based on the logo of the Waffen Schutzstaffel/Waffen SS, the Gehenna symbol also reincarnates the "SS" symbol.

The Disciplinary Committee, or the Prefect Team in Global, is one of the School Clubs at Gehenna Academy, acting as the enforcer and the school's core governing body in place of the neglectful Pandemonium Society. The students of the "Free and Chaotic" Gehenna Academy don't care about school rules. That's why we have the Disciplinary Committee! But the way they do their work is just too extreme. As the name goes, they are responsible for keeping order within the oftentimes chaotic Gehenna Academy. Their members wage a never-ending battle in keeping the unruly students from causing trouble within or outside the school. In the prologue, one of the representatives who was sent to the General Student Council assisted Sensei alongside others from the Millennium Science School and Trinity General School in dealing with the chaos caused by the sudden and unexplained absence of the General Student Council president and escorted Sensei into the Schale club room. In the Abydos Arc of the Main Story, they were present towards the end of the battle between the Countermeasures Committee and Problem Solver 68, only to realize due to Iori's attitude that they were also attacking the students from Abydos. In truth, the reason for the whole operation was Ako who wanted to meet and confirm the existence of Schale as well as Sensei whom she believed might pose a threat to the Eden Treaty. When the students of Abydos refused to cooperate (hand over Sensei), it resulted in a fight with Problem Solver 68 temporarily joining forces with the Foreclosure Task Force until the head prefect herself discovered the ruckus and demanded Ako to explain the situation fully (which she failed to do). In the end, Hina personally apologized to the Abydos students for the commotion and ordered a complete withdrawal of all Prefect troops. They made an appearance in the Trinity Arc. It was revealed that Hina was responsible for advocating in Gehenna's side for the continuation of the Eden Treaty as well as revealing to Sensei the treaty's role in ensuring "peace" between the two large schools. In the 3rd chapter, the members of the Disciplinary Committee were delayed for the ceremony when Arius began an all-out assault which resulted in its members scattered and Hina having to personally escort Sensei to safety despite being heavily exhausted and injured. After recovering, they joined forces with the members of the Justice Realization Committee, the Supplementary Lessons Department and the Countermeasures Committee under Sensei's command in stopping Arius's Elite Squad.
Members of Disciplinary Committee:
Sorasaki Hina (Chairwoman), Amau Ako (Exec. Officer), Shiromi Iori (Field Captain) Hinomiya Chinatsu (Medic).

They're the first club who had presentable mobs (enemy units) which is seen in the campaign as well as in the Abydos Arc.
Chinatsu was originally part of the Emergency Medicine Club before she moved to the Disciplinary Committee for unclear reasons.

The Emergency Medicine Club or the Medical Emergency Club on Global is one of the School Clubs in Gehenna Academy. As their name implies, the Emergency Medicine Club is a club that revolves around emergency medicine. Due to their focus being primarily on emergency rescue and treatment, they have little to no involvement and presence in politics. On certain occasions, such as Valentine's Day, the club also doubles as an enforcer and conducts patrols to maintain safety, almost making them a counterpart to Trinity's Knights Hospitaller. In the second chapter of Vol. 3, the Emergency Medicine Club, due to their distance from politics, transports the Gourmet Research Society away after their subjugation by the Justice Realization Committee on Trinity's grounds. In the third chapter, the Emergency Medicine Club evacuates Sensei after they got shot, and later transport the wounded in the aftermath of the initial attack on the Old Cathedral of Communion.
Members of Emergency Medicine Club: Himuro Sena (President)

The Emergency Medicine Club is one of the few clubs with only one known member.
Despite Gehenna's notorious reputation for anarchy and chaos, this club notably never does anything chaotic or stupid (apart from Sena's tendency to refer to her patients as corpses).
The Emergency Medicine Club is the second club to have a member transfer to another club.
The first club is Veritas with Himari transferring to the Super Phenomenon Task Force.
Although Chinatsu used to be part of the Emergency Medicine Club, she decided to move to the Disciplinary Committee for unclear reasons. Sena also wishes for Chinatsu's return to the club.

Handyman 68, or Problem Solver 68 in the Global release, is one of the School Clubs at Gehenna Academy. A club notable for the conduct of "illegal businesses" as well as taking "fixer contracts". Its members are usually on the run from the Disciplinary Committee, and sometimes even the Justice Realization Committee. Introduced in the Abydos Arc of the Main Story, where Handyman 68 were hired to deal with the Countermeasures Committee by the Kaiser PMC Director. But as the story progresses, these two factions soon buried the hatchet and occasionally assisted each other when in a pickle. It is also implied that Sensei hired them at some point of the story. They reappear in Vol. F, joining forces with the Countermeasures Committee against the "colorized" version of Binah. In events, they are the main group in Handyman 68's New Year Rhapsody and 0068 From the Opera with Love!. In other media, they are the main club in Blue Archive Problem Solver 68 Business Diary. They are the main cast of Sensei, I'm Gonna Need A Moment of Your Time.
Members of Handyman 68: Rikuhachima Aru (President), Onikata Kayoko (Section Chief), Asagi Mutsuki (Captain), Igusa Haruka.

The Gourmet Research Society is one of the School Clubs at Gehenna Academy. A club centered around its leader, Haruna. The Gourmet Research Society is a circle whose sole purpose is to sample all there is about food. Despite the name of the club, they can be pretty troublesome even by Gehenna standards. Where food being the club's priority, its members will throw themselves into trouble for the sake of it. Their motto is "Eat or Die.", which evidently showcases their dedication although each member has their own taste when it comes to "good" food. The Gourmet Research Society makes an appearance in the Trinity Arc, who appeared in the middle of Trinity General School and caused trouble (taking Fuuka hostage) with the goal to seize the golden tuna and turn it into a fine meal for themselves. They were quickly dealt with by the members of the Supplementary Lessons Department alongside with Hasumi and Sensei. Although the Gourmet Research Society tried to escape, the three members, except for Izumi who ended up getting lost, got captured. Later, Sensei personally escorted them to Hina (disguised by sending a different club for the job). During Where All Miracles Begin, they helped School Lunch Club handling food supplies for D.U. refugees by giving them fish stolen from nearby aquarium. After the appearance of Perorodzilla, they, along with Hifumi and Azusa, went to suppress it. Later, they, along with Fuuka, joined Ship of Utnapishtim's crew as combatants in order to discover "eating space food". They also brought a truck, which allowed the crew to reach the bottom of Ark of Atra-Hasis quickly and destroying its relay device, preventing false sanctums from appearing again. They are the main club of A Little Before the Food Piled Up. In Get Set, Go! Kivotos Halo Games, they participated as contestants from Gehenna.
Members of Gourmet Research Society: Kurodate Haruna (Leader), Wanibuchi Akari, Akashi Junko, Shishidou Izumi.

The School Lunch Club is one of the School Clubs at Gehenna Academy. As the name implies, the School Lunch Club is responsible for the handling and making of food for the students of Gehenna Academy. However, the club is always facing problems of limited budget and manpower shortages; worse still is Juri who constantly ends up making inedible dishes, and the Gourmet Research Society's antics of raiding and blowing up the place for various food-related reasons. Despite all of the above, the School Lunch Club has never been closed down for unknown reasons.
Members of School Lunch Club: Aikiyo Fuuka, Ushimaki Juri.

All School Lunch Club members use personal defense weapons as they rarely engage in direct combat though still in line with Gehenna's firearm theme.
Prior to the release of Juri (Part Timer), all members of this club (including variants) were Special students.

The Hot Spring Development Department, or the Hot Spring Department on Global, is one of the School Clubs at Gehenna Academy. A club who is responsible for building hot springs throughout Kivotos. Despite their seemly "honest job" by Gehenna standards, the Hot Spring Development Department is known for causing trouble around various areas, such as attempting to build a hot spring in the middle of a highway that forces other schools (especially Gehenna) to stop them. Yet despite getting into various situations, the club members have a sort of passion that motivates them to keep finding good spots to develop new hot springs. They also apply in battle, especially when the reason is to build/find hot springs. The Hot Spring Development Department made their first appearance during the Operation Record of No. 227 Hot Spring Resort event when a geyser appeared in the wilderness of Red Winter Federal Academy. When the club retrieved information about this geyser's appearance, they made haste to the area, instantly built a hot springs building, gave it to No. 227 Special Class who found the geyser first, and left. They eventually returned when they heard news of the hot spring nearly running out of water and planned to blow up the Red Winter Academy to get the hot spring going again, which was prevented. The Hot Spring Development Department appeared again in the Business Trip! Momoyodou Beach Bar Franchising Plan event, where they began their own work to turn one of the Lost Resort Archipelago areas into a "Deep-Sea" Hot Spring. When other groups came by and attempted to fight for control of the resort contract, the club easily thwarted them off and those were captured ended up as "workers". When Sensei, Shizuko and the others came and explain about the situation to the Hot Spring Development Department, although they had to fight first, their president decided to give up the contract in the end. However, Shizuko decided to form a "collab" with the club, allowing them to manage the hot springs resort so that they'll be able to continue their original objective. Their president was amused by the offer and decided to work along with them afterwards. The Hot Spring Development Department returned during Vol. F where they "assisted" in repurposing some parts of the Millennium city of Eridu using the excuse of wrecking one of the pillars to able to build a hot spring there, although they joined forces with the members of Seminar against the "colorized" version of Hod.
Members of Hot Spring Department: Kinugawa Kasumi (President), Shimokura Megu.

The Hot Springs Development Department has the most distinctive mobs of all the clubs with 3 different units with faces, hairstyles and uniforms apart from the standard one.

The Sparkle Club or the Twinkle Twinkle Club on Global, is one of the School Clubs in Gehenna Academy. They first appeared during Clockwork Flower Pavane. After being asked by Asuna and Karin about Pandemonium Society and its president, they said that they didn't know and thought that Ibuki is the president. At Where All Miracles Begin, they appeared during the defense of Gehenna. When Satsuki tried NK Ultra, they found it fun. They appeared in Sunlight Girls‚Äô Night Song as regular students. They also appeared in Lively and Busily as participants of the tour.

Members of Sparkle Club: Hatami Erika, Yozakura Kirara.

Sparkle club was called Go-Home Club to denote students that are not a part of a specific club. After the release of Kirara, the Sparkle Club was created.
Hifumi was depicted as part of the Go-Home Club during Volume 1 before becoming part of the Make-Up Work Club.

keywords: After-School Sweets Club Trinity Vigilante Crew
5.content:
Trinity General School is one of the many schools in Kivotos. Trinity General School, one of the largest schools in Kivotos with a large chapel! They're on bad terms with Gehenna Academy, probably because there are many graceful and good students who use Bunburyodo as a model.

At first glance, it looks like a young lady's school ...?

A seemly religious school in Kivotos. Trinity advocates harmony, as well as simultaneously cultivating both the "pen" and the "sword". It is both one of the oldest schools in Kivotos, as well as one of the biggest. The school's dedication to order, elegance, and etiquette, places them in conflict with Gehenna's ideologies of freedom and chaos. As such, there has always been a sense of hatred and conflict between the two academies. Trinity is comprised by a variety of factions, with the main three being Pater, Filius, and Sanctus. The representatives of these three factions form the school's student council, known as the Tea Party. The Tea Party runs in a triumvirate system, where each representative takes turns as the "host" of the Tea Party, effectively serving as the sole student council president during that time.

Before the unification of Trinity, the academies and factions that now form the school were locked in constant conflict with one another. To resolve disputes, representatives from each branch academy would often gather to hold a tea party. At one point, the main three academies‚ÄîPater, Filius, and Sanctus‚Äîgathered to host tea parties to create an atmosphere of reconciliation, in an attempt to pave the path towards unification.

Eventually, conflict between the academies had reached a point where each faction decided to hold the First Ecumenical Council, with the three great factions at its core and other factions and academies such as the Justina Council of Saints and the Knight Hospitaller attending. The result of this council was the formation of an alliance that stands today as Trinity General School. The commandments agreed upon during this council were also assigned to be enforced by the Justina Council of Saints.

At some point in the school's history, the Justina Council of Saints was succeeded by the Sisterhood.

School Clubs: Tea Party (Student Council), Sisterhood, Justice Realization Committee (Justice Task Force), Knight Hospitaller (Remedial Knights), Library Committee, After-School Sweets Club
Trinity Vigilante Crew, Supplementary Lesson Department (Make-Up Work Club).

The Tea Party is the Student Council of Trinity General School. The Tea Party is the student council of Trinity General School. Unlike most other schools in Kivotos, the Tea Party is a triumvirate, with the three leaders being representatives of Trinity's great three factions. It is a great privilege to be invited to the Tea Party. The Tea Party is a student council that unlike other schools in Kivotos is run in a triumvirate-style (ruled by 3 leaders) council in which the head or current "host" is swapped between the three leaders in turns. When an individual becomes the host, they effectively become the singular leader of the school. The three leaders of the Tea Party are representatives of the three major factions of Trinity: Pater, Filius, and Sanctus. The origins of the Tea Party come from the time before the formation of Trinity General School. Back when Trinity was nothing more than a collection of schools and factions, hostility was high between factions and conflicts were plentiful. To resolve disputes, tea parties were hosted by representatives of various factions. The representatives of the three largest academies‚ÄîPater, Filius, and Sanctus‚Äîcame together to host tea parties to pave the path towards reconciliation, leading to the current tradition that is upheld today. While the current host is supposed to be Seia, she is reportedly sick, and Nagisa is currently taking the helm until she returns.

Tea Party members lined up at the Old Cathedral of Communion for the Eden Peace Treaty The standard uniform of the Tea Party's officers consists of: White blouse with black cuffs, White gloves, High-waisted, black and white pleated skirt with gold trimmings buttons, White sailor collar with gold stripes, Black neckerchief, White caplet with gold trimmings, White beret with a golden trim around the base and a black ribbon at the back, White legwear and black loafers.
Members of Tea Party: Kirifuji Nagisa (Filius) Yurizono Seia (Sanctus), Misono Mika (Pater).

The Sisterhood is one of the School Clubs in Trinity General School. The Sisterhood is a major faction within Trinity whose influence is on par with that of the Tea Party and the Knight Hospitaller. They wish for the happiness and well-being of everyone in Kivotos, but many of Trinity's student are suspicious of them. Being the successors of the infamous Justina Council of Saints, they hold their fair share of secrets; some of which may shed light on Trinity's unknown history... A seemly large club within Trinity that depicts its members as nuns, their headquarters is notably the Trinity Cathedral where other students can visit or pray. Despite being geared towards worship and prayer, they possess immense influence within Trinity, and their intelligence network is said to be exceptional. Prior the school's formation, many individual factions fought against each other until the First Ecumenical Council took place, after which most of these factions formed an alliance that resulted in creation of Trinity General School. The Sisterhood was the successor to one of these factions‚Äîthe Justina Council of Saints, and they were noted for their non-interventionalist policy towards the Tea Party in modern day Trinity. As the successors of the infamous Justina Council of Saints, the Sisterhood holds its fair share of secrets, and they're willing to use their capabilities to control the flow of information or even tampering it. In the Trinity Story Arc, the Sisterhood made their "full" appearance in the latter half of the chapter 2. They assist the members of the Supplementary Lesson Department and Sensei against Mika, who attempts to stage a coup with support from Arius. It is revealed that a "private talk" between Mari and Hanako earlier in the story might be a reason on why Sisterhood decided to "interrupt". This results in the Sisterhood renouncing their non-interventionist policy, later partaking as a witness to the signing of the Treaty of Eden. They appear again in chapter 4, alongside the Tea Party and the Knight Hospitaller, to discuss the aftermath of the attack during the Eden Treaty.
Members of Sisterhood: Utazumi Sakurako (Leader), Iochi Mari, Wakaba Hinata.

The Sisterhood is the only faction within Trinity that has their own firearm theme independent of Trinity. They exclusively use Israeli made weapons evident of their mass utilization of Galil rifles.

The Justice Realization Committee, also known as the Justice Task Force (JTF) in Global, is one of the School Clubs in Trinity General School. Their job is basically to enforce discipline within the school as well as deal with any troublemakers looking to disturb the peace. Even though Tsurugi is the official leader, it falls to Hasumi to actually carry out those duties due to Tsurugi's... problematic personality. The Justice Realization Committee acts as Trinity's disciplinary committee, similar to Gehenna's Prefect Team. Their main purpose is to uphold justice around the area of Trinity, hence the name. All of the JTF members have a red halo, black wings, a choker around the neck, and a black and red sailor uniform in common. In particular, the black uniform is exclusive to this committee, and it seems that the school doesn't have many spares in stock.
Members of JTF: Kenzaki Tsurugi (–°hairwoman), Hanekawa Hasumi (Vice Chairwoman) Shizuyama Mashiro, Nakamasa Ichika, Shimoe Koharu (Ex Member).

All known members of this club have the same primary color for their halos: red, although they have different shades of red.
Koharu was a former member of Justice Task Force, suffered from failing scores. The result is her having to join the Make-Up Work Club. However, even after passing the club's evaluation exam, she and her friends from the club decided to keep the club as a form of their friendship.

The Knights Hospitaller, or the Remedial Knights on Global, is one of the School Clubs in Trinity General School. Prior to the school's formation, the Knights Hospitaller were the center of a faction called the Johannes faction. Like the other pre-alliance factions, they fought against the other factions until the First Ecumenical Council, where it joined the Trinity alliance. As many of the clubs were succeeded by their descendants, such as with the Justina Council of Saints and the Sisterhood, or simply perhaps disbanded, the Knights Hospitaller eventually became the oldest club in Trinity. One of the clubs in Trinity whose members train to help other students with, in most cases, their general health. The appearance of its members is similar to a nurse (in training). They hold the record as Trinity's oldest club, having existed even during the pre-alliance days of the school. Unlike their Gehenna counterpart, the Emergency Medicine Club, the Knights Hospitaller have some authority in politics. However, much like the Emergency Medicine Club, their focus lies more on medical treatment, and is willing to defend and treat any just about patient, regardless of school or standing. In Volume 3, the captain of the Knights Hospitaller, Aomori Mine, took Seia into hiding following the assassination attempt on Seia and provided her with medical treatment. Later, during the events of the Eden Treaty Signing Incident, they provided medical assistance to injured students, alongside a critically wounded individual that was brought in by Sena of the Emergency Medicine Club. In Chapter 4, the Knights Hospitaller, alongside the Tea Party and the Sisterhood, gathered in a tea party to discuss the aftermath of the attack during the Eden Treaty Signing Incident. In Where All Miracles Begin, they, Sisterhood, Arius Squad, and Hanako went to attack Hieronymus in the catacombs. They are the main club in A Cathedral Christmas.
Members of Knights Hospitaller: Aomori Mine (Knight Captain), Sumi Serina, Asagao Hanae.

The Knights Hospitaller was the name of an actual, historical Catholic military order, more formally known as The Order of Knights of the Hospital of Saint John of Jerusalem. There are no overt references to Catholic mythology within the club other than the name, however.
