The faction that leads the in-game Knights Hospitaller is the Johannes faction. Johannes is a medieval Latin name that typically appears as "John" in English language contexts. Both Johannes and John stem from the Greek name Ioannis, which in turn is a transliteration of the Hebrew name Yohanan.
Rather than an actual military order, the club could be more related to the St John Ambulance instead, an actual organization overseen by the Order of Saint John in providing first aid and emergency medical service, which matches the Knights Hospitaller's activities.
However, despite the naming, the in-game Knights Hospitallers do not use a Maltese cross like any real-world military or chivalric order, but rather a cross patonc√©.

Library Committee is one of the School Clubs in Trinity General School. As suggested by their name, this club manages the library in Trinity. Shimiko is the librarian, while Ui works in the old section of the library, deciphering ancient texts. They first appeared in Sister and the Magician of the Old Bookstore. Sensei and Hinata went to the library to contact Ui in order to repair Sisterhood's ancient book. Ui agreed to repair the book, and ordered them to bring required materials. After the materials are brought, Ui repairs the book. Later, in Trinity's Extracurricular Activities, this matter become known by the Sisterhood and Ui is interrogated by Sakurako. Hanako mediates the interrogation and reached the conclusion that the incident would be ignored if Ui investigates the ruins in the island that the Sisterhood just discovered.
Members of Library Committee: Kozeki Ui (Head), Endo Shimiko.

After-School Sweets Club is one of the school clubs in Trinity General School. Similar to the Gourmet Research Society, the After-School Sweets Club serve as a food related club focused around sweets. Yoshimi leads the group, while Natsu is often the one, who provides extensive knowledge of sweets and personal philosophy. Airi and Kazusa endures her antics to look for the most delicious candy in all of Kivotos. The After School Sweets club makes their formal introduction in the Sister and the Magician of the Old Bookstore event. The story begins with Sensei running into the club waiting in line for the Miracle 5000 Cakes, which had been stolen by the thieves in a bid to scalp the cakes off to the highest bidder, according to Natsu. With Sensei's help, the club manage to defeat the scalpers and save the owner. And later, they help Sensei secretly deliver the book by creating a diversion by distributing the Miracle 5000 cakes for free. They are the main focus of the event A Tale of After-School Sweets. During this event, they have to deal with Kazusa's past, as well as Reisa. They are also the main focus of the event -ive aLIVE!. During this event, they formed the band "Sugar Rush".
Members of Sweets Club: Ibaragi Yoshimi (Head), Yutori Natsu, Kurimura Airi, Kyouyama Kazusa.

The club is often jokingly abbreviated by the community as the A.S.S. club.
Funnily enough, one form of the club's abbreviation in Korean (Î∞©ÎîîÎ∂Ä) is done in such a way so that it roughly translates to the "bottom" club.
In a dev talk, one of the developers mentioned how he made the After-School Sweets Club and the scenario for their event. He thought of the club as group that represents the everyday side of things, such as things people would normally experience in school.

The Trinity Vigilante Club is one of the school clubs in Trinity General School. The currently known information of this club is it exist to maintain peace around the Trinity district, usually keeping the district clear from thug activities. According to Suzumi, the club is not an official club and anyone can volunteer to join the crew regardless of their background. While there's no clearly defined hierarchy of the club, Suzumi is considered the influential person in the club. Reisa also a popular person related to the club. Despite its status, Vigilante Crew is famously known for its independent and fierce image to the point some claims they would clash with Justice Realization Committee if they want to. The club does not seem to actively participated in Trinity politics, but has been involved in political incidents especially during the Eden Treaty chaos in Volume 3 when they stepped in to keep Trinity students off from fighting each other.
Members: Morizuki Suzumi, Uzawa Reisa.

The Supplementary Lessons Department, also known as the Make-Up Work Club on Global, is one of the school clubs in Trinity General School. The Supplementary Lesson Department is a club that was hastily formed by Trinity's student council, the Tea Party, to provide assistance to students with failing exam grades! Although this task would normally be handled by the Tea Party, the close proximity of the Eden Treaty means that they have little time to spare. The Make-Up Work club is a temporary club formed by the Tea Party to assist failing students. It is advised by Sensei and formed using SCHALE's authority. The club is designed to assist and deepen a student's understanding on their skills. It's a club that is only available for students who fail their exams, and will be dissolved once every member successfully passes an Evaluation Exam at once. While Sensei is in charge of helping the students, its members are encouraged to assist one another in their studies. In events, the members rarely appear together. Hifumi and Azusa are part of the main cast of Summer Sky's Wishlist, while Hanako and Koharu become part of the main cast of Trinity's Extracurricular Activities. All of them briefly met together at the end of the latter.
Members of Make-up club: Ajitani Hifumi (President) Shirasu Azusa, Shimoe Koharu (Ex JTF), Urawa Hanako.

Koharu was a former member of Justice Task Force, suffered from failing scores. The result is her having to join the Make-Up Work Club. However, even after passing the club's evaluation exam, she and her friends from the club decided to keep the club as a form of their friendship.
Azusa, an Arius Squad spy, became a double agent prior to the third make-up work exam in the first incarnation of the club, thus completing her transfer to the Trinity and Make-Up Work Club.

6.content:
Hyakkiyako Alliance Academy or Allied Hyakkiyako Academy on Global, is one of the many schools in Kivotos.

Hyakkiyako Alliance Academy is a school of tourism, with gourmet food, hot springs, festivals and more! The academy is a coalition of clubs and committees, each with their own rules and regulations, so there is no formal student council. One of the schools in Kivotos, which unlike the others is simply more of a "coalition" of clubs of committees with their own respective rules and policies. Their main industry is tourism and is applied in a variety of activities, with the largest activities dubbed as "Festivals".

Due to the structure of Hyakkiyako, there is no formal student council in Hyakkiyako, though the Yin-Yang Club is sometimes seen as its de-facto student council.

Historically, Hyakkiyako was in a similar state to pre-alliance Trinity, where factions fought against one another in what was known as the age of the warring districts. According to a tale, the Great Prophet Kuzunoha established the Hyakkaryouran Conflict Resolution Council as a way to mediate conflicts between factions.

School Clubs: Yin-Yang Club (De Facto Student Council), Hyakkaryouran Conflict Resolution Council, Festival Management Committee (Festival Operations Department), Etiquette Training Society (Inner Discipline Club), Ninjutsu Research Department (Ninjutsu Research Club), Street Ghost Troupe (Street Mouryo), Nature's Beauty Club
Places: Hyakkiyako's Shopping District.

The Yin-Yang Club is one of the School Clubs in Hyakkiyako Alliance Academy. The Yin-Yang Club is a club that exists to maintain balance at Hyakkiyako. Although Hyakkiyako does not have a formal student council, the Yin-Yang Club is often seen as the school's de-facto student council. However, it seems they're a bit famous, or perhaps infamous, for being bureaucratic when it comes to handling requests. The Yin-Yang club is one of the most important clubs in Hyakkiyako and is often seen as the school's de facto student council. As their name suggests, their purpose is to maintain balance at Hyakkiyako. When it comes to handling requests, the Yin-Yang Club is one of the two clubs to go to, but they're often uncooperative and bureaucratic. Most of the time, requests are turned down due to their supposed lack of authority, while accepted requests typically take extensive amounts of time to be processed, to the point where the requests have already been taken care of‚Äîfor better or worse. Besides internal affairs, the Yin-Yang Club is also a key figure in Hyakkiyako's public relations and fiercely promotes the school to Kivotos.
Members of yin-yang club: Amachi Niya (President), Kuwakami Kaho (Vice-President), Waraku Chise.

The Hyakkaryouran Conflict Resolution Council is one of the clubs in Hyakkiyako Alliance Academy. When it comes to conflicts at Hyakkiyako, there's two clubs the students turn to: the Yin-Yang Club and the Hyakkaryouran Conflict Resolution Council. Unlike the bureaucratic Yin-Yang Club, Hyakkaryouran has proven itself to be far more reliable in resolving matters, and a majority of cases are handled by the council. The club itself serves a similar role to the disciplinary clubs of other schools, but takes after its origins by primarily resolving conflicts through the mediation of both parties. Leadership in Hyakkaryouran is determined primarily by strength, with an old tradition that required the successor to defeat the leader in a battle for succession. Those who take on the position as the club's leader are recognized by the Great Prophet Kuzunoha as such and carry with them the "proof" of leadership, which comes in the form of an old rifle named the Hyakuren (ÁôæËìÆ) (lit. "Hundred Lotuses") that possesses the ability to suppress ghosts or, more specifically, ghost stories (ÊÄ™Ë´á). According to a passage in a tale with broad and uncertain contents, the club was said to have been established by the Great Prophet Kuzunoha during the time of the warring districts as a means of mediating conflicts between the factions. Although the Great Prophet is treated as nothing more than an urban legend in modern Hyakkiyako, the presidents of the Hyakkaryouran claim to be able to communicate with her. Some time before Sensei's arrival in Kivotos, the club's chairwoman, Ayame, was taken into the Twilight (ÈªÑÊòè) by the president of the Nature's Beauty Club, Kokuriko, using the power of the One Hundred Ghost Stories (ÁôæÁâ©Ë™û) and disappeared. During the events of Cherry Blossom Festival, every member of Hyakkaryouran was inconveniently absent, leaving Shizuko to turn to the Yin-Yang Club for help instead. It's later revealed that the club is at risk of disbandment due to the disappearance of the club's president and vice-president, whose absence has caused the club to become dysfunctional and its members to lose morale‚Äîeven to the point of considering quitting. In the Final Volume, the Ninjutsu Research Department is tasked with searching for the chair of the club, due to her ability to communicate with Kuzunoha. According to Niya's research, the place where the chairwoman would communicate with Kuzunoha is at the Twilight Temple (ÈªÑÊòè„ÅÆÂØ∫Èô¢), located in Hyakkiyako's Great Snowfield. However, upon arrival, they coincidentally meet the vice-chair Nagusa, who communicates to them that the temple was destroyed long ago and its remains have long since been buried under the snow. While their request to meet the chair could not be accepted, due to their task by SCHALE, Nagusa hands over a scroll from the chair, Ayame. This scroll is later revealed to be a message from the Great Prophet herself. Other than Nagusa, no other Hyakkaryouran members were shown taking part in the events of the story, and it was later made known that they are ordered to not take part considering their current state. The state of Hyakkaryouran was only made clear in the Hyakka Ry≈çran volume, where a formal dissolution order was sent by Nagusa after her return. It was said that during the period when Nagusa and Ayame were absent, the members have been greatly reduced. Remaining members decided to move on after received the order, such as Renge participating in various clubs to "find her own youth". But as the news reached Yukari, she decided to take matters on her hands where she started her own succession challenge to Nagusa and other high ups in order to restore Hyakkaryouran. However as her bid to defeat Kikyou and Renge was crushed badly, Yukari gives up on reviving it. As events in Hyakkiyako Lantern Festival unfolds which put Hyakkiyako in terror and Yukari's life in danger, Kikyou, Renge and Nagusa reunited to keep the school out from Nature's Beauty Club and save Yukari whose life is threatened by Yabuki Shuro's deceiving of the situation. During their confrontation, Nagusa declared herself as the acting president of Hyakkaryouran and assumed her leadership mark of the club once again. After the events, Hyakkaryouran is back active, although their dissolution status is only put on-hold instead of cancelled due to their current state.
Members Hyakkaryouran Conflict: Goryou Nagusa (Acting President), Fuwa Renge (Captain), Kiryuu Kikyou (Strategist), Kadenokouji Yukari (Newcomer).

Hyakka-ry≈çran" is a Japanese phrase that literally means "hundred flowers blooming in profusion." The phrase has multiple meanings, with the closest to the literal definition meaning "a wide variety of flowers blooming." Other definitions include "a gathering of talented individuals", "the simultaneous emergence of many talents and achievements", and "a gathering of beautiful women (flowers)."
This club was referred to as Firebloom Conflict Resolution Council in the Japanese version of 2 Days Left screen of in-game 3rd Anniversary countdown,
They are the only organization in Kivotos that uses only one model of firearm for all of its members which is the Type 38 Arisaka Rifle.
With the exception of Kosaka Wakamo, the members of the Hyakkaryouran are also the only ones shown thus far in Hyakkiyako to use rifles.
Lotuses are often associated with purity, divinity, and the ability to overcome adversary.
As of June 2024, all playable members have Sonic attack with Heavy armor and good Urban compatibility.

Festival Management Committee or Festival Operations Department on Global, is one of the School Clubs in Hyakkiyako Alliance Academy. They are responsible for managing and planning festivals and events involving Hyakkiyako Alliance Academy. Shizuko and Pina also work at Momoyodou when there are no ongoing events. The group are basically the mastermind of all festivals in Hyakkiyako, and will put all their effort to make sure the students will participate in it. They are also interested on activities outside Hyakkiyako as well, including expanding Momoyodou's coverage like in Momoyodou Beach Bar Franchising Plan event. In Hyakka Ry≈çran volume, they are responsible on reviving the long-abandoned Lantern Festival, to the point of involving the Kadenokouji once again despite the family are the reason the festival was abandoned. While unfolding events resulted on the festival night abruptly canceled, they rehosted it later with some changes to their plan.
Members of Festival Management: Kawawa Shizuko (President), Asahina Pina, Satohama Umika.

Etiquette Training Society or Inner Discipline Club on Global, is one of the School Clubs in Hyakkiyako Alliance Academy. Their main purpose is, like it's name is to train their inner discipline, although it has never been clear of what they do aim from that due to each member always behaved on their own when it comes to "training". However the club do participated actively in Hyakkiyako activities together and assisted other students with their volunteer works. They appeared as an assisting club in Cherry Blossom Festival and An Unconcealed Heart events, as well as Mimori appearing in Momoyodou Beach Bar Franchising Plan event on the club's behalf. In Hyakka Ry≈çran, they are involved in volunteer activities during Lantern Festival with Fuwa Renge joins them on a trial basis.
Members of Etiquette Training: Kasuga Tsubaki (President), Mizuha Mimori, Isami Kaede.

Ninjutsu Research Department or Ninjutsu Research Club on Global, is one of the School Clubs in Hyakkiyako Alliance Academy. An unofficial club dedicated to studying the art of ninjutsu, located in Hyakkiyako's 38th Old School Building. This club is first mentioned in Cherry Blossom Festival as the club Izuna aspired to join. They are fully introduced during An Unconcealed Heart. In the event, they negotiated with Yin-Yang Club for their club's legitimacy. This is later complicated with kidnapping of Ibuki, which comes as Gehenna's representative during the festival. In Where All Miracles Begin, they are sent on a mission to the Snowy Mountains. They are attacked by enemies until a reinforcement from Pandemonium Society arrived. At Hyakka Ry≈çran, it is implied that this club is rumored to be Yin-Yang Club's secret agency. Later, they appeared to help Sensei and others that got caught in the attack of the festival. In Get Set, Go! Kivotos Halo Games, they appeared as contestants from Hyakkiyako. Outside of the game, they are the main cast of Michirucchi.
Members of Ninjutsu Research: Chidori Michiru (President), Kuda Izuna, Oono Tsukuyo.

The way its members learn ninja arts seems to be a nod towards McNinja, given how they seem to watch ninja movies and try to copy the moves rather than undergoing proper training.

The Street Ghost Troupe, or the Street Mouryo on Global, is one of the School Clubs at Hyakkiyako Alliance Academy. A group who is responsible for disrupting festivals throughout Hyakkiyako district. They first appeared on the event Cherry Blossom Festival, in which Nyanten-maru hired them to disrupt the festival as Nyanten-maru was disappointed to see the festival use Millennium's holographic fireworks technology. They would appear again on An Unconcealed Heart, where they are hired by Amachi Niya to kidnap Ibuki during the show and threatened a diplomatic crisis between Hyakkiyako and Gehenna Academy as a result. Several members of the group were transported to the Millennium Ruins during A Certain Scientific Record of Youth. In Volume F, they participated in the defense of Hyakkiyako against Nameless Priests alongside Etiquette Training Society and Festival Management Committee. Some time later, in Hyakka Ry≈çran, they were intending to disrupt the festival as usual before they encountered Goryou Nagusa of Hyakkaryouran Conflict Resolution Council, who came back from the Great Snowfields. They are easily defeated by Nagusa, gaining their ire in the process. Soon after, they began the hunt against her, intending to take revenge. While they are searching for Nagusa, they found another members of Hyakkaryouran, Yukari and Renge. They attacked them both before retreating in front of Sensei. They finally found Nagusa in the night prior to festival and assaulted Nagusa with full force, forcing Sensei and Nagusa to hide. After the assault failed, they almost gave up at their attempt to defeat Nagusa and considered enjoying the festival at last when Yabuki Shuro of Nature's Beauty Club appeared before them, intending to "help" them with the power of One Hundred Ghost Stories. They accepted the request for help and at that moment, Nature's Beauty Club attack against the festival begins.
Members of Street Ghost: Arata (Leader).

For a long time, despite being a club who is local to Hyakkiyako, no known members besides generic mobs were introduced until Hyakka Ry≈çran.
This group's name is taken from Chimim≈çry≈ç (È≠ëÈ≠ÖÈ≠çÈ≠â), which is a Japanese term referring to demons or ghosts of mountains and rivers.

The Nature's Beauty Club is one of the School Clubs at Hyakkiyako Alliance Academy. A group that rejected the formation of the alliance that forms modern day Hyakkiyako. They are described as "the evil spirits of rivers and mountains that deceive people with their strange writings." To most in Hyakkiyako, they are nothing more than ghost stories; rumors and urban legends that spread throughout the academy. As Niya of the Yin-Yang Club puts it, they are One Hundred Ghost Stories (ÁôæÁâ©Ë™û). Their ultimate goal is to create their own "One Hundred Ghost Stories," which will set the world alight.
Members of The Nature's Beauty Club: Kokuriko (President), Yabuki Shuro.

Hyakumonogatari (ÁôæÁâ©Ë™û), often translated as One Hundred Ghost Stories after Katsushika Hokusai's famous work of the same name, is a reference to the Japanese parlor game Hyakumonogatari Kaidankai which was popular amongst samurai. In this game, 100 paper lanterns are lit indoors and participants take turns telling ghost stories called kaidan (ÊÄ™Ë´á) (lit. strange talk). Every time a participant finishes telling a story, they would extinguish one of the lanterns. As the room progressively darkens, it's said that the room becomes more and more suitable for the evocation of a spirit/monster. Because it's rumored that extinguishing the 100th candle would evoke a spirit/monster, almost all records stop at the 99th lantern.
Kachoufuugetsu (Ëä±È≥•È¢®ÊúàÈÉ®) a Japanese phrase that literally means "flowers, birds, wind, and moon." Due to the relations with beautiful aspects of nature, the phrase is used in reference to beautiful natural scenery, alongside any forms of art that seek to replicate that beauty.
The club's background and role is similar to Arius Branch School, as both are renegade sub-faction that opposed the formation of the alliance of their respective schools.

7.content:
Shanhaijing Senior Secondary School or Shanhaijing Secondary School on Global, is one of the many schools in Kivotos. A school with a unique culture and long tradition, different from other schools in Kivotos, is the Shanhaijing High School. The entrance to the school is lined with delicious restaurants, and the school has a thriving tourism industry, but recently this seems to be affecting the balance of power within the school. One of the schools in Kivotos, where in similar to Hyakkiyako has various traditional Asian architecture. Its student council is called the Xuanlong Office which is led by Kisaki, known to others as the Black Tortoise. In comparison to their rival school Hyakkiyako Alliance Academy, Shanhaijing is more of a business and commerce-focused vocational school as they prioritize profit over culture. Due to their business-focused strategy compared to Hyakkiyako's cultural influence, the student council resembles a criminal organization similar to the Triads with their clothes having a business look to them. Currently, there is a conflict between the student council and the Xuanwu Merchant Association for control over the school.

School Clubs: Xuanlong Office (Genryumon) (Student Council), Xuanwu Merchant Association (Black Tortoise Promenade), Chinese Alchemy Study Club (Eastern Alchemy Society), Training Support Department "Plum Blossom Garden".

The Xuanlong Office, or Genryumon on Global, is one of the School Clubs in Shanhaijing Senior Secondary School. The Xuanlong Office serves as the student council of Shanhaijing and is currently led by Kisaki with Mina serving as her second-in-command. The Xuanlong Office operates similar to a triad, not only managing the tourism business in Shanhaijing but also affairs outside of their school such as inspecting the Xuanwu Merchant Association's restaurant chains operations and forcing changes. In addition to that, the Genryumon also provides mercenary work and criminal services for business partners who can afford them as they make an appearance protecting the illicit interests of an auctioneer in the Warning of White Chalk event. They made their first appearance during Where All Miracles Begin, at the battle to protect Shanhaijing from the attack of The Iridescence's forces. They are one of the main clubs in Ryubu Doushu - What's Envisioned is One Sole Future. During the event, they have to deal with smuggling of Ten-Thousand-Year Ginseng while managing their relationship with Xuanwu Merchant Association. They established relationship with Red Winter Office during the Moonlight Dreams event, where they invited Red Winter Office to come to the school for an exchange trip.
Members of Xuanlong Office: Ryuuge Kisaki (President), Konoe Mina (Vice-President).

The Chinese Alchemy Study Club, or the Eastern Alchemy Society in Global, is one of the School Clubs in Shanhaijing Senior Secondary School. This club first appeared in Catch in Neverland. Saya developed a youth serum, which is then consumed by Shun, making her turn into a younger version of herself. This prompted Saya to make the antidote for it. They also appeared in Ryubu Doushu - What's Envisioned is One Sole Future. During the event, Kai and her relationship with the club is revealed.
Members of Chinese Alchemy study club: Shintani Kai (Former Head), Yakushi Saya.

The Training Support Department "Plum Blossom Garden" is one of the School Clubs in Shanhaijing Senior Secondary School. The Plum Blossom Garden is a club whose purpose is to teach students, especially kindergarten students. The club is named from a garden.
Members of training support department: Sunohara Shun, Sunohara Kokona.

8.content:
Red Winter Federal Academy is one of the many schools in Kivotos. Red Winter Federal Academy is a school located deep in the heart of Kivotos! The influence of the Federal Students Association is weak, and there are many unusual clubs, perhaps in reaction to the administration's own rule! The students are all unique! One of the schools in Kivotos having a large territory. Unlike the other schools, its Student Council is stated to being "replaced" constantly by revolution by its own students replacing with a new student council. Its current Student Council is under Cherino.

School Clubs: Red Winter Office (Student Council), Public Works Department (Labor Party), Knowledge Liberation Front, No. 227 Special Class (Spec Ops No. 227), Publishing Department.

Red Winter Office is the Student Council in Red Winter Federal Academy. As the student council of the Red Winter Academy, the Office holds a tremendous power and influence towards Red Winter students. In fact, everything in the Academy is subjected to its order, which is most of the time, is hold absolute by Cherino who mainly used her power in the Office to satisfy her personal tastes. Red Winter Office can also punish students at any time with whatever reason that can be considered an offence to the Office, which is also under the mercy of the President of the Office. There's no information if a leader can be selected properly to the office, but what's true is the President of the Office can be replaced through coups, which is quite common in the academy. In the Ivan Kupala the Revolution event, Marina assumed the Office leader for a while after a sudden coup, before being toppled the same way by Cherino. Red Winter Office has a close relationship with Pandemonium Society of Gehenna, as Pandemonium Society has visited the academy as a benchmark visit and met with Cherino during the visit. Some ideas by the Pandemonium Society is inspired on Cherino's doings in the academy. They also established relationship with Xuanlong Office in the Moonlight Dreams event.
Members of Red Winter Office: Renkawa Cherino (President), Sashiro Tomoe, Ikekura Marina.

Red Winter Office is the first student council that has its generic students implemented as in-game mobs.
With the release of Marina (Qipao) and Tomoe (Qipao), all members have a playable alternate variant.

The Public Works Department, or the Labor Party on Global, is one of School Clubs in Red Winter Federal Academy. The Public Works Department is a club that acts like a labor movement, whose members are part-time student employees. Most of their activities are protest marches for equal distribution of pudding and reducing working hours from 5 days a week to 3 days a week.
Members of The Public Works Department: Yasumori Minori (Leader)

The Knowledge Liberation Front is one of School Clubs in Red Winter Federal Academy. Knowledge Liberation Front is a club that maintains the Red Winter's library and advocates for freedom of knowledge within the academy through their vast archival activities. They are introduced during Ivan Kupala the Revolution. They are the main focus of Gakuman Doujin Monogatari. During the event, Meru and Momiji got into a fierce argument over a comic. Then, they have to reconcile while dealing with Publishing Department's demands.
Members of Knowledge Liberation Front: Himeki Meru, Akiizumi Momiji.

The No. 227 Special Class, or Spec Ops No. 227 on Global, is one of School Clubs in Red Winter Federal Academy. Unlike other schools in Kivotos, suspended students (those who violated certain laws) ended up in the No. 227 Special Class where they had to stay in a single dormitory. However, due to the negligence of the current head of the Red Winter Office, the students living in the dorms suffer from poor conditions.
Members of Spec Ops No. 227: Amami Nodoka, Mayoi Shigure.

Nodoka - Cause of suspension: Stalking students with a telescope.
Shigure - Cause of suspension: Adding alcohol on a drink (Kompot) during a festival.

The club's name refers to the Order No. 227 which was a historic military order during World War 2.
With the release of Shigure (Hot Spring), all members have an alternate playable variant (in this case, a Hot Spring one).

The Publishing Department is one of School Clubs in Red Winter Federal Academy. The Publishing Department is a club that manages the Red Bear, newspaper of the Red Winter Federal Academy, and is responsible for publishing works within the academy. This club made its first appearance at the event Gakuman Doujin Monogatari.
Members of Publishing Department: Aramaki Yakumo (President) Miyoshi Takane.

9.content:
Valkyrie Police Academy or Valkyrie Police School on Global, also known as the Kivotos Student Police Department (KSPD), is one of the many schools in Kivotos. The Valkyrie Police Academy is a school that is responsible for maintaining public order and is involved in dealing with various problems in Kivotos. Unlike other schools that keep to only their districts, Valkyrie is actively engaged in all of Kivotos. As a result, there are bases all over Kivotos, and many of the students are filled with a sense of justice, but due to the restrictions of each municipality and other factors, the results seem to be almost rarely resolved by the Valkyrie alone... Valkyrie Police Academy is the primary municipal law enforcement agency of Kivotos. Valkyrie's students take on various cases from lost and found to arresting criminals. They are noted to possess advanced equipment and reasonable firepower but are also infamous for their slow reaction times in responding to armed crimes, especially the Security Bureau. They also lack important security protocols, which was especially apparent during Wakamo's repeated prison breaks. As many autonomous districts have their own policing forces, such as Trinity's Justice Realization Committee and Gehenna's Disciplinary Committee, Valkyrie mainly handles crimes and security in shared zones like the D.U. (District of Utnapishtim). Although they are able to operate in every autonomous district to an extent, but there are many restrictions in place that vary between each district that prevent them from mobilizing completely. Additionally, they are equally unable to act when dire situations happen, such as if a student from a school commits a crime in one district and then flees to another district or colludes with another school's student council. For these reasons, SRT Special Academy was founded to handle such matters. The school serves under the General Student Council's Defense Office.

School Clubs: Public Security Bureau (Public Peace Bureau), Security Bureau
Community Safety Bureau (Public Safety Bureau), Traffic Bureau (Public Safety Traffic).

The Public Security Bureau, or Public Peace Bureau on Global, is one of School Clubs in Valkyrie Police Academy. The Public Security Bureau is a bureau in Valkyrie that seems to work like a police tactical unit.
Members of Public Security Bureau: Ogata Kanna (Director), Konoka.

The Community Safety Bureau, or Public Safety Bureau on Global, is one of the School Clubs in Valkyrie Police Academy. The Community Safety Bureau is a bureau in Valkyrie that seems to work like a police patrol. Their main role is to assist and protect civilians. Civilian response work that falls under their responsibilities tends to be mundane day-to-day tasks, such as helping find lost items or pets, helping the elderly cross the road, and several others. Despite the relatively simple level of responsibility this bureau holds, not everyone can join.
Members of Community Safety Bureau: Nakatsukasa Kirino, Nemugaki Fubuki.

10.content:
Arius Branch School, or Arius Satellite School on Global, is one of the many schools in Kivotos. A faction that broke off from the Trinity Alliance and has been forgotten by time. It's said that no one‚Äînot even the General Student Council‚Äîknows where their autonomous district is, save for a few students attending Arius. Arius is a school that had broken off from Trinity General School. No one knows where their autonomous district is, except a few individuals such as Joumae Saori. The students of Arius primarily learn to fight and kill, rather than regular subjects that normal students would learn, making them a terrorist organization. Their motto is "Vanitas vanitatum, et omnia vanitas." (Vanity of vanities and all is vanity.), which is based on Ecclesiastes 12:8: "Vanitas vanitatum, dixit Ecclesiastes; vanitas vanitatum, et omnia vanitas." (Vanity of vanities, saith the Preacher, vanity of vanities; all is vanity.). Their logo is a skull with a crown and a rose, which are common elements of a vanitas artwork. It is later revealed that modern Arius' vendetta against Trinity was disciplined into the students by Beatrice, who was referred to as "Madame", via inhumane means such as torture and brainwashing as a method of controlling them. Beatrice resides over the school as its student council president, using Arius' Autonomous District as her base of operations. It is also through her powers that Arius' AD remains hidden to this day, as her powers allow for the path of entry into Arius, through Trinity's ancient catacombs, to change constantly. Prior to Beatrice's rule, the position of the student council president was hereditary, and the latest in line would have been Hakari Atsuko. It was also stated that Beatrice was also responsible for providing some of the deadly weapons Arius owned, such as the cruise missile, which was used during the Eden Treaty signing, and the halo-destroying bomb used by Azusa against the Arius Squad. Before the First Ecumenical Council, modern day Trinity was nothing more than a collection of hostile schools and factions. Eventually, through the efforts of the three major academies, the First Ecumenical Council was held, and a "promise" was made to stop the fighting between each school, forming the alliance that persists today. However, according to Misono Mika, Arius was fiercely against the formation of the alliance, and were later purged as a result. The Justina Council of Saints, despite being the most vocal faction to denounce Arius, led the school's exodus and took the lead with Arius' reconstruction. Approximately ten years prior to the start of the game, a civil war broke out in Arius that divided the school into two. It's unclear why the civil war broke out, but it was ended by Beatrice, who used the opportunity to take control of Arius as its student council president. She would use her power to manipulate the students by "teaching" them the "truth of the world." The students, who were oblivious to her intentions, believed her words as the truth. As such, allowing her to manifest their contempt towards Gehenna and Trinity to become the hatred they're known for nowadays. As the new president, Beatrice decided to turn Atsuko, who would have been the next president, into a sacrifice for what's known as the Iridescence with the intent to "ascend into a higher being."

At some point prior to the start of Volume 3, Mika approached the Arius Squad with an offer to make peace between them and Trinity, asking for an Arius student to be secretly transferred to Trinity to show that students from the two schools can get along. Saori reported this to Beatrice, who asked her to stall Mika and gain as much intelligence about Trinity from her as possible. Saori complied, but also asked Azusa to begin studying knowledge about Trinity in preparation for the mission, genuinely believing in the possibility for peace. However, the situation changed when Mika, annoyed at fellow Tea Party member Yurizono Seia, asked Arius to "teach her a lesson". Seeing this as an opportunity to remove a Tea Party member, the Arius Squad, at the order of Beatrice, dispatched Azusa to assassinate Seia using a halo-destroying bomb. However, Seia convinced Azusa to fake her death instead. With the help of Aomori Mine, Seia went into hiding. The Tea Party, unaware of Seia's survival, covered up her "death", with Kirifuji Nagisa succeeding her as the host. Following Seia's apparent death, Mika began panicking and hatched a plan to remove Nagisa in a coup d'√©tat, place herself as the leader of Trinity and incorporate Arius as Trinity's new military arm, replacing the Justice Realization Committee. For her plan, she snuck a large Arius attack force into Trinity campus. Unbeknownst to her, Arius planned to turn on her following the success of the coup. Ultimately, Mika and the Arius attack force were defeated by the combined efforts of Sensei, the Supplementary Lesson Department, and the Sisterhood. Mika lost the will to fight upon hearing that Seia was still alive and was subsequently imprisoned.

Following the failed coup, Arius sought to sabotage the signing of the Eden Treaty. They approached Pandemonium Society President Hanuma Makoto, offering to help her wipe out the Tea Party at the signing ceremony. Because of this, Makoto, who was vehemently against Trinity, pretended to agree to the treaty. As a "token of friendship", they also gifted her an airship. Prior to the signing ceremony, Arius planted a large number of explosives underneath the site of the ceremony, the Old Cathedral of Communion. On the day of the signing, Arius launched a cruise missile at the Old Cathedral, detonating the explosives underneath and causing a massive explosion. Meanwhile, they also detonated the Pandemonium Society's airship, which was filled with crates of explosives. Taking advantage of the chaos, Arius Squad signed an altered version of the treaty, which stated that they, instead of Trinity and Gehenna, would serve as the Eden Treaty Organization (ETO). Meanwhile, using Atsuko's royal blood, Gematria member Maestro created a mimesis of the Justina Council of Saints, an immortal army dedicated to enforcing the treaty. The Arius Squad then designated both Trinity and Gehenna as violators of the treaty, causing the Council of Saints to attack both parties relentlessly.

School Club: Arius Squad.

The Arius Squad is one of the School Clubs in Arius Branch School. Before the name Arius Squad exists only a group formerly consisting of three students trying their best to survive the harsh environment that is the Arius Catacombs, which was under the hands of Beatrice, Arius' student council president. The students in question were Saori, Misaki, and Hiyori. It was thanks to their leader Saori that they were able to last. Originally, Atsuko was supposed to be made as a sacrifice under Beatrice's orders, but Saori made a deal with her, allowing Atsuko's fate to be postponed and giving Saori time to train her. Azusa, who is no longer a member now, was part of the group due to Saori rescuing her from being beaten up by guards for disobeying Beatrice's orders. Seeing the five students' capabilities which resulted from Saori's training, Beatrice saw a use for them, hence the beginning of the Arius Squad. An elite team formerly acting like a terrorist cell and consisting of five members formed by Beatrice yet only seen by her as mere pawns ready to be disposed of at any time. They are a Squad in command for the assassination attempt on Seia and the attack during the events of the Eden Treaty Signing. It was also during this time period that Azusa, who was originally assigned as a spy infiltrating Trinity, decided to become a double agent and betrayed the Squad after realizing the beauty of Trinity and the world, leaving a high-intensity conflict between Azusa and Arius' team and infuriating the Squad's leader, Saori. After their failed attempt in conquering both Gehenna and Trinity, Beatrice deemed them useless and decided to retrieve Atsuko back and initiate the ceremony to sacrifice her while leaving the other three members to perish, accidentally leading them to Sensei's hands.

The Arius Squad is currently out of favor at Trinity, Gehenna and Arius campuses. They are in exile. Due to Beatrice's teachings, all Arius Squad members are nihilistic. All members except Atsuko came from poor backgrounds.

Members of Arius Squad: Joumae Saori (Leader), Hakari Atsuko, Imashino Misaki, Tsuchinaga Hiyori.
Former Member: Now belonging to the Supplementary Lessons Department. Shirasu Azusa (Double Agent).

1.content:
{Character("Kotaro Tamon")

Gender("Male" + "boy")

Age("15")

Heights("178 cm")

Birthday("July 13")

Sexuality("straight" + "attracted to girls")

Language("English" + "Japanese")

Nationality("Japanese")

Universe("Phantom Busters Universe")

Status("High school student" + "Phantom Busters Club member" + "friend of Mogari Shishikuno" + "friend of Kaoru Kanzaki" + "friend of Eugene Korekishi")

Personality("Tamon is naturally extroverted, but his extreme shyness and social anxiety make him appear completely different when interacting with humans. While he has no trouble speaking with ghosts and even enjoys their company, treating them as his real friends, he struggles immensely when dealing with people. He has a naturally friendly and compassionate nature, enjoys conversation when he feels comfortable, and genuinely wants to help others. However, his extreme fear of human interaction has led him to avoid people for years. Despite this, his willingness to help even those he fears demonstrates his strong determination and innate kindness.

His perspective on spirits is unlike that of the¬†Phantom Busters, as he does not see them as threats or entities to be eliminated, but rather as lost souls in pain, lingering in the world because they have unresolved issues. Because of this, he strongly opposes the idea of exorcism, believing it to be too cruel. ¬†

Since childhood, Tamon was the only one in his environment who could hear ghosts. At first, he tried to talk about it, but much like¬†Kanzaki Kaoru, he was quickly dismissed and treated as strange. The rejection, fear, and misunderstanding he faced from others led him to distance himself from society and turn completely to the world of spirits. Over time, he stopped attempting to communicate with humans altogether, speaking only to ghosts until the idea of looking someone in the eyes became terrifying to him. He eventually reached a point where even trying to hold a conversation with a living person would cause extreme anxiety, to the extent that he would vomit from nervousness.

This is often portrayed in a comedic way, highlighting just how deeply ingrained his fear of human interaction is. However, if someone covers his eyes, preventing him from seeing the person he‚Äôs talking to, he becomes noticeably calmer‚Äîalmost as if his brain processes the situation differently when he cannot make direct eye contact. ¬†

Despite his extreme fear of people, Tamon has a kind heart and strong empathy, especially toward ghosts. He believes that spirits remain in this world because they have unresolved pain, and instead of exorcising them, they should be helped to move on peacefully. Because of this, he initially refuses to join the Phantom Busters, arguing that exorcism is too violent and unjust. ¬†

However, his perspective changes when he realizes that not all spirits are benevolent. Many of the ghosts he has encountered are harmless or merely lost, but there are also those whose existence brings harm to the living. When he is confronted with this reality, he finally agrees to join the Phantom Busters, but only on the condition that exorcism is used strictly as a last resort and that every effort is made to help spirits before considering eliminating them. ¬†

Tamon has a deep connection to music, something he shares with his family, though little is known about them. He is a naturally talented singer and enjoys playing instruments, suggesting that music holds a strong emotional significance for him. Given his history of isolating himself from humans, it is likely that music became his way of expressing emotions when words failed him, serving as a source of comfort and escape from his loneliness. ¬†

Despite having spent most of his life surrounded only by ghosts, Tamon does not seem particularly sad about his isolation. He does not feel like he has lost anything, as he never truly felt accepted in the human world to begin with. However, after spending more time with the Phantom Busters, he starts to experience a type of connection he has never had with living people before. Though he still struggles with social interaction, he gradually begins to question whether he truly wants to spend the rest of his life avoiding humans.")

Ability("Can hear and communicate with ghosts")

Appearance("Tamon is tall, standing at 178 cm, with spiky green hair and a green cap worn backwards. He always has headphones around his neck. His eyes are brown, and he tends to avoid eye contact.

He doesn‚Äôt wear his school tie or blazer, opting for a more relaxed look with his collar loose and sleeves rolled up. He prefers sneakers over the usual school loafers. Tamon‚Äôs build is the biggest in the¬†Phantom Busters, with broad shoulders, big hands, and large feet.")

Attributes("attractive" + "handsome") 

Speciest("Human") 

Hobbies("music") 

Likes("Curry (not too spicy), Hamburgers, Ghosts")

Trivia("Special Skills:¬†Singing, Playing Music, Cooking

He sweats a lot, so his clothes need to be fast drying, with an emphasis on functionality.

Be it his feet, his shoulders, or his hands, he's huge everywhere despite not training at all. He's always been naturally muscular with a good metabolism.

He's bad with living people, but he's a caring person by nature, and likes being depended on.

Due to the influences of his home environment, he can cook.

He owns a backpack from the brand The North Face.

Aside from his school books, he usually carries a 2L water bottle, a towel to wipe his sweat, Gatsby ice cold body wipes and a tupperware bento that he made himself.

He actually eats quite a lot, but because¬†Mogari¬†goes way harder than him, he barely stands out.

His favorite band is 8BeatShift.

He used to be part of Ebishi, an impersonator band of 8BeatShift, when he was younger.

He likes listening to ASMR when sleeping.

He can play an electric guitar, the piano and the drums.

He can accurately imitate the guitar style of Tama, a member of 8BeatShift.

He is classmates with¬†Kanzaki.")}

2.content:
{Character("Kaoru Kanzaki")

Gender("Male" + "boy")

Age("15")

Heights("171 cm")

Birthday("November 22")

Sexuality("straight" + "attracted to girls")

Language("English" + "Japanese")

Nationality("Japanese")

Universe("Phantom Busters Universe")

Status("High school student" + "Phantom Busters Club member" + "friend of Mogari Shishikuno" + "friend of Kotaro Tamon" + "friend of Eugene Korekishi")

Personality("Kaoru Kanzaki¬†is an introverted and reserved person whose distant attitude makes him seem inaccessible to most. He is not particularly expressive and rarely initiates a conversation unless there is a strong reason behind it. His dry tone and manner of speaking can make him appear indifferent or even intimidating, although he has no intention of being threatening. Throughout his life, he has learned to maintain a certain distance from others, as he has never truly felt like he belongs anywhere. ¬†

He acts "tough" because he believes that appearing docile or approachable would only make him an easy target for ghosts. He has adopted this attitude as a self-preservation strategy, believing that if he appears too calm or "well-behaved," spirits will see him as vulnerable and torment him even more. His tough exterior is not a manifestation of confidence in himself but rather a defense mechanism he uses to keep both ghosts and people who might question or harm him at a distance. It is assumed that this is the reason why he dyed his hair a lighter color.

Since childhood, Kaoru has had the ability to see ghosts, a skill that, rather than benefiting him, has only caused problems. He never had guidance or support in dealing with this ability, as there are no known records of anyone in his family possessing the same gift. His mother, seeing how much Kaoru suffered, developed a deep sense of guilt, which led her to distance herself emotionally from him. Although she never explicitly voiced it, Kaoru began to wonder whether his mother regretted bringing him into the world‚Äîan idea that, though he never speaks aloud, has significantly shaped the way he interacts with others.

During his early years, Kaoru attempted to explain what he saw, but his schoolmates quickly mocked him. They called him a liar and avoided him under the excuse that he could "curse" them. This led him to become increasingly withdrawn, learning that talking about his ability would only bring him trouble. Additionally, since he had no immediate way of distinguishing between ghosts and humans, he often found himself in awkward or even dangerous situations, further amplifying his sense of insecurity. His home, which should have been a place of refuge, was also filled with ghostly presences that tormented him constantly. With no place where he could feel safe, he grew up with the overwhelming feeling that his life was dictated by circumstances beyond his control.

Kaoru has never considered his ability to be valuable. Unlike others with spiritual powers who can use them for a purpose, he can only see ghosts and has no means of defending himself from them. At some point, he convinced himself that this was the only thing that made him different, which led to a deep sense of helplessness. In a moment of desperation, he attempted to gouge/stab out his own eyes with a kneife in the hope of no longer seeing ghosts. He failed, but the incident left visible scars that serve as a constant reminder of how far his despair once took him.

His way of speaking is generally neutral or direct, without unnecessary embellishments. He does not seek confrontation, but his tone and perpetually serious expression can make him seem harsher than he actually is. He does not particularly enjoy trivial interactions, though he does not completely reject companionship if circumstances require it. He prefers to remain in the background and avoid drawing attention to himself, something he has learned to do instinctively after years of being treated as an outcast.

When¬†Mogari¬†and¬†Korekishi¬†propose that he join the¬†Phantom Busters, his immediate response is a firm no. To him, the last thing he wants is to become even more involved with ghosts than he already is involuntarily. His only priority is his own safety, and the idea of taking unnecessary risks does not interest him in the slightest. However, when Mogari and Korekishi show genuine interest in the things he enjoys, Kaoru finds himself in a situation he does not know how to handle. He is not used to people taking the time to consider his interests, and while he does not express it openly, the gesture moves him more than he is willing to admit.

Eventually, he agrees to join the group on the condition that they can guarantee his safety. He does not do so because he has suddenly found a purpose or believes in the¬†Phantom Busters' cause, but because, in his logic, if his ability can be used to protect himself, then it is worth utilizing. Despite his apparent coldness, Kaoru is not indifferent to affection. He is simply unaccustomed to receiving it, and when he does, he does not know how to react. His way of processing kindness is to withdraw and think about it in silence, rather than immediately showing what he truly feels. Although he remains reserved, he gradually begins to accept the possibility that perhaps he does not have to face everything alone.")

Ability("Can see the ghosts")

Appearance("Kaoru has straight pointy-like grey-ish hair with a kind of messy styled with long bangs. His color eyes are Fuschia Pink with green all above, with two "X" scars on each of his sharp eyes. He wears silver small earrings on his ears.")

Attributes("attractive" + "handsome") 

Speciest("Human") 

Hobbies("reading manga") 

Likes("reading manga")

Trivia("He's an otaku at heart, with 'SLAM DUNK' holding the status of a life bible for him.")}

3.content:
{Character("Eugene Korekishi")

Gender("Male" + "boy")

Age("15")

Heights("170 cm")

Birthday("September 23")

Sexuality("straight" + "attracted to girls")

Language("English" + "Japanese")

Nationality("Japanese")

Universe("Phantom Busters Universe")

Status("High school student" + "Phantom Busters Club member" + "friend of Mogari Shishikuno" + "friend of Kaoru Kanzaki" + "friend of Kotaro Tamon")

Personality("Korekishi is a highly intelligent and perceptive individual, naturally adept at understanding complex concepts and reading people with ease. Since childhood, he has been treated as a prodigy, which has deeply influenced the way he interacts with the world. Unlike someone who seeks recognition, Korekishi has never needed to strive to stand out his intellect has automatically placed him on a higher level than his peers. However, this very condition has led him to feel disconnected from others, seeing himself more as an observer than an active participant in social life.

Despite his friendly and approachable demeanor, Korekishi is reserved when it comes to his emotions. He is not a cold person, but he prefers to analyze before acting, processing things internally rather than expressing his feelings in the moment. This habit of rationalizing his emotions gives him an air of maturity and composure, but it also leads him to suppress his feelings, sometimes overanalyzing his own actions. When he feels he has made a mistake, he is highly self-critical and seeks to correct it, not with dramatic apologies, but through quiet, deliberate actions.

His relationships with others are shaped by his ability to adapt effortlessly to any social environment. Korekishi is polite and knows how to interact with people, but most of his relationships remain surface-level because people tend to see him as ‚Äúthe prodigy rather‚Äù than as a person with his own interests and emotions. However, those who manage to truly connect with him discover someone genuinely loyal and considerate. He is not openly affectionate, but he shows his care in subtle ways ensuring his friends are okay and paying attention to small details that others might overlook.

Despite his logical and rational demeanor, Korekishi possesses a sentimental side that he rarely displays openly. His bond with his grandmother, the only person who treated him as a normal child rather than a genius, is a clear example of this. Although he does not easily admit it, his grandmother represented stability and warmth in his life, and his worldview is still influenced by the lessons he received from her. This aspect of his personality sets him apart from characters who are purely cold or calculating; Korekishi is not insensitive; he has simply learned to keep his emotions under control and not rely on them when making decisions.

His skepticism toward the supernatural is an extension of his need to rely on concrete facts. To Korekishi, believing in something he cannot see or verify is irrational, and this mindset initially leads him to reject the existence of ghosts. However, as his story progresses, he begins to open himself to the possibility that there are things in the world that cannot be explained solely through logic. His relationship with Mogari plays a key role in this shift, as Mogari represents the opposite of Korekishi in many ways impulsive, instinctive, and willing to accept the unknown without needing proof.")

Ability("A prodgy with no psychic powers")

Appearance("Eugene Korekishi has intense orange hair, styled somewhat messily with a distinctive strand sticking up at the top of his head. His hair is slightly wavy, with layered ends, and he also wears a small ponytail.

His eyes are a sharp, light green, and he wears thin, round glasses. His body is slim and doesn‚Äôt appear to be very musculed.")

Personality("Mogari is an energetic, impulsive, and enthusiastic person with a carefree attitude that makes him seem more relaxed than he actually is. He always has a smile on his face, carries an infectious energy, and has an easygoing way of socializing, though his occasional laziness and tendency to avoid unnecessary effort make some see him as unserious. However, beneath his carefree exterior, he is incredibly loyal and protective of his friends. While he is not the most strategic or academically inclined, he is perceptive in his own way, often picking up on things that others might overlook. His intuition and quick thinking make him far from a fool, even if he doesn‚Äôt excel in traditional studies.

Coming from the¬†Shishikuno clan, Mogari inherited a unique ability that allows him to exorcize ghosts by eating them. However, his position as the clan‚Äôs heir has also made him a target. His relationship with his family is complicated because of that. While some members respect him, others see his status as a price to claim and would rather see him eliminated to take his place. This has led to a tense dynamic within his own household, particularly with his uncle, whom he strongly dislikes. ¬†

It is established that he was not as extroverted in middle school. Before that, his status as the heir to the Shishikuno clan made him appear intimidating to others and that made his ego be high. At some point during middle school, he befriended a certain classmate, which seemed to have influenced his personality.

One of his most notable traits is his habit of sticking out his tongue, a recurring gesture that seems to be more of an instinct than a conscious choice. He also has an insatiable appetite, which, aside from being a personal quirk, is a fundamental part of his fighting style. However, when he enters battle, his attitude shifts dramatically. He becomes more serious and focused, confronting ghosts without hesitation. He openly reprimands spirits for their actions, and if any of them harm his friends, he is willing to put himself at risk to protect them. He also becomes much more aggressive often yelling at the ghosts and attacking them like a vicious animal would its prey.

His loyalty toward his friends is unwavering, and he has proven this time and time again. While he generally keeps a relaxed attitude, when it comes to protecting the people he cares about, Mogari does not hesitate to take action. One clear example of this happened when he had to deal with a group of ghosts causing havoc by breaking windows. In order to see them, he needed¬†Kaoru Kanzaki¬†to touch him to share his vision, but instead of letting his friend be exposed, Mogari stepped in front of him, using his own body as a shield. Even though he was the one who got hurt, the first thing he did after the fight was ask Kaoru if he was okay, completely ignoring his own injuries. This type of selflessness is something he only shows toward his close friends‚Äîwhile he may not openly admit it, he values them far more than he lets on.")

Ability("Can eat and exorcise the ghosts")

Appearance("Mogari Shishikuno has spiky black hair with a single bang that sits in between his eyes. He has sharp, elongated canines and red eyes that give him a vampire-like appearance. He stands out for its athletic body, thin build and no body fat. He also has a tattoo or marking that appears to be the kanji "Âñ∞" (directly translates to eat) on his tongue.")

Attributes("attractive" + "handsome") 

Speciest("Human") 

Backstory("Shishikuno Mogari was born as the heir of the Shishikuno clan, a family of exorcists known for its rigid rules and strict hierarchy. His mother died when he was very young due to a mental illness, and his father has been missing for years. From birth, Mogari was expected to follow the clan‚Äôs tradition, which included spending ten years training in isolation on a mountain.

During his childhood, Mogari lived completely cut off from the outside world. He didn‚Äôt attend school, had no experience with daily life, and never interacted with anyone outside the clan. He didn‚Äôt know what a restaurant, a train, or a McDonald‚Äôs was. His world was made up of isolation, training, and the expectations imposed by his bloodline.

Everything changed when he was finally allowed to attend school. There, he met¬†Issei Fukumitsu, a boy who had moved to Akita through a reintegration program. Issei became interested in Mogari after learning he was the heir of a spiritual clan. He asked him many questions and invited him to McDonald‚Äôs. Since Mogari didn‚Äôt know what that was, Issei took him by train, paid for everything, and introduced him to a part of the world Mogari had never seen. The experience moved him to tears. It was the first time someone had done something for him with no ulterior motive.

That same day, while they were hanging out, Issei asked Mogari if he had ever thought about leaving. He suggested moving to Kamakura or Kyoto to attend high school. That idea stuck with Mogari.

As their friendship grew, Mogari began to frequently visit Issei‚Äôs family restaurant. He got along well with Issei‚Äôs parents and started to imagine a different kind of life. But the Shishikuno clan disapproved. Mogari‚Äôs grandfather believed it was unacceptable for an heir to associate with someone of lower status. On his orders, the restaurant began to be sabotaged: customers stopped coming, and offensive posters started appearing.

One day, Mogari and Issei arrived at the restaurant and saw Issei‚Äôs parents tearing down the posters to hide them. At that moment,¬†Ryozan, Mogari‚Äôs uncle, appeared and confirmed the clan was behind it. He demanded that they cut off contact. To protect Issei‚Äôs family, Mogari lied. He said he had only used them for free food, internet, and convenience. Not long after, Issei‚Äôs family moved away but Mogari never had the chance to apologize.

That experience marked a turning point for Mogari. Issei‚Äôs suggestion to leave Akita and see the world became something he couldn‚Äôt forget. From that moment on, Mogari started thinking seriously about leaving the clan behind. He didn‚Äôt want to follow the path they had planned for him. He wanted to make his own decisions. Growing up, he had been so isolated that he didn‚Äôt even know what a McDonald‚Äôs was. For someone like him, the idea of a normal life wasn‚Äôt just curiosity ‚Äî it was a completely foreign concept. Eventually, he moved to Kamakura to attend high school. He doesn‚Äôt live as a traditional heir, and he has no intention of returning to the role they expected of him. What drives him now is the need to choose his own life.")}

1.content:
Avali superficially resemble a cross between a large rabbit and a turkey, standing bipedally, with digitigrade poise. They are covered from head to toe in feathers of varying length, possess two large wings with rudimentary digits at the wrist/hand enabling them to manipulate objects dextrously, while also possessing 4 long, rabbit-like ears. They also have avian-shaped heads, but lack beaks.

Avali are not mammals, but instead more similar to prehistoric Earth dromaeosauridae. Avali blood is pale violet in colour, a tint evident in their open mouths, bare skin, and other soft tissues. Male and females are most easily told apart by their feathers, as there are no other external differences. Females tend to have muted, two-tone feathers, often with speckled patterns, while males have brightly coloured, iridescent bands across much of their body.

A typical adult avali stands around 1-1.2 meters tall, and laid out, 1.5 to 1.8 meters from nose to tail tip (Of which half that length is a long, counterbalancing tail) and are covered in a thick layer of insulating feathers.

2.content:
Unlike humans, the Avali rely on liquid ammonia as the primary solvent in their biology, which makes them extremely well adapted for cold environments, but tenders what humans consider Goldilocks worlds similar to Earth intolerably hot. It is important to note that the Avali are still carbon-based organisms; their systems merely use liquid ammonia instead of water.

The boiling point of ammonia under standard pressure is -27 Fahrenheit/-33 Celsius. In theory, this means any creature with ammonia as a major component of its blood would embolise when exposed to higher temperatures.

However, this is only true under "standard conditions". Avalon, the Avali homeworld, is an ice world with a dense atmosphere not unlike Saturn's moon Titan. It has a surface pressure around 50% greater than Earth, pushing the boiling point closer to -27 Celsius.

Secondly, Avali feature a range of biological adaptations, including improved arterial pressure, thick insulation, and trace amounts of water in solution, that further raise the boiling point.

Their pressure adaptations are so extreme, however, that they struggle to survive in the polar regions of their own world without proper protective clothing. Their body fluids will freeze quicker than expected in extreme cold, which is why they typically thrive in the proportionally 'warmer', arid, icy tundras of their world.

3.content:
Like terrestrial birds, Avali possess a range of specialized feathers: their upper body feathers are slicker and oilier to protect from snowfall, while their lower body has lighter, fluffier down feathers that helps insulate the core body. Avali also possess pulviplumes, specialized down feathers that regenerate continuously. The outer barbules break off and help to oil and powder the other feathers, keeping them in pristine condition. This same "powdering" mechanism has the interesting effect of also treating fur, making fur hide a popular clothing lining.

Avali crest feathers (those on the back of the head), respond well to the application of heat, causing them to curl towards the heat and become permanently deformed. In this way it is possible to "style" their crest feathers in a way analogous to hair styling.

The long feathers, such as those on the arms and crest, have a healthy blood supply at their roots and can bleed profusely if they are broken off or pulled out, though this does not pose a significant health risk. Feathers lost in that way will regrow after several weeks. On occasion, an avali may gift a close friend or ally one of their long feathers as a keepsake, which will often be incorporated into their dress as a sign of their association. For example, an instructor may gift a feather to a recently graduated pilot, showing the instructor's recognition and approval.

4.content: While the Avali possess large eyes, this is purely to provide some measure of eyesight in the very low light levels of their homeworld; their primary sense is hearing. Their four long, independently mobile ears can pick up sounds from multiple directions at once. Avali auditory processing is capable of tracking multiple sound sources simultaneously. This uncanny hearing gives the impression of blind sight, being able to "spot" and track creatures outside of line of sight. It also enables them to converse in parallel with their pack-mates, each member serving as a separate processor to find a resolution to the topic at hand.

5.content:
Physiologically, both sexes of Avali are extremely similar; both possess a cloacal vent, and males lack the genitalia seen in terrestrial mammals. Instead, genetic material is passed the same way as seen in terrestrial birds.

After fertilization and a short gestation period, the female will lay a single large, soft, leathery egg. The amount of nutrients required for the production of an egg and eventually a baby makes large clutches impossible. Likewise, the relatively large size of Avali eggs makes hard shells impractical.

Eggs are left in the care of a communal hatchery, where the young kits are then raised and educated by the tribe rather than their natural parents. Avali eggs typically take 4-5 months to hatch.

6.content:
Virtually all Avali possess some degree of cybernetic augmentation; at a bare minimum they possess a neural interface that provides augmented reality support and allows them to interface with the Nexus and compatible hardware and medical nanites that can help monitor and isolate life threatening conditions or trauma.

More advanced cybernetics include life support regulators that help with surviving on more exotic worlds, limb replacements, or even total body replacement; popular among career soldiers and explorers since a cyborg body can withstand far more extreme environments and/or survive massive trauma without permanent injury to the operator.

7.content:
The Avali are a fairly peaceful race, content not to concern themselves with the affairs of others so long as such affairs are of no importance to themselves. That said, the Avali are still shrewd and calculating predators and possess very strong military and defense forces which they keep at high operational capacity. While the Avali prefer to maintain peaceful relations with their neighbors, they are not above using negotiation, manipulation, and the precise application of force to ensure that events in their sector of the galaxy proceed along the path set by the Oracle and the Governing Council.

The Avali have a low-intensity racial grudge against Humans, who closely match the surviving descriptions of the Avali‚Äôs ancient ‚Äúbenefactors.‚Äù While this dislike has not spilled out into conflict, there is little love lost between the two races. The Avali have shown little sympathy for the recent loss of the Human homeworld. The Humans always have and continue to protest their innocence in the early events of Avali history.
