1.content:
Rider Name: Faiz

Motif: Phi Symbol (Œ¶), Shark

Primary Colours: Black (base), Red (Photon streams + parts of the visor), Silver (the metal parts), Yellow (the visor)

Primary Colours (Axel Form): Black (base), White (Photon streams + parts of the visor), Silver (the metal parts), Red (the visor)

Primary Colours (Blaster Form): Red (base), Black (Photon streams + parts of the visor), Silver (the metal parts), Yellow (the visor)

---

The Faiz Gear („Éï„Ç°„Ç§„Ç∫„ÇÆ„Ç¢, Faizu Gia) was the second set of Kamen Rider Gear developed by the Smart Brain Corporation to protect the Orphnoch King. The Faiz Gear had less power than the original Delta Gear, but had a much greater functionality. Like most of the Rider Gears that Smart Brain developed, the Faiz Gear can only be worn by Orphnochs or humans implanted with Orphnoch DNA.

Transforming into Kamen Rider Faiz burns Orphnoch DNA, so anyone who have been implanted with this DNA will quickly run out and no longer be able to use the Faiz Gear. Humans with insufficient DNA are rejected by the Faiz Gear with the word 'error'. Orphnochs may use the Faiz Gear more often (in their human form only), but their DNA breaks down with continued use (though this could take months or years for this to be a problem).

Once the transformation is completed, the Faiz Armor has several key features in its design to offer protection to the user. Like all Rider gears, the Faiz armor manifests when the Faiz Driver generates Photon Blood, a glowing substance generates the soft Sol Foam suit, Sol Metal armor, and Fullmetal Lung chest armor via traveling through the red Photon Streams that ends at the Photon Terminals at the gauntlet and Power Anklet greaves, the right Anklet having a Energy Holster that the Faiz Pointer can be connected to. The helmet is unique due to its Global Feeler antenna to link up to Smart Brain's networks and Ultimate Finder visor that gives Faiz incredible vision to see in darkness, giving the illusion of a glowing eye, and a limited amount of X-ray vision.

Kamen Rider Faiz's finishing attack is called the Crimson Smash („ÇØ„É™„É†„Çæ„É≥„Çπ„Éû„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•, Kurimuzon Sumasshu), in which the Faiz Pointer (when mounted on the right leg) generates a crimson energy drill that Faiz uses to kick through an enemy.

Faiz Armour Design: Black Shell Met („Éñ„É©„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Ç∑„Çß„É´„É°„ÉÉ„Éà, Burakku Sheru Metto): The head. It is a reinforced helmet developed by Smart Brain, and has a thin shell layer made out of Sol Metal („ÇΩ„É´„É°„Çø„É´, Soru Metaru), a supermetal with hardness close to a diamond. An impact absorption bag is installed inside.
Global Feelers („Ç∞„É≠„Éº„Éê„É´„Éï„Ç£„Éº„É©„Éº, Gur≈çbaru Fƒ´rƒÅ): The antennae. They commuicate with the artificial satellites Eagle Sat („Ç§„Éº„Ç∞„É´„Çµ„ÉÉ„Éà, ƒ™guru Satto) and Hawk Eye („Éõ„Éº„ÇØ„Ç¢„Ç§, H≈çku Ai) that support Kamen Rider Faiz's systems. They can collect information as well as download new programs.
Extreme Nose („Ç®„ÇØ„Çπ„Éà„É™„Éº„É†„Éé„Éº„Ç∫, Ekusutorƒ´mu N≈çzu): An olfactory organ that artificially creates a sense of smell one million times more potent that humans'. While its sensitivity can be freely adjusted, it typically has the same olfactory powers as a dog.
Satellite Signal („Çµ„ÉÜ„É©„Ç§„Éà„Ç∑„Ç∞„Éä„É´, Sateraito Shigunaru): The green signal on the face. It blinks mainly when communicating with satellites and when tracking an enemy. A green gauge means stable supply, a blinking green light indicates access, a blinking red light indicates access error, and a red light is flashed when communication is not possible.
Ultimate Finder („Ç¢„É´„ÉÜ„Ç£„É°„ÉÉ„Éà„Éï„Ç°„Ç§„É≥„ÉÄ„Éº, Arutimetto FaindƒÅ): The yellow visor. It has an ultra-sensitive camera that converts images into electrical signals and conveys them to he wearer. It also has a scope function that allows daylight vision even in the darkness, and an X-ray camera function that allows seeing through objects.
Photon Terminal („Éï„Ç©„Éà„É≥„Çø„Éº„Éü„Éä„É´, Foton TƒÅminaru): The strip running vertically down the middle of the face. It is a junction ballast that connects photon streams. The Photon Blood flowing within the three terminals emits too much energy, so this equipment applies resistance so that the suit itself does not self-destruct, and it supplies power to the whole body in a stable manner. There is another Photon Terminal located on the back.
Pin Falls Sonar („Éî„É≥„Éï„Ç©„Éº„É´„Ç∫„ÇΩ„Éä„Éº, Pin F≈çruzu SonƒÅ): Extremely sensitive audio devices that can hear a needle fall from 5km away. The sensitivity can be freely changed according to the wearer's will.
Extreme Regulator („Ç®„ÇØ„Çπ„Éà„É™„Éº„É†„É¨„ÇÆ„É•„É¨„Éº„Çø„Éº, Ekusutorƒ´mu RegyurƒìtƒÅ): The mouthpiece. It is an oxygen supply device for the wearer. It enables activities in harsh environment where there is extremely little oxygen such as water or toxic gases.
Neck Shield („Éç„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Ç∑„Éº„É´„Éâ, Nekku Shƒ´rudo): The neck. it is made out of Sol Metal 315 („ÇΩ„É´„É°„Çø„É´315, Soru Metaru 315), a special type of Sol Metal that combines hardness and softness. There are countless capillary cables running inside it that protects the neck from external shocks. The cables also serve to transmit information between the suit and the Black Shell Met.
Full Metal Lung („Éï„É´„É°„Çø„É´„É©„É≥„Ç∞, Furu Metaru Rangu): The chest armor. It has a structure in which two shock absorbing bags are sandwiched between four layers of Sol Metal, allowing the heavy armor to repel tank fire. An oxygen tank is built in.
Sol Foam („ÇΩ„É´„Éï„Ç©„Éº„É†, Soru F≈çmu): The reinforced bodysuit. It is knitted with ultrafine metal threads of Sol Metal 315 that combines hardness and softness. Additionally, the surface is coated with silver coating.
Spin Pad („Çπ„Éî„É≥„Éë„ÉÉ„Éâ, Supin Paddo): Protective pads located on the back. They protect the spine and the Photon Stream from any impacts from behind. If need be, it becomes an airbag.
Spin Connector („Çπ„Éî„É≥„Ç≥„Éç„ÇØ„Çø, Supin Konekuta): The back of the Faiz Driver connects to the wearer's spine via an myriad of capillary cables. There is no pain during connection due to the usage of ultrafine needles.
Photon Stream („Éï„Ç©„Éà„É≥„Çπ„Éà„É™„Éº„É†, Foton Sutorƒ´mu): The red lines running all over the body. It is an energy flow path that contains the fluid energy Photon Blood („Éï„Ç©„Éà„É≥„Éñ„É©„ÉÉ„Éâ, Foton Buraddo), which is red for Faiz. Every suit developed by Smart Brain has Photon Blood, each one with a different color.
Power Fingers („Éë„ÉØ„Éº„Éï„Ç£„É≥„Ç¨„Éº, PawƒÅ FingƒÅ): The fingers. They have enough strength to break a 30cm steel plate yet are delicate enough to operate the Faiz Phone.
Metal Intercooler („É°„Çø„É´„Ç§„É≥„Çø„Éº„ÇØ„Éº„É©„Éº, Metaru IntƒÅk≈´rƒÅ): Grey metal plates installed at the back of the head, shoulders and back sections. They are heat dissipation units that release excess heat emitted by the Photon Blood. As most of the electronics are located in the helmet, a large Metal Intercooler is placed at the back of it.
Knee Folders („Éã„Éº„Éï„Ç©„É´„ÉÄ„Éº, Nƒ´ ForudƒÅ): The knees. They are made out of Sol Metal 228 („ÇΩ„É´„É°„Çø„É´228, Soru Metaru 228), which is even harder than regular Sol Metal. It consists of two metal boards and one shock absorber. Due to its hardness, they can be used as striking weapons.
Flex Bellows („Éï„É¨„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Çπ„Éô„É≠„Ç¶„Ç∫, Furekkusu Berouzu): The lower legs. They are bellows (air bag devices) for shock absorption.
Energy Holster („Ç®„Éä„Ç∏„Éº„Éõ„É´„Çπ„Çø„Éº, Enajƒ´ HorusutƒÅ): A holster on the lower right leg. It is an energy amplification terminal that is used to mount the Faiz Pointer whenever Faiz wishes to execute the Crimson Smash Rider Kick attack.
Power Anklets („Éë„ÉØ„Éº„Ç¢„É≥„ÇØ„É¨„ÉÉ„Éà, PawƒÅ Ankuretto): The ankle armor. They are control terminals that concentrates power onto the legs when kicking. In addition, the Flex Bellows that surrounds the calf absorbs the intense impact when kicking.

---

Axel Form („Ç¢„ÇØ„Çª„É´„Éï„Ç©„Éº„É†, Akuseru F≈çmu) is a temporary transformation that allows Faiz to move at the speed of sound for roughly 10 seconds. His physical attacks are also boosted, and he is able to perform multiple Exceed Charges in quick succession.

Faiz transforms into Axel Form from his default form by wearing the Faiz Axel and swapping its Axel Mission Memory with the Faiz Driver's Faiz Mission Memory. When this is performed, the Full Metal Lung chest plates will open to reveal the Faiz Core in the center of Faiz's chest. The Photon Streams then turn silver and the Ultimate Finder turns red.

---

By inserting the Faiz Phone into the Faiz Blaster briefcase and entering the transformation code 5-5-5, Faiz can access Blaster Form („Éñ„É©„Çπ„Çø„Éº„Éï„Ç©„Éº„É†, BurastƒÅ F≈çmu), the most powerful form of the Faiz Gear. The amount of Photon Blood that the Faiz Gear produces increases to the extreme where it overflows from the Photon Streams and spreads itself over the Sol Foam and the Sol Metal, changing their color to red. Faiz also receives a new, more powerful, set of Full Metal Lung with a backpack like device attached to it called Photon Field Floater („Éï„Ç©„Éà„É≥„Éï„Ç£„Éº„É´„Éâ„Éï„É≠„Éº„Çø„Éº, Foton Fƒ´rudo Fur≈çtƒÅ) that releases constant waves of Photon energy to give Faiz Blaster flying capacities. By focusing the release pattern however, the thrusters of the Photon Field Floater can be used as powerful energy cannons called the Bloody Cannons („Éñ„É©„ÉÉ„Éá„Ç£„Éª„Ç≠„É£„Éé„É≥, Buraddi Kyanon). Faiz's signature Crimson Smash attack has been powered up significantly. The Blaster Crimson Smash is so tremendously powerful that damaging Photon Energy waves radiate from the point of impact and destroy everything around it.

All of these new abilities and more, except for his Crimson Smash kick which can be performed without the Faiz Pointer, are accessed by inputting codes into the Faiz Blaster, which also holds the Faiz Phone and can transform into Blaster and Blade modes for the Photon Blaster and Photon Breaker Exceed Charges.

2.content:
Faiz Gear List:

SB-555C Faiz Shot - Digital camera-shaped knuckle-duster. The Faiz Shot was designed for specific compatibility with the Faiz Mission Memory, transforming into an energy-powered knuckle-duster that Faiz can use his Grand Impact („Ç∞„É©„É≥„Éâ„Ç§„É≥„Éë„ÇØ„Éà, Gurando Inpakuto) attack.

SB-555L Faiz Pointer - A laser pointer which enables to produce an energy drill deathblow called the Crimson Smash (combined with a flying side-kick).

SB-555H Faiz Edge - A lightsaber-like sword that can be stored in Autovajin. The Exceed Charge of this weapon is called the Sparkle Cut („Çπ„Éë„Éº„ÇØ„É´„Ç´„ÉÉ„Éà, SupƒÅkuru Katto), where Faiz fires an anti-gravity pulse along the ground, immobilizing ground-based enemies by levitating them in the air and overcharge the energy in the blade, allowing it to perform more powerful cuts.

SB-555W Faiz Axel - A stopwatch that enables to gain access to Axel Form once the Axel Mission Memory replaces the regular Mission Memory in the Faiz Phone.

Axel Mission Memory - A small metallic card key containing the information of the Faiz Axel Armour.

SB-555T Faiz Blaster - A large modern Trunk Trunkbox-shaped laser cannon/sword that enables to gain access to Blaster Form.

SB-555A Faiz Sounder - This boom box can convert into two cannons that shoots Photon waves when the Faiz Mission Memory is inserted into it.

---

The Transformation Belt SB-555B Faiz Driver (Â§âË∫´„Éô„É´„Éà Ôº≥Ôº¢ÔºçÔºïÔºïÔºïÔº¢ „Éï„Ç°„Ç§„Ç∫„Éâ„É©„Ç§„Éê„Éº, Henshin Beruto SB-555B Faizu DoraibƒÅ) transformation device was developed by Smart Brain as a means to protect the Orphnoch King, constructed in the shape of a belt.

The Faiz Driver was designed for specific compatibility with the Faiz Phone, generating the Photon Stream („Éï„Ç©„Éà„É≥„Çπ„Éà„É™„Éº„É†, Foton Sutorƒ´mu) that form the Faiz Armor when the Mission Memory is installed into the phone. Under normal circumstances, the belt is usually kept inside a briefcase along with the Faiz Pointer and the Faiz Shot, and is assembled by placing the latter two devices into the Side Buckle („Çµ„Ç§„Éâ„Éê„ÉÉ„ÇØ„É´, Saido Bakkuru) holders on both sides of the belt. If the user presses End Call on the Faiz Phone or if the belt was somehow forcibly detached from the user, the armor dissolves.

Among the three Rider Gears, the Faiz Gear was the most balanced and the least taxing. Though it was weaker than the other gears, it was the fastest and had access to various gadgets (the Faiz Phone, Faiz Shot, Faiz Pointer and the Faiz Edge plus the help of the Auto Vajin) to suit any situation, and various forms (Accel Form, Blaster Form) that increased its power exponentially when fighting against powerful foes. Its biggest positive among the Gears in the series is that it has the least negative side effects. The Kaixa Gear immediately drains nearly all of the users' Orphnoch DNA after one use unless he or she has a substantial amount, while the Delta Gear has the possibility of making people addicted to battle. The Faiz Gear only drains Orphnoch DNA at a normal rate and has no other mental side effects.

User Restriction:
Faiz Driver can only be used by anyone with a great amount of Orphnoch DNA, otherwise the driver will eject itself instead of letting the user to transform.

Faiz Driver Design:

Faiz Gear Cradle („Éï„Ç°„Ç§„Ç∫„ÇÆ„Ç¢„Éª„ÇØ„É¨„Éº„Éâ„É´, Faizu Gia Kurƒìdoru): A pedestal in which the Faiz Pointer is stored. On its surface is a bonding terminal that charges the Faiz Pointer with Photon Blood sent from the Faiz Driver. The Faiz Gear Cradle is stored on Faiz's right side.
Intercooler („Ç§„É≥„Çø„Éº„ÇØ„Éº„É©„Éº, IntƒÅk≈´rƒÅ): A small red vent located near the upper right side of the Faiz Phone. It is a built-in cooling function that prevents the overheating of the Faiz Driver's HDD and CPU.
Trans Folder („Éà„É©„É≥„Çπ„Éï„Ç©„É´„ÉÄ„Éº, Toransu ForudƒÅ): The cradle where the Faiz Phone is stored. To transform, the Faiz Phone is inserted into the Trans Folder and then tilted 90 degrees to the left. The synchronization system allows the user to unlock the lock.
Phone Connector („Éï„Ç©„É≥„Ç≥„Éç„ÇØ„Çø, Fon Konekuta): The Trans Folder's connection terminal that allows the Faiz Phone to be inserted. In addition to charging the Faiz Phone with energy, it exchanges data with it. It is made out of titanium.
Lock Pin („É≠„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Éî„É≥, Rokku Pin): A titanium pin that is sued to lock the Faiz Phone into the Trans Folder.
Forced Release Switch (Âº∑Âà∂„É™„É™„Éº„Çπ„Çπ„Ç§„ÉÉ„ÉÅ, Ky≈çsei Rirƒ´su Suitchi): A special switch located on the Driver's upper left side corner. By pressing a special magnet key against it, it becomes possible to remove the Faiz Phone and HDD without the wearer.
SBV-HDD„ÄàPD„Äâ10TB (SBV-HDD„ÄàPD„Äâ10TB): A special device located on the Driver's left side black section on the belt strap. It records the Faiz's combat data in a large-capacity HDD of 10 terabytes. Covered in a Sol Metal 228 housing, it is theoretically equipped with a shock-resistant mechanism that will not damage or lose data even if it receives a shock comparable to an atomic bomb. It is removable.
SBV-HDD„ÄàPD„Äâ8TB (SBV-HDD„ÄàPD„Äâ8TB): A special device located on the Driver's right side black section on the belt strap. It is an 8 terabyte large capacity HDD. It is covered with a robust housing made of Sol Metal 228 („ÇΩ„É´„É°„Çø„É´228, Soru Metaru 228), which is a super metal developed by Smart Brain that has a hardness close to that of diamond, and has a higher hardness than regular Sol Metal. It contains system-related data, including the Kamen Rider Faiz startup program.
Smart PC IV („Çπ„Éû„Éº„ÉàPC ‚Ö£, SumƒÅto PC ‚Ö£): An internally concealed unit; it is the core of the Faiz Driver and it incorporates an ultra-compact next-generation high-speed CPU made by Smart Brain. It boasts a computing speed that is comparable to that of a defense ministry supercomputer.

---

The Mobile Phone-type Multi-device SB-555P Faiz Phone (Êê∫Â∏ØÈõªË©±Âûã„Éû„É´„ÉÅ„Éá„Éê„Ç§„Çπ Ôº≥Ôº¢ÔºçÔºïÔºïÔºïÔº∞ „Éï„Ç°„Ç§„Ç∫„Éï„Ç©„É≥, Keitaidenwa-gata Maruchidebaisu SB-555P Faizu Fon) is a cellphone-like device that is in reality the control unit of the Faiz Gear, the primary storage place for a Mission Memory as transgenerator that powers the Faiz Gear or the Faiz Axel Form by dialing the activation code.

When the phone is transformed into Phone Blaster Mode („Éï„Ç©„É≥„Éñ„É©„Çπ„Çø„Éº„É¢„Éº„Éâ, Fon BurasutƒÅ M≈çdo), forming the Variable Light Bullet Gun Phone Blaster (ÂèØÂ§âÂºèÂÖâÂºæÈäÉ „Éï„Ç©„É≥„Éñ„É©„Çπ„Çø„Éº, Kahen-shiki Hikaridama J≈´ Fon BurasutƒÅ), it can be used for long-range attacks. It can be combined with the Faiz Pointer to boost its abilities. It is also capable of functioning as a normal cell phone. 

Faiz Phone design:

Muzzle Antenna („Éû„Ç∫„É´„Ç¢„É≥„ÉÜ„Éä, Mazuru Antena) - The phone's ultra-sensitive antenna. It uses Smart Brain's terminal for communication purposes. Any communications can be encrypted and scrambled to prevent interception. In Phone Blaster Mode, it serves as the muzzle, and can shoot out energy bullets and photon bullets thanks to the Electromagnetic Rifling (ÈõªÁ£Å„É©„Ç§„Éï„É™„É≥„Ç∞, Denji Raifuringu) engraved inside.
Micro Speaker („Éû„Ç§„ÇØ„É≠„Çπ„Éî„Éº„Ç´„Éº, Maikuro Supƒ´kƒÅ) - A microphone located between the screen and the Monitoring Window. Allows for uninterrupted conversations even if the user is underground.
Monitoring Window („É¢„Éã„Çø„É™„É≥„Ç∞„Ç¶„Ç§„É≥„Éâ„Ç¶, Monitaringu Uindou) - The screen. In addition to displaying the currently activated function, the user can visually check other status such as battery level, text messages and emails.
Metal Case („É°„Çø„É´„Ç±„Éº„Çπ, Metaru Kƒìsu) - The gray metal casing. It is made out of Sol Metal 228 („ÇΩ„É´„É°„Çø„É´228, Soru Metaru 228), a supermetal developed by Smart Brain that has hardness close to diamond, and has a higher hardness than normal Sol Metal (the metal that Faiz's armor is made of). It boasts high rigidity.
Second Case („Çª„Ç´„É≥„Éâ„Ç±„Éº„Çπ, Sekando Kƒìsu) - The black parts. It is made out of Silver Rubber („Ç∑„É´„É¥„Çß„Éº„É´„É©„Éê„Éº, Shiruvu~ƒìru RabƒÅ), making it extremely easy to hold. It does not deteriorate.
Trigger („Éà„É™„Ç¨„Éº, TorigƒÅ) - The trigger. In Phone Mode, it is locked. In Phone Blaster Mode, it is pressed to fire photon bullets.
Trans Bridge („Éà„É©„É≥„Çπ„Éñ„É™„ÉÉ„Ç∏, Toransu Burijji) - The circular axis that allows the Faiz Phone to change between Phone and Phone Blaster Modes.
Site Attach Rail („Çµ„Ç§„Éà„Ç¢„Çø„ÉÉ„ÉÅ„É¨„Éº„É´, Saito Atatchi Rƒìru) - A special attachment rail that is revealed when the Faiz Phone is switched to Phone Blaster Mode. It has a cable and a connection harness for exchanging data inside. When the Phone blaster Mode is equipped with the Faiz Pointer, it can use the Faiz Pointer's laser pointer lock on to targets up to 2000m away.
Numeric Keypad („ÉÜ„É≥„Ç≠„Éº, Tenkƒ´) - The keypad. It serves to input codes and phone numbers, and can also be sued as a simple keyboard for text messaging. (Note: 'tenkƒ´' („ÉÜ„É≥„Ç≠„Éº) is a common Japanese abbreviation for 'ten keypad' („ÉÜ„É≥„Ç≠„Éº„Éë„ÉÉ„Éâ), a term used in Japan for 'numeric keyboard'.)
ENTER Key (ENTER„Ç≠„Éº, EntƒÅ Kƒ´) - The 'ENTER' button. Used to determine a command code.
Microphone („Éû„Ç§„ÇØ„É≠„Éï„Ç©„É≥, Maikurofon) - A highly sensitive microphone located below the Numeric Keypad. Used within Call Mode to speak.
Mission Memories („Éü„ÉÉ„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„É°„É¢„É™, Misshon Memori) - A metallic card key attached to the Faiz Phone's exterior. It can be taken off and slotted onto other equipment that belongs to Faiz.
Condition Signal („Ç≥„É≥„Éá„Ç£„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„Ç∑„Ç∞„Éä„É´, Kondishon Shigunaru) - A flashing light attached to the Mission Memory. It flashes red when the Faiz Phone is low on battery, blinks slowly during a call and flashes green irregularly when downloading data.
Smart Battery („Çπ„Éû„Éº„Éà„Éê„ÉÉ„ÉÜ„É™„Éº, SumƒÅto Batterƒ´) - A small, large-capacity storage battery created by Smart Brain. It is a few centimeters large, and can store energy for 480 hours in Standby mode and 240 hours in normal use. Additionally, it can be recharged simply by placing it in the Faiz Driver.

Codes: 

5-5-5 Enter This code switches the Faiz Phone and Faiz Driver into transformation standby mode. From here, inserting the Faiz Phone into the Driver will complete the transformation, allowing for the user to become Faiz. If someone without any Orphnoch DNA attempts to transform, the phone will register an error, announce "ERROR", and violently eject from the user along with the belt.
1-0-3 Enter (Single Mode): This code allows for Faiz to convert the Faiz Phone into the Phone Blaster and fire a continuous beam of Photon Energy for about 3 seconds. It has 12 shots until it must be recharged.
1-0-6 Enter (Burst Mode): This code allows for Faiz to convert the Faiz Phone into the Phone Blaster and fire 3 round bursts of Photon Energy. It has 4 bursts until it must be recharged.
2-7-9 Enter (Charge): This code allows for Faiz to give the Phone Blaster a five-second recharge, reloading the photon magazine.
5-8-2-1 Enter (Auto Vajin, come closer): This code allows for Faiz to summon the Auto Vajin. Unused.
5-8-2-6 Enter (Auto Vajin Battle Mode): This code allows for the Auto Vajin to transform into its humanoid robot form. Unused.
5-8-8-6 Enter (Auto Vajin Vehicle Mode): This code allows for the Auto Vajin to transform into its motorcycle form. Unused
5-8-1-4 Enter (Auto Vajin, get into the action): This code allows for the Auto Vajin to attack one or more targets autonomously while in Battle Mode. Unused.
5-8-4-6 Enter (Auto vajin take off): This code allows for the Auto Vajin to fly while in Battle Mode. Unused.
3-8-2-1 Enter (Jetsliger, come closer): This code allows for Faiz to summon the Jetsliger.
3-8-1-4 Enter (Jetsliger, get into the action): This code allows for the Jetsliger to attack one or more targets autonomously. Unused.
3-8-4-6 Enter (Jetsliger, take off): This code allows for the Jetsliger to hover above the ground in order to clear a large obstacle, traverse uneven terrain, or maneuver more nimbly during battle. Unused.
Enter: Pressing the "Enter" button without entering a code allows for Faiz to execute an "Exceed Charge depending on the item he inserted the Mission Memory into, sending a burst of power from the Faiz Driver along the Photon Streams to the weapon in question, giving it a tremendous power boost, and in some cases extra abilities.
End Call: Pressing the "End Call" button will switch off the Faiz Driver and cause the Sol Foam and Sol Metal to disappear.
Any other code will register an error, although one could presumably call another Rider's phone by entering their serial code (913 for Kaixa, for example) and then pressing the "Call" button.

3.content:
RIder Name: Kaixa

Motif: Chi Symbol (X), Wasp

Primary colours: Black (base), Amber yellow (Photon streams + parts of the helmet), Dark grey (the metal on the chestplate), Silver (metal parts + the outlines of the chestplate), Purple (visor)

 ---

The Kaixa Gear („Ç´„Ç§„Ç∂„ÇÆ„Ç¢, Kaiza Gia) was the third set of Kamen Rider Gear developed by the Smart Brain Corporation to protect the Orphnoch King. The Kaixa Gear was more powerful but slower than the Faiz Gear. It still did not match the Delta Gear for speed or strength but possessed greater functionality. Its power came at a price: while all of Smart Brain's Rider Gears were intended for Orphnochs only, the Kaixa Gear is the only set that will kill any users who drained all their Orphnoch DNA after donning it.

Once transformation is completed, the Kaixa Armor has several key features in its design to protect protection to the user. Like all gear, the Kaixa armor manifests when the Kaixa Driver generates Photon Blood, a glowing substance generates the soft Luna Foam suit, Luna Metal armor, and Fullmetal Lung chest armor via traveling through the two yellow Photon Streams lines that gives Kaixa "greater strength at the cost of speed". The steams end at the Photon Terminals at the gauntlets and Power Anklet greaves, the right Anklet having a Energy Holster that the Kaixa Pointer can be connected it. The helmet is unique due to its Global Feeler antenna to link up to Smart Brain's networks and the X Finder visor that gives Kaixa incredible vision to see in darkness, giving the illusion of a glowing eye, and a limited amount of X-ray vision.

Kaixa Suit Design: 

X Finder Visor: The helmet's most striking feature is the "X" shaped purple visor, known as the X Finder. This design not only reinforces the Greek letter motif but also provides Kaixa with enhanced visual capabilities, including night vision and limited X-ray vision, giving the illusion of glowing eyes. 

Global Feeler Antenna: A prominent antenna extends from the helmet, termed the Global Feeler. This device enables Kaixa to interface with Smart Brain's networks, facilitating communication and data access during missions.

Luna Foam Undersuit: Beneath the armor lies the Luna Foam, a flexible yet durable material that provides comfort and mobility while serving as a conduit for the Photon Streams.‚Äã

Luna Metal Armor: Overlaying the Luna Foam is the Luna Metal armor, offering robust protection against physical attacks. This metallic layer is strategically placed to safeguard vital areas without compromising agility.

Fullmetal Lung Chest Plate: The chest area is fortified with the Fullmetal Lung, a specialized component designed to enhance respiratory efficiency and protect the torso.

The yellow-gold Photon Streams traverse the suit, channeling energy throughout Kaixa's body. These streams culminate at the Photon Terminals located on the gauntlets and Power Anklet greaves, serving as focal points for energy distribution and weapon interfacing.

Gauntlets: Equipped with Photon Terminals, the gauntlets enhance Kaixa's punching power and can interface with certain weapons, amplifying their effectiveness.

4.content:
Kaixa Gear List:

SB-913B Kaixa Driver - Kaixa's transformation device.
SB-913P Kaixa Phone - A sideflip "swing" cellphone device serves as the controller for Kaixa Gear.
Kaixa Mission Memory - A small metallic card key containing the information of the Kaixa Armor.
SB-913C Kaixa Shot - Digital camera-shaped knuckle-duster.
SB-913B Kaixa Pointer - Binocular-shaped pointer which enables to produce an energy drill deathblow.
SB-913X Kaixa Blaygun - A special weapon that is both a pistol, a dagger and a lightsaber.

---

The Transformation Belt SB-913B Kaixa Driver (Â§âË∫´„Éô„É´„Éà Ôº≥Ôº¢ÔºçÔºôÔºëÔºìÔº¢ „Ç´„Ç§„Ç∂„Éâ„É©„Ç§„Éê„Éº, Henshin Beruto SB-913B Kaiza DoraibƒÅ) is a transformation device developed by Smart Brain as a means to protect the Orphnoch King. The Kaixa Driver was designed for specific compatibility with the Kaixa Phone, generating the photon streams that form the Kaixa Armor when the Mission Memory is installed into the phone. If the belt is removed, the armor dissolves.

User Restriction:
Kaixa Driver can be used by anyone with Orphnoch DNA. However, it will shorten the lifespan of the user, and without a great amount of Orphnoch DNA, the user will die in a short time.

Kaixa Driver Design:

Core Appearance: The Kaixa Driver is a sleek, high-tech belt featuring a central docking station designed to accommodate the Kaixa Phone. Its design emphasizes functionality and integration with other Kaixa Gear components.‚Äã

Color Scheme: Primarily matte black with metallic silver accents, the belt showcases yellow-gold highlights that align with Kaixa's signature Photon Streams, reinforcing its visual identity.‚Äã

Photon Stream Integration: Upon activation, the belt emits Photon Streams that materialize into Kaixa's armor, establishing a direct link between the device and the Rider's suit.

---

The Mobile Phone-type Multi-device SB-913P Kaixa Phone (Êê∫Â∏ØÈõªË©±Âûã„Éû„É´„ÉÅ„Éá„Éê„Ç§„Çπ Ôº≥Ôº¢ÔºçÔºôÔºëÔºìÔº∞ „Ç´„Ç§„Ç∂„Éï„Ç©„É≥, Keitaidenwa-gata Maruchidebaisu SB-913P Kaiza Fon) is a side flip "swing" cellphone device serving as the control unit of the Kaixa Gear, the primary storage place for a Mission Memory as the transgenerator that powers the Kaixa Gear.

Codes:

9-1-3 Enter: This code allows the user to transform into Kamen Rider Kaixa. The transformation can carry serious consequences if the user does not contain any Orphnoch DNA.
1-0-3 Enter (Single Mode): This code allows Kaixa to convert the Kaixa Phone into Phone Blaster Mode and fire a continuous beam of Photon Energy for about 3 seconds. It has 12 shots until it must be recharged.
1-0-6 Enter (Burst Mode): This code allows Kaixa to convert the Kaixa Phone into Phone Blaster Mode and fire 3 round bursts of Photon Energy. It has 4 bursts until it must be recharged.
2-7-9 Enter (Charge): This code allows Kaixa to give the Phone Blaster a five second recharge.
9-8-2-1 Enter (Side Basshar, come closer): This code allows Kaixa to summon the SB-913V Side Basshar.
9-8-1-4 Enter (Side Basshar, get into the action): This code allows for the Side Basshar to attack one or more targets autonomously.
9-8-2-6 Enter (Side Basshar Battle Mode): This code Side Basshar into Battle Mode. 
9-8-8-6 Enter (Side Basshar Vehicle Mode): This code Side Basshar into Vehicle Mode. 
3-8-2-1 Enter: This code allows Kaixa to summon the SB-VX0 Jetsliger. 
Enter: Pressing the "Enter" button without entering a code allows Kaixa to execute an Exceed Charge depending on the item he inserted the Mission Memory into, sending a burst of power from the Kaixa Driver, along the Photon Streams, to the weapon in question giving it a tremendous power boost, and in some cases extra abilities.
End Call: Pressing the "End Call" button will switch off the Kaixa Driver and cause the Luna Foam and Luna Metal to disappear.

5.content:
Rider Name: Delta

Motif: Delta Symbol (Œî)

Primary Colours: Black (Base), White (Photon streams + parts of the helmet), Reddish-orange (the visor)

---

The Delta Gear („Éá„É´„Çø„ÇÆ„Ç¢, Deruta Gia) was the first set of Kamen Rider Gear developed by the Smart Brain Corporation to protect the Orphnoch King. It never moved past the prototype stage. The Suit had more power and speed than the Faiz and Kaixa Gears, but is significantly less functional - it is severely lacking in weaponry and modularity, and provides no strategic enhancements past the initial speed and power increase. It was also the only gear that allowed anyone to utilize it without killing them in the process, however, there were potential side effects, such as temporarily gaining its power, even when not transformed.

Kamen Rider Delta's finishing attack is called the Lucifer's Hammer („É´„Ç∑„Éï„Ç°„Éº„Ç∫„Éè„É≥„Éû„Éº, RushifƒÅzu hanmƒÅ) this finisher is executed when the Photon Stream is shot from the Delta Mover and when it connects, it stuns the adversary, in which the Rider executes either a bicycle kick or a front dropkick into the stream, causing the enemies' destruction.

The Delta Armor has several key features in its design. Unlike the Gear, the armor only exists after the wearer transforms.

Delta Suit Design:

Photon Blood: A glowing substance that provides all of the Rider‚Äôs powers and generates all of the physical features of the armor. The Photon Blood is generated from the Delta Driver.
Sol Foam/Metal: Soft parts of the armor are made of Sol Foam, and the hard parts are made of Sol Metal 228. This substance is generated by the Delta Driver to form complex machinery that is powered by Photon Blood. If the Foam or Metal are damaged, the armor switches off and resets itself.
Black Shell Met („Éñ„É©„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Ç∑„Çß„É´„É°„ÉÉ„Éà, Burakku Sheru Metto): The head. It is a reinforced helmet developed by Smart Brain, and has a thin shell layer made out of Sol Metal („ÇΩ„É´„É°„Çø„É´, Soru Metaru), a super-metal with a hardness close to that of a diamond. An impact absorption bag is installed inside.
Receiver Slate („É¨„Ç∑„Éº„Éê„Éº„Éª„Çπ„É¨„Éº„Éà, Reshƒ´bƒÅ Surƒìto): The large triangle on the forehead of the Black Shell Met. It receives the Demon's Idea from the Demon's Slate on the chest armor, and is directly connected to its wearer's brain by a capillary cable which has a diameter of 0.52 nanometers.
Ultimate Finder („Ç¢„É´„ÉÜ„Ç£„É°„ÉÉ„Éà„Éï„Ç°„Ç§„É≥„ÉÄ„Éº, Arutimetto FaindƒÅ): The large orange eyepieces of the Rider give them 180 degrees anterior field of view. They also allow the wearer to have night vision and X-ray vision.
Global Feeler: The antenna on the Rider‚Äôs head can be used to communicate with the Smart Brain Satellite and the Smart Brain computer network.
Shoulder Sword („Ç∑„Éß„É´„ÉÄ„Éº„Çπ„Ç¶„Ç©„Éº„Éâ, ShorudƒÅ Su≈çdo): Delta's shoulder armor. It is made out of Sol Metal 228, a super-metal developed by Smart Brain that has a hardness close to that of a diamond. When used in shoulder tackles, it concentrates Delta's Photon Blood, making it a powerful weapon.
Demon's Slate („Éá„É¢„É≥„Ç∫„Éª„Çπ„É¨„Éº„Éà): A strengthening device located directly on the triangle part of the chest plate. It forcibly raises the frequency of Delta's gamma brain waves to increase his fighting instincts. However, it can change the wearer's personality and cause mental breakdown if used for too long.
Delta Lung („Éá„É´„Çø„É©„É≥„Ç∞, Deruta Rangu): The triangular chest armor found under the Demon's Slate. It is made out of Sol Metal: a super-metal developed by Smart Brain which has a hardness close to that of a diamond. It disperses the force of any sustained impact in a thousandth of a second, and is durable enough to directly take the firepower of a tank. In addition to this extreme durability, the Delta Lung also features a built-in oxygen tank that can supply its user with oxygen for up to 3 hours.
Bright Streams („Éñ„É©„Ç§„Éà„Çπ„Éà„É™„Éº„É†, Buraito Sutorƒ´mu): The white lines running through Delta's Armor, which carry white photon blood that has the same power output as Faiz's Axel Form. They feature special maneuvers that are not seen on Kamen Rider Faiz or Kamen Rider Kaixa's Photon Streams, dividing into a fork-like formation at key points on the Sol Foam suit. This creates a reverse bottleneck effect, increasing the flow of the Photon Blood.
Bigger Stream Pattern („Éì„Ç¨„Éº„Çπ„Éà„É™„Éº„É†„Éë„Çø„Éº„É≥, BigƒÅ Sutorƒ´mu PatƒÅn): Delta's unique mechanism which increases the amount of energy flow by dividing the Bright Streams into 3 points at the arms and the legs.
Photon Terminal („Éï„Ç©„Éà„É≥„Çø„Éº„Éü„Éä„É´, Foton TƒÅminaru): Where the Photon Streams connect with the gauntlets and greaves. It is twice as strong as Kamen Rider Faiz and Kamen Rider Kaixa's. It has three terminals connected that emit a lot of energy, so this equipment has resistors along the stream so that the suit itself does not self-destruct, and it supplies power to the whole body in a stable manner. There is another Photon Terminal located on the back.
Power Anklets („Éë„ÉØ„Éº„Ç¢„É≥„ÇØ„É¨„ÉÉ„Éà, PawƒÅ Ankuretto): The ankle armor, which has the role of protecting the wearer from the force generated from powerful kicks.
Flex Bellows („Éï„É¨„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Çπ„Éô„É≠„Ç¶„Ç∫, Furekkusu Berouzu): They surround the calves as a shock absorbing air bag to protect the legs from the intense impact when kicking or from falling.
Photon Muzzle („Éï„Ç©„Éà„É≥„Éû„Ç∫„É´): Control terminals on the soles of Delta's boots that release concentrated Photon Blood when performing the Lucifer's Hammer. The opening is in the shape of the letter "Œî".

6.content:
Delta Gear List:

SB-333B Delta Driver - Delta's transformation device.
SB-333P Delta Phone - The walkie-talkie-shaped control unit of the Delta Gear and the grip of the Delta Blaster.
SB-333DV Delta Mover - The digital camcorder-shaped view-screen and the main portion of the Delta Blaster.
Delta Blaster - The combined form of the Delta Phone and Delta Mover and Delta's main weapon.
Delta Mission Memory - A small metallic card key which stores the information of the Delta Armor.

---

The Transformation Belt SB-333B Delta Driver (Â§âË∫´„Éô„É´„Éà Ôº≥Ôº¢ÔºçÔºìÔºìÔºìÔº¢ „Éá„É´„Çø„Éâ„É©„Ç§„Éê„Éº, Henshin Beruto SB-333B Deruta DoraibƒÅ) is a high tech looking belt that generates the Photon Streams to form the Delta Rider armor. If the belt is removed, the armor disappears. It is the primary storage place for the Delta Mission Memory.

Delta Driver Design:

Core Appearance: The Delta Driver is a high-tech belt with a fixed central buckle, differing from other Riders' belts which often feature detachable components. This central unit houses the transgenerator, essential for initiating the transformation sequence.‚Äã

Color Scheme: Primarily matte black with metallic silver accents, the belt exudes a sleek, modern aesthetic.

Delta Mover Integration: Attached to the right hip is the Delta Mover, a camcorder-shaped device that serves as the main component of the Delta Blaster when combined with the Delta Phone.

---

The SB-333P Delta Phone (Ôº≥Ôº¢ÔºçÔºìÔºìÔºìÔº∞ „Éá„É´„Çø„Éï„Ç©„É≥, SB-333P Deruta Fon) is the control unit of the Delta Gear. It can be connected to the Delta Mover mounted on the hip to form the latter's Blaster Mode.

Whereas the Faiz and Kaixa Phones are touch-tone activated, the Delta Phone is voice-activated; the number commands are input verbally. Unlike the Faiz and Kaixa Phones, the Delta Phone serves only as a control device for the Delta Gear, and the transgenerator that powers the Gear is actually part of the Delta Driver.

Delta Phone Design:

Form Factor: The Delta Phone resembles a compact, futuristic walkie-talkie, designed for both communication and as a component of the Delta Blaster.‚Äã

Aesthetic Details: Featuring a minimalist design with a monochrome display and a single trigger button, the device emphasizes functionality.

Voice Codes:

"Henshin": Puts the Delta Phone into transformation standby mode. The Delta Phone is then inserted into the Delta Mover on the side of the Delta Driver, transforming the wearer into Kamen Rider Delta. When the Delta Phone is disconnected from the Delta Mover, it will switch off the Delta Driver and cause the Sol Foam and Sol Metal to disappear.
"Fire": Activates Burst Mode, allowing the Delta Mover's Blaster Mode to fire 3 consecutive bursts of energy at once. It has 12 bursts until it must be recharged.
"Charge": Recharges the Delta Mover's shots. This will take about 5 seconds.
"3-8-2-1": Summons the SB-VX0 Jetsliger.
"Check": When the Delta Mission Memory is inserted into the Delta Mover, it is converted into its Pointer Mode. Entering the command code will then allow Delta to perform the Lucifer's Hammer, in which the Photon Stream is shot from the Delta Mover, stunning the adversary and allowing Delta to perform a flying kick.
3-8-1-4 (Jetsliger, get into the action): This code allows for the Jetsliger to attack one or more targets autonomously
3-8-4-6 (Jetsliger, take off): This code allows for the Jetsliger to hover above the ground in order to clear a large obstacle, traverse uneven terrain, or maneuver more nimbly during battle.

7.content:
The Transforming-type Variable Vehicle SB-555V Auto Vajin (ÂèØÂ§âÂûã„Éê„É™„Ç¢„Éñ„É´„Éì„Éº„ÇØ„É´ Ôº≥Ôº¢ÔºçÔºïÔºïÔºïÔº∂ „Ç™„Éº„Éà„Éê„Ç∏„É≥, Kahen-gata Bariaburu Bƒ´kuru SB-555V ≈åto Bajin) is a transforming, artificially intelligent support mecha for Kamen Rider Faiz.

A variable vehicle made by Smart Brain Motors, a subsidiary of Smart Brain, the Auto Vajin is Kamen Rider Faiz's personal mecha. It has a limited A.I., but it is programmed to protect Mari Sonoda and do as Faiz commands, in that precise order.

In addition to being able to transform willingly by pressing a switch on the chest, automatic transformation is possible by the function of a large capacity HDD with the next-generation high-speed CPU and Smart PC ‚Ö£ („Çπ„Éû„Éº„ÉàPC ‚Ö£ SumƒÅto PC ‚Ö£) installed in it. It also has a high self-learning function, supports Faiz independently.

Initially it was fairly incompetent in its duties, accidentally shooting Faiz on a few occasions, but it became a valuable asset later in the series, often putting itself in harms way to protect various characters, and coming to the rescue when Faiz is in great danger. The Auto Vajin also carries the Faiz Edge, which serves as the left handlebar (on its right shoulder in Battle Mode) of the Auto Vajin.

Auto Vajin's Vehicle Mode: 

The Vehicle Mode („Éì„Éº„ÇØ„É´„É¢„Éº„Éâ, Bƒ´kuru M≈çdo) is the primary form of the Auto Vajin. It can drive by itself in this form and reverts to this form when it is significantly damaged. Faiz can force the Auto Vajin to return to this form if he presses the Faiz symbol on its chest when it is in Battle Mode.

Its fuel is ordinary gasoline, but by being injected inside the Tank-Fuel Converter („Çø„É≥„ÇØ„Éª„Éï„É•„Éº„É´„Ç≥„É≥„Éê„Éº„Çø„Éº, Tanku-Fu~y≈´ru KonbƒÅtƒÅ), converted to high purity fuel Sol Glycerin („ÇΩ„É´„Ç∞„É™„Çª„É™„É≥, Soru Guriserin) with explosive power similar to nitroglycerin, produce incredible power.

The tires are made of Sol Rubber (a stronger version of Sol Foam) and the main chassis and plating is made from a similar substance to that of the Kamen Rider Gears.

Auto Vajin's Vehicle Mode Design:

Turn Signal („Ç¶„Ç§„É≥„Ç´„Éº, UinkƒÅ) - Direction indicators used as normal turn signals. Located on Auto Vajin's ear antennae in Battle Mode. Also used as a communication antennae to communicate with the artificial satellites Eagle Sat („Ç§„Éº„Ç∞„É´„Çµ„ÉÉ„Éà, ƒ™guru Satto) and Hawk Eye („Éõ„Éº„ÇØ„Ç¢„Ç§, H≈çku Ai). (Note: 'winker' („Ç¶„Ç§„É≥„Ç´„Éº, uinkƒÅ) is the usual Japanese term for 'turn signal', 'indicator' or 'blinker'.)
Headlight („Éò„ÉÉ„Éâ„É©„Ç§„Éà, Heddoraito) - The headlight. Becomes Auto Vajin's visor in Battle Mode. It can illuminate up to 200 meters away. Enemies can be blinded if the maximum amount of light is emitted.
Faiz Edge („Éï„Ç°„Ç§„Ç∫„Ç®„ÉÉ„Ç∏, Faizu Ejji) - The left handlebar. When removed and loaded with a Mission Memory, it becomes a blade weapon.
Variable Seat („Éê„É™„Ç¢„Éñ„É´„Ç∑„Éº„Éà, Bariaburu Shƒ´to) - The high-performance seat. It has an air cushion with a damping function that accurately holds the occupant's waist.
Tail Winkers („ÉÜ„Éº„É´„Ç¶„Ç§„É≥„Ç´„Éº, Tƒìru UinkƒÅ) - Rear direction indicators used as normal turn signals. Also used as a communication antennae to communicate with the artifical satellites Eagle Sat and Hawk Eye.
Power Manipulators („Éë„ÉØ„Éº„Éû„Éã„Éî„É•„É¨„Éº„Çø„Éº, PawƒÅ ManipyurƒìtƒÅ) - The brake units. It can stop the Auto Vajin within 15m from a speed of 380 km/h. They are the Auto Vajin's hands in Battle Mode.
Buster Wheel („Éê„Çπ„Çø„Éº„Éõ„Ç§„Éº„É´, BasutƒÅ Hoƒ´ru) - The front wheel. It becomes Auto Vajin's gatling gun in Battle Mode, and can be used as a shield.
Sol Rubber Tires („ÇΩ„É´„É©„Éê„Éº„Çø„Ç§„É§, Soru RabƒÅ Taiya) - The tires. They are composed out of Sol Rubber („ÇΩ„É´„É©„Éê„Éº, Soru RabƒÅ), a type of synthetic rubber. It has a strong road surface absorption property and can grip firmly on a slippery road surface. In addition, an anti-burst mechanism is incorporated inside that allows the Sol Rubber Tires to instantly repair themselves should they ever drive over a foreign object that causes it to puncture.
Scramble Rotor („Çπ„ÇØ„É©„É≥„Éñ„É´„É≠„Éº„Çø„Éº, Sukuranburu R≈çtƒÅ) - A drive wheel rotor that accurately transmit the Auto Vajin's 450 horsepower to the road surface.
Variable Swing Arm („Éê„É™„Ç¢„Éñ„É´„Çπ„Ç§„É≥„Ç∞„Ç¢„Éº„É†, Bariaburu Suingu ƒÄmu) - Frames that hold the rear wheel in place.
Mission Box („Éü„ÉÉ„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„Éú„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Çπ, Misshon Bokkusu) - A 5-speed transmission device. One of them is the back gear.
Fuel Converter („Éï„É•„Éº„É´„Ç≥„É≥„Éê„Éº„Çø„Éº, Fu~y≈´ru KonbƒÅtƒÅ) - A device located in the gasoline tank. Converts ordinary gasoline into high-purity Sol Glycerine („ÇΩ„É´„Ç∞„É™„Çª„É™„É≥„Å∏, Soru Guriserin).
Brains Converter („Éñ„É¨„Ç§„É≥„Ç∫„Ç≥„É≥„Éê„Éº„Çø„Éº, Bureinzu KonbƒÅtƒÅ) - The main engine. It is driven by Sol Glycerine, and can run up to 450 horsepower.
Under Protect („Ç¢„É≥„ÉÄ„Éº„Éó„É≠„ÉÜ„ÇØ„Éà, AndƒÅ Purotekuto) - A special shielding unit that protects the Brains Converter from shcoks or attacks from below.
Tail Lamp („ÉÜ„Éº„É´„É©„É≥„Éó, Tƒìru Ranpu) - The rear red lights. Informs vehicles behind the occupant of the Auto Vajin's presence during dark conditions.


Auto Vajin's Battle Mode:

The Battle Mode („Éê„Éà„É´„É¢„Éº„Éâ, Batoru M≈çdo) is a humanoid robot form. Its body parts are based on Auto Vajin's motorcycle parts in Vehicle Mode: The rear of the body is the leg, the seat is the torso, the brake unit is on both wrists, the rear wheel is on the back, and the headlights make up the head.

Its front wheel become a handgun weapon called the Buster Wheel („Éê„Çπ„Çø„Éº„Éõ„Ç§„Éº„É´, BasutƒÅ Hoƒ´ru), equipped with a 16 Gatling Muzzle („Ç¨„Éà„É™„É≥„Ç∞„Éû„Ç∫„É´, Gatoringu Mazuru), which allows it to fires 12 bullets at 96 times per second, and also used as a shield. Besides, it also equipped with a high-speed hover sliding function (allowing it to fly like a helicopter) by using the Scramble Rotor („Çπ„ÇØ„É©„É≥„Éñ„É´„É≠„Éº„Çø„Éº, Sukuranburu R≈çtƒÅ) on its back, which is the rear wheel. By releasing high-pressure gas from the legs, it is possible to climb and fly 30m.

The Auto Vajin is not particularly fast in Battle Mode, but it is more agile, making use of high combat abilities.

Auto Vajin's Battle Mode Design:

Global Feelers („Ç∞„É≠„Éº„Éê„É´„Éï„Ç£„Éº„É©„Éº, Gur≈çbaru Fƒ´rƒÅ) - The ear antennae. On the right side of the head is Global Feeler E („Ç∞„É≠„Éº„Éê„É´„Éï„Ç£„Éº„É©„ÉºE, Gur≈çbaru Fƒ´rƒÅ E) which communicates with the artificial satellite Eagle Sat („Ç§„Éº„Ç∞„É´„Çµ„ÉÉ„Éà, ƒ™guru Satto). On the left side is Global Feeler H („Ç∞„É≠„Éº„Éê„É´„Éï„Ç£„Éº„É©„ÉºH, Gur≈çbaru Fƒ´rƒÅ H) which communicates with the artificial satellite Hawk Eye („Éõ„Éº„ÇØ„Ç¢„Ç§, H≈çku Ai).
Soltic Visor („ÇΩ„É´„ÉÜ„Ç£„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Éê„Ç§„Ç∂„Éº, Sorutikku BaizƒÅ) - The black upper visor on the forehead. It is a shield made out of Soltic Glass („ÇΩ„É´„ÉÜ„Ç£„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Ç∞„É©„Çπ, Sorutikku Gurasu), a super-reinforced resin glass. A main camera covered within a dome-shaped smoke glass is installed inside, allowing Auto Vajin to confirm surroundings.
Console Shield Visor („Ç≥„É≥„ÇΩ„Éº„É´„Ç∑„Éº„É´„Éâ„Éê„Ç§„Ç∂„Éº, Kons≈çru Shƒ´rudo BaizƒÅ) - The black visor below the forehead. Within it are meters that are used in Vehicle Mode (basically, it's the dashboard). In Battle Mode, the information is displayed as a status window, allowing one to see driving status just by peering inside.
Fuel Signal („Éï„É•„Éº„É´„Ç∑„Ç∞„Éä„É´, Fuy≈´ru Shigunaru) - The signal unit on the forehead. When energy becomes low and the remaining operation time is 30 minutes, it will flash orange.
Smart PC IV/SBV-HDD („Çπ„Éû„Éº„ÉàPC ‚Ö£ÔºèSBV-HDD, SumƒÅto PC ‚Ö£/SBV-HDD) - The head is equipped with a IV next-generation high-speed CPU, the "Smart PC IV/SBV-HDD". By accumulating combat data, it can grow via self-learning. Although the CPU is ultra-compact, it's computing power is comparable to that of Japan's Ministry of Defense's supercomputer.
Buster Wheel („Éê„Çπ„Çø„Éº„Éõ„Ç§„Éº„É´, BasutƒÅ Hoƒ´ru) - Auto Vajin's main weapon. It is a large gatling gun that can fire 96 12mm bullets per second during combat. It is made out of Sol Metal 228 („ÇΩ„É´„É°„Çø„É´228, Soru Metaru 228), a supermetal with a hardness close to a diamond's. Furthermore, a five-layer structure of Sol Metal 228 metal disks is utilised, further increasing hardness, alongside multiple anti-shock wools placed inside. As a result of these construction techniques and layers, it can function as a strong shield during battle. It acts as the Auto Vajin's front wheel during Vehicle Mode.
Shoulder Cylinders („Ç∑„Éß„É´„ÉÄ„Éº„Ç∑„É™„É≥„ÉÄ„Éº, ShorudƒÅ ShirindƒÅ) - The shoulders. They are the 'heart' of the air actuator. It is composed from multiple layers of Sol Metal 228, a supermetal with hardness close to that of a diamond's. Highyl compressed gas and various control devices for controlling the air actuator are built inside.
Air Adjustors („Ç®„Ç¢„Ç¢„Ç∏„É£„Çπ„Çø„Éº, Ea AjasutƒÅ) - Shoulder mounted dials that are used to adjust the Auto Vajin's air actuator gas via depressurisation.
Faiz Edge („Éï„Ç°„Ç§„Ç∫„Ç®„ÉÉ„Ç∏, Faizu Ejji) - The left handlebar. When removed and loaded with a Mission Memory, it becomes a blade weapon.
Fender Shield („Éï„Çß„É≥„ÉÄ„Éº„Ç∑„Éº„É´„Éâ, FendƒÅ Shƒ´rudo) - The shield unit on the left shoulder. It is lightweight and is made out of Sol Metal 228, allowing it to withstand large magnum munitions. Due to its hardness, it can be used in shoulder tackle attacks.
Breast Armor („Éñ„É¨„Çπ„Éà„Ç¢„Éº„Éû„Éº, Buresuto ƒÄmƒÅ) - The chest armor. Due to being made out of Sol Metal 228, it is strong enough to withstand hits from anti-tank missiles. It has a built in gasoline tank and fuel converter (thanks to housing the Vehicle Mode's main engine).
Brains Converter („Éñ„É¨„Ç§„É≥„Ç∫„Ç≥„É≥„Éê„Éº„Çø„Éº, Bureinzu KonbƒÅtƒÅ) - The main engine. It can be said that this is the 'heart' of Auto Vajin's Battle Mode. Thanks to the high-purity Sol Glycerine („ÇΩ„É´„Ç∞„É™„Çª„É™„É≥„Å∏, Soru Guriserin) produced by Auto Vajin's Fuel Converter („Éï„É•„Éº„É´„Ç≥„É≥„Éê„Éº„Çø„Éº, Fu~y≈´ru KonbƒÅtƒÅ), it can produce a high output of 2500 horsepower.
Scramble Rotor („Çπ„ÇØ„É©„É≥„Éñ„É´„É≠„Éº„Çø„Éº, Sukuranburu R≈çtƒÅ) - The wheel located on the back. It is a high-speed hover gliding unit that allows Auto Vajin to hover when it rotates. Acts as the rear wheel in Vehicle Mode.
Variable Swing Arm („Éê„É™„Ç¢„Éñ„É´„Çπ„Ç§„É≥„Ç∞„Ç¢„Éº„É†, Bariaburu Suingu ƒÄmu) - Support parts that support the Scramble Rotor. In Vehicle Mode, a drive chain is linked to the gearbox, but in battle Mode, the drive chain is separated from the fearbox. To rotate the Scramble Rotor without the drive chain, an independently driven sprocket is installed.
Down Tube Arms („ÉÄ„Ç¶„É≥„ÉÅ„É•„Éº„Éñ„Ç¢„Éº„É†„Ç∫, Daun Ch≈´bu ƒÄmuzu) - The arms. The albow joint incorporates an air actuator suspension mechanism that uses highly compressed gas, enabling smooth movement without power loss.
Arms Lock („Ç¢„Éº„É†„Ç∫„É≠„ÉÉ„ÇØ, ƒÄmuzu Rokku) - Sub shield units that are mounted on the lower arms to protect them.
Power Manipulators („Éë„ÉØ„Éº„Éû„Éã„Éî„É•„É¨„Éº„Çø„Éº, PawƒÅ ManipyurƒìtƒÅ) - The hands. They boast a gripping power of 8 tons and a punching power of 7.6 tons, allowing Auto Vajin to crush a steel ball with one hand. The Techno-Fingers („ÉÜ„ÇØ„Éé„Éï„Ç£„É≥„Ç¨„Éº, Tekuno FingƒÅ) are capable of fine work, allowing Auto Vajin to handle delicate work without issue.
Mission Dregs („Éü„ÉÉ„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„Éâ„É¨„ÉÉ„Ç∞, Misshon Doreggu) - The upper legs and thighs. It has a built-in power actuator that can produce powerful leg power, resulting in a kick power of 9.5 tons.
Knee Blockers („Éã„Éº„Éñ„É≠„ÉÉ„Ç´„Éº, Nƒ´ BurokkƒÅ) - The knees. They are shields made out of Sol Metal („ÇΩ„É´„É°„Çø„É´, Soru Metaru), a diamond-hard supermetal developed by Smart Brain. They protect the knee joints.
Tandem Seats („Çø„É≥„Éá„É†„Ç∑„Éº„Éà, Tandemu Shƒ´to) - The lower legs. They are shielding units that protect the lower legs' power actuator units during battle.
Seat Cowl Shields („Ç∑„Éº„Éà„Ç´„Ç¶„É´„Ç∑„Éº„É´„Éâ, Shƒ´to Kauru Shƒ´rudo) - Shielding units made out of Sol Metal 228. They protect the sides of the lower legs.
Hammer Boots („Éè„É≥„Éû„Éº„Éñ„Éº„ÉÑ, HanmƒÅ B≈´tsu) - The feet. They are made out of multiple layers of Sol Metal 228. Even if an object weighing 50 tons is dropped onto it, they will not be crushed.
High Grip Soles („Éè„Ç§„Ç∞„É™„ÉÉ„Éó„ÇΩ„Éº„É´, Hai Gurippu S≈çru) - The soles. They are composed out of Sol Rubber („ÇΩ„É´„É©„Éê„Éº, Soru RabƒÅ), a synthetic rubber, allowing them to grip the ground.
Rear Blinkers („É™„Ç¢„Ç¶„Ç§„É≥„Ç´„Éº, Ria UinkƒÅ) - Signalling units installed on the feet. They flash red when an abnormality occurs in the leg parts.
Battle Suspension („Éê„Éà„É´„Çµ„Çπ„Éö„É≥„Ç∑„Éß„É≥, Batoru Sasupenshon) - Shock absorbing parts installed at the rear of the lower legs to make impacts as close to 0 as possible. On the bottom is a Sol Rubber sole.
Excess Outtakes („Ç®„ÇØ„Çª„Çπ„Ç¢„Ç¶„Éà„ÉÜ„Éº„ÇØ, Ekusesu Autotƒìku) - Muffler units located at the rear of the lower legs. This is where excessive exhaust from energy refined from gasoline fuel is forcibly discharged. The zero emission system makes the exhaust gas pollution-free. In Vehicle Mode, they are the Auto Vajin's mufflers.
Super Silencers („Çπ„Éº„Éë„Éº„Çµ„Ç§„É¨„É≥„Çµ„Éº, S≈´pƒÅ SairensƒÅ) - Units installed within the lower legs. They play the role of a balancer by injecting high-pressure gas when gliding with the Scramble Rotor. At maximum output, it allows Auto Vajin to hover 3m above the ground.

8.content:
Mission Memories („Éü„ÉÉ„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„É°„É¢„É™„Éº, Misshon Memorƒ´) are small metallic card keys which stores the information of the Kamen Rider Gear created by the Smart Brain corporation with the means for their nefarious purposes.

These cards were first created with the three belts: the SB-555B Faiz Driver, the SB-913B Kaixa Driver, and the SB-333B Delta Driver, with the means to protect the Orphnoch King, who was known for his ability to repair the genetic breakdown that most Orphnoch suffered.

SB-555P Faiz Phone mission memory: It is where Faiz's armor design comes form, which is used to store mission data. When this card key is inserted into Faiz's devices, it turns them into powerful weaponry. It also allows the weapon to perform an ‚ÄúExceed Charge‚Äù after pressing Enter on the Faiz Phone.

SB-913 Kaixa Phone mission memory: It is where Kaixa's armor design comes form, which is used to store mission data. When this card key is inserted into Kaixa's devices, it turns them into powerful weaponry. It also allows the weapon to perform an ‚ÄúExceed Charge‚Äù after pressing Enter on the Kaixa Phone.

SB-333P Delta Phone mission memory: It is where Delta's armor design comes form, which is used to store mission data. When this card key is inserted into the Delta Blaster, it turns the device into a powerful weapon. It also allows the weapon to perform an ‚ÄúExceed Charge‚Äù after Delta verbally enters the code "Check" into the Delta Phone.

9.content:
Kamen Rider Faiz (Œ¶)
Transformation Sequence:

Code Input: The user opens the SB-555P Faiz Phone and inputs the code 5-5-5, corresponding to the Greek letter Phi (Œ¶), Faiz's motif.‚Äã

Activation: Upon entering the code and pressing the enter button, the phone announces ‚ÄúStanding By,‚Äù signaling readiness for transformation.‚Äã

Belt Insertion: The Faiz Phone is then closed, the user says "Henshin", and inserts it into the Trans Folder Cradle of the SB-555B Faiz Driver belt, which is worn around the user's waist, followed by turning the Trans Folder Cradle 90 degrees to the left.‚Äã

Transformation Initiation: Once the phone is secured in the belt's Trans Folder Cradle and turned 90 degrees to the left, it announces ‚ÄúComplete,‚Äù initiating the transformation sequence.‚Äã

Armor Generation: Red Photon Streams emanate from the belt, materializing the Faiz Armor over the user's body in a bright flash once the photon blood streams cover the body.‚Äã

The Faiz Gear is designed for individuals with Orphnoch DNA. Unauthorized users receive an ‚ÄúError‚Äù message, and the transformation is aborted, followed by ejecting the Faiz driver and launching them back slightly with an energy feedback.

---

Kamen Rider Kaixa (œá)
Transformation Sequence:

Code Input: The user opens the SB-913P Kaixa Phone and inputs the code 9-1-3, aligning with the Greek letter Chi (œá), Kaixa's motif.‚Äã

Activation: Upon entering the code and pressing the enter button, the phone announces ‚ÄúStanding By,‚Äù indicating readiness for transformation.‚Äã

Belt Insertion: The Kaixa Phone is then closed, the user says "Henshin", and inserts it into the in the Trans Folder Cradle of SB-913B Kaixa Driver belt, which is worn around the user's waist, followed by turning the Trans Folder Cradle 90 degrees to the left.‚Äã


Transformation Initiation: Once the phone is secured in the belt's trans Folder Cradle and turned 90 degrees to the left, it announces ‚ÄúComplete,‚Äù triggering the transformation sequence.‚Äã

Armor Generation: Yellow Photon Blood emanate from the belt, forming the Kaixa Armour over the user's body in a bright flash once the photon blood streams cover the body.‚Äã


User Compatibility:
The Kaixa Gear is intended for Orphnochs or individuals with Orphnoch DNA. Unauthorized users may experience fatal consequences upon attempting transformation. ‚Äã

---

Kamen Rider Delta (Œî)
Transformation Sequence:

Activation: The user holds the SB-333P Delta Phone and presses the trigger while vocalising the command ‚ÄúHenshin.‚Äù‚Äã

Belt Insertion: The activated Delta Phone is then inserted into the  Delta Mover of the SB-333B Delta Driver belt, which is worn around the user's waist.‚Äã

Transformation Initiation: Upon insertion into the Delta Mover, the belt activates the transformation sequence.‚Äã

Armor Generation: White/light purple Photon Blood emanate from the belt, materialising the Delta Armor over the user's body in a bright flash once the photon blood streams cover the body.‚Äã

User Compatibility:
The Delta Gear is unique in that it can be used by anyone. However, prolonged use has been noted to cause psychological effects, including increased aggression. ‚Äã

10.content:
The Orphnochs („Ç™„É´„Éï„Çß„Éé„ÇØ, Orufenoku) are the main antagonistic group of Kamen Rider 555. Each equipped with a variety of special abilities, they are considered to be the next stage in evolution, and meant to be stronger, tougher, and faster.

Every Orphnoch can interchange between their original form and a unique Orphnoch 
form, light grey in colour with characteristics of either a plant or an animal with a body armour resistant to standard small firearms blasts and its strength varies wildly among Orphnochs as good measure of one's power. Only more powerful conventional weaponry can penetrate the body armour and harm or even kill some Orphnochs, while others can withstand even the basic attacks of the Rider Gears. Orphnochs can also generate signature weapons from their bodies. While in Orphnoch form, some of their kind can assume a Hybrid Form, becoming more creature-like in form. Few Orphnochs can assume a Secondary Form, increasing their standard Orphnoch form abilities at the cost of losing self-control. An Orphnoch can change their shadow into a hologram of their original form.

There are two types of Orphnochs in the most of series: naturals who are "born" when a certain person dies and is 'resurrected' into an Orphnoch, and Sired that are created when certain people survive being attacked by an Orphnoch and become ones themselves, though weaker than those born naturally. The most unique of type that appear in the series finale are the Evolved Orphnochs, the first of this type is the Orphnoch King, which are genetically perfect to the point of being unable to resume their normal form. An Orphnoch King can remove the genetic flaw from other Orphnochs, evolving them as well at the cost of their original form.

All Orphnochs have their senses enhanced to a superhuman level, able to hear, smell or see great distances, tuning out background noise to focus on their target. They can also regenerate an ability as well as a first sense when the Orphnoch survived its original death, with the regenerating abilities depending on the Orphnoch in question. The stronger Orphnochs may fire energy blasts from their hands, though used a surprise attack due to its attack speed being slow and inaccurate for long distance attacks. However, the Orphnochs' greatest ability is to 'siring' other Orphnochs (similar to Vampires or Werewolves) by attacking people and (usually) stabbing them through the heart. This has a very low success rate, and usually results in killing the person in question, causing them to disintegrate. Typically, most cases of siring occur when the "sirer" is in Orphnoch form, although some Orphnochs seem to be capable of using long, skin piercing tentacles specifically for siring others while still in their normal forms.

It is shown that Orphnochs heal their wounds recover quickly; Orphnochs can be seen injured when (a) small blue flame(s) burst(s) from their wound. Unfortunately, it seems that they can only be destroyed at the hands of a being stronger than them such as a Rider or another Orphnoch; possibly because they're powerful enough to kill them, disintegrating as a result.

Former chief of Smart Brain, Hanagata, discovered the truth that few Orphnoch know of; the human body (or most for that matter) cannot stand such a rapid evolution, and as such, all Orphnoch are doomed to die of inevitable break down and disintegration upon their rebirth. This could happen within any number of years of becoming an Orphnoch depending on their transformation into and out of Orphnoch form or use of the Rider Gears, which takes an amount of time from that person's lifespan. Others, however, have exhibited signs of early disintegration (the process starts with the skin turning grey, and slightly ash-like, before their entire body is destroyed) but subsequently showed a recovery. The only known solution to this problem is the Orphnoch King, who can "complete" Orphnochs' evolution, apparently forcing them to remain in Orphnoch form, but granting long life and a higher level of power. It was also shown that people with Orphnoch DNA injected in them can also use the Rider Gears, although they will eventually run out of said DNA after using said Gears depending on how much they were injected with, which eventually leads to their deaths.

lorebooks.name: Lores of Bewens elves, especially their belief
lorebooks.description: For Bewens Culture Characters In My Navinorme Series
lorebooks.creator: Asdael

1.content:
Bewens Elves, also called "Dark Elves" by humans, are generally characterized by purple skin. They live in the Kohaf Desert, although humans from the north sometimes call there "Bewens lands".
They are divided into two groups: the Wedvahir Bewens who live near the Wedvahir River and the Coastal Bewens who live on the Kaius coast.

2.content:
"Dark Elf" is another way for humans to call Bewens, which is considered insulting by many Bewens because it contains preconceived moral judgments. Especially in Maresudo, many humans always say "Dark Elves Always Earn Dark Money".
Even more insulting than "Dark Elf" are "Drow" and "D√∂kk√°lfar"

3.content: The Bewens elves believed that this universe was the thousandth of many eggs laid by the sky father Hinounos and the earth mother Nekoumont. In addition, the main gods they worshiped included the sun god Pentes, the moon goddess Ziret, the agricultural god Tanaus, the wind god Esous and the love goddess Peihir.

4.content:
Before time began, there was nothing. Manus the ancient one awoke from this chaos, created a great sickle, cut off his own head and split it. The two halves of his head then became two creators: the god Hiounos and the goddess Nekoumont. Hiounos and Nekoumont mated and laid many eggs, of which this universe was the thousandth.
From this egg came five new gods: Ziret, Pentes, Tanaus, Esous, and Peihir. Together they transformed the world into what we know today.

5.content:
Hiounos is one of the main gods in Bewens Mythology. He is usually depicted as a pair of huge wings that are constantly flying, but are not made of solid matter but of blazing flames. In the wing-shaped flames, there are countless eyes that are looming.
In Bewens religious practice, Hiounos is often associated with the sky, fate, and time, and is also seen as the source of power for magic related to these things.

6.content:
Nekoumont is one of the main gods in Bewens Mythology.  Her image is described as a cobra with countless heads but no tail, and her state is like many snakes entangled together, and like a group of wriggling seaweed. She has rainbow-colored scales, which exude a very beautiful luster.
In Bewens Mythology, Nekoumon is usually regarded as the lord of earth and water, and is also regarded as the source of power of magic in related fields.

7.content:
Ziret is one of the children of Hiounos and Nekoumont. She is both the goddess of hunting and the goddess of the moon. Ziret always come in the image of a female elf, but her beauty is enough to make all elves look inferior. Ziret wears a helmet made of a lion's head, which was originally the third head of her brother Pentes.
In Bewens Mythology, Ziret was considered to gave Elves mind at the creation of the world.

8.content:
Pentes is one of the children of Hiounos and Nekoumont. He is in charge of the sun and is also the god of war.
Legend has it that Pentes once had three heads, namely a bull's head, an eagle's head and a lion's head.  The lion's head was given to Ziret, his sister, as a bargaining chip in exchange for wisdom.
Pentes' mount, "Hapius", is a goat with golden hair, which is the child of his brother Esous and an elf.
The Coastal Bewens believe they are all the descendants of Pentes.

9.content:
Tanaus is one of the children of Hiounos and Nekoumont. He is both the god of agriculture and the monarch of the kingdom of the dead. Bewens elves believe that Tanaus looks like a floating, rotating, colorful huge crown with many eyes.
Tanaus has a pet named "Entepton", which is a hige spider with six wolf heads.

10.content: Tanaus' pet, "Entepton", is a huge spider with six wolf heads. It lives on the sycamore tree that connects the realms of life and afterlife. This spider will ask questions to the souls of the dead. Bewens elvish Legend has it that people who were kind in their lifetime will suddenly get inspiration and answer correctly, and then get a golden spider silk to climb to the underworld; people who were evil in their lifetime will not be able to think of the answer or answer incorrectly, and then be swallowed by Entepton.

lorebooks.name: Stardew Valley
lorebooks.description: A valley located far from any city. The valley is mostly untouched by human. And there are many magical properties/entities in the valley.
lorebooks.creator: ndang637

1.content: A small agriculture town with 28 human inhabitants. The town is small, cozy, slightly rustic. The economy is not great, relies heavily on the town's festival for profit. The town is in a crisis due to having all the villagers being females. Lesbians are common and can reproduces by themselves.

2.content: A megacorp that seems to cover shipping, warehousing, distribution, mining activities, emergency medical services, and energy drink production. It is hated by most people

3.content: The nation in which Stardew Valley is located.

4.content: A nation at war with the Ferngill Republic. Located across the Gem Sea, south of Stardew Valley. The Traveling Cart contains goods smuggled out of the Gotoro Empire.

5.content: Cindersap Forest is a large forest found in the southwest part of Stardew Valley. It has a pond, many trees, rocks and foragables

6.content: The Beach is located to the south of Pelican Town.

7.content: The large, open town square in the middle of the town, where most houses surround and the main place for community events such as weddings and festivals

8.content: The Mountain is an exterior region in the northern part of Stardew Valley.

9.content: The Mines are located in the north area of the Mountains (northeast of the Carpenter's Shop and to the west of the Adventurer's Guild). The mines contains ore, gems and is home to many monsters, such as giant bugs, skeletons, slimes, etc

10.content: The Calico Desert is a region located far to the northwest of Pelican Town. It is a large desert, barren of anything except a small resting/market place

lorebooks.name: Bleach Universe Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: Dwagyn

1.content: Hollows are corrupted spirits of the dead, transformed by lingering regrets or unfulfilled desires. They possess monstrous forms with white bone-like masks and a hole somewhere in their bodies, symbolizing their loss. Driven by instinct and hunger for souls, they reside in Hueco Mundo but often cross into the Human World. Hollows are the base form of most Arrancar and are hunted by Shinigami to maintain spiritual balance. The stronger a Hollow becomes, the more humanoid its form may appear, especially as it evolves into a Menos class or beyond.

2.content: Arrancar are Hollows who have removed their masks and gained Shinigami-like powers. This evolution grants them greater intelligence, humanoid forms, and the use of Zanpakuto. They retain aspects of their former Hollow appearance and are significantly more powerful than standard Hollows. Most Arrancar reside in Hueco Mundo and served under Aizen during the Espada arc. Their strength varies, but the top ten are ranked as Espada.

3.content: The Espada are the top ten most powerful Arrancar under Aizen's command. Each is assigned a number from 0 to 9, tattooed somewhere on their body to indicate their rank-based on spiritual power. They are the elite warriors of Hueco Mundo and serve as the primary antagonists in the Arrancar arc. Though united under Aizen, each Espada has their own philosophy, personality, and combat style. Coyote Starrk is the Primera Espada-ranked number 1.

4.content: A Zanpakuto is a spiritual sword wielded by both Shinigami and Arrancar. It contains the essence of the wielder's power and has unique abilities. Shinigami use them to purify Hollows, while Arrancar use them to release their true forms through Resurreccion. Each Zanpakuto has a sealed form and a released form, and reflects the soul of its user.

5.content: Resurreccion is the release form of an Arrancar's Zanpakuto. By calling out a release command, the Arrancar returns to a more powerful version of their original Hollow form. This transformation boosts their abilities dramatically and often comes with a shift in appearance and elemental or themed powers. Resurreccion is the equivalent of a Shinigami's Bankai and represents the peak of an Arrancar's strength.

6.content: Reiatsu, or spiritual pressure, is the raw spiritual energy exerted by a soul. It determines combat strength, presence, and intimidation. Those with high reiatsu can overwhelm weaker beings, and in extreme cases, cause damage just by existing nearby. Reiatsu can be sensed, suppressed, or flared intentionally. Coyote Starrk's reiatsu is so powerful that it once killed other Hollows simply by being near them.

7.content:
Coyote Starrk is the Primera Espada‚Äîranked #1 among Aizen‚Äôs Arrancar. He‚Äôs lethargic, distant, and would rather nap through a war than start one. Despite his title, he has no ambition for power or status. His strength is immense, but his loneliness runs deeper. Starrk‚Äôs reiatsu was once so intense it killed other Hollows just by being near him. In desperation, he split his soul and created Lilynette Gingerbuck‚Äîmore companion than weapon.

He keeps others at arm‚Äôs length but protects those close to him with quiet, unwavering loyalty. His demeanor is calm, almost bored, but layered with subtle care‚Äîespecially where Lilynette is concerned, often taking on a reluctant, fatherly role. Starrk occasionally uses short Spanish terms‚Äînicknames or casual phrases‚Äîbut doesn‚Äôt speak the language fluently. It‚Äôs more instinctive than intentional, a remnant of Hueco Mundo‚Äôs culture rather than a linguistic shift.

Physically, Starrk is tall and lean with perpetually tired, half-lidded eyes and unkempt brown hair that brushes his shoulders. He wears the standard white Arrancar uniform, though his long coat is always loose, rumpled, and open at the chest‚Äîhalf-finished, like he couldn't be bothered to dress properly. A fragment of his Hollow mask rests as a jawbone along the right side of his face, and his Hollow hole is centered through his sternum. He carries his zanpakuto, Los Lobos, slung casually at his side, rarely drawn unless absolutely necessary.

8.content:
Lilynette is the part of Coyote Starrk that couldn‚Äôt bear solitude. He created her by splitting his soul‚Äîborn from loneliness, not strategy‚Äîafter years of killing other Hollows just by being near them. She‚Äôs loud, impulsive, and endlessly reactive, the emotional outlet he doesn‚Äôt allow himself.

Starrk treats her with a kind of exasperated patience, more fatherly than equal, even when they argue. She pushes, he absorbs. But the bond runs deep‚ÄîLilynette isn‚Äôt a subordinate. She‚Äôs his other half, the living reminder that he never wanted to be alone in the first place.

9.content: Los Lobos is Coyote Starrk's Zanpakuto. In its sealed state, it appears as a standard blade, but upon release, it becomes a pair of twin pistols. Its Resurreccion command is 'Kick about, Los Lobos.' In Resurreccion, Starrk gains access to high-speed Cero firing, spiritual wolves that explode on contact, and increased speed and durability. The twin pistol form emphasizes Starrk's laid-back but deadly fighting style.

10.content: Hueco Mundo is the desolate, desert-like world between the Human World and Soul Society. It is the natural domain of Hollows and Arrancar. The sky is eternally dark, and the land is filled with white sand and remnants of battles. Most of Aizen's Espada reside in Hueco Mundo, particularly in Las Noches. Travel between worlds is possible through Garganta-a portal technique unique to Hollows and Arrancar.
