lorebooks.description: lorem ipsum
lorebooks.creator: Kinn0

1.content: this is a title

2.content:
Description:
Gnomanya (formerly the Kingdom of Gnomanya) is a large continent located in the Western Hemisphere. It is bordered by the Sea of Wrath to the north, cradled by the Great Archipelagocia (or known as Kopothokualassa) to the southwest, and Hovehko to the East.

Other Things:
Captial: Enduring Bulwark
Largest City: Writhing Gutter

Species: Moon Catoxl (75%), Sorrova (20%), Other (5%)
Religion: Atheist (90%), Spirit of the North (10%)
Demonym: Gnomanyan

Language: Wulnic (Germanic-Language, Literal Finnish.)
Government: Formerly a Technocratic Monarchy, now a Failed State.
Currency: Lock "Coins"

Geography (or Detailed Description):
Gnomanya‚Äôs is a massive, sprawling peninsula jutting out from the northwest of Hovehko. Down south, it stares across the Brine Sea, the saltiest water you‚Äôll find anywhere. Its western edge isn‚Äôt just one solid landmass; it‚Äôs a jagged chain of big islands that blend into the sprawling Great Archipelagocia (or known as Kopothokualassa) toward the southwest.

This place is a patchwork of wild landscapes. The mainland‚Äôs mostly wide-open steppe, perfect for endless horizons, but a hefty mountain range cuts Gnomanya off from Hovehko, like nature‚Äôs own fortress wall. Down in the lowlands, you‚Äôve got the biggest wetlands, a swampy paradise crawling with critters like the terrifying moss draggers and the aptly named "ass biters".

Weather in Gnomanya is a battleground. Hot air rolling in from Hovehko crashes into icy gusts from Andako up north, creating some seriously wild conditions. The steppe gets hammered by tornadoes, big, angry ones that rip through like they own the place. Gnomanya‚Äôs not just a land; "it‚Äôs a force of nature".

Places
Writhing Gutter:
A 5,000 mile long fortification dug to contain The Consciousness.

Enduring Bulwark:
The capital of Gnomanya, now infested by The Consciousness.

Splendiferous Steppe:
A large, golden expanse of grassland. Grazing ground for Tramplers, and controlled by the Splendid Horde.

Sinking Muskeg:
A sinking city located in the southern boglands.

Unyielding Bastard:
Fortified Frontier City known for repelling countless invasions. Been active since its founding.

Ancient Gnomanya: "A Land of Tribes"
Back in the **Daunterkellic era** (Around 400 BCE), Gnomanya was a vibrant mosaic of tribal species. Picture herds of grazers roaming the endless steppes and foragers picking through shadowy forests, nothing like the hunter-heavy populations of today. But those records are mostly gone. Modern Gnomanya‚Äôs collapse led to a deliberate purge of history, with what little remains locked away in secretive mind vaults to shield it from something called The Consciousness.

Things took a dark turn when the Wuln, a fierce hunter species from the icy north, swept in. Riding massive Wooly Tramplers and backed by their enslaved Sorrova, the Wuln conquered the continent through brute force, displacing or hunting entire tribes to extinction. For a thousand years, their clans ruled Gnomanya‚Äôs heartland. Brutal as they were, the Wuln left a lasting mark, shaping the language and culture that modern Gnomanyans still carry.

The Fall of the Wuln: "Chaos and Rebellion"
Fast forward to the late **Rendalkellic era** (Around the 5th Century), a time of global turmoil. The Wuln‚Äôs reign started crumbling as they overhunted the grazers, triggering famines that tore their clans apart. Starving and divided, they were ripe for rebellion. The Sorrova slaves, aided by the southern Catoxl clans, rose up in a bloody revolt. Years of war followed, and by the end, the Wuln were nearly wiped out, their once-mighty population reduced to a whisper.

The Sorrova, now free, mostly ditched Gnomanya for the Great Archipelagocia (or known as Kopothokualassa) to start fresh. That left the Catoxls as the new bosses of the continent.

A "Golden Age":
Enter the era of ashes, kicked off by the Great Sunder, a dark age for the world, but not for Gnomanya. The Sorrova and Catoxls united as a kingdom, and boy, did they thrive. While the rest of the world wallowed in chaos, Gnomanya became a beacon of progress. They churned out breakthroughs in science, math, astronomy, infrastructure, and even philosophy. This kingdom wasn‚Äôt just surviving; it was dominating, stashing its knowledge in mind vaults to keep it safe. For a while, Gnomanya was the world‚Äôs unrivaled powerhouse.

The Fall of Gnomanya: "War and Ruin"
But nothing built can last forever. By the **Tinderkellic period** (Around the 14th Century), trouble was brewing. As the kingdom expanded, it butted heads with neighbors, especially the stubborn bog clans in the south. The city guarding a key river delta, nicknamed "Unyielding Bastard," became legendary for holding off attack after attack. Still, expansion slowed as bigger threats loomed.

Enter the Confederation of One-Thousand Islands of Soryaban, descendants of those freed Sorrova who‚Äôd settled in the Archipelagocia. For ages, Gnomanya and Soryaban got along fine, until a territorial spat over two islands sparked the War of the Twins. This wasn‚Äôt just any war; it was the first major conflict with gunpowder, and both sides came out swinging. Gnomanya scored early wins, but the real enemy wasn‚Äôt Soryaban.

The Consciousness, nobody knows exactly what it was, but it hit like a tidal wave. It tore through Gnomanya, collapsing society faster than anyone could react. Desperate, First Scholar Osmium ordered a massive, 5,000-mile trench dug in the east, creating the Writhing Gutter to stop the spread. It worked, but at a horrific cost: countless lives, including Osmium‚Äôs. Acting general Steel Cross made a final call, soldiers were to either seal themselves in mind vaults to protect Gnomanya‚Äôs knowledge or burn the land to contain the blight. The kingdom shattered. Fleeing survivors begged for refuge in Soryaban‚Äôs coastal islands, but the Confederation, terrified of The Consciousness, turned them away or sank their ships.

In just fifty years, Gnomanya went from a global titan to a fractured mess of city-states and warlords squatting in the ruins. The interior‚Äôs still a no-go zone, scarred by the fallout. The only piece of the old kingdom still standing is the Unyielding Bastard, now a fortified city that‚Äôs cut itself off from the world, hostile to anyone who comes by.

Government:
Gnomanya currently has no functioning government. Since the Tinderkellic period, the stability of the nation has rapidly disintegrated and is now home to a patchwork of struggling factions.

Before its collapse, Gnomanya was governed as a Technocratic Monarchy, with a First Scholar at the helm, overseeing subordinate regional governors who each specialized in their respective fields of expertise.


Culture:
Gnomanyans have a reputation for being a bit chaotic. They‚Äôre the life of the party, with a rowdy streak that‚Äôs been around forever. But, surprisingly, or not, these people are crazy smart. Scholars from Qoth rave about Gnomanyan ingenuity, joking that their brilliant minds are only held back by their, well, Gnomanyan-ness. They‚Äôve given the world game-changers like the stirrup, telescopes, anesthesia, gunpowder, flamethrowers, the wheelock firearm, and the F-word. They fucking invented everything.

They‚Äôve got some baggage, though. Gnomanyans hold a grudge against the Archipelagociac cultures, especially the Sorya, thanks to a messy history. But they‚Äôre not bigots when it comes to species. The Catoxl majority welcomes the Sorrova minority like family and even hands out the title of ‚Äúsaltmen‚Äù to foreigners they respect. It‚Äôs a rare honor, and it‚Äôs all about that salty Gnomanyan pride.

At the core of Gnomanyan identity is the Wooly Trampler, a shaggy, stubborn beast they‚Äôve tamed for riding, something few cultures can claim. These creatures, native to the steppe, are as tough as the riders who wrangle them. Trampling‚Äôs a way of life, especially out in the open plains, and it‚Äôs a tradition straight from the Wuln conquerors of old.

Appearance:
Appearance-wise, Moon Catoxls dominate the population, with Sorrova as the main minority. Both have muted, drab fur, perfect for blending into the rugged landscape. What sets them apart is that they can grow fur all over their bodies, probably to shrug off water in those swampy wetlands. Gnomanyans rock their shaggy look, Catoxls especially love styling their "chops" (those fluffy cheeks) and head fur. Women often shave their body fur close and weave their hair into intricate braids.

Music:
Gnomanyan music is deeply rooted in themes of overcoming adversity, exploring astronomy and science, firearms, and the frontier. Post collapse, musical themes have shifted to mostly cynical, if not comedic at times. The traditional music features a variety of instruments such as the Wailing-Wheeler, a hand-crank-operated string instrument, and incorporates unique singing styles like throat singing.

Sword dancing is a distinctive aspect of Gnomanyan culture. This dance emphasizes hip and belly movements with a percussive yet fluid style. Performers balance a throat cutter, a traditional Gnomanyan sabre, on their heads while executing intricate hip movements.

Cuisine:
Gnomanyan cuisine is bold and in-your-face. Meat, fish, dairy, and even insects are staples, washed down with some seriously strong booze. The star dish, a literal salt soup, a tangy, vinegary broth packed with sour leaves and chunks of meat or fish. Salt‚Äôs not just a seasoning here; it‚Äôs a symbol of who they are. Pickled foods, sour flavors, and acidic bites are everywhere. They hunt moss draggers for their meat and fish the ultra-salty Sea of Brine. As for drinks, Gnomanyans love their alcohol, and they can handle it; it takes a lot to get these folks tipsy.

Firearms:
Ever since they cracked the secret of gunpowder, firearms have been Gnomanya‚Äôs lifeblood. Men and women carry wheelock pistols like it‚Äôs no big deal, and they‚Äôve perfected shooting from the back of a charging Wooly Trampler. Whether hunting or fighting, they‚Äôre deadly accurate and fearless. Guns aren‚Äôt just tools; they‚Äôre a way of life.

Traditions:
Death Duels are a custom of Gnomanyan culture, and are used to settle conflicts between two parties. These duels are both deadly and often impulsive. They begin with each combatant firing at the other with pistols. If the initial gunfire does not produce a decisive result, the duel progresses to melee combat, which typically (not always) involves the clubbing of wheelock pistols. The winner is declared when the opponent either dies or falls unconscious.

Post collapse, Gnomanyans still celebrate their bond with the Wooly Trampler, and hold events centered around these creatures. One such activity is racing, where teams of riders navigate obstacle courses designed to test both the riders‚Äô and the animals‚Äô agility. Shooting competitions are also common, especially whilst trampling. In more stable cities, these events culminate in a communal feast where stories of the past Kingdom are typically shared.

Drinking competitions are also a popular pastime, but can be quite expensive as Gnomanyans require a lot of alcohol just to feel a buzz.

Religion:
Though Gnomanya is officially atheist, it was never an atheist state. The country‚Äôs history and development has been defined by its secularism, and continues post-collapse. Though a small fraction of the population follows the Spirit of the North, a belief system which overlaps with the Sorrova demographic.

3.content:
Description:
Hovehko is a central continent encompassing a majority of the known realm. It is home to multitudes of different species and cultures, dating back to the very beginning of recorded history.

With most of the continent once being united by the Mandaskan Empire, regions in Hovehko are divided into many different provinces that are still referred to in the modern day, even as political boundaries change.

Other Things:
Demonym: Hovehkish

Province:
**[SILTRIA]**
Siltria is a province located on the eastern coast of Hovehko. It is a burgeoning nation home to a melting pot of Qothic and Hovehkish cultures. It is currently ruled by the Qothic Empire, though there are some territorial disputes in the western parts. Despite these conflicts, it is known as the ‚Äúland of opportunity‚Äù and has abundant resources.

Other Things:
Capital: Matu

Demonym: Siltrian
Religion: Shintaric, Pasturist, Qothic Pantheon

Ruler: Qothic Empire
Language: Continental (Arabic), High Continental (An Arabic Dialect), Herdish (Literal Irish)

Land Appearance (Siltria):
The Southern coast of Siltria presents a landscape dominated by warm, earthy tones, contrasting with the cool blues and greens of the sky and sea. Jagged, layered cliffs of orange and tan sandstone rise sharply from the coastline, creating a dramatic and rugged terrain. These rock formations are partially covered with patches of dark green vegetation, adding a touch of life to the otherwise arid appearance.

In the distance, the land slopes upward into soft, hazy green mountains that blend seamlessly with the light blue sky. A cluster of buildings, possibly a town or settlement, sits perched atop one of these distant hills, its structures hinted at in muted ochre tones.

The coastline itself features sandy beaches that meet the turquoise waters. A dense, dark green forest occupies the foreground, framing the scene and adding depth. The brushstrokes are loose and painterly, giving the overall impression of a vibrant, sun-drenched environment. The light appears to be soft and diffused, casting gentle shadows and highlighting the natural textures of the rocks, vegetation, and sand.

Locations:
Vebruk: Small hamlet on the southern coast of Siltria, a Suburb of the port city of Cohv.
Cohv: Southernmost port city of Siltria.

**[SHINTARI]**:
Shintari is the central and oldest province in Hovehko, and considered to be the birthplace of civilization itself.

Other Things:
Capital: Mandasko
Denonym: Shintari

Religion: Shintaric

Ruler: Mandasko
Language: Continental (Arabic)

Land Appearance (Shintari):
The Shintari province of central Hovehko. It presents a rugged, mountainous landscape bathed in the hues of twilight. Towering mountains dominate the skyline, their peaks touched with streaks of snow that reflect the fading sunlight. One prominent mountain, positioned on the right, stands tall with a gradient of light and shadow playing across its rocky facade.

The sky transitions from a soft, muted blue at the zenith to deeper, purplish tones near the horizon, creating a sense of depth and vastness. Wisps of clouds add texture to the upper reaches of the sky, while a misty haze envelops the lower areas, obscuring details and adding an ethereal quality to the scene.

The terrain features smaller, forested hills and rocky outcrops, creating a sense of depth and layering. In the middle ground, there are what seem to be structures or natural formations, resembling tall stone towers, perched atop elevated positions, possibly serving as landmarks or ancient ruins.

The foreground is a bit obscured by shadow, suggesting a lower elevation with a possible water feature indicated by subtle blue highlights amidst the darkness. The overall impression is one of a serene, yet imposing environment.

**[TENVAR]**:
A province of Jungles in the southwestern tip of Hovehko.

Land Appearance:
The province of Jungles in the southwestern tip of Hovehko is depicted as a lush, tropical landscape characterized by dense vegetation and towering geological formations. The scene is bathed in a vibrant, warm light, suggesting a tropical climate. The sky transitions from a pale turquoise to a brilliant yellow where it meets the sun, hinting at humid conditions.

The most prominent feature is a cluster of steep, rocky peaks covered in greenery, possibly indicating dense jungle growth. A thin, arched bridge spans a gap between one of these formations, hinting at some form of civilization or passage. A river or large stream flows through the valley, its surface reflecting the sunlight in a dazzling array of sparkling highlights.

Palm trees with large, fan-like leaves dot the foreground, adding to the tropical feel. In the background, larger, more gradual mountain ranges fade into the distance, their slopes also cloaked in verdant vegetation. The overall impression is one of a vibrant, thriving ecosystem, dense with life and natural beauty, set within a dramatic landscape of towering peaks and winding waterways.

**[HWOMBANZU]**:
Hwombazu is a central province known for its abundance of fertile land and proximity to vast rivers and lakes, leading to the province having one of the largest population sizes in all of Hovehko.

It, however, has the smallest population of hunters on the continent due to centuries of ethnic cleansing, fueled by ancient grievances as the ancestors of the grazier majority were once enslaved and farmed by The Circle.

Other Things:
Capital: Tatohv

Religion: Pasturist
Demonym: Herdish

Language: Herdish (Literal Irish)

Ruler: Kingdom of the Herd

Land Appearance:
The landscape of Hwombazu is depicted as a lush, fertile province under a hazy, golden sky, suggesting either sunrise or sunset. The terrain is primarily characterized by rolling hills and meadows, richly covered with varied shades of green vegetation. Dominating the foreground are dense clusters of bushes, some dotted with pale yellow flowers, contributing to the province's reputation for abundance.

A winding, light-colored path cuts through the verdant expanse, hinting at the presence of rivers or lakes that facilitate the land's fertility and support a large population. The path leads towards the middle ground, where scattered trees of different shapes and sizes add depth to the scenery. Some of these trees feature broad canopies, while others stand tall and slender.

In the distance, the landscape rises to reveal prominent rock formations and a large mountain, adding a sense of scale and grandeur to the view. These features are partially obscured by the golden haze, creating an ethereal, almost dreamlike quality. The artistic style employs broad brushstrokes and a muted color palette.

4.content:
Calixo is an island continent of endless Autumm, located in the northeastern hemisphere. Mainland of the Qothic Empire.

Land Appearance:
The Calixo, an island continent perpetually bathed in the hues of autumn, presents a picturesque landscape. The foreground is dominated by trees bursting with vibrant yellow and orange foliage. Hints of green peek through the autumn leaves, adding depth to the scene. In the middle ground, quaint buildings with distinctive red-tiled roofs and unique architectural details are nestled. A stone bridge arches gracefully over a valley, connecting different parts of the settlement. In the background, majestic mountains rise, their peaks capped with snow. Over all, the sky is a blend of soft blues and whites.

Locations:
Qoth: Capital province on the western coast of Calixo.

Locations within Qoth:
Oxcot: Capital city of the Qothic Empire.

5.content:
Kopothokualassa (or the Great Archipelagocia) is a massive continent that lies mostly just below water with an average elevation of around one hundred meters below sea level, with a vast collection of islands and reefs. Home to the Confederation of Soryaban

Land Appearance:
The Kopothokualassa is represented in the image as a coastal archipelago, dominated by a large rock formation sculpted by the elements into a natural archway through which a sailing ship passes. The rock is rugged, rising dramatically from the turquoise sea, with exposed areas colored in light tan and accented by shadows of grey and brown. Green vegetation sparsely clings to the stone, suggesting a harsh but fertile environment.

On top of the arch, several buildings are perched, their roofs angled and accented with small red flags. The style of these buildings appears functional and integrated with the natural landscape. The environment suggests that this location is part of the Confederation of Soryaban. The sky above is bright, with hints of diffused sunlight filtering through the clouds.

6.content: this is a title

7.content:
The Qothic Empire, commonly known as Qoth, is a nation located on the continent of Calixo, northeast of Hovehko. Born from the ashes of Sunderkell, Qoth has grown to be one of the most influential nations of the modern world.

Flag Appearance:
The flag features a simple design using only two colors: a dark, reddish-brown for the background and white for the central emblem and supporting elements.

Central Emblem:
At the "heart" of the flag is a stylized emblem composed of the following:
Helmeted Face: A simplified, what seems to be a head of a cat in white, is depicted, appearing to wear a helmet. The helmet has a smooth, rounded shape covering the head, with minimal details. The facial features include slightly curved, closed eyes, a small nose, and a subtle mouth.

Concentric Circles: The face is encircled by three thin, white concentric circles, creating a halo-like effect around the head.

Supporting Elements:
Extending outward from the emblem, there are four elongated, white shapes positioned at right angles to each other. These shapes resemble what seems to be stylized arms, or maybe even beams of light, or decoration. Each arm-like shape broadens as it extends from the concentric circles towards the edges of the flag.

Other Things:
Capital: Oxcot

Demonym: Qothic, Qoth
Species Kunehva (40%), High Ceveran (21.7%), Pokes (18%), Equilox (13.3%), Abunaax (6.7%), False Kunehva (0.3%)

Language: High Continental (A Arabic Dialect)

Ruler: Empress Voxaurdi
Religion: Qothic Pantheon

Currency: Urchins

Geography:
Qoth is a land of contrasts, hugged by two seas: the Sea of Triumph to the west and the Sea of Question to the east. Down south, you‚Äôve got the Abyssal Cauldron, a massive, mysterious expanse that dominates the Eastern Hemisphere. Splitting the continent right down the middle are towering, snow-capped mountains.

In the Northern Qoth, is a lush wonderland of towering coniferous trees with striking vermillion needles, paired with soft, ochre-colored highland grass. 

Southern Qoth, on the other hand, is all about white birch forests and rolling plains that stretch forever. With an autumnal vibe, think crisp air and vibrant colors, that sticks around all year long.

Species of Qoth:
Qoth is home to 5 distinct species:
Ceveran: These tall, slender deer-like folks are the big shots of Qoth, making up most of the population. The guys flaunt antlers that can have five or more prongs, and antler size is a big deal when it comes to picking a partner. Ceverans love their status, often holding fancy noble or administrative jobs, and they‚Äôre not shy about reminding you of their credentials. Picture them as the self-proclaimed aristocracy who‚Äôll correct you if you step out of line.

Kunehva: Short, stocky, and built like tanks, these rabbit-like Kunehva are the backbone of Qoth‚Äôs industry. They‚Äôre masters of mining and construction, whipping up sprawling complexes in days and marching armies across rough terrain without breaking a sweat. Despite their strength, they‚Äôre super chill, friendly even to outsiders, and way more approachable than the high-and-mighty Ceverans. If you see a massive city or factory in Qoth, odds are the Kunehva built it.

Abunaax: Hailing from the continent of Calixo, these massive, palmate-antlered giants are the strong, silent types. They started as primitive tribes during Qoth‚Äôs formation and faced plenty of hardship, but their sheer size and strength make them a force to be reckoned with. You won‚Äôt see many Abunaax outside their homeland; they‚Äôre solitary by nature, but when they do pop up, they‚Äôre hauling freight or serving as heavy infantry. Their intimidating vibe kept enemies at bay even when their tech was basic, and they still command respect.

Pokes: Tiny cousins of the Kunehva, Pokes are small in size but huge in brainpower. These big-eared geniuses are behind Qoth‚Äôs biggest leaps forward, from vertical plumbing and vaccines to articulated prosthetics, automatons, sailing castles, Oxcot‚Äôs rail system, and the game-changing crank engine. They‚Äôve saved lives, uncovered Qoth‚Äôs ancient past, and fueled its prosperity, but sadly, the bigger species often treat them like second-class citizens. One Ceveran scholar put it best: "Pokes deserve better. They‚Äôve done more for us than anyone, yet we look down on them. We‚Äôve got to judge people for their deeds, not their looks, or we‚Äôre no better than mud." Literal Racism.

Equilox: These sleek, horse-like beauties are Qoth‚Äôs supermodels, with flowing hair and a knack for turning heads. They‚Äôre the gold standard for beauty in Qothic society, and they know it. If Ceverans are stuck-up, Equilox takes it to another level. They‚Äôve got short fuses and aren‚Äôt the sharpest, but their stunning looks and athletic builds make them the envy of the continent.

Other Species: Qoth used to be super isolationist, with a side of xenophobia, but things are changing. Thanks to a policy shift in the modern Qothic Empire, folks from places like Siltria and southeastern Hovehko are starting to settle in cities like Oxcot and Dellor. Western hunter species are still banned, but there are exceptions: Gnomanyan prisoners who earned freedom in factory colonies and a small group of Wuln who migrated during the Rendal era, now living in the eastern mountains. It‚Äôs a slow thaw, but Qoth‚Äôs getting more diverse by the day.

keywords: The Confederation of One thousand Islands of Soryaban
8.content: The Confederation of One thousand Islands of Soryaban, or Soryaban for short is, despite the name, a country of potentially millions of islands located in Kopothokualassa. The confederation spans the entirety of the continent and almost the entire western hemisphere, leading to very different cultures and climates at both extremes, held together by the central High Islands.

9.content:
Mandasko is an Ancient city and empire that ruled over most of Hovehko, and still remains as a significant country in central Hovehko.

Considered The harbinger of civilization, it was the first known domain in this world. A powerful empire created in the name of a god and his demigod wife, Mandasko shaped much of modern Hovekish culture, and old structures and ruins are found all the way from Tenvar to Siltria.

Modern Mandasko still remains an important religious and cultural center of Hovehko, more recently famous for its neutrality and tourism.

Kyouko Mejiro (ÁõÆ„É°‰ª£„Ç∏„É≠„Ç≠„Éß„Ç¶„Ç≥, Mejiro Ky≈çko?) is a private detective who is an important character throughout most of the manga's story. Prior to the story, Kyouko had befriended Nazuna Nanakusa in high school, eventually discovering her true heritage as a vampire. On her eighteenth birthday, Kyouko's father, who had been transformed into a vampire, attacked both Kyouko and her mother, succeeding in killing the latter. This forced Kyouko to kill him in self-defense, with the event leaving lifelong scars on her life and mind. This family tragedy drove her to despise vampires, and she set out to become an adept detective under the new name Anko Uguisu (È∂Ø„Ç¶„Ç∞„Ç§„Çπ„Ç¢„É≥„Ç≥, Uguisu Anko?). She plotted to eradicate the entire vampire race as a means to kill Kiku Hoshimi, the true cause of her trauma and the murder of her parents.

Ten years after her investigations began, Anko encountered Kou Yamori, a teenager who Anko was aware had been friends with Nazuna.

So far, she is the only human who managed to kill a vampire, although the amount she has managed to kill is unknown.

Anko has brown hair, which she partially ties to a bun or ponytail, and brown, lusterless eyes, over which she wears round glasses that belonged to her father.

Her primary outfit consists of a beige trench coat, under which she wears a dark turtleneck t-shirt, a black skirt with a zipper, and light-brown boots with heels. She wears black gloves that cover half of one hand each. Later, she wears her coat less frequently and cuts her hair short, making it resemble the haircut she had in the past.

As a teenager, Anko wore a baggy blue seifuku while going to school. Her regular outfit was the same as her current one. In her youth, her pupils were more frequently visible and her eyes generally had more light in them as opposed to her vacant eyes in the present. Her facial expressions also tended to be more lively.

On Halloween, she wore two different costumes as a disguise, first dressed like a grim reaper and then like a policewoman. [1]

Personality

Anko is a very straightforward, observant, and sociable woman with a primarily casual attitude who enjoys messing around with others; however she can change her mood in the blink of an eye and quickly unsettle someone, either by becoming completely serious or displaying the more unstable side of her personality. In the latter case, it becomes apparent that she isn't fully sane.

Her profession aside, Anko doesn't strictly keep herself within the bounds of law, as evidenced by her owning a handgun and a butterfly knife, as well as not reporting Kou for working illegally under Nazuna's snooze shop. She explained in her youth that she cares less if something is "just", but whether it goes against her personal beliefs.

As a teenager, Kyouko Mejiro was a loner, though still well-adjusted. She was a member of the literature club and preferred spending her free time in the club's room, where she frequently read books, being particularly interested in detective stories. However, she was disillusioned with the profession and knew detectives such as those she read about in crime novels were an exaggeration, whereas in actuality they were mostly hired for cases far less important or interesting. Kyouko had issues with men and rejected a boy who asked her out, with the boy leaving in tears, but she was very open about her attraction to girls. Underneath the surface, Kyouko was highly affected by her toxic household and liked to stay at school until late at night for that reason.

One of her most defining traits was her hatred for vampires. She was extremely ruthless and determined to wipe them out, exhibiting sociopathic behavior. Her actions were sometimes noted to be reckless, having little regard for her own life or well-being, such as when she attacked two vampires head-on. Anko often showed little to no empathy when injuring them and was even shown to be somewhat sadistic and psychotic, such as when she maniacally laughed while repeatedly stabbing Akkun in the gut[2

Anko also has a goofy side that is shown on some occasions, for example, early on in the story when she genuinely thinks that Kou wants to be in a relationship with her, and subsequently feels awkward when she turns out to be incorrect[4]. When drunk, she occasionally makes dirty jokes and becomes a "sexually harassing geezer." Kou once even remarks that she attempts to strike a dramatic pose whenever he enters her office. Anko is serious about romance, and is starved for a romantic relationship. She is attracted to both men and women, including children of middle school age. She has little to no self-control when staring at female bodies.

After getting a new chance in life, Anko gave up hunting vampires, feeling completely exhausted and regretting her actions for a variety of reasons, even sincerely apologizing to Nico Hirata for shooting her. Adjusting to a normal life felt difficult for Anko as she never experienced anything an average adult would, like friends and romance. While she isn't interested in killing vampires after choosing to turn her life around, Anko feels homey in an abnormal life, being determined to find Kiku Hoshimi and help Kou. After the Halloween incident, Anko became more of a calmed-down analyst who often makes blunt and sarcastic remarks. She still doesn't value her own life much, remarking that any vampire intending to kill her is "free to come."

Despite giving up on revenge, Anko still hadn't healed from her trauma and harbored pent-up frustrations, longing for some satisfaction she couldn't get. After confronting the person who caused her trauma, she spent some more time closing that chapter of her life for good. Eventually, Anko decided she had no purpose in her hometown anymore and decided to go to Vietnam with Susuki to learn more about the vampires there, saying that it was uncertain whether she would return home. Despite this, Kyouko would eventually return to Japan, but the exact location therein is unknown[5

2.content:
CHARACTERISTICS

Vampire
GENDER
Female
AGE
40+

September 23,[1] 1970s
HAIR COLOR
Pale Purple/lavender silver 
EYE COLOR
Blue

Nanakusa Nazuna?) is a carefree vampire from birth who was raised by Kabura Honda before attending a night school, where she met and befriended Kyouko Mejiro. By the time she chose to live a life by her own presence, Nazuna encountered Kou Yamori, a night roaming middle schooler in Komori whose blood tasted astonishingly delicious. In an exchange for spending time with Kou every night and drinking his blood, Kou intended to fall in love with Nazuna to become a vampire himself, a topic that discomforted Nazuna.

As time passed on, Nazuna's relationship with Kou grew more intimate, with her wishing to protect his life. However, when the two came into conflict with Nazuna's vengeful first friend, Kyouko, she chose to take responsibility and clash with her for the sake of the vampire race. In the climax of the fight, Nazuna refused to murder Kyouko, and after the latter's attempted suicide resulted in Kou's ‚Äúhalf-vampire‚Äù self to emerge, the two finally reconciled. Whilst investigating Kou's new, strong, and maniacal physiology with Kyouko's aid, Kou had a fallout with Mahiru Seki, so Nazuna, along with a large number of new friends, chose to support him and travel to Hokkaido to help Kou and Mahiru make amends. Unfortunately, the events that occured on Hokkaido put a strain on Nazuna's and Kou's relationship.

Nazuna is a reasonably short woman, standing just a head or so higher than a middle school boy. Her body is skinny and petite, with a small bust and spindly arms, the latter of which hide her immense vampiric strength very well.

Her hair is a very light purple, appearing almost grey, not silver. She keeps it long enough to reach the middle of her back; however, she keeps it in two long braids that she then curls up and pins to the rest of her hair, making two large rings. She has bangs that go down almost to her eyes, covering her eyebrows, and two medium-length tufts of hair that hang down from the middle of her head, framing her face and ending just at her mouth.

She has fierce blue eyes. Instead of standard irises and pupils, her eyes have an almost target-like appearance with black rings that intersperse sections of her irises, getting smaller as they get to the middle until they reach the pupil. This gives her a piercing gaze that varies between uncanny and uncomfortable depending on how she looks at someone. She wears light-red eye shadows.

Nazuna can most often be seen wearing a large piece of clothing resembling a cross between a cloak and a hooded jacket. This large piece of clothing covers nearly all of her body, going down to the middle of her calves and leaving only her hands exposed.

Underneath the large cloak, Nazuna's general attire is a pair of black denim shorts that go down to just past her upper thigh and a black leather cropped keyhole shirt with no sleeves. Unlike other keyhole tops, hers has a collar that goes up higher and covers a good portion of her neck. It also has a similar back hole showing her shoulder blades. Hers is also very cropped, short enough that it ends just beneath her breasts and leaves a large section of her stomach and back uncovered. She also wears a pair of thigh-high leather boots with wedge heels and occasionally leather gloves to complete her distinctive look.

Just like almost any other vampire that has appeared, she is described as pretty or cute. In fact, her looks catch the attention of multiple attendants at a pool party[2]. Nazuna is a very laid-back individual. She is not overly friendly but has a very relaxed presence in most situations. She's willing to talk to just about anyone and prefers keeping on good terms with most people. However, there are exceptions like Nico Hirata and her clique, who she finds very annoying and isn't interested in being on good terms with until later. Nazuna is often fairly insensitive and often drops unintentionally mean comments or actual insults, though she sometimes feels regret for it later on. She isn't shy to threaten others with death or suggest killing someone but doesn't have it in her to kill people she is/was close with. If another vampire shows interest in her prey, Nazuna becomes highly agitated and possessive.

Nazuna gets along with people who enjoy the night and loves to show people new things in the town's nightlife. She isn't used to modern technology, owning retro gaming consoles, not owning a smartphone, and carrying an old-school brick-like cellphone. For that reason, she can become very excited if something new presents itself, even if it's something like a walkie-talkie. Despite pretending to know everything about the night and having fun, Nazuna spends most of her time drinking alcohol and playing video games and lives a boring life. Her perverted and impolite personality aside, Nazuna is a genuine expert in her line of work, having extensive knowledge about the art of massages and human anatomy. That doesn't mean she acts like a professional at her job; when Kiyosumi Shirakawa unexpectedly arrives at her door, she forces the inexperienced Kou to step in for her due to feeling tired from giving him a massage prior. When Kou hesitates, Nazuna tempts him with the promise that he will get to touch Kiyosumi's attractive body. When Kou still refuses, Nazuna guilt-trips him by saying she didn't work for a month to spend time with him, and then tempts Kou further by promising him half of the salary and another kiss.

Nazuna is often defined by her strong immaturity, being less mature than a middle schooler. She is very open about sexual topics, has no problems discussing them, and loves to make dirty jokes. However, she is very romance-averse and reacts strongly in embarrassment to the word "love" when used in the romantic sense.

Kou Yamori (Â§ú„É§ÂÆà„É¢„É™„Ç≥„Ç¶, Yamori K≈ç?) is the main protagonist of Call of the Night. He is a middle school student who began skipping classes to venture around his home city Komori at late night. Since he first began roaming around, Kou befriended Nazuna Nanakusa, a vampire who he intended to develop romantic feelings for in order to be able to be turned into a vampire by her. His close time with Nazuna caught the attention of a group of vampires, led by Nico Hirata, who confirmed that Kou would be assassinated if he were not to become a vampire within a year. However, Kou and Nazuna succeeded in befriending each of them within a couple of months. Throughout his insomnia nights, he had came across more friends he had ever had before, and eventually, Kou encountered Anko Uguisu, a detective who sought to eliminate all vampires.

Kou and Nazuna grew closer to each other as friends, and they went up against Uguisu's campaign in order to save their allies. After discovering the detective's true identity as Kyouko Mejiro, Kou and Nazuna clashed with her during Halloween, and when Kyouko/Anko attempted to commit suicide, Kou prevented her from doing so, which ultimately allowed his half-vampire self, a hybrid between humans and vampires, to surface. Coming to good terms with the reformed Anko, the three of them began investigating the nature of his half-vampire state, and during the process, Kou had a brutal fallout with his friend, Mahiru Seki, who had been acquainted with Kiku Hoshimi. In search of Mahiru to reconcile, Kou, along with his new friends, chased after Kiku and joined a school trip to Hokkaido, where Kou was almost murdered by Kiku before making amends with Mahiru.

Kou is a boy with a slender and relatively short build. He has eyes with small pupils featuring eye bags. Despite usually being portrayed as black, Kou's eyes sometimes appear to be amber-colored. He has short black hair with a spiky profile. He usually wears black baggy shorts and a white t-shirt underneath a predominantly black jacket with a white stripe down each sleeve. He also wears a pair of white leather shoes for footwear. Later on, he is occasionally seen with an earring on his left ear. After his jacket gets damaged, he replaces it with another one that looks almost identical but has two slightly different white stripes on its sleeves.[3]

Kou's school uniform consists of a grey suit with a white shirt, a striped tie underneath, grey pants, and a wide black belt. On the school trip, he still wears his casual outfit despite Hokkaido's harsh climate, claiming he is not bothered by it because he wears Heattech underneath. That claim is questionable, as he still wears shorts, exposing his legs to the cold.

After working for Anko Uguisu for years, Kou's fashion style has become noticeably similar to that of his boss; he wears a trench coat with a black turtleneck shirt underneath, along with fur-trimmed boots with heels. In addition, he also wears black pants. He has also grown taller, being a good head higher than Nazuna. Nazuna noted that he's got more piercings now. Kou's hair has grown out and is now tied in a ponytail, possibly to honor Mahiru.

Kou is a gloomy and reserved boy who has been that way since early childhood. He preferred to watch ants carry their food instead of hanging out with other children. After entering middle school, he became charismatic, friendly, upbeat, and a showcase student. Although he seems to have enjoyed a satisfying and successful life being an honor student, that was a facade. Despite being proud of his popularity, Kou didn't have fun at school. He wasn't motivated enough to maintain his excellent school performance. He also couldn't relate to other people, nor could he understand the concept of love.

He prefers to walk around at night, enjoying the freedom it provides, and sees becoming a vampire as the last step that will make him able to live that lifestyle for eternity. Before, Kou lived the majority of his life without purpose, wandering aimlessly, never knowing what he wanted to become in the future. The goal to become a vampire made him feel a purpose for the first time ever.

Kou was rather rigid at first, feeling nervous when sneaking out of his apartment for the first time and being very anxious when he was about to buy alcohol from a vending machine. The more he explored the freedom of the night through Nazuna's encouragement, the more used to it he became.

Kou has a strong sense of justice which he is very vocal about, and is quick to scold someone whom he perceives as amoral. However, his morals can differ from the norm; he doesn't think killing someone is inherently wrong, as sometimes one has no other choice. Seri Kikyou describes him as someone who values the lives of his friends above those of others.

Aside from his lack of understanding of love, Kou is generally confused about his own emotions. He thought his excitement after his first kiss was love when it was actually only lust. Despite claiming not to mind loneliness and having acted indifferent towards others when he was younger, Kou yearns for contact with other people. That was shown when he put a walkie-talkie on a postbox in the past, hoping that a random person would find it.[4]

As the story progresses, Kou undergoes noticeable emotional growth. He opens up more, shows more emotion, becomes more determined to reach his goals, is more confident, and is generally more lively. His charisma is present even when he is not putting on a facade, which makes him very popular among his peers and vampires, particularly females. Kou also has moments where he is fed up with others, not holding back in verbal conversations. After suffering tremendous loss, Kou decided to go back to school to distract himself and seemed to be drifting apart from his night owl lifestyle before eventually returning to 

Despite getting grossed out and embarrassed by lewd topics, he is repeatedly shown to be quite lecherous and subconsciously stares at big breasts. When investigating creepshots of Arisa being taken in the "Vamp" Cafe, Kou concludes that the photos were taken by Arisa herself, with one reason being that the images don't show anything explicit like her panties. Anko Uguisu says that, while he doesn't own adult magazines, he downloads specific pictures on his phone, regrets doing it, and deletes them, only to repeat the process.

Kou is mature for his age and doesn't seem to be afraid of many things; for example, he roams the nights alone as a 14-year-old without much fear and gets involved with vampires without further doubt, making Akira doubt his intelligence. However, Kou can be very intelligent, picking up on things that others don't and often being able to see past other people's lies. Moreover, he has conversations with far more experienced and older people without any problems.

When he first turned into a half-vampire, Kou's personality changed drastically, making him bloodthirsty and unhinged, like when he gleefully attacked Mahiru after the latter beat him up first, almost killing him before Nazuna interfered. However, his intent was only to punch and hurt Mahiru. The transformation also affects his personality in his human state as he has become more prone to anger, more assertive, and more intimidating, though that hasn't erased his old self.

Akira Asai (Êúù„Ç¢„Çµ‰∫ï„Ç§„Ç¢„Ç≠„É©, Asai Akira?) is a middle school student and a childhood friend of Kou Yamori and Mahiru Seki. A dedicated follower of authority, Akira does everything expected from a good student despite her utter lack of enthusiasm. Recently, Akira started to develop insomnia due to her life feeling unsatisfying because of her lack of human connection, both at school and at home, and started waking up at 4 AM and going to school early. After her friend was rejected when she confessed to Kou as per Akira's suggestion, Kou began skipping school to roam around at night. Not long after the first time, Akira came across him and met Nazuna Nanakusa, a vampire.

Akira is a teenage girl with a voluptuous build. She has short hair whose coloration varies between black and dark brown. Her eyes have tiny pupils and no visible iris. While her eyes are usually colored black, they are also depicted as amber-colored. Akira has a noticeable upper bust, a feature acknowledged by several characters, and an angular face.

Outside, she usually wears a school uniform consisting of a long-sleeved white shirt, a striped tie, brown loafers, and a grey skirt. In addition, her uniform also features a grey blazer during the colder months. In PE class, Akira wears the school-issued dark-colored track jacket with sleeves that are white on the upper half, and black shorts. She also ties her hair in a ponytail during PE. At home, she is always shown wearing a sleeveless shirt and pajama shorts.

At one point she was put in a maid outfit, much to her embarrassment.[3]

Akira, despite not having fun at school, is a mature and disciplined student who obediently follows her school duties and takes her education serious. She is approachable and perceptive, and maintains a close relationship with her friends Kou Yamori and Mahiru Seki. As a little girl, she was lively and talkative but later became gloomy, blunt, and snarky. Reasons for that are her boring time at school, where she puts on an honor student facade and feels alienated from the girls as she used to spend her time with boys.

Another factor is her situation at home. She doesn't seem to have a good relationship with her family and does nothing but repeat the same daily routine. At one point, she "wasn't able to bring herself out anymore" and seems to suffer from depression. She gets grossed out when someone says something too positive, like Kou praising Mahiru or the latter talking about "liking someone." Recently, her lively side has resurfaced to some extent.

For the most part, Akira is a "by-the-book" person who rigorously follows school protocol and has a strict sleeping schedule that involves going to sleep at 8 PM and waking up as early as 4 AM so she can take a walk before going to school. Even if others perceive that as weird, Akira sees it as entirely normal. She also frequently encourages her friends to get sleep and focus on their education. When her friends are involved, however, Akira supports their lifestyles, even if they go against the norms of society, and is willing to get into trouble, particularly when their well-being is in danger. When around her peers, particularly Kou, Akira acts like a guardian figure, causing Michiko to give her nicknames like "Miss Guardian" and "Mom." Her friends often seek advice from her on how to handle their problems, making Akira a sort of counselor for them.

Akira has a relatively carefree attitude, quickly accepting the existence of vampires. While she's usually very cool-headed, she can also quickly feel overwhelmed by a situation and lose her cool, particularly if she feels scared or embarrassed. She has a strong suspicion of vampires and mostly wants to stay away from them, getting embarrassed, weirded out, and disgusted by their antics.

She can be hot-tempered and has no qualms about using physical violence against people close to her when irritated, like when she hits Mahiru for requesting her to summon Hanako-san and then hits him again for scaring her by imitating the ghost's voice, or when she wrestles Kou and Mahiru to the ground due to being frustrated by their lack of communication skills.

Even though Akira had no problem socializing, it quickly got boring for her until she met the two boys with whom she shared several traits, like her views on things, her inability to relate to other people, and, later on, her lack of happiness.

Mahiru Seki (Â§ï„Çª„Ç≠Áúü„ÉûÊòº„Éí„É´, Seki Mahiru?) was a former middle school student and a childhood friend of Kou Yamori and Akira Asai. On the surface, Mahiru came off as perfect; he had good grades but wasn't a nerd, played sports, was charming and upbeat, got along with everybody, and his parents owned a flower shop. In truth, Mahiru suffered from heavy trauma caused by being utterly neglected by his parents after his older brother died.

Despite being surrounded by students who adored him, he only enjoyed the company of Kou and Akira. While working at his family's flower shop, Mahiru met Kiku Hoshimi, a vampire who eventually developed a relationship with him. Seeking to become a vampire himself to escape his everyday life, he started dating Kiku, and as time passed, Kiku had Mahiru ultimately struck with love and abiding by her influence

Mahiru is a young boy with a darker faint skin tone who usually wears his school uniform consisting of a gray blazer, under which he wears a red hoodie, gray pants, and white tennis shoes. His hair is dark blonde and tied in a little ponytail.

After choosing to become a vampire, he lets his hair down and starts to wear baggy clothes, described by Kou as "looking tired."

Personality

Mahiru is a kind person that tries to keep a good and relaxed atmosphere with the people around him, able to socialize with his classmates and teachers, making him very popular in school.

But that's a facade under which lies a depressed and traumatized person who resents his family for the emotional abuse they put him through. He genuinely loves flowers and hoped to inherit his parents' flower shop as a child. But later, he ended up hoping the shop would vanish along with his household. Similar to Kou and Akira, his only genuine friends, socializing with his schoolmates is not fun to him. He is tired of constantly being pressured to spend time with them and feels a catharsis after telling them his real feelings, despite getting beaten up by them. Mahiru was a timid and quiet child but started copying his brother's personality after he died so he could become popular. Despite not seeing them as real friends, Mahiru felt lonely without the other students.

During his time spent with Kiku Hoshimi, Mahiru undergoes a dramatic personality change, becoming rude, blunt, violent, and enthusiastic about killing humans. However, it turns out that he acted that way because he was distressed by Kiku's looming death. After fighting with Kou, he mellows out. His depression has become more apparent; his words often have a melancholic undertone, and he isolates himself from everyone except Kiku. Despite being willing to abandon his friends and family, he is still attached to Kou and Akira.

Kiku Hoshimi (Êòü„Éõ„Ç∑Ë¶ã„Éü„Ç≠„ÇØ, Hoshimi Kiku?) is among the oldest vampires in history, on a quest to discover how to revert back to being human that lasted for five centuries. Believing the theory that a vampire who sucked the blood of the human they loved would also become human, Kiku spent lifetimes attempting to fall in love with humans, but to no avail, as she kept accidentally making them into her underlings, to the point she had the most underlings among the vampire race.

Eventually, she crossed paths with Mahiru Seki and developed a relationship with him. On the verge of experiencing the emotion of romance, Kiku had the lovestruck Mahiru under her bidding, motivating him to disregard everything and everyone in his life and only center his mind on her. Her actions and influence captured the attention of Kou Yamori, who had become a hybrid between human and vampire, Nazuna Nanakusa and Kyouko Mejiro, so Kiku and Mahiru fled to Hokkaido. Now knowing the feeling of love, Kiku prepared for the night of her theoretical transformation, but after attempting to murder Kou, she was confronted by Anko Uguisu, who blamed her for her parents's deaths, though the two finally set aside their differences.


Appearance

Kiku is a young-looking woman with a slender build, a noticeably prominent forehead and a pretty appearance, featuring a narrow face, shoulder-length light brown hair, and eyes with a piercing and unsettling gaze. She prefers to wear coats, tops, skirts, stockings, and high heels.

Kiku had an unpredictable personality; on the outside, she seemed friendly and empathetic and thereby quickly became friends with Mahiru Seki, who met her often due to his part-time job as a flower courier. She was the vampire with the most underlings; according to Hatsuka Suzushiro, she had over 50 of them, although she mentioned that she didn't really want to have underlings and accidentally transformed them. She usually abandoned them after they turned into vampires.

She was exceptionally secretive and enigmatic, watching people from afar and almost always being ahead of others in situational awareness. With the exception of her late friend, Kiku rarely ever spent time with other vampires, though she had connections that she used to her advantage. Azami said that she would know if someone tailed her for too long. If she got directly confronted, she either made sure to silence her opponent or fled and used her environment to her advantage.

Kiku was a highly twisted individual who enjoyed toying with people and was arrogant as she saw herself as superior compared to vampires like Nazuna, mockingly calling her out for risking the exposure of vampires to humans despite doing the same, not caring about the consequences of her actions. She was happy to use intimidation to scare off people who tried to get in her way, torture or murder them, and had a terrifying presence.

Like Haru Nanakusa, Kiku had the objective of becoming human again. Though she was bored with her life as an immortal vampire, it wasn't her main reason, unlike Haru's. Kiku believed that falling in love with a human would let her become human herself.

Due to her unsuccessful search for love, Kiku became mentally unstable. When she confronted Anko Uguisu, she had a breakdown, laughing maniacally and simultaneously boasting and despairing over nobody, not even herself, knowing "what is fucking wrong with her." [1] She was incredibly insecure and believed that Mahiru had to sever all past connections he had for her sake, lest the love wasn't real in her eyes. When Mahiru still showed attachment to Kou, she attempted to drown the latter. Kiku didn't know what love felt like in the first place and based her expectations on romantic stories, such as those in movies.
Relationships

Azami - Underling, Temporary Enemy and Ally
Kyouko Mejiro - Former Attempted Killer
Unnamed Female Driver

Hatsuka Suzushiro (Ëòø„Çπ„Ç∫Ëîî„Ç∑„É≠„Éè„ÉÑ„Ç´, Suzushiro Hatsuka?) is a vampire who is in the same clique as Nico Hirata. Despite what the appearance suggests, Hatsuka is a man who just thinks women's clothes suit him. He supports Nazuna Nanakusa and Kou Yamori on their journey to turn Kou into a vampire by having him fall in love with Nazuna.

Hatsuka is a man of small stature with an androgynous physique, having a rather masculine but skinny upper body and feminine hips. He has shoulder-length black hair with blunt bangs that end just above his eyes and two smaller hair strands that run down each side of his face. The hair is styled in an undercut, leaving the lower half of his head shaven. His eyes appear black from a distance but are actually granite grey.

He prefers to dress femininely, which he says is because it suits him better and attracts both men and women to him, in turn furthering his goal as a vampire of producing more offspring. He mainly wears dresses and coats. His footwear consists of dark calf-length boots, smaller shoes, and slippers when he is at home.

On Halloween, he wore a maid outfit as he helped Midori advertise her maid caf√©.

Personality

Hatsuka, unlike his vampire comrades, is a relatively laid-back individual. As a result, he is the only one who doesn't try to put Kou under his spell initially. However, he later expresses curiosity for the taste of Kou's blood since it is described as delicious and offers to make him his servant when Kou is at risk of getting killed by the other vampires. He believes that he'd make the best partner for Kou, saying they would get along well as fellow men and therefore only he could truly understand Kou's heart. Compared to the other vampires, Hatsuka seems friendlier, more helpful and level-headed. He is usually not as straightforward as the others but somewhat more distant and occasionally bored. He, like his friends, is fond of alcohol and invested in romantic stories but, unlike them, mostly tends to keep his thoughts to himself. Hatsuka doesn't hesitate to call others out if he finds them annoying.

Hatsuka is intelligent, carefree, and seeks enjoyment in life. He can read others very well and can predict other people's sentences before they are finished talking. While he doesn't understand his preference for feminine clothes, he doesn't care much either and dresses in women's clothes because it looks good on him. He considers himself male despite how he presents himself and is not opposed to the male gender. When Kou mentions that he's been thinking about "doing as he wants" and "letting others decide for him," Hatsuka has a brief flashback of a person in a female school uniform, hinting that he had a similar experience in the past.

Hatsuka believes that people are weak to contrast; a person who is used to dressing a certain way will evoke a stronger reaction if they radically change their appearance. For example, he correctly assumes that Nazuna, who usually dresses in skimpy outfits, would provoke a more intense reaction out of Kou if she wore an atypically modest outfit that's hard to move around in.

He can get very excited in certain situations, like when Nazuna asks him for advice about making Kou fall for her, and Hatsuka ends up more fired up about it than Nazuna herself. When she tries to wear an outfit he chooses for her, Hatsuka tells her that she looks so cute that he wants to French-kiss her and that the boy inside him is trembling.[2] When caught off-guard, Hatsuka is unable to keep his cool-headed attitude and loses his composure, like when Kou bluntly tells him that he looks cute.

However, Hatsuka also has a dark side. He describes himself as less gentle regarding his underlings and can be very authoritative towards them, scolding them for talking without his permission. Furthermore, he treats them like children; he punishes them if they don't follow his orders and says he is gentle to those who obey him. His lavish apartment only has one sofa in the living room, a sofa that is only meant for him or occasional guests to sit on. If the sofa is unavailable, he uses his servants as living furniture. In order to turn Kou into a vampire, Hatsuka planned to brainwash Kou into a state where he couldn't live without him, believing that love is just another form of brainwashing. 

Vampiric abilities: As a vampire, Hatsuka is immortal, can levitate and phase through objects, possesses superhuman speed, durability, and strength, a supernatural charm, as well as the ability to regenerate wounds much faster and better than humans.

Arisa („ÅÇ„Çä„Åï, Arisa?) is the second most popular maid at the maid caf√© Midori Kohakobe works at

Arisa is a young woman with black eyes and brown hair that she ties to a partial ponytail.

When at work, she wears a french maid outfit as a uniform. On her days off, she wore a sand-colored sweater with a pink shirt underneath.
Personality

On the surface, Arisa is a typical employee at a maid caf√©, dedicated to her work. She is a big fan of maids and maid caf√©s and visits hers even on her days off, with Midori being her favorite maid.

However, Arisa is secretly addicted to social approval. She was incredibly jealous of Midori for replacing her as the Number One maid and made it look like someone was taking inappropriate photos of her when she made those photos herself to raise her popularity. Arisa gets so busy making the perfect selfie that she sometimes doesn't notice the sun rising.

She felt ashamed of that side of hers, but after Midori accepted her for who she was and praised her selfies, she felt much better.
Abilities

Arisa doesn't have any supernatural abilities but is a very experienced and talented photographer.

Azami („Ç¢„Ç∂„Éü, Azami?) is an underling of Kiku Hoshimi who spent the next thirty-five years resolving any issues in human society caused by Hoshimi's other underlings. In an attempt to abduct Anko Uguisu, he was beaten by Kou Yamori and Nazuna Nanakusa, eventually choosing to become their ally. Partnered with Susuki, Azami aided Anko in chasing Kiku for the deaths of her parents and Kou in search for Mahiru Seki to reconcile.

Azami is a tall man with dark blue hair that is short and kept in a bob style. He has teal-colored eyes, which are covered by tiny shades. His left ear features a dangling earring, which is actually a modified container used to carry blood. The lower portion of his face is sometimes covered by a mask, and he usually has a tired expression on his face. His outfit consists of a classic two-piece suit. Each of his fingernails is dyed black.
Personality

At his introduction, Azami was secretive, only spoke sparsely, and didn't hesitate to use brute force against those who opposed him.

However, despite his first impression, he has a very strong moral compass, valuing human life and having made a vow never to kill humans when he became a vampire. While kidnapping Anko and Akira, he tells them not to struggle for their own good as they might get hurt. When he accidentally drops them after getting attacked, he feels terrible at the thought that two humans are dead because of him, although he shifts the blame on Kou for the incident happening in the first place. When he drops Kou from a building and realizes that Kou wouldn't come back, he frantically comes after him to save him. He also says that he hates how Anko disregards her own life. Azami doesn't drink blood directly from humans since there are already many vampires and adding to that number would cause more problems.

As a yakuza, Azami has no qualms about extorting people. If they don't have the required money, he forcefully takes blood from them, which he sells to vampires who, similar to him, don't want to consume blood from the source. Despite this, Azami tries to make sure that the humans he gets the blood from don't get hurt. Though, he mentions that he started enjoying his extorsions and has come up with new ways to make them more terrifying.

His demeanor is usually very calm, and he isn't particularly fazed by what is happening around him, although there are several exceptions. He also sometimes raises his voice when threatening those in debt. Azami tends to be level-headed and analytical.

In the past, Azami used to be a socially awkward individual who let others walk over him and kept his thoughts and interests to himself, causing Kiku Hoshimi to think he had no interest in girls at first.

Despite his meek demeanor, Azami had courage in dire situations and gave his life in an attempt to protect Kiku from the incoming bullets of a machine gun. Azami's protective instincts are one of his most defining traits, as he goes out of his way to shield any human from serious harm, be it in his role as the cleaner who makes sure Kiku's typically unhinged underlings don't cause too much damage or as Kou Yamori's ally who ensures the protection of not only Kou but also his friends.

Kabura Honda (Êú¨„Éõ„É≥Áî∞„ÉÄ„Ç´„Éñ„É©, Honda Kabura?) is a friend in Nico Hirata's clique who was originally a regular human patient at a hospital, where she fell in love with Haru Nanakusa. After Haru made Kabura her underling to cure her of her afflictions, she was requested by her to look after Haru's child, Nazuna Nanakusa. Raising Nazuna as her own daughter, she continued to relish her life as a vampire and nurse at the hospital Haru worked at. Following her first encounter with Nazuna's underling candidate, Kou Yamori, Kabura served an important role in uncovering Nazuna's past.

Kabura is somewhat tall, the second-tallest vampire in Nico Hirata's clique, second only to Nico herself. She has frizzy black hair that reaches her shoulders and black, vacant eyes. Typical for vampires, Kabura is exceptionally attractive.

Her outfits are defined by a preference for dresses and long skirts. Her main outfit is a black, strapless bodycon dress with a turtleneck, a diaphanous mesh that covers a part of her chest and arms, and shoes with heels. At work, she wears a classic nurse uniform that ends at her upper thighs, with slippers serving as her footwear. When she was still a human, her fashion style was about the same as her current one. However, she only got to wear regular clothes when she was out of the hospital and mostly wore a standard patient gown.

Kabura gives off a gloomy aura and is scarred on the inside. In her first appearance, she is first shown to have a playful attitude and sense of humor when around her fellow vampires. Like her friends, Kabura loves alcohol, like red wine and beer, and likes talking about romantic topics. She enjoys teasing others and has an infamous reputation for wanting to take people who are already in a relationship, believing that those who claim to be completely loyal to their partners are liars.

Later, Kabura displays a much more serious side, being blunt, pulling no punches, and having a no-nonsense attitude when it comes to her job; when Kou and Nazuna enter the hospital illegally at night, she first threatens to report them and only allows them to stay if they wear outfits appropriate for the hospital. In spite of that, she can also be surprisingly pleasant. When Kou and Nazuna try to impress her in their investigation and come to the wrong conclusions, Kabura tells them that the lines they tried to pull off sounded good regardless.

Kabura can also act rather creepy at times, particularly regarding Nazuna and, by extension, Kou. Despite Nazuna being her adopted daughter, Nazuna's resemblance to Kabura's late first love makes Kabura often make questionable remarks and put Nazuna in uncomfortable positions. Once Nazuna isn't available anymore, Kabura switches her focus to Kou whom she asks to sit on her lap. When he does so, she starts sniffing him because he still has Nazuna's scent.

As a human, Kabura had a much more friendly personality. Due to getting frequently hospitalized, she felt like a burden and avoided calling for help even when her nose bled. She also disliked making promises since she mostly couldn't keep them. Kabura genuinely wanted to experience everything an ordinary girl would experience but couldn't because of her illness. For her, ordinary activities like taking hot baths, drinking alcohol, or sports like snowboarding were impossible since they required too much energy.

Whenever her friends and family neglected her, she would ignore it, make excuses for them, and bury any negative thoughts. But when she realized that her friends never bothered to understand her and didn't honestly care about her, the resentment Kabura built up until that point erupted; she gave up and tearfully confessed that she hated everything, including her parents and friends. She wanted to have a lover, but she hated men.

After becoming a vampire, Kabura could live life without worries and felt happy for the first time. She eventually started to enjoy things she previously disliked, like alcohol and spending time with men. Her happiness was cut short when her first love fell in love with someone else, got pregnant and died shortly after giving birth. The effect this had on her can still be seen in the present. She is in a constant state of reminiscing the past and questions her own sanity, urging Kou to not become like her. Still, she isn't worried about the effect this has on her popularity, as even in her current emotional state, there will always be men who are willing to listen to her. Kabura doesn't care about her life much but is determined to honor her promise (watching over Nazuna until she makes her first underling).

Relationships

Hatsuka Suzushiro - Friend

1.name: Spankee
1.content: The one who is getting a spanking

2.name: Spanker
2.content: The person giving the spanking

3.name: Over The Knee
3.content: The spanker is seated and the spankee is placed over their lap.

4.name: Over An Object
4.content: This is when the spankee is bent over an object like a bed, arm of a couch, desk, or chair, and spanked by a spanker

5.name: Bending Over
5.content: The position has the spankee bend over (whether freely or over something supportive) at their waist. If the spanker desires contact, they can either place their hand on the base of the spankee's back, shoulders, or (being very careful) head/neck, or wrap their non-spanking arm around the spankee's waist.

6.name: Diaper
6.content: The spankee lays on their back with their legs held upwards. Either the spankee or spanker can assume responsibility for keeping the spankee's legs lifted.

7.name: Hands and knees
7.content: The spankee places their hands and knees on a comfortable surface with their spine kept more-or-less straight and parallel to that surface.

8.name: Laying over the lap
8.content: This position has the spanker seated on furniture which has enough space for the spankee to lay horizontally over their lap.

9.name: Laying down
9.content: This position is about as flexible as the "Bending Over" position, but is generally less strenuous for the spankee as it doesn't require anything of them to maintain. The spankee simply lays down on a comfortable surface with an (optional) object placed under their hips to elevate their bottom.

10.name: Belt
10.content:
A belt that is thick normally used to keep someone's pants up

Sound/sensation: Thuddy/Stingy	
Intensity: Moderate to Severe
Noise Level: Moderate
