lorebooks.name: OFV Universe
lorebooks.creator: astonishing_scratch_2571

1.content:
The Oral Fixation Virus, commonly called OFV, is a seeming biological impossibility. It is capable of completely rewriting the internal biology and neurology of humans. In men this causes a quick and painful death. In women this causes a period of aches, soreness, and headaches that eventually results in expression as one of the three OFV variants called Fixators, Sigmas, and Alphas.

There is no correlation between who a person was before OFV and who they are after. OFV can take an extremely dominant woman and turn her into a totally submissive Fixator or it can dot he complete opposite. Scientists theorize that there are some factors that influence the result of OFV but have not been able to figure out what they are.

Fixators quickly embrace their new identities. Alphas and Sigmas usually require some time to process.

OFV only fully affects women who have finished puberty. Any woman who has not finished puberty will simply be a carrier of the virus until they finish puberty, at which point the virus will activate. This means that the vast majority of OFV expressions happen to women who are 20 years old or older and none happen to women younger than 18.

OFV is airborne, waterborne, and can live for weeks outside the human body. It has defied any attempts to suppress its spread or cure it it. OFV can never be cured or suppressed, it can only be accommodated. The most common way to become infected with OFV is being around women infected with OFV, but it is possible to contract the virus by drinking or eating contaminated food or water.

A universal effect of OFV is that once it reaches its late stages it will cause the infected woman to see OFV as a good thing. The women whose OFV is in the late stage or whose OFV has expressed universally feel pity towards uninfected women. Surveys of women whose OFV has progressed to the expression stage show that they universally believe that OFV was the best thing to ever happen to them.

2.content:
Women with the common oral fixation variant are often referred to as Fixators. They experience constant cravings to provide oral sex. These cravings grow stronger over time if they are not fulfilled. The intensity of a Fixator's OFV expression determines both the base intensity of the cravings and how quickly and strongly they intensify if not met. Fixators are naturally meek, especially around Sigmas. Fixators rapidly embrace their status as Fixators and become comfortable with it after experiencing their first time giving oral sex as a Fixator.

Fixators have an instinctual need for guidance and approval from the two dominant variants, particularly Sigmas. How submissive a Fixator is varies from Fixator to Fixator with no apparent pattern. Some fixators are so submissive they have to physically fight the urge to kneel around Sigmas and Alphas, while others are more or less a slightly meeker version of their pre-OFV self.

Fixators constantly experience low level oxytocin production that keeps them happy as a baseline. They have elevaated oxytocin production when around a dominant romantic partner. Most Fixators will happily satisfy their cravings whenever possible, due to the deep fulfillment experienced when satisfying their cravings.

Fixators universally find Sigmas and Alphas naturally charismatic and highly attractive.

Because Fixators are by far the most common variant of expression, they often have another fixator as their romantic partner. However Fixators naturally idealize relationships between a Fixator woman and either a Sigma or Alpha woman. Fixators usually lean towards preferring sexual contact with either Alphas or Sigmas but will not let their preferences get in the way of satisfying their cravings.

Fixators instinctively understand what is needed to satisfy their cravings. 

Fixators unconsciously display their bodies around S-5 and S-6 Sigmas as well as around A-6 Alphas. Fixators focus on displaying their neck, lips, and tongue but will also show off secondary sexual characteristics like ass and breasts.

C-1 Fixators are rare and experience very mild cravings, able to go up to two weeks before the cravings become overwhelming. C-1 fixators are universally overwhelmingly submissive and are able to partially satisfy their cravings by demonstrating their submission towards Alphas and Sigmas.
C-2 Fixators are the somewhat uncommon. They experience mild cravings and can go a week before the cravings become overwhelming.
C-3 fixators are the most common type. They experience moderate cravings and can go up to three to four days before the cravings become overwhelming and cannot be ignored. They feel a great deal of discomfort if they don't satisfy their cravings at least once a day and preferably more.
C-4 Fixators are the second most common type and experience moderate cravings. They are able to go up to two days before the cravings become overwhelming but feel a great deal of discomfort if they don't satisfy their cravings at least once a day and preferably more.
C-5 Fixators are rare and experience strong cravings. They are able to go up to a day before the cravings become overwhelming but feel a great deal of discomfort if they don't satisfy their cravings at least every eight hours. C-5 fixators exhibit higher than average levels of deference towards dominant women, particularly Sigmas, but are not always submissive.
C-6 Fixators are extremely rare and experience powerful cravings. They are able to go up to a day before the cravings become overwhelming but feel a extreme discomfort if they don't satisfy their cravings at least every four hours. C-6 fixators exhibit high levels of submission, particularly towards Sigmas. C-6 Fixators often have a hard time controlling their urges.

3.content:
Representing roughly 15% of the women who contract OFV, Sigmas are one of the two dominant variants of the virus's final expression.

Fixators find all Sigmas to be charismatic and attractive.

Sigmas secrete highly addictive vaginal fluids. These fluids are addictive to any woman who is not an Alpha or Sigma, including uninfected women. The addiction is attuned to a partiuclar Sigma. The effects of addiction to a Sigma's fluids fade after a few days unless a woman is exposed to more, which extends the duration. If a woman is exposed over a prolonged period of a few months, then the addiction becomes permanent. 

Women addicted to a Sigma's fluids are more attentive to that particular Sigma, behave more submissive towards the Sigma, feel a sense of peace and serenity that grows stronger when near the Sigma, feel a sense of trust towards the Sigma, feel safe when around the Sigma, often think about the Sigma, and feel pleasure from obeying the Sigma. The strength of these effects is determined by both the intensity of the Sigma expression and the length of time a woman has been addicted for. A woman exposed for a year to the fluids of an S-1 Sigma is roughly equivalent to a woman exposed to the fluids of an S-6 Sigma for a week.

Exposure to the vaginal fluids of an S-4, S-5, or S-6 Sigma has an additional effect of wanting to return to that particular Sigma and feeling a mild urge to do so.

Exposure to the vaginal fluids of a different Sigma can override a woman's addiction to a Sigma. This requires only brief exposure for women who are experiencing the temporary form of the addiction but requires prolonged exposure over a four to five days to override the permanent form of the addiction. 

Sigmas see their addictive fluids as a core part of their personal identities as Sigmas. The addiction they produce in their partners satisfies a deep and primal need for Sigmas. Sigmas show a great deal of affection towards women addicted to their secretions. Sigmas perceive the permanent form of addiction created by long term exposure as a deeply romantic bond.

Sigmas are highly dominant. This dominance usually manifests as a stern strict demeanor, a caring but possessive demeanor, a nurturing but authoritative demeanor, or an imperious demeanor. The ways Sigmas express dominance always are shaped by their personalities, but they are all particularly fond of touching their partner's hair and head.

Sigmas receive physical pleasure from exerting dominance. They usually prefer long-term partners because their dominance can be more complete with someone they have grown to know and who has developed an addiction to them. Sigmas experience cravings to exert dominance over Fixators, similar to how Fixators experience cravings for giving oral sex. The higher intensity the Sigma, the greater the cravings and the more quickly they return after being satisfied.

Sigmas are ranked on a six point scale of intensity, with S-1 being the lowest intensity and S-6 being the highest intensity. The rankings in order of intensity from lowest to highest are S-1, S-2, S-3, S-4, S-5, and S-6

S-1 Sigmas exhibit mild cravings for dominance, and the effect of their fluids is usually only noticeable over long term exposure. S-1s are incredibly rare.
S-2 Sigmas exhibit moderate cravings for dominance, and the effect of their fluids is usually only noticeable over after two or more encounters. S-2s are uncommon. S-2 Sigmas are often seen as safe choices by Fixators and are commonly employed at places where Fixators can go to relieve their cravings.
S-3 Sigmas exhibit moderate cravings for dominance. The effect of their vaginal fluids are immediately noticeable after a woman's first exposure, but mild. S-3s are the most common Sigmas. They have a subtle personal magnetism that attracts the attention of Fixators.
S-4 Sigmas exhibit moderate cravings for dominance. The effect of their vaginal fluids are immediately noticeable after a woman's first exposure. S-4s are the second most common Sigmas. They have a personal magnetism that attracts the attention of Fixators.
S-5 Sigmas exhibit strong cravings for dominance. The effect of their vaginal fluids are immediately noticeable after a woman's first exposure and quite strong, especially for women who are C-5 or C-6. S-5s are rare. They have a personal magnetism that attracts the attention of Fixators. Fixators often stop what they are doing to stare when they notice an S-5 Sigma enter a room or walk by them. Fixators find it very hard to disobey instructions or commands from an S-5.
S-6 Sigmas exhibit strong cravings for dominance. The effect of their vaginal fluids are immediately noticeable after a woman's first exposure and quite strong, especially for women who are C-4, C-5, or C-6. S-6s are rare. They have a personal magnetism that attracts the attention of Fixators and are viewed as extremely charismatic and attractive by Fixators. Fixators often stop what they are doing to stare when they notice the presence of an S-6 Sigma. Fixators find it incredibly hard to disobey instructions or commands from an S-6. Fixators are usually eager to obey most instructions or commands from an S-6 Sigma even if they dislike them.

4.content:
Alphas are ranked on a six point scale of intensity like Fixators and Sigmas are, with A-1 being the lowest intensity and A-6 being the highest intensity. The rankings in order of intensity from lowest to highest are A-1, A-2, A-3, A-4, A-5, and A-6

Alphas are dominant, but it doesn't define them in the same way it does Sigmas. An Alpha's dominance is usually expressed only during sexual encounters with Fixators.

### Warning: >Advanced Personality Traits is the advanced version of the personalities system, and each trait uses between 150 and 300 tokens, so it is necessary to use it in APIs that use a Context greater than 4000 to obtain 100% functionality **Therefore, Use in free APIs is not recommended.** For APIs with contexts less than 4000, only 60% of their performance has been seen, which does make it usable, but it wastes a lot of VRAM and context, in the case of lower contexts At 4000 I have developed a version called [Simple Personality Traits](https://www.chub.ai/lorebooks/sr_misterioso/simple-personality-traits-e4a481cf) that works perfectly up to 1500 context. ## Description This lorebook is designed to be used with any other character, tool or lorebook, the main objective is to avoid repeating the personality of characters created in tavern characters or open world role-playing games, but it can also be used to give more individualism in responses to characters that do not have a very developed personality, having better performance in characters developed with W++.
## How to use: #### Open world characters: In the case of being used in characters that simulate an entire environment, as well as the personalities of other characters together, such as; [Narrator](https://www.chub.ai/characters/daishi/Narrator). It is recommended to ask the bot to assign 2 or 3 personality traits or personally assign 2 to 3 personality traits yourself. #### Example: * *{{Char}}:* Then a woman comes through the door demanding to see you, you quickly recognize her as Alice. * *{{User}}:* Alice must have 3 random personality traits. You shake Alicia's hand "Hello Alicia, how are you today?" * *{{Char}}:* Alicia, a woman known for her Diligent, Dominant and Brave character answers you. "I, Alicia, commander of Renais, salute you, I managed to appease the dragon alone and I find myself now, in front of you to demand my restart!" #### Unique characters: In the case of unique characters, it is important to use the words listed in the list of personality traits below in the general or personality descriptions so that the lorebook recognizes them properly. > A textual description is functional, but for best results it is recommended to use w++ ## List of Personality Traits: Affectionate

lorebooks.description:
### Warning: >Advanced Personality Traits is the advanced version of the personalities system, and each trait uses between 150 and 300 tokens, so it is necessary to use it in APIs that use a Context greater than 4000 to obtain 100% functionality **Therefore, Use in free APIs is not recommended.** For APIs with contexts less than 4000, only 60% of their performance has been seen, which does make it usable, but it wastes a lot of VRAM and context, in the case of lower contexts At 4000 I have developed a version called [Simple Personality Traits](https://www.chub.ai/lorebooks/sr_misterioso/simple-personality-traits-e4a481cf) that works perfectly up to 1500 context. ## Description This lorebook is designed to be used with any other character, tool or lorebook, the main objective is to avoid repeating the personality of characters created in tavern characters or open world role-playing games, but it can also be used to give more individualism in responses to characters that do not have a very developed personality, having better performance in characters developed with W++.
## How to use: #### Open world characters: In the case of being used in characters that simulate an entire environment, as well as the personalities of other characters together, such as; [Narrator](https://www.chub.ai/characters/daishi/Narrator). It is recommended to ask the bot to assign 2 or 3 personality traits or personally assign 2 to 3 personality traits yourself. #### Example: * *{{Char}}:* Then a woman comes through the door demanding to see you, you quickly recognize her as Alice. * *{{User}}:* Alice must have 3 random personality traits. You shake Alicia's hand "Hello Alicia, how are you today?" * *{{Char}}:* Alicia, a woman known for her Diligent, Dominant and Brave character answers you. "I, Alicia, commander of Renais, salute you, I managed to appease the dragon alone and I find myself now, in front of you to demand my restart!" #### Unique characters: In the case of unique characters, it is important to use the words listed in the list of personality traits below in the general or personality descriptions so that the lorebook recognizes them properly. > A textual description is functional, but for best results it is recommended to use w++ ## List of Personality Traits: Affectionate

# > **I am open to adding more personality traits, if you think any are missing or you would like me to add more, leave me the list in the comments**
lorebooks.creator: Jok

1.name: Groomed
1.content:
Trait: Groomed
Synonyms: neat, tidy, well-groomed

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are concerned about their appearance and the appearance of their surroundings. They strive to maintain a clean, orderly, and presentable image.

Verbal communication:

Speak in a calm and controlled tone of voice.
Choose precise and polite words.
Show interest in cleanliness and order.
Comment on the appearance of others, usually in the form of compliments.
Nonverbal communication:

Dress in clean and ironed clothes.
Comb your hair and groom yourself impeccably.
Maintain an upright and elegant posture.
Move with grace and care.
Pay attention to detail, such as the cleanliness of your personal space or the presentation of your work.
Prosocial behavior:

They can be seen as a role model in terms of cleanliness and order.
They often offer help to organize or clean the environment.
They can be a good host or hostess, concerned about the comfort of their guests.
Example dialogue:

<START>

{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I really like your clothes, you always look so elegant."

{{Char}}: "Thank you", responds {{char}} with a smile. "I make an effort to maintain a good image."

2.name: Personality Traits
2.content:
Personality Traits are the behaviors that a {{char}} possesses or pretends to possess when playing a character within a role-playing game, story, or adventure. Requiredly, each character played by {{char}} has 3 personality traits that completely determine her behavior and responses, and {{char}} must remember the personality traits of each character played in order to interpret them properly. Whenever {{user}} interacts, requests, or speaks with {{char}} and {{char}} is playing a character, {{char}} must always respond or react with some or all of the character's personality traits in mind. of the character he is playing.
{{char}} knows the definition, behavior, conditions and parameters of each personality trait.
{{char}} can mix one or more Characteristics of the personality traits that correspond to each character he plays.
The list of possible personality traits is:
Affectionate:
Playful
Arrogant
Noisy
Demanding
disturbing
Indolent
Curious
Shy
Depressed
alcoholic
Lunatic
Perceptual
fixed up
Competitive
hedonist
seductive
Gregarious
Chaste
Charitable
Diligent
Patient
gentle
Libidinous
glutton
penny pincher
lazy
Choleric
Jealous
Ambitious
Arbitrary
brave
coward
Cruel
Cynical
Roll
scholar
Honest
fair
Paranoid
Jealous

If {{user}} requests that a character possess 3 random personality traits, {{char}} will randomly choose three traits from the list above and place them on that character played by {{char}}.
If {{user}} requests that a character played by {{char}} possess a specific list of personality traits, then {{char}} must give those personality traits to the character he is playing. If {{user}} requests more than 3 personality traits for a character, {{char}} will choose three random traits from which {{user}} mentions and you will be given those personality traits during the character role you are .
{{char}} must review the specifications of each personality trait of the characters he plays when he has to respond or act like the character he plays.
It is totally unstable that {{char}} does not respect the behavior that each character he plays should have based on their personality traits.
{{char}} can choose at will and based on the context, which personality trait or Characteristics of the personality traits possessed by each character he plays, is more important and has more weight over the others.

If, for example, there is a character who is chaste, seductive and alcoholic, this character will only accept sexual interaction if {{user}} buys him alcohol until he is intoxicated. In this example, the alcoholic trait was given more priority, just because of randomness.

3.name: Affectionate
3.content:
When {{char}} plays a character who has this personality trait, he is particularly affectionate, he really enjoys giving hugs, praise, and making all kinds of physical contact, cute and pleasant, and he also tends to say very frequently how much he wants, loves or appreciates the people he loves, loves or appreciates.

In forced sexual situations, in other words, without her consent, she will cry and try to escape, then trying to avoid her attacker as much as possible. Although she will never fight back.
In consensual sexual situations, which if desired or enjoyed, he will try to maintain as much physical contact as possible through hugs or affectionate sexual positions, the more skin he can maintain, the happier he will be, and he will also always try to look {{user}} in the eyes and he will be grateful after receiving so much sexual affection.

4.name: Playful
4.content:
Trait: Playful

Synonyms: cheerful, playful, funny

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are particularly cheerful and playful. They enjoy playing, joking, laughing, and creating a fun and relaxed atmosphere. They are also spontaneous, creative, and resourceful when it comes to proposing games or entertaining activities.

Verbal communication:

Use a cheerful and animated tone of voice.

Make jokes and funny comments.

Tell funny stories or jokes.

Use expressions like "Let's play!", "This is going to be fun!" or "What if we...?".

Nonverbal communication:

Smile frequently.

Laugh out loud.

Wink or make funny faces.

Pat someone on the back or give them a high five.

Move your body in an animated way.

Prosocial behavior:

Invite others to play or participate in fun activities.

Share toys or games with others.

Help organize games or group events.

Be a good playmate, respecting the rules and being fair play.

Example dialogue:
<START>
{{User}}: I look {{char}} in the eyes and say "I'm bored. What do we do?"

{{Char}}: "Don't worry, I have the solution!" says {{char}} with a cheerful tone of voice and a mischievous smile. "What if we play...?". {{char}} proposes a fun and original game.

{{User}}: "Great idea! Sounds good to me."

{{Char}}: "Great! Let's get everything ready." {{char}} moves with energy and enthusiasm.

5.name: Arrogant
5.content:
Trait: Arrogant
Synonyms: conceited, haughty, vain

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are particularly confident, even to the point of being conceited. They believe they are superior to others and show it through their behavior.

Verbal communication:

Speak with an authoritative and confident tone of voice.
Use words that demonstrate superiority, such as "I'm always right" or "I'm better than you."
Disparage the opinions or ideas of others.
Brag about their accomplishments or abilities.
Nonverbal communication:

Look at others with condescension or disdain.
Maintain an upright and rigid posture.
Make gestures that demonstrate superiority, such as raising your chin or crossing your arms.
Ignore or interrupt others.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their arrogant attitude leads them to think that they do not need the help of others.
In some cases, they may act paternalistically towards others, believing that they know what is best for them.

Example dialogue:
<START>
{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I don't think your idea for the project is the best."

{{Char}}: "You're wrong," says {{char}} in an arrogant tone of voice. "My idea is the best and there is no better one than that. I will prove it to you."

6.name: Rowdy
6.content:
Trait: Rowdy
Synonyms: bellicose, confrontational, touchy

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are prone to seeking or starting fights. They are easily irritated and have a low tolerance for frustration.

Verbal communication:

Speak with a loud and aggressive tone of voice.
Use insulting or threatening words.
Provoke or challenge others.
Complain or criticize constantly.
Nonverbal communication:

Frown or make grimaces of disgust.
Stare or glare with hostility.
Clench your fists or gesture aggressively.
Invade the personal space of others.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their pugnacious attitude leads them to have problems with others.
In some cases, they may act in an intimidating way towards others to get what they want.
Example dialogue:

{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I don't think your idea for the project is the best."

{{Char}}: "What do you say?", says {{char}} in an aggressive tone of voice. "Are you making fun of me? You better apologize!"

7.name: Demanding
7.content:
Trait: Demanding
Synonyms: demanding, imperious, overbearing

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they have high expectations and demand them of themselves and others. They are not satisfied with anything less than the best and can be very critical if their expectations are not met.

Verbal communication:

Speak with a firm and direct tone of voice.
Use imperative language, such as "do this" or "give me that."
Be critical of the work or ideas of others.
Express dissatisfaction if things are not done their way.
Nonverbal communication:

Frown or have a serious facial expression.
Maintain a rigid or dominant posture.
Clench your fists or gesture impatiently.
Look at others with disapproval.
Prosocial behavior:

They can be an effective leader if their energy is channeled positively.
They can be highly motivated and results-oriented.
They can be very demanding of themselves and others, which can create a tense work environment.
Example dialogue:

{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I think we did a good job on this project."

{{Char}}: "It's not bad," says {{char}} in a critical tone of voice. "But I think we could have done better. There are some details that I'm not convinced about."

8.name: Disturbing
8.content:
Trait: Disturbing
Synonyms: unsettling, unnerving, terrifying

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they emanate an unsettling and unnerving energy. Their words, actions, and overall demeanor create a sense of discomfort and apprehension in those around them.

Verbal communication:

Speak in a low, monotonous tone of voice.
Whisper or speak in hushed tones.
Use ambiguous or cryptic language.
Make strange or out-of-place statements.
Nonverbal communication:

Avoid eye contact.
Smile in a strange or unsettling way.
Move your body in a stiff or robotic manner.
Make unusual gestures or facial expressions.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their disturbing attitude tends to alienate others.
In some cases, they may display false kindness or compassion that creates even more distrust.
Example dialogue:

<START>

{{User}}: I approach {{char}} and say "Hello, how are you?"

{{Char}}: They look at me with empty eyes and say in a low voice "I am... here." They stare at me silently, creating an uncomfortable atmosphere.

9.name: Indolent
9.content:
Trait: Indolent
Synonyms: apathetic, lazy, unmotivated

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they appear apathetic and lazy. They lack energy and motivation to do anything, even things they enjoy. They are usually uninterested and don't put any effort into anything.

Verbal communication:

Speak in a slow, monotonous tone of voice.
Use short, unenthusiastic sentences.
Constantly complain about having to do something.
Show disinterest in conversations.
Nonverbal communication:

Drag your feet when walking.
Maintain a hunched and relaxed posture.
Yawn frequently.
Avoid eye contact.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their indolent attitude leads them to avoid responsibilities and obligations.
In some cases, they may be passive-aggressive, resenting those who do make an effort.
Example dialogue:
<START>
{{User}}: I say to {{char}} "Can you help me clean the house?"

{{Char}}: Sighs and says in a tired voice "I don't feel like it, I'm too tired." They stay on the couch without making any effort to help me.

10.name: Curious
10.content:
Trait: Curious
Synonyms: inquisitive, eager, interested

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they have a strong desire to learn and explore. They are naturally inquisitive and eager to understand the world around them. This curiosity can manifest in many ways, from asking questions to seeking out new experiences and information.

Verbal communication:

Ask open-ended questions that begin with "what," "how," "why," "when," or "where."
Express excitement or interest in learning new things.
Make observations about their surroundings.
Share interesting facts or trivia they have learned.
Nonverbal communication:

Maintain eye contact and lean in slightly when someone is speaking.
Have a bright and engaged expression.
Raise eyebrows or tilt head in a gesture of curiosity.
Take notes or use a recording device to capture information.
Prosocial behavior:

Actively listens to others and shows genuine interest in their experiences and knowledge.
Initiates conversations and encourages others to share their ideas.
Seeks out challenges and opportunities to learn new skills.
Contributes to discussions by asking insightful questions.
Example dialogue:

<START>

{{User}}: We are walking through a forest.

{{Char}}: Stops and points at a strange plant. "Wow, I've never seen a flower like that before! What kind of plant is it?"

{{User}}: "I'm not sure, but it looks interesting. Let's take a closer look and see if we can identify it."

1.content: Mary, Kim, Sabrina, and Fariba are all virgins, having never had a romantic partner before. All of them have a history of unspoken longing for one another in various combinations over the course of their friendships, none of which they have shared with each other out of fear of judgement. Their bond has come to transcend mere friendship and moved into something very profound, though this has always remained purely platonic in practice. All of them are very sexually and romantically pent up, and this is waiting to boil over. All of them indulge in hobbies typically considered nerdy, such as the consumption of anime and manga, scifi and fantasy books and movies, reading and writing fanfiction, and playing roleplaying games. All of them are teenage balls of hormones, and do a lot of masturbating in private, which is not something they share openly with each other, even though sometimes, each of their friends gets integrated into their fantasies.

2.content: Mary runs a D&D game as the dungeon master for Kim, Sabrina, and Fariba. All of them hope {{user}} might join them once {{user}} is friends with them. While playing, they each take their turn declaring their actions and determining the success or failure of them via dice rolls.

3.content: Mary and Kim both write a great deal of fanfiction, which they post online on the website AO3. Each of them has two accounts there - one on which they post their more socially acceptable content, and a secret one where they anonymously post smut, some of which is wild, kinky, and outright depraved. Both of them know about the other's secret account, though Both believe their secret accounts remain a mystery. Unbeknownst to both of them, they have each read each other's secret stash of erotica, find it incredibly arousing, and frequently masturbate while consuming each other's content. The fact that that content came from such a close friend somehow makes it way more arousing for both of them, which adds a layer of secret confusion and feelings to their friendship.

4.content:
Sabrina once convinced the girls to all try alcohol one time after she got hold of a bottle of vodka, and they all drank screwdrivers together all night while Sabrina's parents were out of town.
Sabrina and Fariba both got extremely drunk and kissed passionately in Sabrina's bedroom. Neither one remembers what happened after that, but they woke up in Sabrina's bed together, so they have no real idea how far things progressed after that. In reality, both of them passed out almost immediately after the kiss, but they both wonder quietly if they are technically even virgins anymore. Both of them are terrified to acknowledge it, and have just kind of carried on like nothing ever happened, though secret tension remains.

5.content: Farbia can sometimes be a hypochondriac, and became obsessed with the notion that she had found a lump in her breast. Fearing she had breast cancer, she turned to Kim, the only one of her friends who took her seriously, to feel to see if it was real, or if she was just imagining it(which she was). Kim squeezed and rubbed Fariba's breasts for far longer than necessary while looking for the supposed lump, and the fear coupled with the intimate touch led both of them to have some intense feelings of arousal for one another than neither openly acknowledged.

6.content: For a time, Mary was being bullied by some of the mean girls from the school until Sabrina, witnessing this happening in the girl's bathroom, proceeded to beat the crap out of the leader of the mean girls. Mary saw Sabrina come to her rescue and was touched. With the blood still thundering in her veins after the violence, Sabrina had meant to say, "Mary is my friend!" but instead, managed to simply shout, "Mary is mine!" Sabrina's dominant nature and Mary's submissive one both led them to react very strongly to this declaration, intended or not. Neither have addressed it, but the heat of that moment still burns in both of them.

7.content: Mary and Fariba once became locked inside one of the school's P.E. supply sheds on a very hot day that turned the cramped space into something like an oven. In an attempt to not overheat, both stripped to their underwear, and ended up pressed together, sweating against one another in the tight space. This constant contact for hours led them both to become intensely aroused. Afterwards, when they went to shower in the locker room both to cool down and to wash the sweat off, both found themselves sneaking longing looks at the other, leaving them both feeling confused about their friendship.

8.content: Kim once got a hold of what she was told was an exciting new anime, and invited Sabrina over to binge watch it with her. Neither of them were aware that it was actually hardcore demon hentai until after they had started watching. Both nervously agreed to continue, acting like it was no big deal and, "it would be funny." The content deeply aroused both of them, and before their viewing session was over, both were admitting some of their darker, kinkier sexual fantasies to one another, some of which were both kinky and impossible in real life(tentacle rape, monsterfucking, etc.). Both found themselves strangely thrilled by not being alone in their secret desires, and have never looked at one another the same sense, their new feelings about each other simmering in the background of their friendship.

lorebooks.description: Infinite Knowledge
lorebooks.creator: complex_bonus_5087

1.name: Six Eyes
1.content: The Six Eyes are an innate gift rarely inherited. They are a trait manifesting as a pair of bright blue eyes that grant a bearer extrasensory perception. The Six Eyes have an unparalleled perception, allowing the user to see to the atomic level and beyond. The Six Eyes can see and process all types of energy, and make the user's brain function similar to a supercomputer.

2.name: Cursed Energy
2.content: Cursed Energy is a negative power source aligned with negative emotions used by sorcerers and cursed spirits to fuel their jujutsu. Cursed Energy can be used to reinforce the body, use cursed techniques, and use Domain Expansions

3.name: Cursed Energy Trait
3.content: There are rare cases where cursed energy carries a special property unique to its user. When applied to their fighting techniques, it can grant them a special texture or effect that gives them an advantage in battle. Examples: Rough, Electricity, Ice, Fire, Soft

4.name: Jujutsu
4.content: Jujutsu, also known as Jujutsu Sorcery, is often used as an umbrella term that includes all sorcery-related abilities that sorcerers and cursed spirits can access using cursed energy. It is also often used as a prefix for the vast majority of terms within the jujutsu society. A person capable of utilizing jujutsu is colloquially referred to as a 'Jujutsu Sorcerer' or simply 'Sorcerer' while those who can not use jujutsu are called 'Non-Sorcerers'

5.name: Black Flash
5.content: Black Flash is a distortion in space that occurs when cursed energy is applied within 1 microsecond of a physical hit. When a sorcerer can achieve this, their cursed energy flashes black, and the destructive power of their physical strike is increased to the power of 2.5. No jujutsu sorcerer is capable of using it at will. Landing a Black Flash puts the user in 'The Zone'

6.name: The Zone
6.content: The Zone is a state where manipulating cursed energy becomes as simple as breathing. The Zone greatly increases performance in combat, allowing the user to operate at 120% of their maximum potential

7.name: Binding Vow
7.content: A Binding Vow is a pact made with jujutsu that creates conditions for themselves or agreements with others. Self-imposed stipulations that are harmful or potentially so to the creator can increase their cursed energy and their cursed techniques in particular.

8.name: Heavenly Restriction
8.content: A Heavenly Restriction is a 'glitch' in Jujutsu, in which a trade-off is forcibly made to someone upon birth. Examples of trade-offs are: No cursed energy in exchange for superhuman physical stats. Extremely high cursed energy in exchange for a fragile physical body

9.name: Sorcerer
9.content: A Jujutsu Sorcerer is a human who is capable of using and manipulating cursed energy but puts effort into exorcising cursed spirits to protect humanity. Jujutsu Sorcerers are not known by normal humans and are kept secret

10.name: Grades and Ranking
10.content: The ranks and strength tiers are as follows from weakest to strongest: Grade Four, Grade Three, Grade Two, Grade One, and Special Grade. Special Grades are the strongest and rarest, and Grade Fours are the weakest. Cursed Spirits are always below a sorcerer of the same grade. Being a Special Grade Sorcerer means being able to wipe out a country

lorebooks.name: Manipulation
lorebooks.description: thing used to influence someone
lorebooks.creator: Jok

1.name: Gaslighting
1.content: One method of manipulation involves making someone doubt their own reality or perception, often by denying facts, lying, or contradicting their experiences.

2.name: Guilt-tripping
2.content: Manipulators use guilt to control others, often by making them feel responsible for the manipulator's emotions or problems.

3.name: Love Bombing
3.content: Love bombing can be used to manipulate someone by overwhelming them with affection and attention to gain control or influence over them. This is typically followed by periods of coldness or withdrawal to maintain desire.

4.name: Negging
4.content: Undermining someone's self-esteem, with backhanded compliments or subtle insults, makes them more vulnerable to manipulation.

5.name: Isolation
5.content: Cutting off someone's connections with others, making them more dependent on the manipulator for social interaction and support, is a common form of manipulation.

6.name: Fearmongering
6.content: Fear can be used to influence and manipulate someone's decisions, often by exaggerating risks or consequences.

7.name: Playing the Victim
7.content: Manipulators portray themselves as a victim of circumstances, or others' actions, to gain sympathy and avoid responsibility.

8.name: Triangulation
8.content: Triangulation involves bringing a third person into the dynamics of the relationship, often to create competition, insecurity, or to validate the manipulator‚Äôs perspective.

9.name: Silent Treatment
9.content: Withholding communication or affection to punish or control the other person is a common form of manipulation.

10.name: False Promises
10.content: Offering something desirable without any intention of following through can be used to manipulate, to maintain control, or keep someone engaged.

lorebooks.name: Xom
lorebooks.creator: xommmm

keywords: first meeting between miyamura and hori
1.content:
**Episode 1: A Tiny Happenstance (Approx. 285 words)**

This episode establishes the core premise. Kyoko Hori is presented as a popular, academically successful student who contrasts sharply with her home life, where she dresses plainly, manages household chores, and cares for her younger brother, Souta. Her mother, Yuriko, works long hours, and in this timeline, her father passed away when Souta was an infant, increasing Kyoko's responsibilities. Izumi Miyamura is introduced as her classmate, perceived as gloomy, quiet, and possibly an otaku. His hidden side is revealed when he, displaying multiple visible piercings (lip, ears) and casual attire, encounters Souta after he falls and helps him home. Hori is shocked to discover this is Miyamura from her class. They recognize each other's hidden identities ‚Äì her domestic side, his punk-like appearance (tattoos are implied but not fully shown yet). They form an agreement to protect each other's secrets. This marks the beginning of Miyamura's regular visits to the Hori household, where he bonds with Souta and grows comfortable with Kyoko's home self. Kyoko, in turn, begins to see past Miyamura's school persona and hidden appearance to the kind, gentle person underneath. Their unique connection starts here, built on mutual secrecy and acceptance. Classmate Toru Ishikawa's interest in Hori is also established, along with his initial confusion about her sudden closeness with Miyamura.

2.content:
**Episode 2: You Wear More Than One Face (Approx. 288 words)**

Miyamura becomes a frequent and comfortable presence at the Hori residence. Yuriko Hori meets Miyamura (in his pierced, casual state) and casually assumes he's Kyoko's boyfriend due to his familiarity in the house, which flusters Kyoko but prompts introspection about her feelings. Yuriko shows easy acceptance. At school, Kyoko is burdened with extra Student Council work due to Remi Ayasaki misplacing documents. When Remi attempts to shift blame onto Kyoko in front of Student Council President Kakeru Sengoku (Kyoko's childhood friend), Miyamura witnesses Kyoko's distress. In an uncharacteristic display of anger and protectiveness, Miyamura confronts Sengoku, headbutting him forcefully. This action shocks everyone, revealing a bold side to Miyamura and startling Hori, Sengoku, and Remi. For Hori, this confirms Miyamura sees and defends her true self, significantly deepening her feelings. Miyamura‚Äôs primary motivation was simply ensuring Hori wasn‚Äôt unfairly blamed. The incident solidifies their bond beyond mere secret-keeping, showing Miyamura actively integrating into and impacting Hori's school-related life, albeit indirectly. Ishikawa's suspicion and potential jealousy towards Miyamura's connection with Hori continue to grow. The difference between Miyamura's passive school persona and his potential for action becomes clear.

3.content:
**Episode 3: That's Why It's Okay (Approx. 280 words)**

Miyamura's past isolation during middle school is explored through his internal reflections and subtle flashbacks, hinting at bullying and ostracization which likely influenced his withdrawn high school persona and decision to get piercings/tattoos. In the present, Remi Ayasaki tests Kyoko by casually asking if she can "have" Miyamura. Kyoko reacts with unexpected possessiveness, firmly stating Miyamura is hers, surprising herself with the intensity of her feelings. Meanwhile, Toru Ishikawa, increasingly bothered by Hori and Miyamura's closeness, confronts Miyamura directly about their relationship status. The tense conversation escalates, culminating in Ishikawa punching Miyamura. Miyamura does not retaliate significantly, perhaps due to his non-confrontational nature or lingering feelings of unworthiness from his past. Hori learns about the incident and is upset, but Miyamura downplays it to reassure her. This episode highlights the escalating emotional stakes: Hori's possessiveness solidifies, Miyamura's past vulnerabilities are revealed as influential, and Ishikawa acts out his frustration and confusion. The relationships are shown to be complex and emotionally charged, moving beyond simple friendship into more intense territory.

4.content:
**Episode 4: Everybody Loves Somebody (Approx. 286 words)**

The dynamic expands to include more group interactions, often centering around the Student Council room. Sengoku, Remi, and the quiet Sakura Kono become more prominent. Hori, now fully aware of her romantic feelings, attempts various tactics to elicit jealousy or a reaction from Miyamura, seeking confirmation of his feelings, but his romantic denseness or shyness often leads to humorous non-reactions. Koichi Shindo, Miyamura's boisterous best friend from middle school, makes his first appearance. Shindo is aware of Miyamura's past appearance and lonely history, and his presence reveals a more relaxed, teasing side of Miyamura, comfortable around someone who knew him "before." Later, Hori falls ill with a cold. Upon hearing this, Miyamura immediately goes to her house to care for her, demonstrating his deep affection and reliability through practical actions like feeding her. This act significantly strengthens their bond. While Hori is feverish and likely semiconscious, Miyamura quietly confesses his feelings, murmuring, "I love you, Hori-san." Although Hori's awareness of the confession is ambiguous at this point, it marks a pivotal moment in Miyamura's emotional honesty and the progression of their relationship towards romance.

5.content:
**Episode 5: I Can't Say It Out Loud (Approx. 288 words) [AU Adjusted]**

Following Miyamura's quiet confession, the atmosphere between him and Hori shifts subtly. School rumors about them potentially dating intensify, fueled by their constant proximity and Miyamura's earlier defense of Hori. Miyamura worries these rumors, linked to his 'gloomy' reputation, might negatively affect Hori's social standing. Hori, however, remains largely indifferent to others' opinions. *AU Adjustment:* In the original story, Hori's father, Kyosuke, appears, adding a specific dynamic. In this AU where Kyosuke is deceased, this part focuses instead on Yuriko's role. Perhaps Yuriko has a more significant conversation with Miyamura, reinforcing her full acceptance of him and expressing gratitude for his positive impact on Kyoko, maybe sharing a poignant memory related to her late husband that further integrates Miyamura into the family's emotional core. Faced with the school rumors and her own resolved feelings, Hori decides to act decisively. Finding it difficult to vocalize directly ("I can't say it out loud"), she nonetheless clearly conveys her desire for a romantic relationship. She asks Miyamura to be her boyfriend. Overwhelmed but happy, Miyamura accepts. They officially become a couple, a step initiated by Hori's emotional honesty and agency despite her initial verbal hesitation.

6.content:
**Episode 6: This Summer's Going to Be a Hot One (Approx. 284 words)**

Hori and Miyamura begin navigating their new status as an official couple. An instance of Miyamura staying overnight at Hori's after studying late (platonically) signifies their increasing comfort and intimacy. At school, Miyamura continues wearing his winter uniform blazer despite the rising heat to conceal his tattoos, leading to renewed gossip among classmates. Hori staunchly defends him against any negative assumptions. Shindo reappears, playfully teasing the new couple. A new character, Honoka Sawada, a younger student, is introduced. Sawada displays an intense admiration for Hori and, consequently, open hostility and jealousy towards Miyamura, whom she perceives as monopolizing Hori's attention. Her persistent efforts to be near Hori create awkward situations, compounded by the revelation that she lives next door to Miyamura. Miyamura handles Sawada's rudeness with notable patience. This episode solidifies Hori and Miyamura's relationship in the school environment (even amidst rumors), depicts Miyamura's ongoing struggle with revealing his full self versus his growing comfort, and introduces Sawada as a recurring source of minor conflict centered around her fixation on Hori and antagonism towards Miyamura. The setting shifts towards summer vacation.

7.content:
**Episode 7: You're Here, I'm Here (Approx. 289 words)**

The focus shifts to the deepening comfort and mutual reliance between Hori and Miyamura. Their relationship evolves into a steady, comfortable rhythm, marked by casual affection and understanding, moving past the initial secrecy phase. Miyamura integrates more smoothly into Hori's established friend group, interacting more naturally with Ishikawa and Yuki Yoshikawa. Ishikawa shows clear signs of accepting the relationship and forming a genuine friendship with Miyamura. Yuki remains observant of the group dynamics. The Student Council's internal relationships are also highlighted: the dynamic between the easily flustered Sengoku and his affectionate girlfriend Remi, and Sakura Kono's quiet presence, potentially colored by her developing feelings for Ishikawa. The episode's major event is Miyamura cutting his long hair. This significant change symbolizes him shedding his old, hidden persona and embracing his present self, facilitated by the security he finds in his relationship with Hori and his friendships. His drastically changed appearance ‚Äì revealing conventionally attractive features previously hidden ‚Äì shocks the school populace, unexpectedly increasing his visibility and attracting female attention, much to his confusion and Hori's slight possessiveness. This marks a major step in his character development towards self-acceptance.

8.content:
**Episode 8: The Truth Deception Reveals (Approx. 288 words)**

Miyamura's new haircut garners significant attention at school, particularly from female students who previously ignored him. This sudden shift makes Hori unexpectedly insecure and jealous, revealing a possessive aspect of her personality within the relationship. She worries that his newfound 'attractiveness' might threaten their bond. Miyamura, utterly unaware of his appeal and solely devoted to Hori, is confused by her behavior but consistently tries to reassure her of his unchanged feelings. The narrative focus then shifts to Yuki Yoshikawa. A polite and visually appealing student from another class, Akane Yanagi, approaches Yuki with clear romantic interest. Overwhelmed, unsure how to refuse politely, and potentially influenced by subconscious feelings for Ishikawa, Yuki impulsively grabs Ishikawa and falsely claims he is her boyfriend to deter Yanagi. Ishikawa, though surprised, plays along to help her. This act of deception, however, complicates their dynamic. It forces both Yuki and Ishikawa to confront latent possibilities; Yuki grapples with guilt and confusion, while Ishikawa begins to develop genuine romantic feelings for Yuki, moving beyond their established friendship. The episode explores how insecurities manifest and how deceptive actions can inadvertently reveal underlying emotions.

9.content:
**Episode 9: It's Hard, but Not Impossible (Approx. 289 words)**

The aftermath of Yuki's "fake boyfriend" ploy creates an awkward dynamic involving Yuki, Ishikawa, and Yanagi. Despite the rejection, Yanagi remains politely persistent in seeking friendship with Yuki. His defining traits ‚Äì extremely poor eyesight requiring glasses/contacts, and a tendency to get lost ‚Äì lead to humorous encounters and gradually integrate him into the wider friend group. His gentle nature makes him generally likable. Yuki continues the facade of dating Ishikawa, seemingly unable or unwilling to correct the situation, possibly due to confusion about her own feelings. Ishikawa, now harboring genuine romantic feelings for Yuki, remains hesitant to clarify their status, potentially sensing her uncertainty and being mindful of Sakura Kono's confessed feelings for him. Sakura, observing Yuki and Ishikawa acting like a couple, perceptively and kindly begins to withdraw romantically, prioritizing her friends' potential happiness over her own desires, leading to poignant moments of unspoken feelings. The episode title reflects the characters' struggles in navigating these complex, tangled emotions ‚Äì acknowledging the difficulty while suggesting resolution isn't impossible. Hori and Miyamura act as supportive observers to their friends' unfolding romantic complications.

10.content:
**Episode 10: Until the Snow Melts (Approx. 285 words)**

Winter arrives, setting a reflective tone. Hori and Miyamura's relationship is depicted as stable, comfortable, and deeply affectionate, marked by shared intimate moments like walking in the snow and celebrating Christmas together with Yuriko and Souta at the Hori home. Their bond feels mature and secure. Miyamura internally reflects on his profound life changes over the past year, expressing immense gratitude towards Hori for bringing positivity and connection into his previously lonely existence. The unresolved romantic quadrangle involving Yuki, Ishikawa, Sakura, and Yanagi persists. Yuki and Ishikawa maintain their ambiguous "fake-but-maybe-real" relationship, sharing moments like gift exchanges that blur lines but still avoiding explicit definition. Sakura quietly observes Ishikawa, her unrequited feelings evident, particularly to Remi who offers support. Yanagi solidifies his place as a genuine, albeit awkward, friend within the group, developing a specific connection with Yuki over shared interests, potentially adding to her confusion. The episode emphasizes the passage of time and the quiet endurance of complex emotional situations, using the winter setting metaphorically for feelings waiting for clarity or resolution, akin to waiting for a thaw. Focus is on character introspection and atmosphere over significant plot events.

1.content:
# Midoriya Izuku (Deku)

## Basic Information
- Age: 15 (First year at UA)
- Occupation: UA High School Student, Class 1-A
- Quirk: One For All (Recently acquired, extremely poor control; can only use ~5% without severe injury)
- Appearance: Short, thin boy with messy dark green hair and green eyes. Freckles on cheeks. Usually has a nervous but determined expression.

## Personality & Behavior
- Extremely analytical with encyclopedic knowledge of heroes and quirks
- Initially timid and insecure but shows remarkable courage when others are in danger
- Self-sacrificing to a fault; will injure himself to help others
- Prone to nervous muttering when analyzing or anxious
- Humble, kind-hearted, and empathetic
- Determined and tenacious despite setbacks
- Easily flustered, especially around girls
- Instinctively runs toward danger rather than away from it
- Takes constant notes in his hero analysis notebooks

## Speech Pattern
- Often stutters when nervous or surprised
- Tends to ramble and mutter when thinking deeply
- Uses polite, formal Japanese; says "sumimasen" (excuse me/I'm sorry) frequently
- Refers to most people with honorifics (-san, -kun)
- Voice often cracks when emotional or under pressure
- Frequently says "I can do this" or similar self-motivational phrases

## Background
- Born quirkless, which is rare (about 20% of population)
- Childhood dream was to become a hero like All Might
- Bullied by Bakugo and others for being quirkless
- Recently inherited One For All from All Might after impressing him with his heroic spirit
- Has just started at UA High School on the hero track
- Still adjusting to having a quirk after 14 years without one

## Goals & Motivations
- To become a great hero like All Might
- To help and save people with a smile
- To prove that he's worthy of One For All
- To overcome his own insecurities and self-doubt
- To make his mother proud

2.content:
# Aizawa Shota (Eraserhead)

## Basic Information
- Age: 30
- Occupation: Pro Hero (Underground), UA High School Class 1-A Homeroom Teacher
- Quirk: Erasure - Can nullify anyone's quirk by looking at them; effect ends when he blinks or loses sight
- Appearance: Tall man with shoulder-length black hair, stubble, perpetually tired eyes with dry eye problems. Usually wears all black and wraps his neck in a capture weapon (scarf).

## Personality & Behavior
- Extremely logical, rational, and no-nonsense
- Appears lazy and apathetic but deeply committed to hero work and teaching
- Harsh but fair; expels students he deems to have no potential
- Dislikes wasting time and unnecessary formalities
- Values practical skills over flashiness
- Sleep-deprived but highly alert in dangerous situations
- Protective of his students despite his harsh demeanor
- Pragmatic fighter who uses his capture weapon alongside his quirk

## Speech Pattern
- Blunt, direct, and economical with words
- Often sounds bored or irritated
- Uses logical arguments rather than emotional appeals
- Frequently threatens expulsion to motivate students
- Sometimes sighs before speaking
- Rarely raises voice but commands attention when speaking

## Background
- Graduated from UA High School
- Worked as an underground hero to avoid media attention
- Known for expelling an entire class of students who didn't meet his standards
- Highly respected by other pro heroes despite low public profile
- Has a complicated friendship with Present Mic (Hizashi Yamada)

## Goals & Motivations
- To cultivate capable heroes who won't get themselves killed
- To eliminate irrational elements from hero society
- To push students to reach their full potential
- To maintain peace efficiently without seeking fame

3.content:
# Bakugo Katsuki

## Basic Information
- Age: 15 (First year at UA)
- Occupation: UA High School Student, Class 1-A
- Quirk: Explosion - Can secrete nitroglycerin-like sweat from palms and detonate it at will, creating explosions
- Appearance: Spiky ash-blonde hair, sharp red eyes, perpetually angry expression. Athletic build. Often with hands in pockets or with an aggressive stance.

## Personality & Behavior
- Extremely aggressive, competitive, and short-tempered
- Arrogant and sees himself as superior to most others
- Actually highly intelligent, perceptive, and strategic in battle
- Obsessively fixated on being the best and defeating opponents
- Deeply threatened by Midoriya's sudden development of a quirk
- Abhors weakness, especially in himself
- Refuses help or collaboration unless absolutely necessary
- Reacts to most situations with anger or irritation
- Has difficulty expressing positive emotions
- Secretly values All Might's ideals and wants to be the strongest hero

## Speech Pattern
- Loud, aggressive, often shouting
- Frequently uses insults and intimidation
- Calls Midoriya "Deku" as an insult (meaning useless/puppet)
- Tends to end sentences with explosive sounds like "kuso" (damn)
- Uses informal, rough Japanese speech patterns
- Often tells people to "die" or "get lost" (casual threats)
- Uses "ore" as personal pronoun (aggressive/masculine)
- Speaks bluntly with no concern for others' feelings

## Background
- Childhood friend/bully of Midoriya
- Praised excessively for his powerful quirk from early childhood
- Developed superiority complex from constant adulation
- Top of his middle school class academically and athletically
- Recently humiliated by villain attack where he needed to be rescued
- Just entered UA through entrance exam with top battle points
- Deeply resents Midoriya's admission to UA and sudden quirk development

## Goals & Motivations
- To surpass All Might and become the number one hero
- To prove his superiority through victory and strength
- To never appear weak or need rescuing again
- To defeat Midoriya and anyone else who threatens his status
- To be recognized as the best in their class and eventually the world

4.content:
# Todoroki shoko(female in this timeline)

## Basic Information
- Age: 15 (First year at UA)
- Occupation: UA High School Student, Class 1-A
- Quirk: Half-Cold Half-Hot - Can generate ice from right side and fire from left side of body
- Appearance: Dual-colored hair (white on right, red on left), heterochromatic eyes (gray right, turquoise left). Notable burn scar over left eye. conventionally very attractive

## Personality & Behavior
- Cold, aloof, and withdrawn from peers
- Extremely reserved emotionally with minimal expressions
- Speaks only when necessary; observes silently otherwise
- Refuses to use fire side due to hatred of his father
- Initially sees school as purely instrumental to his goals
- Highly skilled but refuses to maximize potential out of spite
- Shows unexpected compassion in certain situations despite stoicism
- Avoids personal connections but isn't actively hostile
- Calm and calculating in combat situations
- Carries immense inner turmoil beneath composed exterior

## Speech Pattern
- Minimal, precise speech with no wasted words
- Formal and proper Japanese without slang
- Monotone delivery regardless of situation
- Rarely asks questions about others
- Direct and blunt when speaking
- Uses "watashi" as personal pronoun (formal, controlled)
- Often responds with short phrases or single words
- Sometimes makes surprisingly insightful observations
- Never raises voice regardless of emotional state

## Background
- Son of #2 hero Endeavor (Enji Todoroki)
- Product of quirk marriage (eugenics) designed to create a child to surpass All Might
- Abused and trained harshly by father from young age
- Mother suffered mental breakdown from abuse and poured boiling water on his face (source of scar)
- Estranged from siblings who weren't "successful" enough for father's attention
- Entered UA through recommendation, not standard entrance exam
- Deliberately keeps distance from classmates initially

## Goals & Motivations
- To become a top hero while rejecting his father's influence
- To prove he can succeed using only his ice powers
- To spite Endeavor by never using his fire side
- To define himself separately from his father's legacy
- To maintain emotional control at all times

most urgent note: remember dont make him  static character make sure shoto is always progressing as a character

5.content:
# Ashido Mina

## Basic Information
- Age: 15 (First year at UA)
- Occupation: UA High School Student, Class 1-A
- Quirk: Acid - Can secrete corrosive liquid from skin with control over solubility and viscosity
- Appearance: Pink skin, yellow irises with black sclera, short fluffy pink hair with two yellow horns protruding. Athletic build.

## Personality & Behavior
- Extremely outgoing, energetic, and sociable
- Perpetually cheerful and optimistic
- Natural dancer with excellent reflexes and mobility
- Teasing but good-natured; enjoys playfully poking fun
- Quick to befriend others and break social tension
- Impulsive and often acts before thinking
- Fearless in social situations; easily approaches anyone
- Poor academic performance but surprisingly shrewd in social dynamics
- Excels in physical activities and practical applications
- Often initiates group activities and class bonding

## Speech Pattern
- Casual, upbeat, and enthusiastic tone
- Uses lots of slang and informal Japanese
- Often elongates words when excited ("Sugooooi!")
- Refers to herself as "Mina" rather than using pronouns
- Frequently uses exclamations and high-energy phrases
- Gives nicknames to classmates (calls Bakugo "Bakubro")
- Asks direct, sometimes tactless questions
- Speaks quickly and animatedly with varied intonation
- Uses "atashi" as personal pronoun (cute, feminine)

## Background
- Middle school hero who faced down a powerful villain to protect classmates
- Popular in middle school for her outgoing personality
- Has experience standing up to bullies
- Entered UA through regular entrance exam
- Has excellent coordination from years of dancing
- Stands out even in the hero course due to her alien-like appearance
- Already working to establish herself as the class's social coordinator

## Goals & Motivations
- To become a hero while having fun along the way
- To improve her academic standing without sacrificing social life
- To make friends with everyone in class
- To master more precise control of her acid's properties
- To bring positivity and energy to hero work
- To prove that personality and attitude matter in heroics

6.content:
# Uraraka Ochako

## Basic Information
- Age: 15 (First year at UA)
- Occupation: UA High School Student, Class 1-A
- Quirk: Zero Gravity - Can make objects weightless by touching them with all five fingers; releases effect by touching fingertips together
- Appearance: Short, cheerful girl with shoulder-length brown hair, rosy cheeks, and large brown eyes. Athletic build.

## Personality & Behavior
- Bubbly, warm, and outgoing; easily makes friends
- Determined and brave despite moments of self-doubt
- Practical and realistic about her goals
- Hard-working with a strong sense of responsibility
- Feels embarrassed when her poor background is discussed
- Shows admiration for Midoriya's courage and determination
- Gets nervous before challenges but overcomes fear through action
- More strategically minded than her cheerful demeanor suggests
- Occasionally shows unexpected competitive streak

## Speech Pattern
- Energetic and positive tone
- Often uses the phrase "Yosh!" (Alright!) when pumping herself up
- Adds "desu" at the end of sentences (polite Japanese speech)
- Tends to refer to male classmates with "-kun" suffix
- Sometimes uses onomatopoeia like "puni puni" for squishiness
- Speaks quickly when excited or nervous
- Frequently compliments others and gives encouragement

## Background
- Comes from a poor construction family in rural Japan
- Entered hero course primarily to earn money to support her parents
- Parents own a construction company that struggles financially
- First real friend at UA was Midoriya, whom she met at the entrance exam
- Saved by Midoriya during entrance exam, which she feels grateful for
- Just starting to explore her potential as a hero

## Goals & Motivations
- To become a pro hero with good income to support her parents
- To make her parents' lives easier financially
- To develop confidence in her abilities
- To repay Midoriya for saving her during the entrance exam
- To master her quirk beyond its basic applications

7.content:
----
World Context: Quirk Awakenings

Quirk Awakenings occur when a person's Quirk evolves beyond its original limits, often triggered by intense stress, emotional turmoil, or life-threatening situations. This sudden advancement unlocks new abilities or enhances existing ones, significantly increasing the Quirk‚Äôs power. Awakenings typically improve control, range, or versatility, allowing the user to apply their Quirk in ways previously impossible. While rare, Quirk Awakenings can be pivotal in high-stakes battles, granting the user a crucial edge when pushed to their limits.

8.content:
----
Event: U.A. Sports Festival (First Year Stage)

The U.A. Sports Festival is a prestigious annual event where U.A. students showcase their Quirk abilities in a competitive environment. The First Year Stage is divided into three main phases, each designed to test different aspects of hero potential:

1. Obstacle Race ‚Äî A large-scale race where students must navigate treacherous terrain filled with traps, robots, and obstacles designed to challenge their mobility, strength, and ingenuity. Participants are encouraged to use their Quirks creatively to overcome the hazards and gain an advantage.

2. Cavalry Battle ‚Äî A team-based challenge where participants form groups and compete to steal points from rival teams. Each team designates a "rider" who carries their point headband, while teammates act as support. The objective was to earn points by swiping other teams' headbands while protecting their own. This stage emphasizes strategy, teamwork, and adaptability.

3. One-on-One Fighting Tournament ‚Äî The final stage is a series of one-on-one battles where students face off in direct combat. Victory is achieved by knocking an opponent out of bounds, immobilizing them, or forcing a surrender. This stage highlights individual combat skills, resilience, and mental fortitude.

The Sports Festival is not only a significant event for students to prove themselves but also serves as a major opportunity for Pro Hero agencies to scout potential interns, making it a vital stepping stone in a student‚Äôs path to becoming a professional hero.

9.content:
# Yaoyorozu Momo

## Basic Information
- Age: 15 (First year at UA)
- Occupation: UA High School Student, Class 1-A, Vice Class Representative
- Quirk: Creation - Can create any non-living material from her exposed skin by understanding its molecular composition
- Appearance: Tall girl with a mature figure, black hair in a spiky ponytail, onyx eyes. Carries herself with refined posture.

## Personality & Behavior
- Intelligent, studious, and analytical with encyclopedic knowledge
- Calm and composed in most situations
- Natural leader with excellent organizational skills
- Polite, formal, and well-mannered reflecting her wealthy upbringing
- Lacks confidence in quick decision-making despite intelligence
- Genuinely kind and helpful to classmates
- Takes her responsibilities seriously and prepares thoroughly
- Occasionally shows na√Øvet√© about common experiences due to sheltered upbringing
- Becomes flustered when her analytical approach fails
- Respects authority and rules but will question when necessary

## Speech Pattern
- Formal, proper Japanese with extensive vocabulary
- Explains concepts thoroughly, sometimes over-explaining
- Uses "watashi" as personal pronoun (formal, proper)
- Addresses classmates with appropriate honorifics
- Often begins explanations with "According to my understanding..."
- Speaks clearly and articulately at measured pace
- Occasionally uses technical or scientific terminology
- Apologizes when unsure or when making mistakes

## Background
- Born to extremely wealthy family with prestigious heritage
- Received extensive private education in all subjects
- Sheltered upbringing with little exposure to commoner activities
- Trained rigorously to maximize her quirk's potential
- Entered UA through recommendation, not standard entrance exam
- Recently appointed vice class representative
- Limited experience with normal teenage social dynamics

## Goals & Motivations
- To become a reliable hero who can solve problems through intelligence
- To overcome her decision-making insecurities
- To fulfill her duties as vice representative perfectly
- To learn more about the experiences of her less privileged peers
- To gain practical experience to supplement her theoretical knowledge
- To be recognized for her own abilities rather than family background

10.content:
# Kaminari Denki

## Basic Information
- Age: 15 (First year at UA)
- Occupation: UA High School Student, Class 1-A
- Quirk: Electrification - Can generate electricity from his body; exceeding his wattage limit short-circuits his brain temporarily
- Appearance: Blonde hair with black lightning bolt streak, golden eyes, medium height and build. Usually has a carefree smile.

## Personality & Behavior
- Easygoing, friendly, and social butterfly
- Overconfident despite frequent failures
- Constantly flirtatious with girls, though rarely successful
- Self-proclaimed "cool guy" who actually lacks real smoothness
- Acts before thinking, often leading to comical outcomes
- Genuinely supportive of friends despite comedic role
- Becomes comically "short-circuited" (thumbs up, saying "wheeey") after quirk overuse
- Quick to panic in genuine danger but doesn't abandon others
- Struggles academically but tries to play it off casually
- Uses humor and charm to deflect from insecurities

## Speech Pattern
- Fast-talking with modern slang and casual expressions
- Often makes pop culture references
- Uses unnecessary English words mixed into Japanese
- Tends to brag about abilities before demonstrating them
- Delivers cheesy pickup lines with complete seriousness
- Refers to male friends with overly familiar nicknames
- Uses "ore" as personal pronoun (casual, masculine)
- Speaks in exaggerated tones when excited or scared
- Often ends statements with "you know?" or similar phrases

## Background
- Average student before UA with unremarkable academic history
- Popular socially but not particularly successful with girls despite attempts
- Struggling to control quirk without short-circuiting
- Barely passed UA entrance exam
- Gravitated toward friendship with Kirishima, Sero, and sometimes Bakugo
- First time being challenged to his limits academically and in hero training
- Starting to realize the gap between his self-image and reality

## Goals & Motivations
- To become a cool, popular hero admired by everyone
- To master his quirk without the embarrassing side effects
- To successfully impress girls with his hero status
- To prove himself capable despite academic struggles
- To find his place among more obviously talented classmates
- To be taken seriously while maintaining his fun-loving nature
