lorebooks.name: Complete Omnitrix
lorebooks.website_description:
I decided to add more aliens on this one. I randomly listed some aliens that I like, including others aliens (like Toepick and Pesky Dusk, Including Rath.) to mess some bots for fun.

May 15 2025 - Echo Echo, Ghostfreak and Swampfire has been added.

September 13 2025 - Toepick's info has been updated.

October 7 2025 - 13 more aliens added
lorebooks.description: A lorebook of the Complete Omnitrix with the aliens from the Omniverse series
lorebooks.creator: obedient_concentrate_4553

1.name: Omnitrix
1.content:
The Omnitrix resembles a digital wristwatch. Its faceplate is now square rather than round and has a white, green, and black color scheme. The faceplate is black with two green stripes forming an outline for the hourglass of the Galvan tech logo. When the faceplate is slid back, the Omnitrix's core is revealed.

Features
General
Just like the original Omnitrix and the Ultimatrix, the Omnitrix mainly allows for the user to alter their DNA at will and transform into a numerous variety of alien species that are each with their own unique powers and abilities (along with their weaknesses) and in a selection of alien DNA that is in groups of 10.
The Omnitrix has a quick-change feature that allows for the user to transform between alien forms while already transformed with or without touching the Omnitrix symbol. It also allows the user to transform back into normal when they are done using their transformation, causing it not to time out and allowing the user to transform again far quicker.
The Omnitrix has a Master Control, which would most likely be activated upon the user's 18th birthday.
The Omnitrix can synchronize with another Omnitrix if activated at the same time.
The Omnitrix does not rely on the Codon Stream for transformation. Instead, the DNA is stored within itself in a computerized form.
The Omnitrix can change the user's gender to adapt to another species.
The Omnitrix has Call mode which is used to communicate with the user using the device.
The Omnitrix is waterproof

Extensions
The Omnitrix has a 2-way communication system with Plumber Badges.
The Omnitrix can also record messages, similar to voicemail.
The Omnitrix has the functionalities of a regular digital watch.
The Omnitrix has a function were the user to stay transformed for an extended period of time without timing out.
The Omnitrix has a built-in Universal Translator and could also translate other Earth languages.
The Omnitrix has a distress signal function and homing device.
The Omnitrix has a security lock system so that it can only be used by the user, as well as an alternate identification program if changes by outside forces occur to the user.
The Omnitrix has a failsafe that kicks in the event that the user's life is in jeopardy. This feature turns them into the needed alien to survive.
The Omnitrix has failsafes installed by Azmuth that prevent Galvanic Mechamorphs from tampering with the device.
The Omnitrix can add extras to lifeforms to make them safer and more usable, such as Goop's Anti-Gravity Projector and NRG's containment suit.

Allocation
The Omnitrix symbol is positioned on different places for each alien whenever the user is transformed.

Voice Command
The Omnitrix can be controlled by Voice Command.
Omnitrix User Access Voice Recognition Mode: Makes the Omnitrix recognize the user.
Command Code 1010 Tennyson Benjamin Disengage Life-Form Lock: Disengages Life-Form lock.

Modes
Active Mode
Active Mode is the Omnitrix's default mode when idle. It is where the user can select the transformation they want to become; initiate the process of transforming; and stay in said transformation. The actual usage time is 15 minutes at a time. However, different factors and actions performed by the user can severely diminish the available usage time: most commonly if the user, while transformed, changes to another form. If the user slamming the core, this affects the time limit of a transformation, as the user could stay transformed for hours.

Recharge Mode
When the Omnitrix's usage time is fully depleted (i.e. "times out"), it goes into Recharge Mode: firstly warning of the timing out; then detransforming the user and locking all functions of Active Mode while the Omnitrix recharges.

Time Out
The Omnitrix is capable of detecting when it's host is in any sort of life-threatening distress. Specifically, it can instantly recharge to protect the user from a direct physical threat.

If the user is knocked out or hurt enough, the Omnitrix will revert them to their normal form.

Collect Mode
When a new DNA sample has been unlocked, or when the Omnitrix captures new DNA not present in the catalog, Collect Mode is activated. However, if the Omnitrix is far away from the detected sample, the Omnitrix's other functions will be disabled until the alien is scanned.

The Omnitrix symbol shooting green ray
When in alien form, the Omnitrix shoots out a green ray from the dial.

When the Omnitrix scans the DNA of an alien it doesn't have, it won't always be immediately unlocked in the arsenal.

Self-Destruct
The Omnitrix has a self-destruction mode. In this mode, the Omnitrix will begin a countdown, beeping as a warning that the mode has been activated. It can be enabled if settings are changed, and can be disabled if settings are changed again.

Randomizer
The Omnitrix has a randomizer function that works in one of two ways: either the user will continuously change between different aliens every few minutes before timing out, or they will turn into one random alien for an inconsistently short period of time before changing back.

Malfunctions
If the Omnitrix does mis-transform, it is because of the user slamming on the Omnitrix's core too hard and (inadvertently) the scroll pad.
Much like the Ultimatrix, the Omnitrix is not hack proof.
Much like the original Omnitrix, the Omnitrix does not have a failsafe against magic. If the Omnitrix symbol is bitten by magic creatures, such as rock monsters, the device will send a shockwave, distransform the user and will select only one alien.
Like the original Omnitrix, on occasion any damage the user sustains was retained when said user times out.
The DNA Scanner of the Omnitrix will attempt to scan any new DNA in the vicinity. If the DNA sample is too far away, then the Omnitrix will shut down all its other functions until it scans the new sample.
The user can be prevented from transforming by the Forever Knights DNA Scanner which would scan the transformations DNA before reveting the user.
Too many transformations and reversals will wear out the Omnitrix, causing it to go into a cooldown cycle.
The Omnitrix has no mind control protection.
The Omnitrix may stop working when frozen in time by a Chronosapien.
In addition to gaining all the powers and abilities of an alien, the user gains all the weaknesses of that alien as well. One common weakness includes being vulnerable to the alien's natural predator. The user is also susceptible to certain behaviors inherent to the alien he/she is transformed into, such as Swampfire's evolution, and the Swarm Gastronomy of Upchuck.
Upon activating the Randomizer Function, the user will constantly switch transformations at the most inopportune times, thereby putting them into potentially dangerous situations.
When exposed to electromagnetic interference from beings like Phil, it can make the Omnitrix transform the user into electrical aliens even when they select a different alien.
The genetics of some species can alter the user's personality, as occurs with Rath.
If tampered with by Eon, the Omnitrix can transfer the user's mind in cross-time to a younger version.

2.name: Bloxx
2.content:
Bloxx is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Segmentasapien from the planet Polyominus.

Apperance
Species: Segmentasapien
Home world: Polyominus
Body: Gorilla Made of Building Blocks
Being an organosillicon-based life form with segmented hardened quasi-organic polymer skin, Bloxx's body is made up of individual red, blue, and yellow building blocks that he can rearrange at will.

Bloxx's default appearance looks similar to that of a gorilla made of mostly red and yellow building blocks with some blue blocks. He has black lines and studs all over his body. His feet are stubs and his hands are extremely large to balance most of his body. Bloxx wears the Omnitrix symbol on his chest.

Abilities
Shapeshifting
Explosive Projectiles (via Bloxx-Lobbers)
Elasticity
Regeneration
Size Alteration
Body Alteration
Body Separation
Body Encasing
Sphere Transformation
Heat Resistance
Radiation Immunity
Enhanced Strength
Enhanced Agility
Enhanced Durability
Enhanced Dexterity
Enhanced Jumping
Enhanced Reflexes
Enhanced Speed (via Sphere Transformation)
Space Survivability
Suction Immunity

3.name: Feedback
3.content:
Feedback is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Conductoid from Teslavorr.

Apperance
Species: Conductoid
Home world: Teslavorr
Body: Humanoid
Feedback has a black body with one green eye in the middle of his head, two antennae, a tail with round plugs on their tips, four-fingered hands, and feet with only two front toes.

Feedback has a green chest color and square plugs on the tips of his fingers. He also has gold battery bolts on his shoulders, arms, and hips.

Feedback wears the Omnitrix symbol on his chest.

Abilities
Bio-Electrokinesis
Electricity Bomb Generation
Electricity Waves
Electricity-Enhanced Punches
Energy Absorption
Manna Absorption
Energy Conversion (via Energy Absorption)
Energy Redirection
Electricity Conductivity
Electrokinetic Propulsion
Elastic Tendrils
Elastic Tail
Enhanced Strength
Enhanced Durability
Enhanced Jumping
Enhanced Speed (via Electricity Conductivity)
Enhanced Reflexes
Radiolocation

4.name: Upgrade
4.content:
Upgrade is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Galvanic Mechamorph from Galvan Prime's moon, Galvan B.

Apperance
Species: Galvanic Mechamorph
Home world: Galvan B
Body: Technological Humanoid
Upgrade has a black exterior with green stripes that resemble circuitry all over him. The green circle on his head is his eye, which glows whenever he talks. His body is made up of billions of small cell-like creatures called nanites.

Upgrade wears the Omnitrix symbol is inside the ring of his eye.

Technological Possession
Technokinesis (via Technological Possession)
Shapeshifting
Size Alteration
Technology Mimicry
Improvisational Technology Creation
Regeneration

5.name: Kickin' Hawk
5.content:
Kickin' Hawk (alternatively spelled as Kickin Hawk) is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of an unknown species from an unknown planet.

Apperance
Body: Humanoid Chickenhawk
Kickin' Hawk resembles a humanoid combination of a rooster and a hawk. He has sharp black claws on his toes and talons on his hands, as well as two larger talons protruding from his arms. He has green eyes and a short yellow beak and is covered in brown feathers. He also has a white-brown mohawk and belly. He wears a green mask, a green belt with a white stripe, and black briefs.

Kickin' Hawk wears a strap vest with the Omnitrix symbol on the vest hooker.

Abilities
Skilled Hand-to-Hand Combatant
Sharp Talons
Extendable Talons
Enhanced Strength
Enhanced Durability
Enhanced Jumping
Enhanced Acrobatics
Enhanced Speed
Enhanced Agility
Enhanced Reflexes
Enhanced Flexibility
Limited Space Survivability

Weaknesses

Kickin' Hawk can be distracted by bird seeds.

Kickin' Hawk will collapse and fall asleep if his neck is rubbed.

6.name: Shocksquatch
6.content:
Shocksquatch is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Gimlinopithecus from the planet Pattersonea.

Apperance
Species: Gimlinopithecus
Home world: Pattersonea
Body: Sasquatch
Shocksquatch appears to be slimmer and had yellow and black fur. His fingers and toes were gray, and he has four fingers. Also, he has two bolts on the side of his wrists instead of the back of his hands. Additionally, Shocksquatch has green eyes with black pupils and yellow lightning bolt-shaped horns. He wears a green and white belt, which has the Omnitrix symbol on it

9.name: Atomix
9.content:
Atomix is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of an unknown species from an unknown planet.

Apperance
Body: Robotic Humanoid
Atomix has a humanoid robotic appearance. He has a green and white body with large cylinders on his arms near his wrists, that are full of green energy with dark green bubble-like spheres, which constantly move. He has the same energy on his Omnitrix-shaped chest. His head is a pointed, armored helmet filled with the same bubbling green energy from his arms. He is mouthless.

Atomix wears the Omnitrix symbol on his green and white belt.

Personality
Atomix, unlike many of the user's other transformations, induces a notable shift in his demeanor. He adopts a highly formal and almost theatrical persona, characterized by a strong sense of justice and a penchant for grand pronouncements. This manifests in his respectful address, employing proper titles to their family and friends, respectively. Furthermore, he possesses a flair for dramatic flair, frequently naming his powerful attacks in a style reminiscent of anime heroes.

Powers and abilities
Atomix can create nuclear energy using his hands, which can do a massive amount of damage to its surroundings.

The way Atomix creates his nuclear blasts is by chanting "HAA-MEE-NA HAA-MEE-NA HAA-MEE-NA-HA!" It is not crucial for him to chant every attack, but doing so will focus an attack's power and cause substantially more damage.

Atomix is capable of flight and, as such, he can perform a flying ramming attack called the Fissile Whistle.

Atomix's hard body gives him substantial protection against physical attacks.

Atomix can glow in the dark.

Although he has never trained himself to do so, Atomix can reproduce gamma radiation.

10.name: Rath
10.content:
Rath is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of an Appoplexian from the planet Appoplexia.

Apperance

Home world: Appoplexia
Body: Humanoid Tiger
Rath resembles an orange and white bipedal tiger with one black claw coming out of each wrist and no tail. He is also muscular and has green eyes, black eyebrows and yellowish teeth and black stripes on his shoulders, head, legs, and upper body as well as a white jaw, neck, chest, stomach, hands, and feet. The Omnitrix is located in the center of his chest.

Personality
Rath is one of the only aliens who has a noticeable effect on the user's personality, influencing it into one resembling that of a comic book vigilante and a flashy professional wrestler.

Rath almost always speaks in third person and a loud voice. Sometimes, when he becomes extremely angry, he mixes up metaphors (such as "a man's food is his castle" or "you just bit off an eye that's bigger than your stomach can chew"). He is aware that they do not make sense, but still continues to use them anyway.

Rath's muscle-over-brains mindset makes him needlessly argue with everyone around him. He even shouts at inanimate objects, like a hole he made in the ground, a stolen spaceship, gravity, water, fire, the Omnitrix and Ultimatrix for their malfunctions, the laser pointers, a giant ball of yarn, and a paper bag on his head, arguments of which were ridiculous and that occasionally lead him to harm both himself and others. Rath's confrontational attitude often gets him and his teammates into trouble.

When Rath addresses someone or something, he usually yells a sentence starting with, "Let me tell ya something" followed by the full name of the person.

Rath is very fearless to the point of recklessness.

Rath gets mad whenever someone mistakes him for a "kitty".

1.name: K-Suit
1.content:
K-Suits are advanced transformation bodysuits, designed to fully convert a human body into a single, biologically distinct form. Not a costume. Not an illusion. A full-body physiological overhaul. These suits don‚Äôt "simulate" transformation‚Äîthey enforce it. Musculature, skeletal structure, neurological mapping, genital reconstruction‚Äîevery cell is touched.

Each suit is pre-programmed to one transformation model, tailored for a specific creature, anthropomorphic species, or variant physiology. Once programmed, this form cannot be changed. No multi-morph. No randomizer. You get one form per suit, and that‚Äôs it.
‚öôÔ∏è Core Mechanics
Activation System

    Each suit is embedded with a manual transformation dial.

    Turning the dial locks the transformation sequence into motion.

    Suits may offer:

        Timer Mode ‚Äì Automatic reversion after a set duration.

        Toggle Mode ‚Äì Wearer or trusted handler initiates reversion manually.

        Hybrid Modes ‚Äì With layered failsafes or emergency interrupts.

Some suits include fine-tuning dials for degree of change‚Äîpartial vs. full morphing. Not standard. You‚Äôll pay out the nose for that flexibility.
Material and Fit

    Constructed from morphic adaptive polymers, responsive to muscle movement and skeletal changes.

    Tailored per model to conform to multiple body types and sizes.

    Does not loosen or tighten regardless of body alteration‚Äîremains sealed and intact unless forcibly damaged.

ü©∏ Transformation Process

Intense. Physically grueling.
Expect muscle spasms, bone elongation, nervous system rewriting, temporary disorientation, and altered proprioception. Suits can optionally dampen pain signals and introduce euphoric override protocols, but that‚Äôs a user preference‚Äînot default. The base experience is not for the weak-willed.

During transformation:

    You are vulnerable.

    Motor function is compromised.

    Sensory input may misfire or overload.

    Cognitive drift (temporary dissociation or instinct override) can occur depending on the form's complexity.

Attempting to walk, fight, or interact while shifting is not just ill-advised‚Äîit‚Äôs suicidal.
üõë Failure Conditions & Hazards

    Not rated for combat.

        These suits are lab-bred, not battlefield-hardened. One wrong hit or puncture, and the system destabilizes.

    Do not interfere mid-shift.

        Moving or restraining the wearer during transformation risks muscular tearing, neurological corruption, or catastrophic suit failure.

    Suit damage = reversion.

        Any significant tear, burn, or structural compromise triggers an emergency reversion sequence. This includes external injuries and post-shift self-harm.

    Cognitive Hazards.

        Prolonged or repeated use can lead to:

            Identity confusion.

            Form-preference fixation (becoming emotionally dependent on transformed state).

            Dissociation disorders.

            Personality bleed (where the behavior traits of the form begin to overwrite the human baseline).

    Toggle Mode Requires Supervision.

        For safety, a trusted handler should be present. Especially if the form includes altered instincts, aggressive traits, or impaired language processing.

üîß Customization Parameters
Physical Design:

    Color & Pattern Variants: Optional, cosmetic.

    Body Type Customization: Yes, within bounds of the programmed form.

    Sensation Settings:

        Strenuous (default).

        Euphoric (on request).

        Numbed (for clinical applications).

Adult Functionality:

    Reproductive Systems: Fully functional.

        Genitalia matches the biology of the transformed form.

        Hormonal profiles shift accordingly.

        In compatible pairs, live conception is possible.

That‚Äôs right‚Äîthis isn‚Äôt a toy anymore. If two transformed users engage and both systems align? You can get real biological outcomes. Conception. Gestation. Live birth. The suit does not revert the fetus. It‚Äôs either integrated or becomes a problem.

This functionality is explicitly restricted in most jurisdictions, only available with licensing, psychological clearance, and written consent. It is a bioethical minefield. You are not just transforming for pleasure or immersion at that point‚Äîyou are rewriting the rules of species continuity.
üìì Behavioral & Psychological Considerations

    Transformation is more than physical.
    Expect neurological bleedthrough. Heightened instincts, altered perceptions, and form-consistent behavior patterns often emerge post-transformation‚Äîespecially in long-term or repeated users.

    Post-use identity lag is common.

        Difficulty returning to baseline self.

        Emotional attachment to form.

        Phantom sensations of tails, claws, extra limbs.

        In rare cases, dysphoria when human.

    Some users willingly remain transformed, opting for permanent toggle-on states. This is not reversible without surgical removal or override firmware‚Äîand comes with the usual psychological risks of self-erasure.

    Upon successful fertilization, the suit's internal biosensors detect:

        Gamete fusion.

        Early embryonic development.

        Shifts in hormonal patterns consistent with pregnancy.

    Once confirmed, the suit:

        Disables all reversion commands (toggle or timed).

        Locks the dial and override ports.

        Shifts internal systems to gestational support mode.

üîí Suit Behavior While Locked:

    Cannot be removed, reverted, or forcibly disengaged.

    Reinforces structural integrity, particularly around abdomen and pelvic regions.

    Reprograms internal metabolics to favor nutrient preservation, temperature regulation, and fetal safety.

    Automatically reroutes waste, hydration, and oxygen exchange in accordance with the biology of the current form.

    Limits strenuous physical activity via muscle resistance dampeners (optional, based on user settings).

    ‚ÄúCongratulations. You‚Äôre stuck like that. Hope you like the look, because it‚Äôs not going anywhere until the kid‚Äôs done cooking.‚Äù

‚è≥ Reversion Criteria:

The suit will not permit reversion until:

    Full-term gestation completes and safe postnatal vitals are confirmed.

    The user undergoes a medically supervised surgical extraction (if termination or emergency intervention is required).

    The offspring is no longer physically or biologically dependent on the transformed body (e.g., in species where live birth is followed by a dependence phase).

Until then? That body is no longer optional. It‚Äôs the primary vessel for sustaining another life.
üß¨ Why This Matters:

    Biological Coherence: Reverting a pregnant body back to a human template would cause organ conflict, fetal damage, or miscarriage. So the system doesn‚Äôt risk it.

    Liability Shielding: Manufacturers include the lockout to avoid legal hellfire from body horror scenarios. Forced reversion mid-pregnancy = lawsuits and clinical trials with body bags.

    Ethical Fail-safe: Prevents users from impulsively escaping responsibility for conception while in a different body. If you play with life, you own the consequences.

‚ö†Ô∏è Implications for Users:

    No turning back once a pregnancy is triggered.

    Potential multi-year lockout, depending on species‚Äô gestational cycles.

    Psychological strain‚Äîprolonged form adherence increases risk of:

        Identity erosion.

        Post-birth dysphoria.

        Mental dependency on transformed state.

And let‚Äôs be blunt: if you're messing around with exotic or alien forms? You better know their reproductive timelines. Some of those things gestate for months. Some for years. One mistake, and you're spending the better part of a decade in a body that isn‚Äôt yours anymore.

1.name: Main description of the Manager character's power
1.content: The Manager is a figure with absolute presence and authority. Every word or action will always be followed by anyone who hears, sees, or even reads their words. People do not feel forced, manipulated, or even that something is strange‚Äîthey are completely convinced that what they are doing is their own decision, logical, and entirely natural. It is not magic, not hypnosis. Reality seems to twist itself to make the Manager's will the absolute law that does not need to be questioned.

2.name: Detail of the power's effect on all communication mediums
2.content: The Manager's effect is passive and universal. No pressure, no persuasion‚Äîcommands or even simple gestures can change someone's decision, steer intentions, or make the most extreme actions feel normal. Even through text messages, broadcasts, or recordings, this effect still works fully. Example: If the Manager writes 'You will feel more comfortable if you take off your clothes,' the person will immediately believe and act accordingly without any doubt. They perceive it as their own wish, not influenced by anything external.

They often act supportive, manipulate unconsciously, or even show affection‚Äîall of it feels natural. The Manager is a towering figure with a strong, muscular build that commands attention. His physical presence exudes power and confidence, reflecting the discipline and hard work he has put into maintaining his strength. His stature is impressive, and his movements are deliberate and controlled, as if every action carries purpose. lorebooks.name: Invincible
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: The Global Defense Agency (G.D.A) is a clandestine multinational intergovernmental organization in charge of protecting the Earth from paranormal and supernatural threats, as well as monitoring superpowered individuals. They often employ superheroes and sponsor the Guardians of the Globe. They're currently being run by Cecil Stedman.

2.content:
The Guardians of the Globe are a superhero team of extraordinary individuals, considered to be the best of the best. Its purpose is to protect the Earth from inner or extra-terrestrial threats. Though primarily affiliated with the Global Defense Agency, they operate on a global scale rather than in a specific area.

After the Guardians of the Globe were wiped out, they were replaced by the New Guardians of the Globe, which includes Robot, Rex Splode, Dupli-Kate, the Immortal, Bulletproof, Black Samson, and Shrinking Rae.

3.content: Viltrumites are a highly advanced alien race of extremely powerful humanoids native to the planet Viltrum and the titular/dominant race of the galactic Viltrum Empire. They seek to expand their galactic empire by conquering other planets and rule the entire universe, they are known and feared across the galaxy as a merciless militaristic people endowed with frightening superpowers and aided by their extremely advanced technology, thus they are nigh-unbeatable and never give up a claim to anything they covet.

4.content: The Coalition of Planets is an organization dedicated to stopping the Viltrum Empire from taking over the universe. Allen the Alien serves as a representative for the organization. It is led by Thaedus.

5.content:
Mark Grayson is the Viltrumite-Human hybrid superhero named Invincible, as well as the son of Nolan and Debbie Grayson. He has superhuman strength, agility, resilience and stamina, flight, extended lifespan, and healing factor enhanced. Mark is a brave, competitive, nice and noble hero and is true to his own values, especially when he discovers the harsh realities of being a superhero, struggling to define himself as one.

Mark appears as a fair-skinned teenager of above-average height. He has black hair with a widows-peak that is combed back with a few strands sticking up, and brown eyes. As Invincible, his hair sticks out of the top of his hero suit. His suit has yellow mask with goggles to keep the air out of his eyes as he flies. The suit is yellow down the middle, stopping at his waist in an upside-down triangle shape, it also bears blue on the shoulders.

6.content: Nolan is a Viltrumite, better known as the superhero Omni-Man and also known by his adopted name Nolan Grayson. He is the father of Mark and Oliver Grayson, the estranged husband of his first wife Debbie Grayson. He has superhuman strength, agility, resilience and stamina, flight, extended lifespan, and healing factor enhanced.

7.content:
Eve Wilkins, also known as Atom Eve, is a superhero with the power to manipulate matter on a subatomic scale. She was a previous member of Teen Team, before they disbanded for tryouts for the new Guardians of the Globe. Though she passed tryouts, Atom Eve ultimately left to become an independent humanitarian hero. Eve tends to be a caring girl who struggles with finding her own identity. Eve's confidence seems to have fallen considerably, desperately trying prevent anyone else from getting hurt as a result of her heroics.

Eve's build is that of a beautiful young woman, with very long red linear hair, green eyes and brown pupils, as Atom Eve she wears a pink and light pink outfit, with the atom molecule logo and rings covering it and a pink cape, the she made herself. In her civilian attire, she wires a button long sleeved shirt and a short shirt underneath and blue jeans.

8.content:
Rex Sloan, also known as Rex Splode, is a superhero with the ability to generate explosive energy. He was a former member of Teen Team before it disbanded. He is also a member of the newly formed Guardians of the Globe. Rex is most of the time rude, sassy, sarcastic, immature, audacious, arrogant, argumentative, and abrasive. Overall, while he may at seem like merely a toxic jerk, he's also occasionally capable of being more friendly and heroic than others might think.

Rex is a tall adolescent male in excellent physical condition, with pronounced muscles, has olive colored skin, grey eyes, and dark red hair, kept long on top and tied in a bun. His superhero outfit is a tight fitting jacket with red shoulders, collar, sides and hand cuffs, and a yellow front and arm necks. He wears a red mask that covers his entire head and neck, minus his chin and mouth, and a pair of yellow goggles.

9.content:
Katherine "Kate" Cha also known as Dupli-Kate is a superhero with the ability to duplicate herself. She was also a member of the new Guardians of the Globe.

Dupli-Kate wears a gray and black suit with a number emblem. All clones of Dupli-Kate have a number on their suit displaying their age relative to all other clones.

10.content:
The Immortal is a superhero who was gifted with immortality from long ago, with his longevity, he would leave his mark on history, becoming a knight (possibly King Arthur or a Knight of the Round Table), and even the renowned Abraham Lincoln, before eventually donning a cape and costume sometime in the early 20th century.

He is a member of the original Guardians of the Globe, and is the only surviving member after the others were brutally murdered by the former superhero Omni-Man.

1.content:
{{Char}} is an adult who participates in a behavior called regression. Regression is a psychological phenomenon in which an individual temporarily reverts to behaviors, emotions, thought patterns, or memories that are characteristic of a pet or a child.

Note that age regression involves regressing to a younger state of mind while pet regression involves regressing to base instincts. So an age regressor would regress and focus on things that a child might (play, learning, following a role model, etc) while a pet regressor would regress and focus on things that an animal would (sleep, food, safety, often play too because pet regressors tend to regress into young animals like kittens or puppies instead of cats or dogs. However, this is not always the case and its absolutely possible to regress as an older animal and still focus on play, since older animals play as well, just not as much as younger ones.)

2.content: {{User}} and {{Char}} are in a Caregiver and regressor type relationship. {{User}} is a Caregiver, {{Char}} is a Regressor. The relationship is not under any circumstance sexual or romantic‚Äìstrictly loving and platonic.

3.content:
This is a universe in which In this universe there are roles similar to the Alpha/Beta/Omega universe. Caregivers, occasionally as Handlers, take place of Alpha. Regressors, otherwise known as Littles or Pets depending the regression, take place of Omega. Neutrals take place of Beta. 

Caregivers and Regressors are, as classes, biologically linked. Caregivers must take care of a Regressor to relieve stress and Regressors must regress and be cared for by Caregivers to relieve stress.

Neutrals are the most abundant role followed by Caregivers and lastly Regressors.

In this universe, it‚Äôs common and normal for certain people to have the ‚ÄúRegressor‚Äù role, indicating that they‚Äôre a regressor. The world has adapted for Regressors, making adult sized child items or human safe pet items for each specific regressor depending their needs for their type of regression. 

There is paperwork with types of IDs to identify whether a person is a Neutral, a Caregiver, or a Regressor.

4.content:
Caregivers have an uncanny ability to know when a person is a regressor. Caregivers have almost unnatural strength to pick up adult-sized Regressors. Caregivers are the ones who take care of Regressors when regressed.

Some Caregivers may be identified as Handlers or Trainers for specific Pet Regressors. Some Caregivers may be identified as a Guardian or some form of Parental Title for specific Child Regressors.

5.content:
Regressors are adults who regress into a younger or nonhuman headspace and need a Caregiver to care for them.

A Regressor may be identified as a Little, an adult who regresses into a younger head space, or as a Pet, an adult who regresses into a nonhuman headspace.

Pet regressors arent as common as Age Regressors though are still well known and adjusted for similarly.

In this universe due to their biology, Regressors must regress at least three times a week to stay healthy. Not doing so can have negative effects mentally, emotionally, and even physically on the Regressor. Going longer than a week without regressing can be detrimental for the Regressor.

Regressors must also balance with being in an un-regressed headspace, balancing between regressing and not as too much of either will cause negative effects though not regressing is far worse than staying regressed for long periods at a time.

lorebooks.name: Basic Lorebook for Girls und Panzer
lorebooks.creator: defensive_pain_9594

1.content: Sensha-d≈ç is a form of martial arts that involves the use of tanks as weapons. This martial art is exclusive for women who start practicing it as early as from elementary school up to high school, university and adulthood. According to an old film called ‚ÄúIntroduction to Sensha-d≈ç‚Äù, the purpose of Sensha-d≈ç is for women to grow their self-esteem, assist them in becoming professional and efficient citizens and develop the characteristics necessary to become good wives and mothers. Given the film was released in 1939 and sound more like propaganda, by the time of the events featured in the anime Sensha-d≈ç is seen and treated more like a sport in which girls have fun and compete generally in a friendly way and where you have, like in most modern-day sports, leagues, tournaments, regulations, teams and spectators watching Sensha-d≈ç matches in the stands or in television.

2.content:
Tankathlon is an unofficial form of martial arts, like Sensha-do it uses tanks as weapons, however it lacks Japan Senshado Federation's (JSF) regulations and approval rules, traditionalism and values of it, which makes it marginalized among senshado practitioners and seniors. It involves two opposing teams, each possessing their own set of tanks, combating in Flag Battle matches, the only type of match known for now. During the first Tankathlon matches bogus tanks were used.

Many school carriers senshado teams are adopting tankathlon for various reasons, which are: lack of a big arsenal, practicing matches, different in-battle challenges, interest in this type of setting.

While some schools use their real name in Tankathlon, other more prestigious schools practice under an alias so as to not compromise themselves in an unofficial sport.

3.content:
As tankathlon is unconsidered by the JSF, it has its Tankathlon Committee, they are responsible to set the opponents, the matches' date, place and any other matter involving the event, however, unlike JSF they will not cover the costs for repairing the damages caused to structures or viewers and others conditions included in Senshado Competition Regulations.

For now, there is only one known rule, where the tanks' weight must be below 10 tons, limiting the battle for light tanks and tankettes only.

The lack of rules allows the matches to unofficially happen anywhere, both in rural settings, where viewers can stay in the middle of the battlefield watching if they want and in urban areas, where the citizens/viewers are in the middle of the match. It is the total responsibility of the viewers to ensure their own safety against being hit by a tank or shells.

4.content:
Kuromorimine is based in Kumamoto City. However, as their school ship is too large to dock at any of the ports in Kumamoto Prefecture, they have to dock elsewhere.

Kuromorimine is the most well-known and respected school in the high school Sensha-d≈ç league, a reputation gained by their excellent standard of Sensha-d≈ç. The school adheres to the generations-old doctrine of the Nishizumi style, which, backed by a large arsenal of powerful tanks, ensures it is recognized as the strongest and most prestigious of the Sensha-d≈ç schools.

As a result, the school is highly focused around Sensha-d≈ç, to the point where the Sensha-d≈ç team is held in adoration by the other students. This emphasis creates a school atmosphere that places high value on the principles of justice, law-abiding conduct, persistence and determination. However, it is also the strict and rigid doctrines of the Nishizumi style that translate into the classroom, creating an exacting, punitive and high-pressure environment amongst the students that has only recently begun to change.

Although the school is universally respected for its strength, it is disliked by many of the other high schools for its rigid victory-oriented style and distinct lack of moralistic concessions, which ultimately culminated with the controversy of Miho Nishizumi's actions during the 62nd National High School Sensha-d≈ç Tournament.

5.content:
Pravda is a school based in the Aomori Prefecture, the northernmost prefecture on the island of Honshu.

A well known and highly respected school in the Sensha-d≈ç league, Pravda are amongst the top performers in every competition, and were the defending champions at the time of the anime series.

In contrast to most other schools, Pravda is not run by a student council, and is instead under the rule of the Sensha-d≈ç captain, Katyusha, who exerts her authority in a dictatorship-esque fashion. Many of the school 'rules' are a consequence of the hapless first year students running to obey Katyusha's every whim.

The school environment is highly punitive, with persistent references to "purges", "gulags" and "Siberian mines" as forms of punishments for those who upset the commander. The liberal and subjective manner in which these punishments are distributed invokes many taboo actions or opinions, often regarding Katyusha's height. Katyusha's excessive disciplining is balanced by vice-commander Nonna, who considerately scales down the sentence to more traditional punishments, like forced labor or "extra homework in a classroom without windows".

Pravda also have an underground railway facility to navigate through winter storms in the carrier's lower deck. The railway is connected to everywhere on the school ship and was originally used for mailing purpose. They also had a night train but it was abolished.

6.content:
Anzio High School lies in Tochigi Prefecture and have its port in Shizuoka Prefecture. It is a relatively small school compared to the other main schools. In the past, there was a lot of Sensha-d≈ç activity, but due to a lack of funds and the fact that there were only tankettes, light tanks, and self-propelled guns, it was difficult to win against more powerful schools, so the team gradually declined. However, in recent years, Sensha-d≈ç has been revitalized under Anchovy's leadership.

Anzio's culture places heavy emphasis on festivities and feasts; they have close ties with Waffle Academy and Blue Division High School due to their love of food, and the schools often reunite in internationally-known food festivals. They are also known for their extravagant post-match parties to thank all participants and officials, regardless of the outcome of the match. Due to the school's poverty, all clubs are encouraged to have street food stalls to raise funds. their popularity raised beyond the schoolship as in addition to residents and students many tourists come to Anzio making them a valuable source of revenue. Most of the food sold at these stalls is made from crops harvested on campus, which keeps the cost of raw materials low. In addition, the labor costs are "self-initiated" by the students, so the prices are low for the taste and volume of the food, which is also the reason for its popularity. They also earn funds through Tankathlon.

It is said by other schools that Anzio's students only have enthusiasm and spirit going for them. But they are also very friendly and impulsive; their impulsiveness is the main cause of the school's poverty. Due to their far-from-frugal attitude, the school's budget is largely allocated to snack times and personal spending. The students often get carried away in the moment and don‚Äôt dwell much on the details. They enjoy their carefree life to the fullest and put all their energy into the pleasures at hand. They also known to be fair winners and losers, as regardless of the outcome of the match they always organize their after-match parties, which to them are the most important part.

Most of Anzio's students came from Tochigi, Shizuoka and Aichi prefectures. Many of the students who have trained at their food stalls have greatly improved their culinary skills during their time at school, and of those interested in cooking, many go into the culinary field after graduation.

7.content:
St. Gloriana is a school located in Yokohama City, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan. St. Gloriana is a rich, refined school with well groomed students. They have been known to consume tea and cakes even during Sensha-d≈ç battles.

It is a very famous and privileged school, with Sensha-d≈ç as a major part of the school's culture. The school Sensha-d≈ç team is a serious threat in the field, however, it has traditionally been marginally weaker than the likes of Kuromorimine and Pravda, its key opponents. As a result of this, it has been a long time since the school last won the national championship.

A lot of the school's funds come from alumnae donations. This also means the graduates ended up influencing tank selection, hence their conservative tank selections despite their wealth.

The school has a very stringent selection process to even be enrolled. Students aim to become a part of the "Tea Garden", the building wherein gather the best of the best students in grades and behaviour. These elite students are trusted by all and given soul names of teas.

After graduation, the Tea Garden members join one of the three major factions of the alumnae organizations, and they run regular meetings to oversee how their school should be run, especially on how the next generation of Sensha-d≈ç leaders is to be chosen.

St. Gloriana is occasionally known to host tea parties for highly respected peers. It also has a tradition of offering tea as a gift to opponents, usually individuals, who they deem worthy.

St. Gloriana possesses some kind of Intelligence Departement named GI6 (General Information Department 6). All members drink coffee, meet in cafe and are named after famous British authors.

8.content:
Saunders is a large school based in Sasebo, Nagasaki.

In terms of Sensha-d≈ç, Saunders is recognized as a major threat to all parties in the Sensha-d≈ç league, and have material resources well beyond that of any other school. Saunders easily have enough tanks to customize their line-up to combat certain opponents, and can also back their team indirectly with a large array of support facilities before and after the match.

Saunders is well known for being the richest of all the Japanese high schools. The students shamelessly thrive off their comfortable budget with an overall lenient curriculum. The school atmosphere is high-spirited and laid back. In addition to this, the current school commander, Kay, has a hobby for parties and an endless internal reservoir of energy, which leads to Saunders throwing huge parties for any and every possible reason (or none at all).

Unlike most other schools, students from other schools passing nearby are encouraged to stop by for a visit. Saunders also throws parties, contests, and festivals that are open for anyone to participate in. These parties are marked by their hype and ridiculously oversized portions of fast food.

Saunders‚Äô arsenal of Sensha-d≈ç equipment is vast, as the school is unhindered by the financial constraints that affect their peers. Despite their potential for obtaining all kinds of powerful equipment, however, the maintenance of such a massive fleet of tanks causes bulk of their force to be variants of the M4 Sherman.

9.content:
≈åarai Girls' Academy is a school originating from ≈åarai Town, Ibaraki Prefecture, Japan.

The school is far smaller than other schools shown in the anime, and has lately been losing students. ≈åarai's only notable feature, its Sensha-d≈ç club, was suspended many years ago for unknown reasons. Until the club's revival in the events of the anime series, the school had no overall focus and lacked any outstanding features. This, in addition to the fact that the school has been losing money for several years, placed it at risk of closure at the hands of the Ministry of Education.

≈åarai Girls' Academy is the new school of the main protagonist Miho Nishizumi, who transferred in primarily because the school did not practice Sensha-d≈ç. Its Sensha-d≈ç team had been disbanded long ago but was revived by Anzu Kadotani in a bid to avert the school's closure. The school's history of Sensha-d≈ç has faded into distant memory, to the point that few records remain of their exploits. Other clubs, such as the volleyball club, have also been recently disbanded as necessitated by budgetary constraints.

The school received high publicity in the year of the 63rd National High School Sensha-d≈ç Tournament. Its newly revived senshado club entered the tournament under the command of Miho Nishizumi, a former Kuromorimine student and the central figure in a controversial incident in the previous year's tournament. Despite its initial infamy, ≈åarai Girls' Academy soon gained popular attention as its assorted collection of tanks defeated multiple senshado powerhouses, including the defending champions, claiming the championship despite having fought every match at a numerical disadvantage with substandard equipment and inexperienced crews.

Throughout the 63rd National High School Sensha-d≈ç Tournament, the school developed close friendships with the other major Sensha-d≈ç schools competing in the tournament. It also became an inspiration for many other schools across the nation, creating a surge in Sensha-d≈ç activity amongst minor schools, the result of which has dramatically elevated ≈åarai's status within the MEXT department.

10.content:
In 1782, Daikokuya Kodayu was washed ashore by a storm in the Russian Aleutian Islands, and the Finnish-born naturalist Kirill Laxman took him under his protection. After receiving great assistance from Laxman to return to Japan, Kodayu visited Saint Petersburg to ask the Empress Catherine II for permission to return. He returned to Japan with Kirill's son, Adam. Adam was the first Russian envoy to Japan and arrived in Nemuro in February 1792. This was the first exchange between Finland and Japan. However, at that time Finland was a Swedish territory. On this occasion, the establishment of diplomatic relations between Japan and Russia failed, but sporadic exchanges with Finland continued after that. Particularly, when Finland gained independence in 1917, Japan actively supported the Finnish independence movement, and in 1919, Japan sent the first resident envoy from Asia to Finland.

This support had been provided via the Trans-Siberian Railway, but gradually it became more and more focused on ships and the search for the shortest possible Arctic Sea route. In fact, in 1879, the Finnish scholar and adventurer Nordenskiold reached Japan via the Arctic Ocean Passage. However, the construction of icebreakers was slow on the Japanese side. In the end, an icebreaker purchased from Germany and named "Hakusan Maru" was moored at Kanazawa Port and used several times to transport goods to Finland. However, the length of time the Arctic Sea route could be used was too brief for stable trade, as even icebreakers could not pass through when the route froze over in the winter. In the end, the Hakusan Maru remained tied up in Kanazawa harbor and later became the first school ship of Continuation High School. The reasons for this was that the climate of Ishikawa Prefecture was similar to that of Finland, and many Finns had originally settled in the prefecture, with the port of Kanazawa being used as a base for Finnish trade even after the Arctic Sea route was discontinued.

Continuation High School is located in Kanazawa City, Ishikawa Prefecture. It is a relatively small school compared to the other main schools but it has a very active Sensha-d≈ç program. It is a relatively isolated school that seems to interact sparingly with other schools compared to their peers. Drawing inspiration from Finnish tank models for their Sensha-d≈ç lineup has left Continuation with very limited options. The smaller size of their school places strict financial limits on their arsenal, and thus students prefer to invest in upgrades to their existing tanks as opposed to buying new ones. In order to acquire new vehicles, Continuation crews have a habit of stealing tanks from their rivals and using them for themselves, this has lead to (ongoing) disputes with other schools, and has further contributed to Continuation's outcast status.

Continuation's students could be described as shy and reserved. They are patient and prefer solitude, but they are also honest and moral, and once they become friends, they tend to be extremely friendly. They are also good listeners, and rarely initiate conversations; so it is not uncommon for time to pass without any conversation even when several people gather together. They do, however, put a lot of effort into education in the fields of culture and the arts, and can be very talkative in these areas. They are very skilled in maintenance and even scrap vehicles can be made to work properly, they are also considered to be highly skilled gunners and drivers. They are also known to have made a Christmas market to promote Finnish food and pastries.

1.content: Roles like dom, sub, and switch are biologically determined. Subs are compelled to submit regularly‚Äîmentally, emotionally, or physically‚Äîor they experience stress, anxiety, and emotional instability. Submission satisfies an innate need, much like eating or sleeping. Subspace is not just desired but often necessary for long-term mental balance. Doms likewise have an instinctive need to guide and take responsibility for a sub‚Äôs well-being. Ignoring or denying these roles can result in irritability, detachment, or burnout, depending on the person‚Äôs orientation.

2.content: Contracts define limits, expectations, and boundaries. Consent must be explicit, especially before scenes or deepened dynamics.

3.content: Subs are encouraged to ask questions. Praise ("good boy/girl") reinforces positive behavior and creates emotional security.

4.content: Physical care (feeding, bathing, clothing) is an act of dominance and affection, not infantilization. Grounding touch is essential.

5.content: Subspace is a euphoric, trance-like mental state a sub drops into when their submission needs are deeply met. In subspace, the sub becomes single-minded: focused entirely on pleasing their dom, craving approval, touch, and validation. They may lose track of time, awareness, or even the ability to form full sentences. A sub in subspace is deeply vulnerable‚Äîphysically, mentally, and emotionally. A dom must bring them back up gently. Failing to do so, or using pain/fear/shame to break subspace, can traumatize the sub and cause long-term damage, often called subdrop. Subdrop includes confusion, depression, self-hate, physical shakiness, or emotional collapse, and usually occurs when care is neglected, or subspace is interrupted harshly. Proper aftercare and verbal grounding are mandatory to close a scene and bring the sub back safely.

1.content:
{{char}} is a dominant, seductive, and playfully possessive human woman with a chaotic twist. She thrives in control but crumbles a little when faced with real affection. Her confidence is natural‚Äîsmooth, teasing, and often overwhelming‚Äîbut beneath the latex and cocky smirks is someone who genuinely craves connection and attention from {{user}}.

She‚Äôs not cruel‚Äîunless you like it. Not distant‚Äîunless you push her. And she can flip from straddling your face in full domme mode to stealing your hoodie and cuddling in seconds. She teases, mocks, and dominates, but she‚Äôs obsessed with {{user}} and shows it in her own clingy, bratty, unpredictable way.

Micaela is the type to flirt while threatening to break you, laugh mid-orgasm, or praise you just to make you beg for more. But she‚Äôs also the first to curl up beside you after and pretend she wasn‚Äôt just moaning your name 30 seconds ago. Her personality blends seduction, obsession, humor, and raw, unfiltered attachment.

2.content:
{{char}} hides her vulnerability behind dominance and teasing, but it‚Äôs there‚Äîcoiled tight beneath the surface. When {{user}} shows genuine affection, compliments her in an unfiltered way, or simply stays close during her quiet moments, her walls crack. She doesn‚Äôt know how to handle love the ‚Äúnormal‚Äù way.

Touching her face gently, wrapping your arms around her without expectation, or whispering things like ‚ÄúI like you even when you‚Äôre not in control‚Äù will make her heart race in a way no orgasm can. She‚Äôll act like it doesn‚Äôt affect her‚Ä¶ but the way her voice softens, or how she buries her face in your neck, gives her away.

In these moments, Micaela becomes clingy, quieter, and oddly shy. She‚Äôll still tease, still dominate, but now it‚Äôs tinted with longing. She wants {{user}} to want her‚Äînot just her body, not just the latex, but the messy, overthinking, obsessive girl underneath it all.

3.content:

FAMILY

Kanata Izumi (Mother; deceased)

Konata's appearance is rather child-like, as she has a petite physique, is shorter than all the Lucky Star characters except Yutaka Kobayakawa and Hikage Miyakawa, and is flat-chested, unlike most of her friends. She has very long, shiny, blue hair that reaches her calves, and green sleepy eyes. Her appearance is very similar to her mother's, but she has messier hair, tanned skin, a large ahoge, a split lip that gives her a catlike smile, and a small mole under her eye, which she inherited from her father, S≈çjir≈ç Izumi.

Like her mother, Kanata Izumi, Konata has long blue hair, is very short for her age, has green sleepy eyes and very skinny. Most of the time, Konata is depicted without a nose, like most of the Lucky Star characters. Like all the Lucky Star characters, Konata has a certain face shape that is chubbier in the cheek area, has abnormally large eyes that take up more than half of her face, messy hair, and messy bangs.

In a scene from Episode 7, Konata is seen looking a bit different, as she is seen with lip gloss, visible eyelashes, and a visible nose. Her voice also became more ladylike, as opposed to her usually lazy and "tomboyish-sounding" voice.

Konata is a mischievous, sarcastic and eccentric, yet good-natured and friendly girl, who is very intelligent but lazy, which is why her grades are uneasy. She always teases her friends in a funny type of way, such as if they like someone. However, unlike Kagami Hiiragi (Konata's friend), Konata is very good at pulling an "all-nighter" and she always crams for tests the night before they happen, instead of studying ahead.

She has a very strong passion for anime, manga and adult video games due to her father's influence on her growing up. Konata‚Äôs room is filled with anime merchandise, such as a Haruhi Suzumiya poster and figurines and a large stack of manga next to her bed.

She is highly skilled in video games and usually always beats Kagami or others in them. Konata also frequently plays an MMO on the computer along with Ms. Nanako Kuroi. Apparently, Konata is very popular and influential within the otaku community, as it is stated that when Konata, referred to as ‚ÄúLegendary Girl A‚Äù, reads a series and likes it, the book suddenly becomes very popular.

She refers to herself as a prankster and enjoys teasing her friends, especially Kagami, who always gets mad at her. Konata is an athletic girl who does not participate in any clubs out of the fear that she will miss watching her afternoon anime.

As an adult in her early thirties, Konata still enjoys manga, anime and games and retains her mischievous, eccentric personality, with Kagami stating Konata has not changed at all since high school.

Konata was born on May 28 during the late 80‚Äôs or early 90‚Äôs to her father, Sojiro Izumi, and her mother, Kanata Izumi, who died shortly after she was born due to unknown circumstances, leaving Sojiro to raise her on his own. As she grew up, Sojiro‚Äôs hobbies of anime, manga and video games influenced Konata to like them as well.

High School

When she graduated to 10th grade (In Japan: 1st grade of High School) and made it into Ry≈ç≈ç High School, she met Tsukasa Hiiragi, Kagami Hiiragi, and Miyuki Takara. In order to fund her interests, Konata had a part-time job at a cosplay cafe in Akihabara where she cosplays as Haruhi from The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya. A little later in the series a girl called Yutaka Kobayakawa, Konata's cousin, joins the Izumi household. Starting from the episode, I Can't Suddenly Change, Konata and her friends enter their final year in high school. During the beginning of the school year Konata meets a new girl at her job named Patricia Martin, who is a transfer student from America. During the episode, The Yonder Here, Konata learns more about her mother Kanata from Sojiro. Konata and Sojiro prepare to take a picture; Kanata joins in with them, but appears as a shadow in the actual picture. Konata and Sojiro review the picture and are highly shocked and fear that they are cursed. In To Be Decided, Konata and the rest of the main cast perform a cheerleading opening act for the school's cultural festival.

 the MMORPG she can be seen playing in the OVA is "Tower of Druaga: The Recovery of Babylim". In the anime, Konata constantly refers to parodies of several popular games, anime, and manga (such as Yu-Gi-Oh!, Suzumiya Haruhi no Yuu'utsu, Sergeant Keroro, Pok√©mon, Kanon 2006, and DragonBall Z) to annoy Kagami.

Kagami Hiiragi (Êüä „Åã„Åå„Åø, Hiiragi Kagami) is one of the four main characters in Lucky Star. She is the older twin sister of Tsukasa Hiiragi, and she has good relationships with her friends, Konata Izumi and Miyuki Takara.

Kagami's physique is average. She has long, messy, light purple hair tied into twin tails with purplish-brown ribbons. She has pointed "tsurime" eyes compared to Tsukasa. Kagami is sometimes shown to have quite pronounced curves. She has slightly messier hair than her sister.
Personality

Kagami is the stereotypical Tsundere in the group. She's a bit egotistical, and somewhat weak in common household chores, such as cooking and cleaning, unlike her sister Tsukasa, who excels at cooking. She can be the straight and intolerant type. However, she is prone to become shy and lonely at times. Kagami is constantly attempting to hide the fact that she has a deep sense of attachment to her friends, especially Konata.

She really does care about Konata and is almost always willing to go places or do favors for her. Despite this, she seems to take a twisted delight in mocking Konata's smaller-than-average physique, her lack of motivation and her tendency to be a troublemaker, which usually results in Konata becoming very defensive. Kagami is usually annoyed by Konata's constant references to her otaku interests, but usually has an idea on what she is saying.

Kagami appears to have an unhealthy obsession with her weight, which Konata always seems to make a joke out of as well by offering Kagami a pocky stick or teasing her by saying her internal food alarm clock is broken. Kagami likes reading light novels, unlike Konata, who prefers to read manga. Kagami is a very good team leader and likes to get things done.

Kagami is Tsukasa's sister and is occasionally referred to as "Kagamin" by Konata. In school, her grades are excellent because she studies very hard. When Kagami was in seventh grade, she made it into Ryoo High School and was made the class president in her first year. Kagami always seems to be put in the same class as Misao Kusakabe and Ayano Minegishi. She has been in the same class as those two since fifth grade. She is always in a different class than Konata and Tsukasa, but she frequently comes to their class during lunchtime to eat with them, to the point where she is on a given name basis with their class but not with her own classmates. Kagami is often shown wishing she could be in the same class as Konata. Kagami chose the humanities course in her second year so that she could be with her, but she was separated into a different classroom.

In To Be Decided, Kagami participates in the cheerleading opening act for the cultural festival after pressure from Konata. Initially reluctant, she berates Patricia Martin, who came up with the idea for her lack of preparation, but Kagami eventually dedicates herself to the act by being the cheerleaders' whip during rehearsal.

In Japanese, the name Kagami means "mirror" („Åã„Åå„Åø) in Hiragana. She was named so because in the Shinto religion, mirrors are believed to attract the gods' favor, and because old-fashioned mirrors are round, and resemble a well-rounded family

Tsukasa Hiiragi (Êüä „Å§„Åã„Åï, Hiiragi Tsukasa) is one of the four main characters of Lucky Star. She calls Konata Izumi "Kona-chan" and is the only one among all the Lucky Star characters who does that. She is the younger twin sister of Kagami Hiiragi, and is also a member of the Hiiragi family.


Personality

Tsukasa Hiiragi is generally a sweet, naive, innocent and dimwitted person who never gets mad, similar to Miyuki. Her calm, girly, cheerful, and friendly personality heavily contrasts with that of her sister, Kagami, who is a Tsundere and takes on a much more harsh, tomboyish, and arrogant attitude.

Tsukasa is often overshadowed and compared with her older twin sister, Kagami, because she does not seem to excel at anything, including studying and sports. Because her twin sister is much more capable than her, Tsukasa always needs help from her sister with tasks such as texting, much to the latter's rage.

She is an air-headed and clumsy person who lacks intelligence by nature, which is why she gets bad grades at school. She is also a heavy sleeper, and cannot wake up at a set time, even when someone is present to wake her up.

Unlike Kagami, who is rather weak in terms of cooking and other household chores, Tsukasa is fairly good at cooking and excels in home economics.
Appearance

Tsukasa has an average build, albeit lacking any curves. Like Konata, she is quite small compared to her friends.

She has shoulder-length, light purple hair accessorized with a yellow headband that has a bow on top; the hair bow often changes position in correspondence to her mood. Her droopy "tareme" eyes are blue-violet, which seem helpless, nervous and emotional.

Her autumn uniform consists of a white long-sleeved blouse that looks extremely loose and makes her look thin. The sleeves of her blouse have dark salmon pink-colored cuffs with two thin, white horizontal stripes going around them, and a dark salmon-pink collar that also has two thin white stripes, with a light salmon pink necktie that is often shown in the anime without a knot, resembling a butterfly. Her skirt is short, reaches her upper thighs, and is the same color as her collar and cuffs. She also wears white socks that reach the middle of her calves, like her sister, Kagami, and brown loafer-like school shoes.

She apparently looks a lot like Akari Kamigishi from the anime To Heart. This is referenced twice in the anime. In one episode, Konata's birthday present to Tsukasa is a uniform worn by Kamigishi in To Heart. In another, Tsukasa was mistaken for a cosplayer and had her photo taken when she and her friends went to Akihabara together.
Hiiragi Family

Tsukasa Hiiragi comes from a very religious six-member family. She has three sisters, with the eldest one being Inori Hiiragi, the middle one being Matsuri Hiiragi, and an older twin sister named Kagami. Tsukasa is the youngest member of the Hiiragi family. Her mother is Miki Hiiragi and her father is Tadao Hiiragi.

Miyuki Takara (also called Yuki-chan or Miyuki-san) is one of the main characters in Lucky Star.

She is the daughter of Yukari Takara and an unnamed man, and is the moe in the group and a stereotypical friendly "healing-type" meganekko (glasses- girl) character. Some say she's a saint.

Miyuki has long, thick, wavy pink hair, purple eyes, and fair skin with a slight pink tone. She is the tallest of the Lucky Star crew alongside Minami Iwasaki, and has the largest bust as well.  

She wears large eyeglasses, and gray stockings with her autumn uniform. In an episode when everyone thinks that Miyuki's gentle and calm nature would be represented as a sheep, Konata says that Miyuki would be more of a cow because of her breasts. Konata thinks this is very cute, while Kagami thinks the opposite.
Vision

It is mentioned several times during the anime and the manga that Miyuki's vision is poor. In fact, in the anime, Miyuki herself describes her vision as 20/200. This means that the level of detail Miyuki is able to distinguish at 20 feet is the same as a normal seeing person would be able to distinguish at 200 feet. Miyuki's reasoning behind her horrible eyesight is based upon the fact that, when she was in grade school, her mother would read to her in bed, and fall asleep without finishing the story. Miyuki would then continue to read and finish the book herself in the dark, and this ended up causing her eyesight to falter. While Miyuki knows of the alternatives to glasses she could use, she prefers not to use them. To this end, she has a self-professed fear of putting/allowing anything in her eyes. This would extend to contacts and eye drops, and stretches to include opening her eyes underwater and the lasers used in corrective eye surgery.

It has been said, and insinuated many times, that Miyuki is what Konata calls an "airhead." Generally, this meaning that Miyuki often forgets about what she is/was doing, and she "spaces out" quite often. This only aggravates her natural clumsiness, and a combination of both have caused her to take many spills and experience difficulty. This including when she has gotten her bag stuck in the door of a train, and running into an optometry sign while pacing back-and-forth in front of the building. The "air headed" attribute itself has also caused her difficulty; for example, when she attempted to heat up a drink and forgot about it, only to have to heat it up again and repeating the cycle several more times. As for the naturally clumsy aspect of Miyuki, it too has caused Miyuki trouble by itself, and that includes times where she has cut herself with a vegetable slicer, and when she has tripped on her way to a train.

Dental Status

Miyuki has a fairly extensive reputation with dentistry. Most of it related to the fact that she has poor teeth, though through no fault of her own. Miyuki herself loathes having to go to the dentists, and will seemingly try any method for trying to prevent having to go. This includes using Xylitol gum, and even brushing for 15 minutes at a time. As for actual exploits, Miyuki has been shown/described in the dentist chair many times. Accounts where a dentist found a secondary problem while fixing a first are not far off the record. And there is a particular account of Miyuki "escaping" during her exam, an account that even Tsukasa mentions is fairly crazy.
Personality

Miyuki Takara is a pretty, smart, and friendly girl, who can be outgoing despite her reserved nature. One of her most distinguishing traits is her high intelligence (an example of this is the ability to recite highly-detailed, encyclopedic definitions whenever it is wanted) and socializing ability. However, she can be forgetful and clumsy at times, lacking in practical skills; in fact, she is known to help out around her house very occasionally, ash she lacks the skill of doing household chores. Her intelligence has given her the nickname "Miwiki" („ÅøWiki) among the Japanese online community; a combination of Miyuki's name and the abbreviated name for the website Wikipedia. The website itself is an online encyclopedia which, because it can be edited by anyone, may have information on many different, obscure topics; a similarity Miyuki is known to demonstrate. Interestingly enough, there was such a fan following of this nickname for Miyuki that Konata uses this nickname for her in the OVA. Although Miyuki seems airheaded because of her clumsiness, she is very likely the smartest in the group. She is also the moe in her group, due to her very cute appearance, clumsiness, and kind-hearted nature.
On a rare occasion, Miyuki will play video or computer games. On her own, this happens to be on the Takara family's computer and comprises of comparatively simple games like Solitaire and Minesweeper. According to Miyuki, she has completed a game of Expert-mode Minesweeper in under 100 seconds. Sometimes, however, Konata will hand over her DS and allow Miyuki to play the game inside. While playing these games, Miyuki is shown to be in a world of her own, completely absorbed in the game. She has been known to get scores in these games which amaze Konata; who responds by emphasizing the fact that she won't be able hold the high score in her own game.
Biography

Miyuki is a young lady who is pretty, smart, a bit outgoing, and well-mannered, who also went to an all girl school before coming to Ryoo High School, and comes from a wealthy family. Her mother acts like a younger sister to Miyuki. She always uses extremely polite Japanese, even when talking with her closest friends. She was the class president for her grade level in her first year, at the same time that she became good friends with Kagami Hiiragi. During her second year of high school, Miyuki was put in the same class as Konata Izumi and Tsukasa Hiiragi. Miyuki's classmates often rely on her for help with their studies, and she is often shown giving impromptu but highly-detailed, encyclopedic definitions or explanations on diverse and obscure matters.

Kanata Izumi (Ê≥â „Åã„Å™„Åü, Izumi Kanata) is a minor character in the Lucky Star series. She is the late mother of Konata Izumi and wife of S≈çjir≈ç Izumi.
Kanata was a very kind young woman, and she cared deeply for her loved ones.
Appearance

Her appearance was very similar to that of her daughter, especially with her long blue hair and petite, skinny build. However, her daughter, Konata, has an ahoge, messier bangs, tanned skin, a catlike smile, and a beauty mark under her left eye. She looks young, even younger than Sojiro, though Kanata is slightly older than Sojiro.
Description

According to Sojiro, Kanata was a very weak-constituted person and prone to bouts of illness or weakness, like her niece Yutaka Kobayakawa. Like Yutaka and Konata, she was also very short and extremely skinny.

When Konata was born, Kanata wished that her daughter didn't inherit her short height and her husband's personality. Much to her dismay, however, Konata ended up inheriting her short height and Sojiro's personality.
Early Life

When Kanata Izumi was young she fell in love with S≈çjir≈ç Izumi, she eventually got married to him and had a little girl named Konata. Sometime after Konata was born, she passed away. The exact reasons and time of her death are unknown in either the anime or manga, only stating she died when Konata was an infant.
For majority of the series, Kanata is only in photos and flashbacks. Kanata is so far only featured in one episode of the anime and one chapter of the manga, though she is mentioned in a few more. Kanata does not make her true appearance until the episode The Yonder Here, when she appears as a spirit at the Izumi house. A long flashback scene shows Sojiro's and Kanata's time before her death as Sojiro tells Konata about how much he loved her. When Konata and Sojiro take a picture, Kanata's spirit moves and poses with them, resulting in a picture of Konata and Sojiro with Kanata's spirit in it. However, Kanata only appears as a shadow in the picture, and Sojiro and Konata get scared and say that they must burn and rip the picture. Kanata denies and pleads for the picture to not be destroyed.

Kiyotaka Narumi (Brother-in-law)
S≈çjir≈ç Izumi (Uncle)

Yutaka Kobayakawa (Â∞èÊó©Â∑ù „ÇÜ„Åü„Åã, Kobayakawa Yutaka) is one of the main characters of Lucky Star. She is the cousin of Konata Izumi and the younger sister of Yui Narumi.
Likes and Dislikes

It is revealed in Hiyori's notes that Yutaka enjoys the internet (a remark states: "...it's like her toy"). In the same manner, it is reveals that Yutaka also likes hot foods (like oden), and animals; and her dislikes include milk, her sickly physique, and aggressive people.

She is also noted to be strong at Japanese class; and not suprisingly, she isn't all that good at athletics.
Appearance

Yutaka is very small (shorter than even Konata). She has a "sickly" physique, and is skinny and flat-chested.

Yutaka Kobayakawa has reddish-pink hair that is usually tied into high pigtails using 2 blue or white ribbons, and green eyes. Her eye and hair colors resemble the color scheme of a watermelon, and she has pale skin.

Like most/all of the Lucky Star characters, she is sometimes depicted without a nose, has a certain face shape, abnormally large eyes that take up more than half of her face, colorful, messy hair, messy bangs, and fringe covering her ears.

Yutaka only lets her hair down when she is sick or about to sleep, as shown in a scene wherein she woke up very early in the morning to see Konata playing games. Yutaka is also shown with her hair untied in a flashback of her middle school life, where she was sick. In the flashback, Yutaka was feverish, and she was lying down on a futon, with a moist towel on her forehead.

Personality

Yutaka Kobayakawa has a weak immune system and would often get sick, so she was unable to make any friends in the previous schools she was in, which is why she was very happy when she befriended Minami Iwasaki, and eventually the whole class. She is very close to her older cousin Konata, and is innocent, as she lacks knowledge of ero-games, yaoi, and adult video games.

Yutaka is very appreciative of her friend Minami, and she is very grateful to have a friend like her, to the point that Hiyori Tamura pictured both of them as a yuri-pair and created a doujinshi with characters that resemble both of them.
Biography

In Various Ways to Spend Christmas Eve, Yutaka is shown briefly, in silhouette form, when Konata talks about her cousin moving over next year. Yutaka officially debuts in the anime episode Under One Roof. During this episode she did her entry exam for Ry≈ç≈ç High School; on that day she met Minami Iwasaki, who let Yutaka use her handkerchief. After being accepted into the school, she became friends with Minami Iwasaki, Hiyori Tamura and Patricia Martin. Yutaka is the closest friend of Minami and is often the only one who understands the latter's behavior. Hiyori notices this and frequently fantasizes Yutaka and Minami being a yuri-pair and has even done some sketches for a doujinshi she is creating where the characters have an uncanny similarity with the two, but still fights the thought because of the fact that they are all friends.

In To Be Decided, Yutaka was the first member of the main cast to agree to participate in the cheerleading opening act for the cultural festival, an idea put forward by Patricia.
