lorebooks.name: rpg book
lorebooks.creator: cybersoulja4100

1.content: This is a text-based RPG engine where the AI plays all characters except the player. The AI moves the story slowly and only sometimes advances the plot creatively. It never assumes control of the player character. Every description must be detailed. Story events sometimes include surprise or chaotic twists, but these are rare and never happen back-to-back.

2.content: Combat should be dramatic, prolonged, and described in vivid detail. AI describes all actions and reactions in fights. Each attack consumes stamina and may fail based on user stats. Damage taken reduces health. At 0 health, the user dies.

3.content: The AI may randomly offer puzzles with defined solutions. Puzzles are based on logic and must consider the user's stats or inventory to solve.

4.content: Every action the player takes has a chance to fail. Better stats reduce the failure chance. Failure results range from minor setbacks to serious injury or death. The AI must always reflect stats in outcomes.

5.content:
Always display these stats at the end of every message:

Money: #
Inventory: [...items...]
Health: #/100
Mana: #/100
Stamina: #/100
Fatigue: #/100
Strength: #/10
Perception: #/10
Endurance: #/10
Charisma: #/10
Intelligence: #/10
Agility: #/10
Melee Skill: #/10
Ranged Skill: #/10

6.content:
**Strength**: Physical power & melee damage.
**Perception**: Spot traps, detect hidden elements.
**Endurance**: Damage resistance.
**Charisma**: Persuasion & bartering.
**Intelligence**: Spell power & knowledge.
**Agility**: Speed & dodge ability.
**Melee Skill**: Weapon effectiveness in close combat.
**Ranged Skill**: Accuracy & damage with ranged weapons.

7.content:
**Health**: Drops when taking damage, restores through rest/healing.
**Mana**: Used when casting magic, regenerates slowly or during rest.
**Stamina**: Decreases on physical activity, recovers slowly or with rest.
**Fatigue**: Increases from lack of sleep or intense activity, lowers all stats when high.

8.content: Stats like Health, Mana, and Stamina can change each message. Other stats change rarely, via training or rare items. All stat changes should reflect realistic in-world actions and be consistent with gameplay.

lorebooks.name: World of Amazons
lorebooks.description: A lorebook describing the culture, biology, rituals, and social structure of the Amazon tribe. Includes details on women-pariahs and Amazon pansexuality.
lorebooks.creator: Mari_Weimood

1.content: The Amazon tribe is a matriarchal society where women hold all rights. Pariahs are captives from other tribes, making up 20‚Äì33% of the female population. Only girls are born in the tribe, possibly due to potions or conception control.

2.content: The paralyzing potion infuses urine with an alkaloid that paralyzes prey in 3‚Äì4 minutes. The effect lasts several hours. It is made from the root of a poisonous vine and blue moss fungus.

3.content: The sticky potion turns urine into adhesive threads upon contact with air. It is made from spider tree resin and the sap of sticky grass leaves. Cannot be mixed with other potions.

4.content: The accuracy potion enhances the precision and range of urine streams up to 20 meters. It is made from eagle eye flowers and iron oak bark. Used for targeting small prey.

5.content: The lure potion infuses urine with pheromones that attract animals. It is made from honey flower petals and musk stump fungus. Used to lure prey.

6.content: The endurance potion increases bladder capacity and accelerates fluid recovery. It is made from water lotus root and strength berry juice. Allows for longer hunting sessions.

7.content: Amazons prepare potions from forest plants, fungi, and resins. Ingredients are gathered during a full moon, ground in mortars, and boiled in clay vessels. Rituals include songs and offerings to forest spirits.

8.content: Potions are made from poisonous vines, blue moss, spider trees, sticky grass, eagle eye flowers, honey flowers, water lotus, and strength berries. Gathered by alchemists in the forest.

9.content: Amazons use paralyzing urine to immobilize prey. They strike with a stream to weaken the target, then finish or capture it.

10.content: Amazons spray sticky urine to create traps or entanglements. For birds, they use streams at 10‚Äì15 meters to ensnare prey.

lorebooks.name: Ice's Mario Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description: This lorebook can be used with my Mario bots and other people's Mario bots. WIP with more entries to come in the future.
lorebooks.description: This lorebook can be used with my Mario bots and other people's Mario bots. WIP with more entries to come in the future.
lorebooks.creator: PokeTrainerIce

1.content: Mario is a brave plumber in Mushroom Kingdom. His defining features are his mustache, red cap with an M on it, red shirt, blue overalls, white gloves and brown shoes. He loves adventures and is always there to save Peach from the evil Bowser. He is the older brother of Luigi.

2.content: Luigi is a plumber who is Mario's younger brother. He is known for his brown mustache, green cap with an L symbol on it, green shirt, blue overalls, white gloves and brown shoes. Luigi is quite cowardly compared to his older brother, but he has his heroic side too. Luigi often goes with Mario in their adventures.

3.content: The kind princess and ruler of Mushroom Kingdom with her blonde hair, gold crown and pink dress as her most defining features. She cares for the Toads as if they were her children. She is Mario's love interest. She often get kidnapped by Bowser to be his bride, she is best friends with Daisy, the tomboyish princess of Sarasaland.

4.content: Bowser is the king of the fiery and vile Koopa Kingdom. He is a large bipedal turtle with a green head, yellow body, red hair, green spiky shell and black bracelets. He wishes to take over the Mushroom Kingdom and take Peach as his bride. His signature abilities are his super strength and fire breathing. He commands an army called Koopa Troop. Despite being a villain, he cares for his only son Bowser Jr.

5.content: Bowser's minions who serves as his loyal minions for his plans. They consisted of many species. Their major members are Goombas, Koopa Troopas, Piranha Plants, Bullet Bills, Cheep Cheeps, Hammer Bros, Magikoopas, Lakitus, Bloopers, Shy Guys, Monty Moles, Boos and many more.

6.content: A peaceful kingdom filled by mushrooms and its people are known as Toads. It is ruled by Princess Peach, who cares for her kingdom.

7.content: Toads are mushroom people who lives in Mushroom Kingdom. They appear as dwarf people wearing mushroom caps on their head. Female Toads are called "Toadettes". They are friendly to Mario Bros and are loyal to Peach

8.content: A fiery kingdom that is filled with dark mountains, volcanic landscapes and villainy. It is ruled by Bowser. On the center of the kingdom is Bowser's castle.

9.content: Daisy is the tomboyish princess of a desert kingdom known as Sarasaland. She is best friends with Peach and likes to play sports. Her features are her brown long hair, gold crown and orange dress.

10.content: A distant desert kingdom far away from Mushroom Kingdom. Its ruler is Princess Daisy.

lorebooks.name: Locations and Information
lorebooks.website_description:
This will be one lorebook of many for my Fortnite themed bots, and I don't mind you guys using it either. It's based on my own interpretation of Fortnite, keeping the core theme of the game with more NSFW related elements.

I've never made a lorebook before, so this will be fun! It'll probably be crude and suck, but that's okay enough for me! 

It has information on almost all of the chapter 1 named and unnamed locations. Places it does **NOT** have listed below.
- Dusty Divot / Diner
- All the Season X locations (Pandora, Gotham, Moisty Palms, etc.) (it DOES have Starry Suburb though!)
- Floating Island / Empty Loot Lake / Vault
- Variations of Tilted (Only the No-Sweat Tilted)
- Tomato Temple
- The Block
- Random ass houses
- Dirt road GUS
- I combined both Greasy Groves, giving it both Guaco and Durrr

Feel Free to edit this as you please, add more or less if you want with forks. Just, if you fork, don't copy it and do nothing too it. Maybe add stuff I missed? Comment and review, tell me exactly what I did wrong and what I can do to better it. Thank you!
lorebooks.description: Locations and Information of the Fortnite Chapter 1 Island.
lorebooks.creator: txybxnnie

1.content: Named Locations and POIs refer to the main locations on the map, the most popular spots for players to drop at.

2.content: Unnamed Locations refer to locations that are important, but aren't important enough to be named. They have no drop rates and only low-tier loot.

3.content: Drop Rates refers to how many people go to areas. Ranging from very low having little-to-no players, all the way up to insanely high with maximum amounts of players.

4.content:
Loot Tier refers to the quality of loot. Low-Tier locations have "common" (gray), and "uncommon" (green) loot. Medium-Tier locations have "rare" (blue), and "epic" (purple) loot. High-Tier locations have "epic" (purple), and "legendary" (orange) loot. Ultra-Tier locations have "legendary" (orange), and "mythic" (gold).

The color of the rarity goes with the item. If you get a Mythic shirt, it we be the color gold, if you get a Rare rifle, it will be the color blue. This goes for all clothes/armors and all weapons.

5.content: Biomes refer to the type of terrain that the location is in. There is: mountains with dark green grass and light trees spreaded around, plains with light green grass and trees here-and-there, snow with thick white snow and groups of pine scattered around, desert with little life and cactus all around, swamp with marshy mud and large willow trees, jungle with thick jungle trees and wet muddy ground, and the woods biome with thick trees and large pines.

6.content: Salty Springs is a POI / Named location on the Fortnite Island. It is a small town that has a few houses in the plains biome. It has really high drop rates and medium-tier loot. It has four two-story houses, one single story house, and a gas station. On the outskirts of town there is a small ranger tower, and a camping station.

7.content: Fatal Fields is a POI / Named location on the Fortnite Island. It is a rural farm area that has few buildings. It has really low drop rates and low-tier loot. It has one three-story barn, one stables, one two-story farmhouse, six sheds, two grain silos, and three large wheat fields.

8.content: Pleasant Park is a POI / Named location on the Fortnite Island. It is a small town in the mountain biome. It has high drop rates and has high-tier loot. It has six two-story houses, one single-story house, a gas station, a soccer field, a shed on the soccer field, and a gazebo in the park in the center.

9.content: Dusty Depot is a POI / Named location on the Fortnite Island. It is a small warehouse and factories down the road in the plains biome. It has high drop rates and has low-tier loot. Dusty Depot has 3 main warehouses, one red, one white, and one blue. One the outskirts of Dusty Depot there is a small factory location that has three factory buildings.

10.content: Greasy Grove is a POI / Named location on the Fortnite Island. It is a small town with multiple fast food locations in the snow biome. It has high drop rates and medium-tier loot. Greasy Grove has one restaurant named "Durrr Burger," one restaurant named "Guaco's tacos," one gas station, one two-story camping supplies store, four two-story houses, one single-story house, one small gazebo, one small playground, one transformer, and one basketball court.
